rows.Scenes: Barbados, Monica and Chandler's Room. They both enter from Ross's room. Monica still has her big, frizzy hair.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, the way you crushed Mike at ping pong was such a turn-on.You wanna...? (plays with her finger on Chandlers chest)ScenesChandler: You know, I'd love to, but I'm a little tired.ScenesMonica: I'll put a pillowcase over my head.ScenesChandler: You're on!Scenes(they start to get ready, but then Phoebe enters through the door from Ross's room)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: What's up?ScenesPhoebe: Well, okay, Mike's taking a shower, which by the way there's no law against. And then we're gonna grab some food, so if you want...Scenes(there's a door slamming in Ross's room, and some indistinct murmuring)ScenesRoss: ... finally...ScenesPhoebe: Is that Ross?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you can hear everything through these stupid walls.ScenesPhoebe: Sounds like he's with someone.ScenesChandler: He could be alone. This morning I heard him do push-ups, and then talk to his triceps.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, I think Phoebe's right. You know I hear someone else in there with him.Scenes(they all put their ear against the wall to be able to hear what's being said. We move to Ross's room where he and Charlie are kissing.)ScenesCharlie: Ooh... Dr. Geller!ScenesRoss: God, you're amazing... I didn't even have to ask you to call me that.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, that's Charlie!ScenesChandler: She's cheating on Joey with Ross!ScenesPhoebe: Oh that tart... floozy... giant...ScenesMonica: I'm not sure about this.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you're right. This is none of our business.ScenesMonica: No I'm not sure that it's the best way to hear everything. Someone get me a glass!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'm not gonna do this, okay? I'm not gonna eavesdrop on my friend.ScenesRachel: (through wall) Ooh... I love Barbados!Scenes(Phoebe starts to listen at the other wall, where Rachel's room is. There, Joey and Rachel are kissing.)ScenesJoey: Ooh... I can't believe I'm kissing you. I'm kissing Rachel!ScenesRachel: I know, I'm her!Scenes(they start to kiss again, and Phoebe turns to Chandler and Monica)ScenesPhoebe: (whispering) Rachel and Joey! It's Rachel and Joey!!!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Get over here!Scenes(Chandler and Monica take a sprint to the other wall)ScenesRachel: ooh...ScenesChandler: Wow!ScenesMonica: (in her Monica-excited-way... TOO LOUD!) Oh my God, I love how thin these walls are!Scenes(In the rooms next door, Joey, Rachel, Ross and Charlie stop kissing and try to understand what the yelling was about. After a while they continue kissing. We're back in Chandler and Monica's room. Monica has some of her own hair stuffed in her mouth by Chandler.)ScenesMonica: (muffled) Thank you.ScenesOPENING CREDITSScenes(Rachel and Joey's)ScenesRachel: Hey, you know, before you said that nothing could happen between us? What changed?ScenesJoey: Well, I only said that because of Ross, you know. Then I saw him kissing Charlie...ScenesRachel: What? Ross and Charlie? (Joey nods) Wow! She's really making her way through the group, huh? Ah, who am I to talk?Scenes(Chandler and Monica's)ScenesMonica: I can't believe this. Rachel and Joey?ScenesChandler: How about the dinosaur twins in the other room? No-one is manning that wall!ScenesMonica: I'm on it!ScenesChandler: Anything?ScenesMonica: I think I hear curtains closing...ScenesPhoebe: We've got shoes being kicked off over here.ScenesMonica: Bedsprings, unmistakable!ScenesChandler: You do realise that's your brother?ScenesMonica: Not until you said it. Somebody switch! (Chandler makes a clicking sound with his fingers and Phoebe runs to the other wall. Monica returns to Chandlers wall.) Wait a minute... Ross and Charlie, Joey and Rachel, Phoebe and Mike! We're the only people leaving with the same person we came with.ScenesChandler: That's not true. I came with Monica and I'm leaving with Weird Al.ScenesMonica: Okay, I've had it with the hair jokes. Tomorrow morning, before we leave, I'm going to the salon.ScenesChandler: Okay Buckwheat!ScenesPhoebe: You gotta hear this, it's great... It's like free porn! (Chandler eagerly rushes over)Scenes(Ross and Charlie's)ScenesRoss: Weh...*sigh*ScenesCharlie: uhm... Is everything okay?ScenesRoss: Yeah, It's just... I don't think I can do this...ScenesCharlie: Ooh... Is it because of what might be on the bedspread, because I saw that news report too, with the infra red and the ... I could just...ScenesRoss: No, NO! (they're moving to the side of the bed, where they sit down) Look, I need to talk to Joey. I mean, you guys just broke up. Before anything more happens between us, I need to know he's okay with it.ScenesCharlie: I uhm... I completely understand.ScenesRoss: Alright, I'm gonna go find them... (twitches a bit, looks down) I just need a... need a before I can... you know. (gestures standing up... they sit and wait for a while) Grandma... grandma... grandma... (he tries to concentrate...) Okay, I see you later.ScenesCharlie: Okay...Scenes(Chandler and Monica's, all three of them are listening at the wall to Ross and Charlie's)ScenesPhoebe: That's the door. He's gone...ScenesChandler: And she's... turning on the TV... and watching... Miss Congeniality!ScenesMonica: Honey, if you know it through a wall, you know it too well!Scenes(They are still listening at the wall, when Ross enters their room)ScenesRoss: Hey, what are you guys doing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, we're just... we're sad to go so we're just saying goodbye to the hotel. (hugs the wall) I love you... Paradise Hotel, Golf resort and Spa... (she walks away from the wall)ScenesMonica: (also hugs the wall) Yeah, we had a great time, thank you! (walks to Phoebe)ScenesChandler: (caresses the wall with his finger) Bye!ScenesRoss: Okay, uhm... Hey, you guys seen Joey anywhere?ScenesChandler: He's probably in his room with his current girlfriend Charlie. That's the situation as we know it... (walks to Phoebe and Monica)ScenesRoss: Well, if you see him could you please tell him I'm looking for him?ScenesChandler: You got it!ScenesRoss: Thanks! (walks out of the room and starts hugging the wall) Thank you! (closes the door)ScenesMonica: Other wall, people! Other wall!Scenes(they rush to the wall to Rachel and Joey's, and we move to that room)ScenesRoss: (knocks on door) Rach, you there? (Joey and Rachel both get up from the bed)ScenesJoey: Oh my God, it's Ross. What are we gonna do?ScenesRachel: Oh, ju-ju-just stay calm. Just be calm. For all he knows we're just hanging out together. Right? Just be nonchalant. (Joey like stands at attention with his chest forward and his hands on his sides, looking up at the ceiling with his lips pouted.) That's not nonchalant!ScenesJoey: No idea what it means.ScenesRachel: Oh... okay, just hide!ScenesRoss: (knocks) Rach?ScenesRachel: Coming! Try under the bed, try under the bed!Scenes(When Rachel starts to look under the bed if Joey would fit under there, Chandler opens the door inbetween the rooms, grabs Joey by his shirt and drags him to his room, and closes the door again)ScenesRachel: There's no room under the bed. (looks around because she can't find Joey anymore)ScenesRoss: Is everything okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah... (still looking to see where Joey went, and opens the door)ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hi...ScenesRoss: You know where Joey is?ScenesRachel: ...I really don't... (looks around again)ScenesRoss: Can I talk to you for a minute?ScenesRachel: Yeah, sure... (looks outside into the corridor if Joey is there)Scenes(Monica and Chandler's room. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler have their ears pressed against the wall, and Joey looks at them)ScenesJoey: I don't believe this... Have you guys been...ScenesPhoebe: Shhh... This is the listening side of the wall.Scenes(Now Joey also wants to listen, and wants to press his ears against the door, which has a big mirror on it, he hesitates seeing himself in the mirror, but still puts his ear against it. We move again to Rachel's room.)ScenesRoss: And then she told me that she and Joey had broken up, and that part of the reason was that she had feelings for me.ScenesRachel: (clearly not listening and still trying to find out where Joey went) Uh-huh... right... yeah...ScenesRoss: And you know I wanted to ask Charlie out since the day I met her.ScenesRachel: (still searching) Oh, I know... I know it's been really hard for you.ScenesRoss: Anyway, one thing lead to another, and... oh... before you know it, we were kissing. I mean, how angry do you think Joey is gonna be?ScenesRachel: (now looking up at the ceiling) That is hard to say, Ross. That is hard to say.ScenesRoss: You know, I gotta go find him. He's gotta be here someplace.ScenesRachel: You would think!Scenes(Ross leaves the room)ScenesRachel: Joey!ScenesJoey: Is he gone?ScenesRachel: (still can't find him) How are you doing this?Scenes(Joey now enters the room through the door, Monica, Chandler and Phoebe are following him.)ScenesJoey: Pssst...ScenesRachel: How... wha... Hey! What are you... What is this? Have you guys been listening this entire time?ScenesMonica, Chandler and Phoebe: YE-AH!ScenesPhoebe: Now, what is this?ScenesRachel: Ah, what is this? Well, lets see, we kissed for ten minutes and now we're talking to our friends about it, so I guess this is sixth grade!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no... Have you thought about it how complicated this could get? What about Ross?ScenesJoey: Well, he's with Charlie now.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but he wants to talk to you before anything really happens with her. And as his friend, I mean, don't you think he deserves the same from you?ScenesJoey: (long pause and he twitches a bit) You're a pain in my ass, Geller!ScenesRachel: All right, look you guys... Look, we appreciate all the advice, but this is between Joey and me and I think we can handle it...ScenesChandler: Okay, well we'll go back in there, but will you do one thing for us? The people that care about you?ScenesRachel: Sure...ScenesChandler: Enunciate!ScenesRachel: Get out!Scenes(They leave and Rachel locks the door.)ScenesRachel: Are they right?ScenesJoey: Probably, yeah... I mean, maybe we should... hold off until we talk to Ross.ScenesRachel: Yeah... Yeah, we can wait, we don't have to do anything tonight.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I think that'd be best... So, so I'm gonna... I'm gonna take off...ScenesRachel: (Joey walks to the door) Although...ScenesJoey: (turns around very fast) I like although!ScenesRachel: I mean, you know... Ross and I haven't dated in like... six years...ScenesJoey: Six years? Wow... It's almost as long as highschool...ScenesRachel: Plus, you know, he is with Charlie now.ScenesJoey: Absolutely! He's not thinking about you.ScenesRachel: No...ScenesJoey: I'm thinking about you...ScenesRachel: Yeah...ScenesJoey: Let's forget about Ross...ScenesRachel: Forgotten.Scenes(They want to kiss, but just before their lips touch, Rachel pulls back quickly, gasping)ScenesJoey: What's wrong?ScenesRachel: Nothing...ScenesJoey's voice, but she sees Ross: Seriously... What is it?ScenesRachel: Nothing... It's really... It's nothing... Come here, come here...Scenes(again, just before their lips touch, she pulls back, gasping)ScenesJoey's voice/Ross: What's wrong?ScenesRachel: Sorry, I just uhm... I can't seem to get Ross out of my head...ScenesJoey: Well, maybe I can help. (he grabs her head passionately, closes his eyes and kisses... Ross in Rachel's dress! He realises it too late, and when he does, pushes Ross's/Rachel's head away)ScenesRachel/Ross: Ooh, your lips are so soft... Do that again... (and she/he moves in for another kiss. Joey, pushes her head away again...)ScenesJoey: Yeah... we really need to talk to Ross...ScenesBoth: YeahScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's room. Chandler is packing when Ross knocks on the door and enters...]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: You guys ready to go?ScenesChandler: Not quite. Monica's still at the salon, and I'm just finishing packing.ScenesRoss: Dude! You're not taking your Bible?ScenesChandler: You're not supposed to take that. Besides, it's a New Testament, what are you gonna do with it?ScenesRoss: Learn about Jesus...Scenes(Charlie now also enters the room, Chandler walks to the bathroom)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesCharlie: So, did you talk to Joey?ScenesRoss: Uh, no... no. I couldn't find him. I'm just gonna talk to him on the plane.ScenesCharlie: Yeah, sounds like a good idea... Dr. Geller!ScenesRoss: Stop it!ScenesCharlie: PHDScenesRoss: You're filthy!Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, have you guys seen Monica?ScenesRoss: Uh, actually I think she went to the salon.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, oh, she went to the salon alright...Scenes(Monica enters, with her hair braided and little shells at the end)ScenesMonica: Check it out!ScenesPhoebe: Who's day just got better? CHANDLER!Scenes(Chandler enters from the bathroom)ScenesChandler: Hey!... aaaaaahhhh!ScenesMonica: What do you think?ScenesChandler: I think.... I think I can see your scalp.ScenesMonica: Don't you just love it?ScenesRoss: Ye... Yeah... Yeah... You got shellfish in your head.ScenesCharlie: It's so... something... You go girlfriend!ScenesRoss: You've never said that in your life, have you?ScenesCharlie: Not once.ScenesRoss: I thought so.ScenesMonica: And listen to this... (shakes her body so the shells tingle)ScenesChandler: What d'ya know... It's a treat for the eyes and the ears.

rows.Scenes: Boarding the plane.]
rows.Content: Joey: Whoo, whoo. Wow, it's uhm... kinda weird that I'm sitting next to Charlie after we broke up.ScenesChandler: Yeah, it's almost if Air Barbados doesn't care about your social life.ScenesJoey: Look, does someone mind switching to sit with Charlie?ScenesRoss: Oh, I uh, I mean, I... dude, I spent the whole conference with Charlie.ScenesJoey: I understand...ScenesRoss: No, I'll do it. (he quickly grabs Joey's boarding pass and gives Joey his one.)ScenesChandler: Wish I could switch with someone. I really don't wanna sit with Allen Iverson over there.Scenes(Switch to Phoebe and Mike, who are kissing)ScenesPhoebe: Uhm... You know, once we're in the air and the captain turns off the seatbelt sign... you feel free to roam about my cabin...ScenesMike: You should be careful when checking your overhead bins, 'cause items may shift during...ScenesPhoebe: Aaah... you're not good at this...ScenesMike: You don't have to go home tonight, do you?ScenesPhoebe: No, I think I can come over. It's Saturday, right?ScenesMike: Oh...ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesMike: Uhm... I can't do anything tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Why not?ScenesMike: I have a date.ScenesPhoebe: You have a... You have a date? With who?ScenesMike: Oh, it's... my girlfriend.ScenesPhoebe: (lets go of his hand) You have... have a girlfriend?ScenesMike: Yeah... Well, when... you and I broke up I started seeing someone.ScenesPhoebe: For how long?ScenesMike: Three months.ScenesPhoebe: Three months? Okay... This is probably none of my business, but uhm, how long do you think you're gonna keep seeing her?ScenesMike: I'll tell her that it's over tonight at dinner. I promise.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay... good. You do that. And then when you get home, maybe there'll be a special delivery package waiting for you.ScenesMike: Maybe I'll sign for it. Tear it open. Pull out the packing material...ScenesPhoebe: You know what, we're gonna have sex. Let's just leave it there.Scenes(cut to Charlie and Ross)ScenesRoss: Right, I'm gonna go talk to Joey. I think this is the right time. He's always in a good mood after the flight attendant says "duty free".ScenesCharlie: Okay... Good luck.Scenes(Ross gets up and gestures to Rachel, we cut to Joey and Rachel)ScenesRachel: Ross is coming over. I think now would be a really good time to talk to him.ScenesJoey: I guess so. I'm just... really nervous.ScenesRachel: Okay, well keep in mind that by the time you're done, they'll probably be serving dinner.ScenesJoey: Ooh...ScenesRachel: Still nervous?ScenesJoey: I'm gonna get the lasagna.ScenesRoss: Hey Rach...ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Do you mind if I sit here for a sec.?ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah sure! Yeah! (mouths "Good luck" to Joey and gets up from her seat)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: So, I uhm... kinda need to talk to you about Charlie.ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Okay, last night after you guys broke up... so sorry to hear about that, by the way... Well, Charlie and I were talking, and..., well...ScenesJoey: You kissed.ScenesRoss: Wha... (gasps) What? What would give you that idea?ScenesJoey: I saw you.ScenesRoss: Yeah, we kissed, but... nothing else... nothing else happened, okay.ScenesJoey: Ross, Ross, Ross... It's okay.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: It's okay. You know, I totally understand, alright? You guys, make way more sense than her and I ever did, you know. And... I want you to be happy.ScenesRoss: Are you serious?ScenesJoey: Yeah... Now I have something...ScenesRoss: I am speachless... I mean the fact that you would put my happiness first like that. I mean, you're an incredible friend, you know that?ScenesJoey: Oh... uh... look... before you...ScenesRoss: No, I mean it. You are so loyal man, and selfless, and generous...ScenesJoey: I am those things, yeah.ScenesRoss: You know what? I know Chandler longer, so I always think of him as my best friend, but now... I may have to rethink some stuff...ScenesJoey: Dude!ScenesRoss: Hey, if there is ever, anything I can do for you...ScenesJoey: I can't think of anything.Scenes(They both hug, and Rachel, who was in the back of the plane, sees this and smiles.)ScenesRoss: Thanks!ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Ross walks to the back of the plane, where Rachel is.)ScenesRachel: So hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: So you eh, you talked to Joey?ScenesRoss: Ah, yeah. We had a really good talk.ScenesRachel: Oh! That's great!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesRachel: Oh, so everything's okay?ScenesRoss: Oh, no, it's great. It's great. He is... He is an amazing guy.ScenesRachel: Ah... Well, obviously I think so too.ScenesRoss: Well, I'm so excited about this.ScenesRachel: Really? Excited?ScenesRoss: Are you kidding? I have had some very dirty dreams about this...ScenesRachel: Excuse me! (and she walks back to Joey, who is still looking very impressed about what Ross said to him. Rachel looks at him and hits him.) You didn't tell him, did you?ScenesJoey: I couldn't. He was saying all these really nice things about me. I didn't want him to get mad and take 'em all back. I'm on a edge on Chandler.ScenesRachel: Oh God! Alright, fine. You know what Joey, forget it. When we go back to New York, I will tell him.ScenesJoey: Thank you. Yeah, I appreciate that.Scenes(Chandler walks by and Joey lets out an evil "muhahaho".)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Mike's apartment. Phoebe's there and the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi, Mike's place.ScenesMike: Hey, it's Mike.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, that was fast.ScenesMike: Oh, err... no, she's not here yet. You know, I think I'm just gonna take off and break up with her over the phone...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you can't do that! Oh, come on Mike, strap on a pair.Why don't you just tell her that we got back together. You know, women appreciate honesty. We also appreciate gentle spanking once in a while. Just F.Y.I.ScenesMike: One more thing... There... might be a picture of Precious on my coffee table.ScenesPhoebe: Her name is Precious? Is she a purebreed or did you pick her up at the pound?ScenesMike: Anyway, I just wanna give you a heads up.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, oh and you know, if she gets upset, just scratch her tummy and give her a liver snout. (laughs and hangs up the phone)Scenes(there's knocking on the door which Phoebe opens)ScenesPrecious: Hi, I'm Precious, who are you?ScenesPhoebe: (stunned) I... I'm Phoebe.ScenesPrecious: Phoebe? Mike's ex-girlfriend Phoebe, the love of his life? That Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Enchanté (she holds out her hand, and they shake hands)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Monica's carrying the laundry hamper to their coffee table.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, I can't wait for everyone at work to see these... (plays with her hair to make the shells tingle again) Ow!ScenesChandler: You go back to work tomorrow night, right?ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesChandler: So if you want people to see them, then by definition you're not having them taken out... say, at the break of dawn?ScenesMonica: Well, if I had them taken out, then I wouldn't be able to do this. (she pushes Chandler on the couch and brushes her hair and shells against Chandler's chest) You like that, right? (again, she brushes her hair against his chest and hums...)ScenesChandler: What are you singing?ScenesMonica: It's "Bolero" from "10".ScenesChandler: It's "Ride of the Valkyries" from "Apocalypse Now"... See, here's the thing: The corn rose were really a solution to your frizzy hair problem. And now that we're home, we don't have that problem anymore, so if you think about it... I hate them!ScenesMonica: You what? You said you liked them.ScenesChandler: Did I? Let's refresh. I believe what I said was that I could see your scalp.ScenesMonica: Fine, so you don't like them. Everybody else does.ScenesChandler: Again, let's journey back... As I recall what Rachel said, was she had never notice the shape of your skull before. And Joey... Well, Joey didn't realise that there was anything different.ScenesMonica: You know what? I don't care. I like it like this, and I'm gonna keep it. You're just jealous because your hair can't do this... (and she shakes her head more violently) OUCH!ScenesChandler: Hit yourself in the tooth?ScenesMonica: And the eye!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment.Someone's knocking on the door. Ross rushes to the door and it's Rachel with Emma.]
rows.Content: Ross: (gasps) Hi... There she is. Hi Emma. Oh my God, I missed you. (kisses her) Oh Emma, I missed you so much. Hey... Did you have a good time with grandma Green? Huh? Did she give you a bottle of anti-depressants again to use as a rattle? (to Rachel)ScenesRachel: That was one time, Ross, and they were only like 5 milligrams.ScenesRoss: Ooh hey, Emma, daddy has some presents for you okay? Okay? I want you to wait right here. Come here sweetie.ScenesRachel: Aaah... Ross, actually there's something that I really need to talk to you about.ScenesRoss: (unpacking his bag) Okay, shoot!ScenesRachel: Okay, uhm... alright, here's the deal.ScenesRoss: (gasps) OH NO!ScenesRachel: What? What is it?ScenesRoss: Oh, major shampoo explosion!ScenesRachel: Uh, look Ross, this really isn't easy.ScenesRoss: Oh, it's all over everything. Why? Why me? (looks up)ScenesRachel: Because you took three hundred bottles of shampoo?ScenesRoss: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You were saying?ScenesRachel: Well, yeah... Okay, look it's about me and...ScenesRoss: Oh, not another one! Oh my G... And this is moisturiser. It's even harder to clean! Why? Why do bad things happen to good people?ScenesRachel: Wow! Well, clearly this is not a good time.ScenesRoss: Duh, you think? (enters the kitchen)

rows.Scenes: Mike's place. Phoebe is on the phone.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, bye. Alright, so Mike's on his way over. See, you thought you guys were meeting here, and he thought you were meeting at the restaurant, so you know... Doesn't really matter who's right or wrong. Point is... I'm gonna take off.ScenesPrecious: I'm not letting you leave until you tell me what's going on here. I mean, are you guys getting back together or something?ScenesPhoebe: Alright... Susie, can I call you Susie?ScenesPrecious: My name is Precious.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I can't say that. uhm... Susie, I'm gonna be straight with you... Mike and I are back together... and uhm... unfortunately that effectively ends your relationship with him. And he's very sorry about that and wishes you the best of luck in all your endeavours.ScenesPrecious: I just can't believe this... Why?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I don't...ScenesPrecious: Oh, why would he do this? I mean, what's wrong with me?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing, there's nothing wrong with you.ScenesPrecious: I mean, what the hell am I supposed to do now?ScenesPhoebe: Damn it woman, pull yourself together! Have some pride, for the love of God.Scenes(Precious starts crying)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, not a fan of the tough love.ScenesPrecious: I just can't believe that Mike didn't give me any warning.ScenesPhoebe: But he didn't really know, you know. He wasn't planning on coming to Barbados and proposing to me...ScenesPrecious: He proposed to you? This is the worst birthday ever. (she starts to cry again)ScenesPhoebe: Look, Precious... Mike's not worth this. You're an attractive, intelligent woman and let's face it, Mike's kind of a wang. I mean, he proposed to me while he was still seeing you... He was gonna break-up with you on your birthday? And, I don't like to kiss-and-tell, but he cheated on you a lot this weekend.ScenesPrecious: Oh, my God, maybe you're right. Maybe I don't need him. I deserve to be treated with respect.Scenes(Mike enters the apartment.)ScenesPrecious: Screw you, Mike. You're a coward and a bastard, and I hope you rot in hell.Scenes(she slaps him in the face, Mike looks like he doesn't believe what just happened. Precious leaves, and he turns to Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: You're welcome!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's. Only Chandler is in the living room and walks to the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Honey, you've been in there for a long time... Is everything okay?ScenesMonica: Not really.Scenes(Chandler enters the bathroom, and Monica is standing there in a towel, with her hair stuck in the shower curtain.)ScenesMonica: I have a problem.ScenesChandler: Really? What happened?ScenesMonica: Well, I was dancing around, and singing "No Woman, No Cry" and I got stuck.ScenesChandler: You can't move at all?ScenesMonica: Oh, well, I can move... (she moves back and forth the shower curtain rail, opening and closing the shower curtain with her hair as she goes)ScenesChandler: If I untangle you, will you please get rid of the corn rose?ScenesMonica: (looking disappointed) I guess so...ScenesChandler: (trying to untangle her) Some of these look a little frayed.ScenesMonica: Yeah, I tried to gnaw myself free.

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey's apartment. Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: So, did you err... did you tell Ross?ScenesRachel: Well, I tried, but then he had a shampoo related emergency. So I guess now it's your turn again.ScenesJoey: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no... I think it's better if you tell him, you know. It's easier for a woman. That way, you know, if he gets mad, all you have to do is go... I didn't mean it. I'm so so--ooory. (he pushes his breasts together from the side)ScenesRachel: Yeah, 'cause that's what we do.ScenesJoey: Alright, alright, okay, uhm... How 'bout this, how about this? Tomorrow... tomorrow we'll both go and we'll tell him together.ScenesRachel: Okay, that sounds fair. It just means that once again we can't...ScenesJoey: I know, I know..., but that's okay. I mean, we can control ourselves, we're not animals.ScenesRachel: No! Of course we can wait. Alright, so I guess that means good night then?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Good night! (they give each other a small kiss on the mouth, and stare at each other for a while)ScenesRachel: Goo--ood night!ScenesJoey: Good night! (they give each other a kiss again, but this time it lasts longer)ScenesRachel: Seriously, good night!ScenesJoey: Stop saying good night.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(Now they kiss passionately... and then Ross enters with Emma. They freeze, pull away and look at Ross who looks like he just can't believe what he's seeing. Joey straightens his shirt, and Rachel says I'm so-oo sorry, and presses her breasts together, just like Joey did before.)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's. Monica walks in with one of those knitted Rasta hats.]
rows.Content: Monica: Look what I found in the drawer... (Chandler looks up from his book.) And you said I'd never wear this...ScenesChandler: Now that I untangled you, how 'bout you doing a little something for me?ScenesMonica: Sure, what do you have in mind?ScenesChandler: I think you know.ScenesMonica: Really? I don't really feel like it.ScenesChandler: This is what I want to do.ScenesMonica: Okay, I just don't get why you like it so much.ScenesChandler: (Picks up the "Miss Congeniality" DVD) She's an FBI agent, posing as a beauty contestant.ScenesTHE ENDScenes1002 - The One Where Ross Is FineScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen PlummerScenesDirected by: Ben WeissScenesTranscribed by: Kreidy

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. The scene starts where we took off in the last episode with Ross seeing Joey and Rachel kissing. Rosss tares at them.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, Ross, I realise that you didn't expect to walk in and see that, but.. Let me explain, okay?ScenesRachel: We weren't doing anything!ScenesJoey: Rach, he just saw us.ScenesRachel: Shhh.ScenesJoey: But what you saw, that is the extent of it, okay? One kiss.ScenesRachel: No, come on, that is a lie. We also kissed in Barbados.ScenesJoey (to Rachel): Dude, chill! (to Ross) Okay, we also kissed in Barbados, but we didn't plan it, okay? And the only reason that that happened was because I saw you kissing Charlie.ScenesRachel: Yeah, you started it! I've got to chill.ScenesJoey: Look, we probably should have talked to you about this before it ever happened, but..ScenesRachel: We feel so terrible about this, Ross.ScenesJoey: Yeah, but it did happen, so...Scenes(Ross looks shocked and says nothing.)ScenesJoey: Ross?ScenesRachel: Ross? (to Joey) Can we just close the door?ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ross, say something. Anything.ScenesRoss: So you two are..?ScenesJoey and Rachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: And have you .. ed?ScenesJoey: No, no, no!ScenesRachel: No, no, no!ScenesRoss: But if I hadn't walked in here, would you..?ScenesJoey: Probably.Scenes(Rachel looks at him.)ScenesJoey: No, no!ScenesRachel: Ross, this is not how we wanted you to find out about this. You have every right to go nuts.ScenesRoss: I'm not going nuts. Do you see me go nuts?ScenesRachel: No, but you know what I mean.ScenesRoss: Hey, hey, hey... If you two are happy, then I'm happy for you. (Squeaky.) I'm fine!ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesRoss: Absolutely. (Very Squeaky.) I'm fine! Totally fine. I don't know why it's coming out all loud and squeaky, 'cause really, (deep voice) I'm fine. I'm not saying I wasn't a little surprised to see you guys kissing. I mean, at first I was like.. (Screams.) But now that I've had time to absorb it; Lovin' this.ScenesJoey: Ross..ScenesRoss: It's all working out! Me & Charlie, and you two. You know what we should do?ScenesRachel: Calm ourselves?ScenesRoss: No. We should all have dinner. Yes, we'll do it tomorrow night. I'll cook!!ScenesJoey: Look, don't you think that will be a little weird?ScenesRoss: Weird? What? What's weird? The only thing weird would be if someone didn't like Mexican food, because I'm making fajitas!! (Storms off.)ScenesJoey: I do like fajitas.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Monica and Chandler are there. They have lots of brochures about adoption in front of them.]
rows.Content: Monica: God, this adoption stuff is so overwhelming. There's inter-country adoption, dependency adoption.. There are so many ways to go, and this is like the biggest decision of our lives.ScenesChandler: There's a hair in my coffee.Scenes(Phoebe enters.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey guys!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, have you seen Frank Jr., 'cause he's meeting me here with the triplets.ScenesChandler: You know, it's funny. Every time you say "triplets," I immediately think of three hot blonde 19-year olds.Scenes(Monica glares at him.)ScenesMonica: That's sweet. Drink your hair.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, what's all this stuff?ScenesMonica: Oh, they're brochures from different adoption agencies.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, babies! Oh, this one is so cute, get this one!ScenesMonica: That's not really how it works.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how does it work?ScenesMonica: I don't know!ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you're having a hard time, you should talk to my friends, Bill and Colleen. They adopted a kid. I'm sure they'd help you.ScenesMonica: Thanks, that would be great. Hey, honey, wouldn't that be great?Scenes(Chandler looks like he did the time he swallowed the toy in 605 TOW Joey's Porsche. It's the hair in his coffee.)Scenes(Frank Jr. and the triplets enter.)ScenesFrank Jr.: Alright, alright, alright. Remember what we talked about. When we're in a public place, there are certain rules.Scenes(The triplets scream and run amok in the coffeehouse.)ScenesFrank Jr.: That's not what we talked about!!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesFrank Jr.: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Good to see you.ScenesFrank Jr.: Good to see you, too.ScenesMonica: Hi Frank.ScenesFrank Jr.: Hi, how you doin'?ScenesMonica: Oh, my goodness, they've all gotten so big!Scenes(Little Chandler is pulling Chandler's sweater, while Leslie is throwing bagels at him.)ScenesMonica: Which one is which again?ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, that's Frank Jr. Jr. pulling the tampons out of the lady's purse. And that's Chandler climbing on Chandler, and that's Leslie throwing bagels at him.ScenesMonica (reads a form in her lap): "Willing to adopt triplets?" No!

rows.Scenes: The hallway in Ross's building. Joey and Rachel are on their way to Ross's dinner.]
rows.Content: Joey: Ah, can I just say I know we're doing this for Ross, and that's cool, but if it was up to me, this is not what we'd be doing on our first date.ScenesRachel: Well, what would we be doing?ScenesJoey: I'd take you out for a romantic night. Some champagne, fancy dinner, feel you up on the carriage ride home...ScenesRachel: Feel me up?ScenesJoey: In a carriage!Scenes(Charlie walks up to them.)ScenesJoey: Hey, Charlie!ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesCharlie: Hi, hi. So.. Dreading this?ScenesRachel: Oh, you bet.Scenes(Joey sees that she's carrying a small red bag.)ScenesJoey: So, did you bring a little something for Ross?ScenesCharlie: Actually.. It's stuff you left at my apartment.ScenesJoey: Oh. Oh, thanks.ScenesCharlie: And you know, you can just give me my stuff whenever you want.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I didn't throw any of that out..Scenes(They enter Ross's apartment. Ross is already quite hyper.)ScenesRoss: I thought I heard voices! Hi Charlie! (Kisses her.) Hi Joey. (Hugs him.) And.. Oh! You're gonna have to introduce me to your new girlfriend. (Laughs.) I'm just kidding, I know Rachel, I know. (He squeezes her hand.) Come, please come in. Come in.ScenesRachel: Okay, well, we brought you some wine.ScenesRoss: Oh! That is so thoughtful. (To Joey.) She's a keeper. And what did you bring me? (Grabs the bag that Charlie brought for Joey.)ScenesJoey: Uh, actually, that's..ScenesRoss: Underwear, a toothbrush, and Van Halen CD. I can use all these things!!ScenesCharlie: Gosh, Ross, you know, you seem a little...ScenesRoss: What? Fine? Because I am! Aren't you? Aren't you? Aren't you? You see? Who else is fine?ScenesJoey: Okay, listen, hey, Ross. Why don't you try to relax, okay? Maybe have a drink.ScenesRoss: You know what? That is a very good idea. I'm gonna go make a pitcher of Margaritas.Scenes(Does a Mexican dancing-thing before going to the kitchen.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Frank Jr., Phoebe and the triplets are there. The triplets are now sleeping on top of each other on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, god. So adorable. Look at them sleeping there like angels.ScenesFrank Jr.: Yeah, I really cherish these moments, 'cause before you know it, they're gonna be awake again.ScenesPhoebe: Well, they may be a handful, but they're so cute.ScenesFrank Jr.: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, god, the last time I babysat them, they did the funniest thing..ScenesFrank Jr.: I haven't slept in four years!ScenesPhoebe: That's a, that's a long time.ScenesFrank Jr.: You just don't know how hard it is, Phoebe. There's just so many of them. You know, two I can handle. Two's great. You just hold one in each hand, but what do I do when the third one runs at me with his bike helmet on. I've got no more hands to protect my area! There's three of them, Phoebe, three!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know, Frank. I counted them when they were coming out of my area.ScenesFrank Jr.: Sometimes I think that.. Oh, no, no, no, I can't say it, it's too horrible. No.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesFrank Jr.: No, I can't.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my god, Frank, are you thinking of leaving? Because I didn't have those triplets so you could just run out on them!ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, no! I would never do that. No. I just was thinking that, you know, maybe you could take one.ScenesPhoebe: What?! You can't separate them! That's terrible. Which one?

rows.Scenes: Bill and Colleen's apartment. Chandler and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Thank you so much for seeing us. Phoebe has told us such great things about you guys.ScenesColleen: Oh, please, we're happy to help.ScenesBill: We went through the same thing when we were adopting.ScenesChandler: So, a lot of malfunctioning wee-wees and hoo-hoos in this room, huh?Scenes(Bill and Colleen look shocked.)ScenesChandler: I mean, you have a lovely home.ScenesMonica: Well, we appreciate anything you can tell us.ScenesColleen: Well, actually, I think this might help.Scenes(She gives Monica a big binder that's perfectly in order.)ScenesColleen: It's pretty much all the information you need.ScenesMonica: Oh my god!ScenesColleen: Everything is broken down into categories, and then cross-referenced, and then colour-coded to correspond with the forms in the back.ScenesMonica: Thank you. (To Chandler.) I think I just had a tiny orgasm.ScenesBill: I know the process is frustrating, but it's so worth it. Adopting Owen was the best thing that ever happened to us.ScenesChandler: That's great. (To Monica.) Can I see the book?Scenes(Monica looks at him.)ScenesChandler: You want me to wash my hands first, don't you?ScenesMonica: It's.. It's just so pretty and white.ScenesColleen: The bathroom is down the hall, to your left.Scenes(Chandler leaves.)ScenesColleen: I would have told him to do it too.ScenesMonica: Can I adopt you?Scenes(Cut to the hall. Owen is wearing his scout-uniform and is looking through a box when Chandler walks up to him.)ScenesChandler: Hey, you must be Owen.ScenesOwen: Yeah.ScenesChandler: I'm Chandler. Hey, I was in the scouts too.ScenesOwen: You were?ScenesChandler: Yeah, in fact my father was a den-mother.ScenesOwen: Huh?ScenesChandler: You know how to use a compass?ScenesOwen: I have a badge in it.ScenesChandler: You do? That's fantastic!ScenesOwen: You wanna see it?ScenesChandler: I'd love to, but I gotta get back to talking to your parents. They're telling us all about how they adopted you.ScenesOwen: What?!?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesOwen: I'm adopted?Scenes(Chandler tries to come up with a good answer.)ScenesChandler: I got nothing.

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment. Ross is totally wasted, but he's still drinking all the margaritas.]
rows.Content: Ross: The first batch of margaritas was not so great, but the second batch is gooooood.ScenesRachel: Well, maybe the next batch, we could all get some.ScenesRoss: Oh, guys, this is fun, isn't it? You know? Just the four of us. Just hangin'.ScenesJoey: Dude, are you okay? And when are the fajitas gonna be ready?ScenesRoss: I'm fine! Hey, I'm great! I'm just.. I'm just proud of us. There's no weirdness, no tension.ScenesRachel: No awareness.ScenesRoss: We make a great foursome. We should do more stuff together. Ooh! Let's take a trip. Okay, where do you think we - we can go?Scenes(The oven timer pings in the kitchen.)ScenesRoss: My fajitas!!Scenes(He runs off to the kitchen.)ScenesRachel: Look, Charlie, I just want you to know. Ross is just having a little trouble adjusting to the thought of Joey and me. You know, he normally doesn't drink like this.ScenesCharlie: Oh, you know what? This is nothing. My father is a raging alcoholic.Scenes(Joey and Rachel don't know how to respond to that.)ScenesCharlie: Oh, I'm sorry, have I made this evening uncomfortable?Scenes(Ross enters carrying a frying pan with fajitas - without any oven mitts.)ScenesRoss: Fajitas! Be careful, very hot plate, very hot plate!!ScenesRachel: Ross, you don't even have oven mitts on!Scenes(Ross laughs.)ScenesRoss: That is gonna hurt tomorrow!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Frank Jr., Phoebe and the triplets are there. Continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, well, this is crazy. Can't seriously be talking about me taking one of your kids, can we?ScenesFrank Jr.: No, of course we're not.ScenesPhoebe: Insane.ScenesFrank Jr.: I know.ScenesPhoebe: Alice would never go for it, right?ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, I don't know, she's pretty tired, too, I think we've got her onboard.ScenesPhoebe: Well, just you know, for argument's sake, you know, hypothetically. Which one would you be willing to give up?ScenesFrank Jr.: Huh.ScenesPhoebe: Frank Jr.Jr.?ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, you'd be getting a really good one. I mean, you know, he's really funny. Like, the other day he made up this joke.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesFrank Jr.: What's green and says "hey, I'm a frog"? A talking frog! (Laughs.) Oh, no, you can't have him, he's too funny.ScenesPhoebe: Well, alright, that's fine. What about Leslie?ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, no, no. Not Leslie. No, she's, she's the only one that knows how to burp the alphabet.ScenesPhoebe: Alright, so that leaves Chandler.ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, no, no, you can't have Chandler, no. No, no. She's my little genius. I got big hopes for her. She's gonna be a doctor or a realtor..ScenesPhoebe: Wow, Frank. I think we just ran out of kids.ScenesFrank Jr.: Oh, I think you're right. Oh, wow. Phoebe, I don't think I can give one of them up. I mean, you know, they drive me crazy, but they're my babies.ScenesPhoebe: I'm sorry, Frank. I didn't realise things were so bad. You know, I'll help out more. I can - I can babysit any time you want. You name the day, and I'll be there.ScenesFrank Jr.: How about tomorrow?ScenesPhoebe: Well, that's not good. But you know, I can move some stuff around, and I'll be there. You and Alice just take the whole day together.ScenesFrank Jr.: You'd do that for us?ScenesPhoebe: Are you kidding? That's what sisters are for.ScenesFrank Jr. (looks at the triplets): Look at them! Aw. I love you so much. (Strokes Leslie's hair, and she moves a little.) Oh crap, don't wake up, don't wake up!

rows.Scenes: Bill and Colleen's apartment. Chandler comes running into the living room. Monica is the only one there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Where are Bill and Colleen?ScenesMonica: They're in the kitchen getting something to eat. Can you believe how nice they are?ScenesChandler: We have to leave!!ScenesMonica: Why? What did you do in the bathroom?ScenesChandler: I didn't get to the bathroom. I bumped into Owen on the way, and he didn't know he was adopted. And there's a slight chance I may have told him.ScenesMonica: Oh my god, where's my purse? No, you know what? I can replace everything in there. Get that binder, and let's go!Scenes(Bill and Colleen enter.)ScenesColleen: Hey.ScenesBill: Some little snacks for everybody. Oh, you don't have to eat the sour worms. Those are for Owen.ScenesColleen: I'll go get him in a second. By the way, you should know we haven't told him he's adopted yet.ScenesChandler: But kids are so intuitive. Don't you think on some level he already knows?Scenes(Owen comes running in.)ScenesOwen: I'm adopted?!ScenesChandler: See? Intuitive!ScenesBill: What? Where did you hear that?ScenesOwen: He told me! And he paid me 50 dollars not to tell.ScenesChandler: Which technically now you should give back!ScenesColleen: You told him he's adopted?ScenesChandler: I'm so sorry, but you should have a sign out there or something. Or at least whisper it to people when they come in the door. "Owen doesn't know he's adopted, and he also thinks that Santa is real.ScenesOwen: He isn't?!ScenesChandler (to Monica): We have to get out of here, baby!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment. Rachel, Joey and Charlie are eating fajitas when Ross enters from the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Ross: Everyone? I would like to make a toast to Rachel and Joey.ScenesRachel: Ooy.ScenesRoss: And to love. Ah, love. L-O-V-E, love. L is for life. And what is life without love?ScenesRachel: Oh my god, are we supposed to answer?ScenesRoss: O is for "oh, wow!" The V is for this very surprising turn of events, which I'm still fine with by the way. E is for how extremely normal I find it. That you two are together. And now one day you might get married and have children of your own.Scenes(Ross chokes up and pauses. Rachel and Joey look at him.)ScenesJoey: Dude, are you okay?ScenesRoss: Totally.ScenesRachel: Ross, you don't seem okay.ScenesRoss (on the verge of tears): I'm sorry, it must be the pressure of entertaining. I think everyone would feel better if we had some flan.ScenesCharlie: Wait, Ross. Ross. I - I have to take off.ScenesRoss: No!ScenesCharlie: I'm sorry, I have a really early class in the morning, but this has been lovely.ScenesRoss: Wasn't it? And you thought it would be awkward with Joey and that you never really liked Rachel.ScenesCharlie: You're on fire! I'll call you in the morning, okay?ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesCharlie: Alright.Scenes(Ross goes to the kitchen.)ScenesCharlie: God, Rachel, what Ross just said that is just so..ScenesRachel: Oh, that's okay, girls tend not to like me.ScenesCharlie: Bye.Scenes(Ross enters from the kitchen with three plates with flan.)ScenesRoss: Okay, I guess it's just flan for three! Hey, hey, that rhymed!ScenesRachel: You know what, Ross? I think we're gonna take off too.ScenesRoss: Oh, oh. Of course. God, I'm so stupid. You guys are a couple now. I mean, you probably just want to be alone.ScenesRachel: No, no, it's just that it's getting late...ScenesRoss: Hey, hey, it's fine. It's totally fine. We've got plenty of margaritas. It's all good.Scenes(The oven timer pings again.)ScenesRoss: I don't even know what that's for.Scenes(He goes back to the kitchen.)ScenesJoey: You know what? I think I'm gonna stay here and make sure he's okay.ScenesRachel: Yeah, that's probably a good idea.ScenesJoey: Yeah. I'll see you in the morning.ScenesRachel: Uh-huh. Okay. You know what, Joey, I don't think he's ever gonna be okay with this.ScenesJoey: It doesn't look good, does it?Scenes(They kiss each other on the cheek, and Rachel leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment the next morning. Ross is very hung-over on the couch as Joey enters with a cup of coffee for him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Morning. Here you go.ScenesRoss: Thanks. Did you stay here all night?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: So you took off my pants and shoes?ScenesJoey: No, no, no. You actually did that when you were dancing to the Chicago-soundtrack. Look, Ross, about, about Rachel and I. Listen, you don't have to worry about that, okay? Because nothing is gonna happen.ScenesRoss: What do you mean?ScenesJoey: Well, she and I said from the beginning that we weren't gonna do anything unless you were okay with it. And clearly..ScenesRoss: Hey, what are you talking about? I'm fine!ScenesJoey: It's okay, Ross, alright? I totally understand. Of course you're not fine. You're.. You're Ross and Rachel.ScenesRoss: Except we're not. I mean, we haven't been a couple in like, six years. Oh my god, is that right? Has it been that long?ScenesJoey: That's what I hear, yeah.ScenesRoss: This is crazy. I mean, six years? And because of me you guys aren't gonna be together? Can I ask you something? Really, what is this thing with you and Rachel?ScenesJoey: Come on, I mean, you know me, you know...ScenesRoss: Joey.ScenesJoey: I'm crazy about her.ScenesRoss: And she feels the same way?ScenesJoey: I think so.ScenesRoss: Well, then, maybe it's time we all moved on.ScenesJoey: Yeah, but, Ross, I mean, you're not okay with it.ScenesRoss: No, but I wanna be. Hey, I will be. Besides, I'm with Charlie, right? Oh my god, I'm still with Charlie, aren't I? I mean, she didn't see the dance, did she?ScenesJoey: No, no, no, no, that was - that was just for me. Are you sure about this?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I'm sure.ScenesJoey: And we're okay?Scenes(Ross smiles and holds up his hand for a high-five, but he has forgotten about his burnt hands. He gasps in pain as Joey grabs his hand.)ScenesENDING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Monica and Chandler enter to find Phoebe there with the triplets.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, PhoebsScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesMonica: Uhm, we just wanna give you a heads-up. Bill and Colleen hate us.ScenesChandler: Owen didn't know he was adopted, and Monica told him.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Still, he had to find out sometime.ScenesChandler: Yeah, but how would you like it if someone told the triplets that you gave birth to them?Scenes(The triplets stare at him.)ScenesChandler: I'm gonna go tell Emma she was an accident. (Runs off.)ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1003 - The One With Ross' TanScenesWritten by: Brian BucknerScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & Vanessa

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment]
rows.Content: Chandler: So, you and Rachel tonight, huh?ScenesJoey: Yeah. It's actually our first official dateScenesChandler: Wow! So tonight may be the night! You're nervous?ScenesJoey: Naa, no. This is the part I'm actually good at.ScenesChandler: What must it be like not to be crippled by fear and self-loathing.ScenesJoey: (pause) It's OK!ScenesChandler: How can you be so confident?ScenesJoey: Well, I... I know exactly what I'm gonna do!ScenesChandler: Really? Like you have a routine?ScenesJoey: No, no no no no. See. Each woman is different.You have to appreciate their uniqueness.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesJoey: No, I do six things! First, I look deep in her eyes. Then, I kiss her. Next I take my hand and I softly graze her thigh.ScenesChandler: You mean like this? (he starts touching his thigh in a funny and awkard way)ScenesJoey: NO! Not like that, no no. No, like this. (He starts lightly grazing Chandler's thigh)ScenesChandler: Oh, I see what you mean, that's quite nice. (They look at each other, both embarassed)ScenesJoey: More foosball?ScenesChandler: ...and beer!!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Ross and Chandler are on the couch]
rows.Content: Monica: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss and Chandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Hey sweetie! (they kiss)ScenesRoss: (looking at Monica's legs) WOW!ScenesChandler: Hey! Stop staring at my wife's legs! No no! Stop staring at your sister's legs!ScenesRoss: I'm sorry, it's just... how did you get so tan?ScenesChandler: She went on one of those spray-on tan places.ScenesRoss: Eh, you got a spray-on tan?ScenesMonica: Chandler gets pedicures!ScenesRoss: (laughing) Why, why you do, like with the-the toe separators?ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Why...why?ScenesRoss: Still, I can't believe that's sprayed on... I mean, it looks really good. I wonder if I should get one!ScenesChandler: Sure, then you should get a mini skirt so you can really show it off.ScenesRoss: So, do you get colours or just French tips?ScenesMonica: There. Here's their card.ScenesRoss: Thanks. (he takes the card) Hey, I know where this place is! It used to be an X-rated video... (pauses when he realizes what he is saying) florist. (he goes away)Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey Pheebs!ScenesMonica: Hey Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you won't believe who moved back to town.ScenesMonica: I know, Amanda! Ah! She called me too! She's the worst!ScenesChandler: Who's Amanda?ScenesMonica: She's this girl who used to live in the building before you did. Then she moved to England and she picked up this fake British accent. On the machine this is her message. (she apes Amanda using an awful British accent) "Monica, darling! It's Amanda calling!ScenesChandler: Are you trying to do a British accent?ScenesMonica: (pause) (to Phoebe) Chandler gets pedicures!ScenesChandler: Just so I know, how many more of those can I expect?ScenesPhoebe: You know what Amanda said to me when she got me on the phone? (apes Amanda in a british accent) "Oh, so sorry to catch you on your Mo-Bile!" If-if you don't wanna get me on my mo-Bile, don't call me on my mo-Bile!ScenesMonica: I know, and she's always bragging about all the famous people she's met.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I know! "Oh...I slept with Billy Joel". All right, who hasn't?ScenesMonica: Oh, what are we gonna do! I don't wanna see her!!ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, Let's just cut her out!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Cut her out of our lives! Just ignore her calls and dodge her 'till she gets the point!ScenesMonica: Oh, I guess we could try that, but... it seems so harsh! (to Chandler) Have you ever done that?ScenesChandler: No, had it done to me though. Feels good !

rows.Scenes: At the tanning salon. Ross and a male assistant are walking through a hall]
rows.Content: Assistant: Alright Mr. Geller! Right this way! So, how dark do you wanna be? We have one, two or three.ScenesRoss: Well... I like how you look, what are you?ScenesAssistant: Puerto Rican.ScenesRoss: Two, I think a two.ScenesAssistant: You've got to face the red light. When the red light goes on the spraying is about to start so close your eyes. When the spraying stops, count to five. Pat yourself down to avoid drip marks then turn around so we can get your back. Got it?ScenesRoss: Spray, count, pat, then turn, spray, count and pat.ScenesAssistant: Wow, you catch on quick.ScenesRoss: Well, I have a PhD, so... (assistant walk out, not impressed by this statement)Scenes(Ross takes his bathrobe off and he enters the tanning booth. He stands up in front of the red light and the sprayer starts and sprays his face and torso)ScenesRoss: One Mississipi, two Mississipi, Three Mis...(the sprayer starts again, spraying him in the face and torso again) WAIT! WAIT! I'm not-I've not finished counting!! (he leaves the booth) (the assistant enters the room)ScenesRoss: You sprayed my front twice!ScenesAssistant: You've never turned?ScenesRoss: No, I barely even got to three Mississippi.ScenesAssistant: Mississippi? I said count to five'!ScenesRoss: Mississippilesly? (pause) Well, how bad is it?ScenesAssistant: Ain't that bad yet, but it keeps getting darker for the next four hours.ScenesRoss: So, how dark is it gonna get?ScenesAssistant: You got sprayed with two two' s and...ScenesRoss: I'm a four?ScenesAssistant: Yeah, but you're back's a zero. You're gonna wanna even that out.ScenesRoss: (sarcastically) Really!ScenesAssistant: You might wanna get back in there.ScenesRoss: (annoyed) Ok!Scenes(The assistant leaves and Ross goes back in the spray-on tan booth and turns his back to the spray nozzles, facing the back wall)ScenesRoss: Wait, wait a minute, there's no light on the back wall! How do I know when it's gonna start? Hello? (he slowly turns and the spraying begins, on his face) Ah, oh, ah! (he turns, but then he turns again and is sprayed in the front again) Ah! (he spits and angrily goes out of the spray-on tan booth and the assistant enters the room) The same thing happened again!ScenesAssistant: You got two more twos?ScenesRoss: (hysterically) I'm an eight!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Joey and Rachel enter the room]
rows.Content: Rachel: Thanks for dinner.ScenesJoey: I thought you paid. (Rachel does not answer and seems puzzled) Ha, guess we won’t be going back there!ScenesRachel: So.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Joey and Rachel start kissing)ScenesJoey: Hey what do you say, we move this onto the likes of the couch?ScenesRachel: I say ‘cheesy line’, but ok.Scenes(They move on the couch and start kissing again. Joey does his grazing on Rachel’s thigh and she slaps his hand)ScenesJoey: What’s the matter?ScenesRachel: I am sorry, I don’t know, I am sorry, I don’t know why I did that!ScenesJoey and Rachel: OkayScenesRachel: Ok, so sorry.Scenes(They start kissing again and, when Joey grazes her thigh, she slaps him on his hand again)ScenesRachel: I am sorry! Again... I don't know, I don’t know what happened, I must be nervous!ScenesJoey: I don’t get it, Chandler loved it!ScenesRachel: Ok, ok, ok. I promise, I promise, I promise, I won’t do it again. I really do. I promise. This is gonna be great.ScenesJoey: Ok.Scenes(They start kissing again and when Joey grazes, she slaps him three times, on the hand, and on both cheeks)ScenesJoey: (a little giddy) Uh, was that good for you?

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Monica and Phoebe are reading magazines when the phone rings and Phoebe reaches to pick it up]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Phoebe) No, no, don’t get it. Let the machine pick up.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah. Could be Rachel asking if someone could baby-sit again.ScenesMonica: It could be Amanda!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you’re right! I was just kidding about Rachel. Babysitting is a gas!Scenes(The machine picks up the phone)ScenesAmanda: Hello Monica. It’s Amanda calling again. I am in the neighborhood hoping I can pop by your flat!ScenesMonica: You're from Yonkers! Your last name is Buffo-Martisis!ScenesAmanda: Let’s see.. to assure you get this directly, ring me back on my mobile.ScenesPhoebe: Ok, don’t hold thy breath!Scenes(Sound of dialing numbers is heard from the speaker of the machine)ScenesChandler: Hello? Is someone on the line?ScenesAmanda: Yes, I was looking for Monica.ScenesChandler: Hang on, she’s right here. (he enters the living room and hands the phone to Monica) Someone's on the phone, for ya.ScenesMonica: We weren’t picking up, it’s Amanda!ScenesChandler: (to Amanda) I get pedicures!ScenesMonica: Hi Amanda! Actually now... it’s... is not a good time. Dinner tomorrow night? (Phoebe mouths 'no') Ok, Phoebe and I will see you then!ScenesPhoebe: Why, why, why didn’t you just say no!ScenesMonica: Well, I said 'no' to her coming over now! I couldn’t say 'no' twice! I get this uncontrollable need to please people!ScenesPhoebe: (leaving) Fine, fine! You would not hold up well under torture!ScenesMonica: And you would?ScenesPhoebe: I did!Scenes[scene: Joey’s apartment. Joey and Rachel are sitting on the couch]ScenesJoey: Rach, you sure you wanna do this?ScenesRachel: Absolutely! Absolutely. I d... it’s just a little weird, it’s you, and it’s me, it's just gonna take some getting used to.ScenesJoey: Ok. Well, how, how can we make it easier?ScenesRachel: Ok, let’s work from the top down! (Joey nods, but then puzzled because he does not get it) Just work the bra, Joe!ScenesJoey: Ok, yeah, got it.ScenesRachel and Joey: Okay.Scenes(They start kissing and Joey starts to undo her bra, but fails completely)ScenesJoey: This thing welded shut?!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesJoey: All right, turn around, I got to get a look at this thing.ScenesRachel: Oh!Scenes(Joey starts trying to undo her bra, but it won’t go.The elastic band snaps back, hurting Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Ow!ScenesJoey: Sorry!ScenesRachel: Well this is romantic!ScenesJoey: I'm sorry! (He stands up) This never happened to me before! I'm an expert at taking off bras! I can do it with one hand! I can do it with my eyes closed! One time I just looked at one, and it popped open! I blame your bra!ScenesRachel: It’s a standard issue bra clasp!ScenesJoey: Then I blame you! Yeah! That's right! You threw me off with all your slapping!ScenesRachel: Ok well, well I'm really, I'm sorry about that Joey, but do you think that maybe on some level, you don't want to take off my bra?ScenesJoey: (contemplates for a few moments what Rachel just said) NAH! I don't have another level!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment]
rows.Content: (Chandler is at the table reading; Monica puts some food for him on the table. Ross walks in looking very tanned. Chandler and Monica look up at him smiling.)ScenesChandler: Hold on! There is something different.ScenesRoss: I went to that tanning place your wife suggested.ScenesChandler: Was that place... The Sun?ScenesRoss: Oh! And it gets worse! (Turns his side to Chandler and Monica and pulls up his shirt. There's a distinct line across his body, where his belly is very tanned and his back is very pale.)ScenesChandler: Oh My God! You can do a duet of Ebony and Ivory all by yourself!ScenesMonica: How could you mess this up? It's so easy? You go into the booth, you count to five and you turn around!!ScenesRoss: (looks at her suspiciously) How do you count to five?ScenesMonica: One Two Three...ScenesRoss: (Yells) Damnit! (Goes to the door to leave. Rachel just enters, sees him and starts laughing)ScenesRachel: (laughing) oooh! Oh oh!ScenesRoss: (Still yelling) I Know!ScenesRachel: oh oh! What is up with Miss Hawaiian Tropic?ScenesChandler: How was your date with Joey?ScenesRachel: Well, it was good.. until we got back to our apartment, and then we were fooling around and he started to put his hand up my leg and I kept slapping it away!ScenesChandler: You didn't like that?ScenesRachel: Well, it wasn't just me, alright? He freaked out too! He couldn't even undo my bra!ScenesMonica: Wow, really? One time he just looked at my bra and it popped open.Scenes(Chandler starts looking at her bra)ScenesRachel: I do not know what's wrong with us, I mean, we have kissed before and that's been great! But this time it was leading somewhere and I was very aware of the fact that it was Joey touching me.ScenesMonica: Well, you guys have been friends forever. Remember the first time that you kissed Ross? How weird that was? You couldn't stop laughing? You got through that.ScenesRachel: (looking thoughtful) Ok, that's true. That's true, we can do this. You're right, you're right, we can do this. We're just gonna power through!Scenes(Joey walks in)ScenesJoey: Hey Chandler can I talk to you for a second (points to the hall).ScenesRachel: (To Joey) No need!! Problem solved, we are powering through (At which point she grabs his hand and pulls him back to their apartment).Scenes(Chandler resumes staring at Monica's bra)ScenesMonica: (sees what he is doing) Chandler, stop! It is not going to pop open!ScenesChandler: (without taking his eyes off the bra) You don't know! (Monica just smiles)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk.]
rows.Content: (Phoebe is sitting on the couch. Monica walks in.)ScenesMonica: Hey Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Is Amanda here yet?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: (sits down) Oh good. Good, look I'm so sorry, for screwing up that cutting-her-out plan. But I have a new plan. Chandler agreed to call here in a few minutes with an emergency.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Well, what kind of emergency that gets us both out of here?ScenesMonica: Well, what do you think of Mike and Chandler being in a car accident?ScenesPhoebe: (makes a face) Are you kidding, I love it!Scenes(A blonde woman walks in. Supposedly Amanda)ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesAmanda: Hi! (Phoebe and Amanda hug)ScenesAmanda: (To Monica) Hello!Scenes(Monica holds her hands out for a hug, but instead of hugging her, Amanda hangs her purse on one of Monica's extended arms.)ScenesAmanda: (In a fake British accent) It's so nice to see you! Both of you! Look at me. Look how young I look! (gives her coat to Monica as well) Oh gosh! We have so much to catch up on! But first things first: touch my abs (at which point she grabs both Phoebe and Monica's hands and places them both on her stomach) I don't exercise at all! (she pulls them down to sit.) Oh gosh, so Monica, you're married!ScenesMonica: (beaming) Yeah! Yeah! His name is Chandler and...ScenesAmanda: (To Phoebe) Smell my neck! (Phoebe does so) It's not perfume! It's me! It's my natural scent!Scenes(Monica looks shocked)ScenesPhoebe: Musty!ScenesAmanda: Oh! Gosh! This is brilliant. Gosh, it's just like old times. I'm so happy you two are friends again!ScenesMonica: When were we not friends?ScenesAmanda: Well, it was 1992, and I remember because that was the year I had sex with Evil Knievel (She starts laughing very proudly).ScenesMonica: Ehm, we were friends in 1992.ScenesAmanda: (to Phoebe) No I distinctly remember you were dodging her (points at Monica) calls and trying to avoid seeing her.ScenesMonica: (To Phoebe) You were going to cut me out?ScenesPhoebe: Well...kinda.ScenesMonica: Oh My God!ScenesAmanda: Oh! Bugger. Should I not have said that? I feel like a perfect arse!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, in America you're just an "ass".Scenes(Monica's mobile starts ringing. She picks it up.)ScenesMonica: (Into the phone) Hello? Chandler, what's wrong? (She listens) Oh my God, are you alright? (listens some more) Yeah, I'll be right there. (She hangs up and speaks to Amanda) I'm so sorry, but Chandler was in a car accident. (She gets up)ScenesPhoebe: (Also gets up and starts taking her purse) Oh my God. Was Mike with him?ScenesMonica: Nope! (She turns and leaves)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment.]
rows.Content: (Joey comes running in.)ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey! Got champagne?ScenesJoey: Yes ma'am, ready to Power through!ScenesRachel: Excellent! Stick it in the ice bucket, the phone is off the hook, and in the interest of powering through (Starts to remove her bra from under her clothes)...ScenesJoey: Uh! (When she's done she throws her bra at him)ScenesRachel: Ok (starts to light some candles) Sexy, sexy, very sexy, sexy. (Claps her hands and jumps at Joey, clearly very excited) Alright! Lets do it!ScenesJoey: Ok, you're scaring me a little bit.ScenesRachel: Oh! Get over it soldier, we've gotta do this! (She pulls him towards her and throws him onto the barcalounger) Ok. Aha! You like that huh?ScenesJoey: Oh! yeah!ScenesRachel: You like that? (She climbs on the barcalounger seductively, putting her knees next to Joey's hips.) Let's take this into high gear (She pulls the barcalounger lever and seat reclines. She puts one of her knees between his legs and begins to kiss his neck.)ScenesJoey: uh uh!ScenesRachel: Yeah baby, I'll show you how we do it!ScenesJoey: No, no, no! You kneed me in my misters!ScenesRachel: What? Oh my God! I'm so sorry. Joey? Are you ok?ScenesJoey: (He just sits there, legs very close together with a painful look on his face) Soldier down!Scenes[Monica and Chandlers apartment.]Scenes(Chandler is sitting on the couch reading. Monica walks in.)ScenesMonica: We are not friends with Phoebe anymore.ScenesChandler: If she asks, I protested a little, but ok!Scenes(Phoebe and Amanda walk in)ScenesPhoebe: Oh Chandler! Thank God you're alive. Monica, can I talk to you outside for a minute?ScenesMonica: I have nothing to say to you.ScenesAmanda: (announces more to herself than anyone else) Wow, my flat is twice this size!ScenesPhoebe: Please, Monica? In the hall?Scenes(They both walk to the door and enter the hallway.)ScenesAmanda: Ooh, that accident must have been terrible. You look positively ghastly.ScenesChandler: Well, aren't you a treat.

rows.Scenes: The hallway]
rows.Content: Monica: I can't believe you tried to cut me out. Why Phoebe, why?ScenesPhoebe: It was right after we were living together and you were driving me crazy, okay? You were really controlling and compulsive and shrill.ScenesMonica: I'm still all those things!ScenesPhoebe: You're also so generous and kind and scrappy!ScenesMonica: (starts smiling) I am scrappy.ScenesPhoebe: Exactly! Look, no matter what I tried to do, I couldn't keep you out of my life. Of all the people I have cut out, you were the only one who ever clawed her way back in.ScenesMonica: It's because I'm scrappy.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you are. And I'm so glad that you fought your way back in, because I don't know what I would do without you.ScenesMonica: I won't know what I would do without you.Scenes(They hug)ScenesMonica: Well, I guess we should go back in. When you gave me another chance, I guess we should do the same for Amanda.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I guess you're right.Scenes(They both enter the apartment again, where Amanda is "dancing" for Chandler, but she's really terrible at it)ScenesAmanda: Can you believe it. I've never had any professional dance training.Scenes(Monica and Phoebe look at each other and leave the apartment again)

rows.Scenes: A different spray-on tan center]
rows.Content: (Glenda, who works here, and Ross are walking to the room with the spray-on tan booth.)ScenesGlenda: Now, let me explain how this works. You go into the booth, and...ScenesRoss: I'm gonna stop you right there, Glenda. Okay? Does it look like this is my first time, huh? Now I want 4 two's... and I want them all on my back.ScenesGlenda: (quietly) Okay...Scenes(Ross enters the room, takes off his robe and enters the booth. He stands with his back to the nozzles and then realises that this booth has nozzles at both sides of the wall)ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, there's two sets of nozzles, which one is it?Scenes(He turns around frantically from side to side.)ScenesRoss: Which... which... which... Which one is it?Scenes(He then stops turning, facing one of the nozzles, which starts spraying in this face and front again.)ScenesRoss: OH! SON OF A BITCH!Scenes(He now turns to the other side, which also starts spraying his face and front.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's]
rows.Content: (Joey and Rachel are both sitting on the couch. Joey keeping his knees pressed against each other)ScenesRachel: What is the matter with us?ScenesJoey: Well, I know what's the matter with me.ScenesRachel: No, I mean with us, you know. I mean, is it supposed to be this... difficult?ScenesJoey: I don't know.Scenes(Chandler enters the apartment)ScenesChandler: That fake British woman is a real bitch, but she sure can dance... Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi! Hey, listen, can we ask you a question? When you and Monica first hooked up, was it weird going from friends to... more than that?ScenesChandler: Kinda... you know, sneaking around, having to hide from you guys...ScenesRachel: No, no, no... No, I mean... se-x-u-ally...ScenesJoey: Yeah, was there a part of you that... felt like it was... really wrong?ScenesChandler: Actually, no. No, it felt right. You know, it felt like uhm... I can't believe we haven't been doing this the whole time.Scenes(Rachel and Joey are still looking at Chandler, slowly letting his words get to them)ScenesChandler: I can tell from your expressions that that's the good news you were hoping for... Well, I'm gonna go continue to... spread the joy.(Chandler leaves the apartment. Joey sighs)ScenesRachel: Well, just because it happened that way for them doesn't mean it has to happen that way for us.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah... Absolutely. I mean, just because something's difficult doesn't mean that you quit.ScenesRachel: Right, totally.ScenesJoey: Yeah, so we just keep trying and trying until we... do it.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and if doesn't work, then we'll be just one of those couples that never have sex.ScenesJoey: That's a... pla-an.Scenes(They both stare for a while, and then look at each other)ScenesJoey: (sighs) Wow... I did not see this coming.ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesJoey: I don't get it. I mean, I was so sure this was what I wanted.ScenesRachel: Hmmm... Me too...Scenes(She puts her head on Joey's shoulder and Joey kisses her on her head.)ScenesRachel: I wonder how Monica and Chandler could do it?ScenesJoey: I guess they weren't as good friends as we are.Scenes(Lifts her head from Joey's shoulder)ScenesRachel: Aah... I bet you're right.Scenes(They look at each other for a while)ScenesJoey: So...ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: I love ya.ScenesRachel: Love you too... Alright, I'm going to bed.ScenesJoey: Yeah, me too.Scenes(Rachel gets up, and Joey tries to get up, but halfway up he sits down again.)ScenesJoey: Ooh, yeah, I'm not going anywhere for a while.Scenes(Joey takes the ice-bucket with the champagne bottle in it and puts it on his sore spot)ScenesENDING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment.]
rows.Content: (Ross is reading a National Geographic on his sofa when Chandler knocks on the door.)ScenesChandler: Dude, it's Chandler. Let me in.Scenes(Ross's face is now a VERY dark shade of brown.)ScenesRoss: Go away! I don't want to see anybody.ScenesChandler: I know, I went to the tanning place and the same thing happened to me. You have to let me in.ScenesRoss: Really? Did you count Mississipily?Scenes(Ross walks to the door and opens it.)ScenesRoss: Dude, you're not tanned.ScenesChandler: No, I just had to get a picture of this.Scenes(Chandler holds up a camera and takes Ross's picture.)ScenesChandler: I see you later!Scenes(Ross closes the door)ScenesendScenesFriends Scenes1004 - The One With The CakeScenesWritten by: Dana KleinScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & Vanessa

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: Monica: (she enters) Hey guys!ScenesRoss, Rachel and Chandler: Hey!ScenesChandler: Honey, I got us that room at the Woodford Inn this weekend.ScenesMonica: That place in Vermont? You can take a hint!ScenesRachel: Wait, you can't go away this weekend! It's Emma's birthday!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesRachel: We're having a party.ScenesMonica: Well, can't you just have the party when we get back?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: No, that day... that won't be her real birthday!ScenesChandler: Gee if only she were one and had no idea what the hell a birthday was!ScenesRoss: C'mon you guys, this is really important to us.ScenesMonica: Well, I'm sorry, but Chandler and I could really use a weekend away. You know, to reconnect... emotionally.ScenesChandler: There's this thing I really want us to do. I read about it in Maxim...ScenesRachel: Well, can't you just go to Vermont the next day?ScenesRoss: Yeah, we want everyone to be there. As much as I hate to delay your doing weird sex stuff to my little sister.ScenesRachel: And I mean, you know, you guys... This is a big deal. I mean, how can we have her first birthday party without her aunt and her uncle!ScenesMonica: All right, we'll stay. We can just drive up after the party.ScenesChandler: Fine, but if we end up not doing this Maxim thing because of this party...ScenesMonica: Believe me, that is not why we won't be doing that!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey's apartment]
rows.Content: Rachel: You know Pheebs, when I was little, on my birthday, my daddy would hide a present in every room of the house, and then he would draw a treasure map to help me find 'em all.ScenesPhoebe: Oooh, I love family traditions like that. When uhm... when Ursula and I were kids, on our birthday, our stepdad would sell his blood to buy us food!ScenesRoss: (he enters) Hey guys!ScenesRachel and Phoebe: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey, I brought the camera for Emma's video.ScenesRachel: Oh, good, good! We had this idea to make a birthday video for Emma and we'll give it to her when she is 18.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, COOL!! Wow, it's like a time capsule!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, just think... she's gonna be watching that video on a TV that hasn't even been invented yet! With friends who right now are just like babies! And they'll be living in a floating city that the humans built to escape the ant people!ScenesRoss: That's the hope! So, is Emma awake yet?ScenesRachel: Oh no, it's still nap time. But she'll be up soon.ScenesRoss: Ah, and where is Joey?ScenesRachel: I said it's still nap time.Scenes(Joey comes out from his room, yawning)ScenesRoss: (taping Joey with the cam) Hey, there is uncle Joey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, say something to Emma on her 18th birthday!ScenesJoey: 18, uh? (starts to prepare himself to say his "How You Doin'" line)ScenesRoss: Joey, NO!ScenesJoey: What, what!? it's for her hot friends!ScenesRoss: When they see this you'll be 52!ScenesJoey: And starting to think about settling down!ScenesRachel: Hey Joey, will you please set this up for people to put Emma's presents on?ScenesJoey: I'd love to! Yeah! ScenesJoey: (To Phoebe) We were supposed to bring presents?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! I wrote Emma a song.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah! How was I supposed to know?ScenesPhoebe: Joey, it's a birthday party.ScenesJoey: Yeah, but for a one-year-old. What's the point... the other day she laughed for like an hour at a cup. Just a cup with a picture of Elmo on it dressed as a farmer. And he's standing next to this cow and the cow says "El-moo"! (Joey starts laughing) Yeah... that's a funny cup!Scenes(Monica and Chandler enter)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey hey! Where's the birthday girl?ScenesRachel: Oh, she's still nappingScenesChandler: Oh, sure, she was probably up all night, excited about the party she knows is happening.ScenesRachel: Look, I know that you guys really want to get to Vermont and this isn't a really big deal to you, but it really is to us, ok? Emma will never have a first birthday again.ScenesMonica: All right... you're right. We're sorry. Now let's wake up Emma and get the fun time started!ScenesRachel: No really, she didn't sleep well last night, so we can't wake her up.ScenesMonica: Are you freaking kidding me, Green?Scenes(someone knocks on the door. Rachel goes to open it)ScenesJack and Judy: HI!ScenesRoss: (points the camcorder towards them to record their entrance) Hey!ScenesMonica: So glad you came!ScenesJack: I can't believe Emma is already one!ScenesJudy: (to Monica) I remember your first birthday! Ross was jealous of all the attention we were giving you. He pulled on his testicles so hard! We had to take him to the emergency room!ScenesRoss: (pointing the camcorder at himself) There's something you didn't know about your dad!ScenesJoey: Hey Mr. and Mrs. Geller! Let me help you with that.ScenesJack: Thank you!ScenesJoey: Oh man, this is great, uh? The three of us together again! You know what would be fun? If we gave this present to Emma from all of us!ScenesJack: Which one are you?Scenes(Time lapse)ScenesMonica: I can't believe Emma is still asleep!ScenesChandler: I know, what are we gonna do?ScenesMonica: I've got a plan. I've got a plan. I'm going to ram this platter really hard into your ribs. You're gonna scream out and that'll wake her up!ScenesChandler: I'm not going to Vermont with this Monica!ScenesJoey: Hey Pheebs, you know what? I was thinking... since you wrote a song, maybe I could do something for Emma using my talents!ScenesPhoebe: So you’re gonna... hit on her?ScenesJoey: No, no, no! My talents as an actor!ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesJoey: You know, I could like maybe... I could do a dramatic reading of one of her books!ScenesPhoebe: Or you could stick a fork in an apple!ScenesJoey: Hey, I think Emma might like it!ScenesRachel: Oh! Emma might like what?ScenesJoey: Um, my present!ScenesRachel: What did you get her?ScenesJoey: Actually we prepared performances.ScenesPhoebe: Separate performances.ScenesJoey: But equally real!ScenesRachel: Well, this sounds like fun! Well, you know what? Actually? People are getting a little antsy waiting Emma to wake up from her nap, so would you mind performing them once now?ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah!ScenesJoey: (unconfidently) O K.ScenesRachel: (to everybody) All right, let’s get this party started, huh? Joey and Phoebe are gonna perform a little something for us.ScenesRoss: Oh, great!ScenesPhoebe: (to Joey) Are you gonna be embarrassed going up there having nothing prepared?ScenesJoey: Hey, I do it every week with three cameras pointed at me and a whole crew waiting!ScenesRachel: So, Joey, what are you gonna do for us?ScenesJoey: I will be doing a dramatic reading of one of Emma’s books.ScenesRachel: Oh, ok, which one?ScenesJoey: Uh, why, it’s a... (he picks a book up) one of her favorites, uh, (he reads the title of the book) “Riding the Storm Out. Coping with post-partum depression” eesh!
