(he puts the book back and picks up another) “Love you forever”. Love you forever. By Robert Munsch. Published by Firefly books. Printed (he pauses and changes the tone to a dramatic one) in Mexico. A mother held her new baby and very slowly rocked him back and forth, back and forth, back and forth, and while she held him she sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”. (the picture fades and Joey is now finishing the book). And while he rocked her, he sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”.ScenesRachel: (crying) Wow! That was amazing!ScenesRoss: Thank you so much for that gift!ScenesChandler (nearly weeping): I was not ready for this today!ScenesRoss: Amazing... amazing.ScenesRachel: Oh, Phoebe, I’m sorry! Phoebe has prepared something as well.ScenesPhoebe: That’s right, I've prepared a song for Emma. From my heart to hers. For there’s no greater gift, than the gift of music. (she starts singing) Emma! Your name poses a dilemma. 'Cause not much else rhymes with Emma! Maybe the actor Richard Crenna, he played the commanding officer in Rambo. Happy birthday Emma!ScenesRachel: Is that it?ScenesPhoebe: No, of course not! I also, you know, prepared a reading (she picks up a book). “Sex and the single mother. (pause) Finding your G-spot.ScenesEverybody: No, no, no, no, no!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Apartment. Ross is filming his parents ]
rows.Content: Judy: Hello Emma. Happy eighteenth birthday.ScenesJack: Right now that seems so far away, seventeen years.ScenesJudy: Yes, you’ll be all grown up by then. We’ll be... Well your grandfather and I might not be here.ScenesJack: That’s true! This message could becoming to you from beyond the grave, Emma!ScenesJudy: After all, my parents died very young.ScenesJack: And my cholesterol’s off the charts!ScenesJudy: Remember, Emma, heart disease kills women too!ScenesRoss (stops recording): Ok, cut! Great. That was... that was just... yeah!ScenesRachel: Ross, um, don’t forget to get a shot of Emma’s cake. It’s in a box in the fridge.ScenesRoss: Sure.ScenesRachel: Oh, you're gonna love this cake. I got it from a bakery in New Jersey, Corino’s.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, that place has the creamiest frosting! I use to hitchhike there when I was a kid.ScenesRachel: Well, anyway, they make these great novelty cakes, in all different shapes, and if you give them a photo, they’ll copy it in icing!ScenesMonica: Oh, did you do a picture of Emma?ScenesRachel: Yes! On a cake shaped like a bunny.ScenesRoss: Uh, Rach? Does this bakery by any chance also bake erotic cakes? Say for bachelorette parties?ScenesRachel: Ross, what are you talking about? (she sees the cake) oh! Oh my God! They put my baby’s face on a penis!ScenesPhoebe (sees the cake): oh! Now it’s a party!ScenesRachel: Why you guys this isn't funny, all right? If I wanted this cake to be a disaster I would have baked it myself!ScenesJoey (staring at the cake): Uh.. is it ok that I still think it looks delicious?ScenesJudy:(to Jack) Jack, look at this.ScenesJack: I know what you're thinking Judy, the resemblance is uncanny!ScenesRoss: I am this close to tugging on my testicles again.ScenesRachel (on the phone): No, no, this is not what I ordered. Ok? I went all the way to New Jersey so that I could have the perfect cake for my daughter’s birthday and I need a bunny cake, right now!ScenesRoss: Ask them if it would be faster if we cut the baby’s face off the penis, so we can put it on the bunny. (pause). That is a weird sentence!ScenesRachel: Oh! Believe you me! I am going to bring this cake back, I don't even want it in my home... (Turns towards the cake and sees Joey trying to take a piece and yells at him) Joey, don't touch it!!ScenesJoey: I'm so confused!ScenesRachel: (speaking to the person on the phone again) Yes, yes. I still want my daughters picture, but on a bunny cake. Yellow cake, chocolate frosting with nuts!ScenesChandler: To be fair this one does have nuts.Scenes(Time lapse)Scenes(Ross, Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen area)ScenesRoss: Hey Mon, that was really nice of you to loan Rachel your car so she could go and get the cake.ScenesMonica: Oh. So nice of her to pull my hair, 'till I dropped the key!ScenesRoss: Well, you know what? While we're waiting, you guys could tape your message to Emma for her 18th birthday, huh? (takes the camcorder and points it at Monica and Chandler) Ok!ScenesChandler: Hi Emma! It's the year 2020. Are you still enjoying your nap?ScenesMonica: We're Aunt Monica and uncle Chandler, by the way. You may not recognize us, because we haven't spoken to your parents in seventeen years!ScenesChandler: We used to be married, but then we missed a weekend away together and things kind of unraveled. Because of you! Happy Birthday. (Ross looks disappointed and switches the camcorder off)ScenesMonica: Ross, Rachel promised it would be over by now. We seriously have to go, if we want to get to Vermont. I called them and the last train leaves in a half hour.ScenesPhoebe: And you know, I have a massage client soon.ScenesRoss: You guys, just please.. a little bit longer. I promise, Rachel will be back with the cake any minute. Monica, remember.. the frosting? huh?ScenesMonica: Alright, 5 more minutes.Scenes(The phone rings, Ross picks up)ScenesRoss: (Into receiver) Hello? (listens) Oh no! What happened? (listens some more) Ok ok, where are you? (Grabs a pen and starts writing). Ok, I'll be right there. (Puts the phone down)ScenesChandler: Was that Emma? Is she up?ScenesRoss: No, Rachel got pulled over for speeding. She forgot her licence so now I have to bring it to her.ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you're leaving, I'm definitely gonna go.ScenesMonica: No! Wait! If anybody gets to go.. it's us (Points at herself and Chandler) We've been complaining the longest!ScenesRoss: No, wait ! You guys, no, no, you can't leave! Rachel already feels bad that the cake's messed up. How do you think she's gonna feel when she comes back here and all you guys are gone?ScenesChandler: I don't know! You'll tell us on Monday!ScenesRoss: Joey! You're in charge, ok? You make sure nobody leaves! (leaves)ScenesJoey: Got it! (Goes towards the front door and stands with his back to it) Hey hey hey! (to Chandler) Where do you think you're going?ScenesChandler: To the bathroom!ScenesJoey: Alright, well the rest of you get comfortable, ok, because we're gonna be here for a li...(stops and thinks) Wait a minute, there is a window in there!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! He's not getting away that easy! (Phoebe and Joey run towards the bathroom and enter)ScenesChandler: (Yelling) What are you doing? Get the hell out of here! (Phoebe and Joey come out looking shocked)ScenesJoey: Well, that one did not have Emma's face on it.ScenesPhoebe: No, it did not.ScenesJoey: No.ScenesJudy: Well, we better get going, it's late. Jack's not allowed to drive at night anymore. He has trouble staying in his lane.ScenesJack: Last winter I went up on a church lawn and drove right through a manger scene. The papers thought it was a hate crime.ScenesJudy: Anyway, it was lovely seeing you.ScenesJoey: Ok! (Opens the door for them)ScenesJudy: Bye... Bye dear.ScenesJoey: Nighty-night!ScenesJudy: Nighty-night!ScenesJoey: Bye, bye.ScenesPhoebe: Joey? How could you just let them leave?ScenesJoey: Hey, hey, hey, hey! I'm not gonna mess with Jack, he's a great man, he fought for our country.ScenesMonica: No, he didn't! He pretended to be a Quaker to get out of Korea.ScenesJoey: (Shocked) Oh! Well that's it! He's the last one to go. I'm locking you guys in. (turns the bolts of the door, thereby locking it)ScenesChandler: You do know, I can just turn them the other way around, right?ScenesJoey: Oh! I forgot you used to live here!Scenes(The phone rings, Joey picks up)ScenesJoey: Hello?ScenesEstelle: (on the other side of the line) Joey! It's Estelle!ScenesJoey: Hey! (smiles)ScenesEstelle: So, how did your audition go today?ScenesJoey: (smile fades) What audition?ScenesEstelle: The one I told you about last week?ScenesJoey: What? You never said anything about an audition!ScenesEstelle: (Looks confused) Let me start over. I just got a call about an audition. I think you can still make it. It's down at the Astor Theatre and you need to have a monologue prepared.ScenesJoey: A monologue? I don't have.. (sees the book he was reading before for his "dramatic reading") I got it. (hangs up) (announces to the room) Aah! so... I'm gonna take off!ScenesPhoebe: Wh.. what? No wait, you don't get to leave! I've got a massage client waiting outside my door any minute!ScenesMonica: Yeah, and we've paid for a room, that we're supposed to be in right now!ScenesPhoebe: Well, oh, ok now... Only one of us has to stay with Emma. Ok, and as the person who realized that, I get to go!ScenesMonica: No! no! Let's figure out a fair way to decide who's staying.ScenesJoey: Oh! I got it! Ok, everyone pick a number from one to ten. Alright? Whoever gets the highest number gets to go first.ScenesMonica: (She gives Joey a you-are-so-stupid-look) Ok, ten.ScenesJoey: Okay, Monica picks ten, I call nine! Anyone else?ScenesPhoebe: No, lets just draw straws.ScenesJoey: Or.. we could flip a coin, and then multiply the..ScenesChandler: I'm begging you stop.ScenesJoey: Right.ScenesMonica: Ok, how about this: We got wind up toys for Emma for her birthday. We can make them race, and whoever comes in last, stays!ScenesPhoebe: (Visibly excited) Yeah!! Let's do that!ScenesChandler: (Also very excited) That sounds more fun than the thing we were going to do in Vermont!ScenesMonica: Everybody get your toys! (They all run toward the table with toys)ScenesPhoebe: Ok! I want the dolphin!ScenesChandler: Thats a bear.ScenesPhoebe: I'm too excited!ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you get the bear, uhm, Joey, you get the robot, and Chandler and I get the dog. Ok, and the race is going to go (Takes two cups and marks the start and finish lines with them) from here to here. Now the one who comes in last, stays!ScenesJoey: Ok, ladies and gentlemen, wind your toys! (they do so)ScenesChandler: Ok, on your mark... Get set... GO!!!Scenes(Monica, Phoebe and Joey release their wind-up toys.)ScenesPhoebe: Go! Go!ScenesJoey: Come on robot!Scenes(Phoebe's bear takes the lead, followed by Joey's robot, and far behind is Chandler and Monica's dog, which walks a few paces, stops and starts barking, sits, walks again, and so on... )ScenesMonica: (to the dog) What are you barking at?Scenes(While Phoebe's bear is still in the lead, it is now closely followed by Joey's robot. Chandler and Monica's dog however, sits down, barking... and does a backflip.)ScenesMonica: Wha... How the hell is that gonna help?ScenesChandler: I bought you. How did I forget that that's all you do?Scenes(Meanwhile the race has been won by Phoebe's bear, followed by Joey's robot)ScenesJoey: Way to go robot!ScenesPhoebe: Good job Alan!ScenesJoey: Hey, good race you guys.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, see you later!Scenes(Joey and Phoebe leave for the door)ScenesMonica: No! No, no... wait! We didn't lose. (turns to Chandler) The rules clearly stated that the last one to cross the finish line was the loser. Well, our dog never crossed the finish line, so technically...ScenesChandler: They left.Scenes(Monica turns to see the closed door.)Scenes[ Scene: The freeway. Rachel is driving Monica's Porsche, while using her mobile phone. Ross is sitting next to her.]ScenesRachel: (into the phone) No, there isn't time to go to the bakery. We're just gonna come home... Everybody left? Alright, well just tell Emma we're gonna be there as soon as we can. (emotionally) Bye...Scenes(She hangs up, closes her phone, turns around and puts it in her bag which is in the back of the car. While doing this and not looking at the road, she turns the steering wheel by accident, which makes the car swerve.)ScenesRoss: RACHEL!ScenesRachel: OOH! God! Sorry!ScenesRoss: (sarcastically) I can't believe they gave you a ticket. You're such a good driver.Scenes(Ross fastens his seat belt.)ScenesRachel: Emma's awake.ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: I can't believe this. This is her first birthday. She's awake. We're not even there. Everybody left. We still have this stupid obscene cake.ScenesRoss: Hey, maybe I can fix that, you know. Try to turn it into something else. (he opens the box)ScenesRachel: Oh, why do you even bother? I already ruined her first birthday... And do you know how important these early experiences are Ross? Very! According to the back cover of that book that you gave me.ScenesRoss: Rach, she's not going to remember this.ScenesRachel: (shakes her head) I guess... Oh, I just had such an idea of what this day would be like, you know? Emma laughing and everybody gathered around her cake singing "Happy Birthday". Then we would all go into... HEY GET OUT OF THE ROAD YOU STUPID STUDENT DRIVER!!! (honks furiously, and Ross looks at her in disbelief and Rachel looks at him.) They have to learn!ScenesRoss: (looks back at the cake) Hey!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: It's not bad.ScenesRachel: (she looks at the cake) Oh my God! Look what... you made it into a bunny. How did you do that?ScenesRoss: Well, I just made these two things uhm... cheeks. And then I split this to make ears.ScenesRachel: Well, I'm very impressed.ScenesRoss: Some can sing, some can dance. I apparently can turn phallic cakes into woodland creatures.Scenes[ Scene: Rachel and Joey's apartment. Chandler, Monica and Emma are sitting on the floor, and Emma's stuffed animals are lined up in front of them.]ScenesMonica: Now another way to organise your stuffed animals, is by size.ScenesChandler: I'm sorry, is this a game for Emma or for Monica?ScenesMonica: Game?ScenesChandler: Emma, you even know it's your birthday today? You're one! One-year-old, that's little.Scenes(With his index finger he shows her how old she is. Emma also points her finger and babbles...)ScenesChandler: Ooh! That's my girl!ScenesMonica: That's how old you are.ScenesChandler: Did I teach her that? Did I just... impart wisdom?ScenesMonica: (embraces Emma tightly) Ooh, I want one...ScenesChandler: Me too...Scenes(There's a couple of seconds of silence. Then Chandler looks around...)ScenesChandler: There's no-one around. Why don't we just take this one?ScenesMonica: ...and head to Canada!ScenesChandler: I was kidding.ScenesMonica: I wasn't. Let's get going!Scenes(Phoebe enters the apartment again.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, are Ross and Rachel back?ScenesChandler: No, not yet.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good, I didn't miss the party.ScenesMonica: What about your massage client?ScenesPhoebe: I just felt so bad, missing this. So I just slipped him a little something, you know. As long as I'm back in five or six hours, it will be alright.Scenes(Joey comes running into the apartment, out of breath.)ScenesJoey: Okay, if Ross and Rachel ask, I've been here the whole time. THE WHOLE TIME!Scenes(Ross and Rachel enter.)ScenesJoey: (to Ross and Rachel) I've been here the whole time!ScenesRoss: Joey, we just saw you come in. You ran past us on the stairs.ScenesRachel: I don't care that you left. I'm just glad that you're here. Thanks you guys!ScenesChandler: Hey, guys! Come on! You gotta see what Emma just did.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesChandler: Emma, how old are you? How old are you today? (holds up his index finger again)ScenesEmma: Wo-ish. (and holds up her finger)Scenes(Ross and Rachel gasp)ScenesRachel: Oh! Emma, that's right! You're that many!ScenesRoss: Oh my God! Our daughter's a genius! Rach, this means...ScenesRachel: (angrily) NO, no science camp!ScenesRoss: Damnit! I'll put a candle on the cake.ScenesRachel: Oh!... Oh and Emma, look at your stuffed animals lined up so neatly!ScenesMonica: Thanks!ScenesRoss: Okay, here we go! Emma's first birthday cake... Well hey... well, blow out the candle. Come on Emma.ScenesChandler: Let's do it, come on!Scenes(Rachel wipes away some tears.)ScenesRoss: What's wrong? Are you okay?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, nothing! These are happy tears! This is just what I wanted.ScenesPhoebe: (pointing at cake) Hey, you made it into a bunny.ScenesJoey: What is wrong with me. It looked more delicious when it was a penis.ScenesENDING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey's apartment. It's just Ross and Rachel. They put the camera on a tripod in the kitchen and they are standing in front of the camera.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay, you ready?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: A-a-and... record.ScenesRachel: Okay. (they both look into the camera, and Ross waves.) Hi Emma. Well, your first birthday is over, and it was really...Scenes(There's a lot of yelling and screaming coming from the hallway, and they get up to look at what's the noise all about. In the hallway, Monica, Chandler, Joey and Phoebe are having another wind-up animal race, yelling and screaming fanatically.)ScenesPhoebe: (yelling at the top of her voice) Go, go, go Alan! Run you, hairy bastard!ScenesendScenesFriends Scenes1005 - The One Where Rachel's Sister Baby-sitsScenesWritten by: Dana KleinScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & Vanessa

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: ScenesRachel: You know, I'm thinking about letting Emma have her first cookie.ScenesJoey: Her first cookie? She has cookies all the time!ScenesRachel: I've never given her a cookie. Have you?ScenesJoey: No! No... and, for the record, I've also never given her a frosting from a can!ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, the adoption agency needs letters of recommendation and we were wondering if you would write one for us.ScenesRachel: Of course, I'd be honored!ScenesChandler: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Thank you!Scenes(Joey looks at them, disappointed about their decision)ScenesJoey: U-U-Um, I think there's been an oversight.ScenesChandler: Joey, we would've asked you, we just thought you wouldn't be interested.ScenesMonica: Yeah, it's just we don't think of you as really being so much "with the words".ScenesJoey: Whoo-weh hey weh-hey whoo hey!!ScenesMonica: Clearly we were wrong.ScenesJoey: I gotta a lot of nice stuff to say about you guys, ok? And I know how much you wanna have a baby, you know, and I would love to help you get one.ScenesMonica: You know what? Then, Joey, we want you to do it.ScenesJoey: Thank you! Alright, let me see how I'm gonna start... "Dear baby adoption decider people...ScenesChandler: So excited about your letter!Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesAll: Hey Phoebe!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: Wow! Don't you look nice?!ScenesPhoebe: Yes, I do! Today is Mike and my one-year anniversary.ScenesRachel: OH! What's it the anniversary of? Your first date, your first kiss, first time you had sex...ScenesPhoebe: YEAH!ScenesChandler: So you must be going to somewhere fancy to celebrate?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-uh. Ehm, a Knicks game.ScenesJoey: Uhm... Aren't you a little overdressed?ScenesPhoebe: Hey, you know what, I've never had a one-year anniversary before, so no matter where we go, I'm wearing something fancy pants, and... I'm gonna put on my finest jewelry and we're gonna have sex in a public rest room.ScenesMonica: You guys do that? Chandler won't even have sex in our bathroom!ScenesChandler: That's where people make number two!!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Ross' apartment. Ross is grading papers. Charlie approaches him.]
rows.Content: ScenesCharlie: Hey! (They kiss and cuddle a little)ScenesRoss: Hey...ScenesCharlie: So, you know... I have a little time. If you... if you want to...ScenesRoss: (surprised) Oh... (he pauses) (sounds disappointed) Ohh... I'd love to but I really have to grade these papers.ScenesCharlie: Fine, it's fine... (she whispers) I'll just shower by myself...ScenesRoss: (Writing on the papers) B, B, B, B, B!ScenesCharlie: Oh, Ross, you gave a B to a Pottery Barn catalogue.ScenesRoss: Well, it had some good ideas, take off your shirt.Scenes(they start kissing but someone knocks at the door)ScenesRoss: Damnit!ScenesAmy: (yelling from outside) Rachel!! Open up!! It's your sister!! (she knocks on the door again) I have to talk to you!!ScenesRoss: (he opens the door) Hi Amy!ScenesAmy: You're not Rachel.ScenesRoss: Still sharp as a tack!ScenesAmy: Um... Charlie, this is Rachel's sister Amy. Amy, this is Charlie.ScenesCharlie: Hi!ScenesAmy: Hi!ScenesCharlie: Nice to meet you.ScenesAmy: H-Hi!!(to Ross) And you are...?ScenesRoss: (pause) Ross? I... I grew up on your block! We had Thanksgiving together last year... I had a baby with your sister!ScenesAmy: (looks confused) N-no... uhm... did I buy a falafel from you yesterday?ScenesRoss: (gives up) Yes, yes, you did.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment]
rows.Content: Scenes(Ross enters the apartment with Amy)ScenesRoss: Hi Rachel! Here's your sister Amy! She thinks I need pec implants!ScenesRachel: Amy! Hi! Oh-oh-hoh! (they hug) Wow! You remember Joey?ScenesAmy: Yeah! Hey, sure! The "Days of Our Lives" guy!ScenesJoey: That's right, yeah.ScenesAmy: You're not good!ScenesJoey: Always nice to meet a fan!ScenesRachel: So now, what are you doing here?ScenesAmy: Well, I have huge news.ScenesRachel: (Emma starts crying in the other room) Oh sorry, hold on. Let me just check on the baby!ScenesAmy: Wait, this is important! Can Ella wait? (Rachel goes to Emma)ScenesRoss: Ehm... Her name is Emma.ScenesAmy: Why did you change it, Ella was so much prettier!ScenesRoss: What do I know? I just sell Middle Eastern food from a cart!ScenesAmy: Hey, your English is getting better!!ScenesRoss: (to Joey) Oh my God!ScenesJoey: I know, she may be the hottest girl I've ever hated.ScenesRoss: What... what you working on?ScenesJoey: (using a laptop) Oh, Monica and Chandler's recommendation. I want it to sound smart but.. I don't know any big words or anything, so...ScenesRoss: Why don't you use your Thesaurus?ScenesJoey: What did I just say?ScenesRoss: Watch. (he takes the laptop) Here, you ehm... You highlight the word you want to change.ScenesGo under Tools and the Thesaurus generates... 'gives'... 'gives' a whole list of choices. You can pick the word that sounds smartest.ScenesJoey: Oh my God, that's great! I'm smart!! No, no, I'm... (he uses the Thesaurus) "brainy, bright, clever", I love this thing! Look out ladies, Joey Tribbiani's got the whole package!!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Rachel's room. Rachel is attending to Emma. Amy is standing behind her.]
rows.Content: ScenesRachel: God!ScenesAmy: So beautiful.ScenesRachel: Oh, I know, isn't she?ScenesAmy: No, I was talking about your bedding.ScenesRachel: All right. What's your news, Amy?ScenesAmy: Oh! Um... Well... I'm getting married.ScenesRachel: What? Oh my God! To who?ScenesAmy: This guy! He has a killer apartment.ScenesRachel: A-And??ScenesAmy: A-And it's on Fifth. And the elevator opens up right into the living room.ScenesRachel: No, what's he like?ScenesAmy: Oh! He's ok. Do you remember my old boyfriend Mark?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesAmy: It's his dad.ScenesRachel: Huh... wow, so he's gotta be...ScenesAmy: Old? Yeah! But he travels a lot, so he's hardly ever there.ScenesRachel: Sweety, I gotta tell ya... it sounds a little bit like you like the apartment more than you like...ScenesAmy: Myron. Hmm... I told you he was old!ScenesRachel: Oh... sit down, sit down. Oh, honey, you know, I once also almost married somebody that I didn’t love. Do you remember Barry?ScenesAmy: Humpf, remember him? How we used to make out all the time after you went to sleep.ScenesRachel: Sometimes just nodding is ok. (pause) Uhm, so but anyway, listen, not marrying Barry was the best decision that I ever, ever made. Honey, you deserve true love. Your soulmate is out there, somewhere. Someone that is your age, that is smart, that is fun and that you care about!ScenesAmy: (thinks about it) You’re right, you’re right! I’m gonna do it!ScenesRachel: Ok.ScenesAmy: I’m gonna marry Myron and keep looking for Mr Right.ScenesRachel: Ok, let’s keep talking.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Madison Square Garden. Mike and Phoebe are walking to their seats.]
rows.Content: ScenesPhoebe: Excuse me, anniversary. Excuse me, anniversary. (looking at her ticket). Uhm, sir, could you move your nachos... they’re in my seat. It's my anniversary. (to Mike) Here we are! (Mike nods). Can’t believe it's been a whole year!ScenesMike: I know. This has been the best year... (the crowd starts cheering so he starts yelling) THIS HAS BEEN THE BEST YEAR OF MY LIFE!ScenesPhoebe: ME TOO! I NEVER THOUGHT I COULD LOVE SOMEONE THIS MUCH!ScenesMike: I FEEL THE SAME WAY!ScenesPhoebe: YOU’RE SO GENEROUS AND KIND AND (crowd stops cheering) YOU'RE AMAZING IN BED (everyone hears it and stare at them.) (to everybody) IT’S OUR ANNIVERSARY!ScenesAnnouncer: Knicks fans, please turn your attention to the big screen on the score board. Someone has a special question to ask. (on the screen there’s written ‘Julie, will you marry me?’ and goes on to show a guy kneeling down in front of a girl holding out a ring to her)ScenesPhoebe: Oh how lame... oh, it’s so tacky, and impersonal.ScenesMike: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s the worst way to propose!ScenesMike: (looks strangely shocked) Excuse me... (he leaves, then Phoebe realizes what she did).Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Joey enters the room]
rows.Content: ScenesJoey: Hey, finished my recommendation. (he hands it over to Chandler) Here. And I think you’ll be very, very happy. It’s the longest I ever spent on a computer without looking at porn.ScenesChandler: (reading) I don’t... uh... understand.ScenesJoey: (sounding very proud of himself) Some of the words are a little too sophisticated for ya?ScenesMonica: (also reading it) It doesn’t make any sense.ScenesJoey: Of course it does! It’s smart! I used the the-saurus!ScenesChandler: On every word?ScenesJoey: Yep!ScenesMonica: Alright, what was this sentence originally? (shows the sentence to Joey)ScenesJoey: Oh, ‘They are warm, nice, people with big hearts’.ScenesChandler: And that became ‘they are humid prepossessing Homo Sapiens with full sized aortic pumps...?ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah and hey, I really mean it, dude.ScenesMonica: Hey Joey, I don’t think we can use this.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesMonica: Well, because you signed it baby kangaroo Tribbiani (Joey makes a 'and-what’s-wrong-with-that' look). Hey, why don’t you stop worrying about sounding smart and just be yourself!ScenesChandler: You know what? You don’t need a thesaurus, just write from here, (points at his own heart) your full sized aortic pump.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The corridor. Amy knocks Joey’s door and Rachel opens the door.]
rows.Content: ScenesRachel: Amy, hi!ScenesAmy: I took your advice, I left Myron.ScenesRachel: Oh, good for you!ScenesAmy: I know! I'm Erin Brockovich!ScenesRachel: Yes you are! Oh, I am so proud of you!ScenesAmy: Thank you! So, can I stay with you?ScenesRachel: But Erin Brockovich had her own house.Scenes(Joey comes out of Monica’s apartment and sees Rachel and Amy but does not notice the huge amount of bags)ScenesJoey: Ah, look who’s back! (he sees the bags) Why do you have bags? RACH, WHY DOES SHE HAVE BAGS?ScenesAmy: Well, I’m staying with you guys!ScenesJoey: What?ScenesAmy: We’re gonna be roomies! (she snaps her finger and points at Joey, snaps her fingers again and points to the bags) Come on!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Rachel is in the living room and Joey comes out of his room.]
rows.Content: ScenesJoey: You slept out here?ScenesRachel: Yeah... Amy kept kicking me in her sleep yelling ‘Myron, get off!’ScenesJoey: But uhm, we're getting rid of her, right? Rach, please tell me we’re getting rid of her.ScenesRachel: Joey, I can’t do that!ScenesJoey: Oh, come on! Last night I was finishing off a pizza and she said (aping Amy badly) "Uoh oh oh, a moment on the lips, forever on the hips!" I don’t need that kind of talk in my house!ScenesRachel: Well Joey, uhm look, I know that she’s difficult, but I think it’s really good that she’s here.ScenesJoey: 'Cause we will appreciate it more when she’s gone?ScenesRachel: No, it's just... look, you know, when I first moved to the city I was a lot like her! I was spoiled, self-centered and you guys really took care of me.ScenesJoey: Yeah, Monica made us!ScenesRachel: Well, uhm... whatever, I have really appreciated it, 'cause I don’t think I would be the person that I am today if it wasn’t for you guys. See, I wanna help Amy the way you guys helped me. And I know it’s gonna take patience, but that’s ok.ScenesAmy: Good morning.ScenesJoey: Yeaah.ScenesRachel: Amy, that’s what I was supposed to wear today, that’s why I hung it on the door.ScenesAmy: Oh, sweety, you can’t pull this off.ScenesRachel: Amy, you know what? I was thinking that maybe now it'd be a good time for us to sit down and, you know, talk about your future.ScenesAmy: Oh, I can’t, honey. I’m gonna go get my eyebrows shaped. (points at her eyebrows) I am not happy. (to Joey who has a pizza box in his hands) Oh... sure you wanna eat that?ScenesJoey: (yelling at her) I’M CURVY, AND I LIKE IT!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Apartment. Rachel, Ross, Monica and Chandler are there, Phoebe enters the room]
rows.Content: ScenesPhoebe: Hi. I just had the worst anniversary ever.ScenesChandler: I doubt that! Tell her about us last year.ScenesMonica: Oh, well, I bought Chandler a five hundred dollar watch and he wrote me a rap song.ScenesRoss: Seriously?ScenesChandler: Word!ScenesPhoebe: Well, mine was worse than that.ScenesRachel: Well, what happened?ScenesPhoebe: We were at the game, and this guy proposed to his girlfriend on the big screen thing...ScenesRachel: Oh, that is so tacky.ScenesPhoebe: Well, that’s what I said, but it turns out, Mike was planning on proposing to me that same way last night!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, Mike was gonna propose?ScenesRachel: Phoebe, that’s huge!ScenesRoss: Well, do you wanna marry him?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I really do! Yes, but, after I dumped on the way he was gonna propose to me, I don’t think he’s ever gonna ask again! I mean, I said no in Barbados and now this!ScenesChandler: She's right! If I were a guy and... (stops himself mid-sentence...everyone stares at him) Did I just say if I were a guy..?ScenesMonica: Maybe you don't need him to propose to you, maybe you can propose to him!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I don't know, I don't know, isn't that a little desperate?ScenesMonica: I proposed to Chandler! (Phoebe stops herself from laughing) Alright, moving on...ScenesChandler: Oh, I don't think it was desperate, I think it was amazing!ScenesMonica: Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel and Ross) Well, do you think I should propose?ScenesRachel: I think it could be kind of great!ScenesRoss: Absolutely! You'll love the feeling! There's nothing like it!ScenesPhoebe: Ok, ok, so how should I do it?ScenesMonica: How about at a game, on the big screen?ScenesRachel: (Sarcastically) Uuuh!! How about at a Footlocker? (claps her hands together, faking excitement)ScenesMonica: What? what? He obviously thinks that's a nice way to be proposed to, plus he'd never suspect it!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, that does make sense. Ok, now, would... would you two (points to Ross and Chandler) like that?ScenesChandler: Sounds good to me... but what would a guy think?Scenes(Amy walks in carrying a phone handset)ScenesAmy: (To Rachel) Nana is on the phone (Hands the phone over to Rachel)ScenesRachel: (Takes the phone) Oh! That's interesting, since she died seven years ago!!ScenesAmy: She did? Who got her condo in Boca?ScenesRachel: (Into the phone) Hello? (announces to Amy) Oh, it's our nanny! (goes back to the phone conversation) Hi! Oh... God! I hope you feel better! Ok, bye! (Hangs up) (To Ross) That's Molly, she's sick. Can you watch Emma today?ScenesRoss: No, I can't. I have back-to-back classes. Did Molly say what she had? Because my throat's been hurting?ScenesRachel: Menstrual cramps.ScenesRoss: I don't think that's what this is.ScenesRachel: (To Monica, Chandler and Phoebe) Can any of you watch Emma?ScenesMonica: No, sorry sweety..ScenesPhoebe: No, I've got work and then I'm proposing..ScenesRachel: (To Ross) Great, shoot, what are we gonna do?ScenesAmy: Well, I can do it.ScenesRachel: (Thinks for a moment) Well, actually...ScenesRoss: (He interrupts her immediately, and drags her by her arm to the other side of the room) Well, can I talk to you for a sec.?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Um, I do not want her baby-sitting our child.ScenesRachel: Why not?ScenesRoss: Well, for one thing, she keeps calling her Ella!ScenesRachel: (Defends Amy) Wha.. well, Ella's a nice name!ScenesRoss: Fine, we'll call the next one Ella.ScenesRachel: (Shocked) Wha... the next one?ScenesRoss: (a little confused) Okay, um... I don't want her watching our baby.ScenesRachel: Ross, I am trying to help her become a better person. This is a huge breakthrough for her! She just offered to do something for another human being!!ScenesRoss: I... I don't know..ScenesRachel: Ross, I'm telling you, she's giving up getting her eyebrows (points at her own to emphasize the word) shaped to do this alright? Do you understand how important that is in our world?Scenes(Amy approaches from behind)ScenesAmy: um... listen, I couldn't help but overhear... 'cause I was trying to... Listen, let me do this alright? I really wanna help you guys out, and plus Rachel's been so wonderful to me... (looks at hem pleadingly)Scenes(Rachel looks at Ross and her agrees silently)ScenesRachel: Absolutely.ScenesAmy: (very excited) Oh! Great! So how much does it pay? (Ross just gives up and leaves)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Joey is inside, Chandler and Monica walk in.]
rows.Content: ScenesChandler: Hey Joe! How's the second draft of the letter coming?ScenesJoey: Great, I'm finished! In fact, I just dropped it off at the agency.Scenes(Chandler and Monica look shocked)ScenesMonica: You dropped it off?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Can we read it? Can you print out another copy?ScenesJoey: No can do amigo. No, I didn't use the computer. Felt more personal to hand-write it. (Chandler and Monica look even more shocked)ScenesMonica: You hand-wrote it?ScenesJoey: Yeah, and don't worry. I didn't try to sound smart at all! See ya later! (Leaves)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, oh my God, that letter is gonna go in our file! We're never gonna get a kid. No, we're gonna be one of those old couples that collects orchids or has a lot of birds!ScenesChandler: It's ok, it's ok. You know what? (Takes out his mobile) I'll just call the agency and tell them to throw out the letter. (starts dialing)ScenesMonica: Okay good.ScenesChandler: (on the phone) Hello, this is Chandler Bing. Somebody just dropped off a handwritten recommendation letter, and.. (listens) Uh-huh... Uh-huh... okay... thank you. Good-bye. (hangs up looking very confused).ScenesMonica: Ugh, we're screwed, aren't we? You know what? Just tell me on the way to the bird store.ScenesChandler: (Still looks confused) They loved it.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: They thought it was very smart of us to have a child write the recommendation letter.ScenesMonica: (surprised) They thought Joey was a child?ScenesChandler: She guessed 8, 9, based on his drawings.Scenes(Amy comes in with Emma in a stroller)ScenesAmy: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey, what did you guys do today?ScenesAmy: Ella wanted to go out, so we went shopping and got some sushi.ScenesChandler: That sounds like fun.ScenesAmy: Yeah, not really. Babies are dull.Scenes(Rachel comes in, sees Amy and Emma)ScenesRachel: (To Emma) Hey! Hi, how's my girl?ScenesAmy: I'm fine! And, I got you a present for letting me stay with you. Ready?ScenesRachel: (sounds excited) Yeah!Scenes(Amy takes off Emma's hat)ScenesAmy: Ta-daaa!Scenes(Rachel looks at Emma)ScenesRachel: (not excited anymore) You pierced her ears!?ScenesAmy: (Very excited about it) Doesn't it make her nose look smaller?Scenes(Rachel looks very shocked)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAKScenesRachel: You pierced her ears? How could you do this without telling me?ScenesAmy: Well, if I had told you, then it wouldn't have been surprise, now would it?ScenesChandler: I think she looks cute. (Rachel turns around and stares at him angrily) ... but I am wrong!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Oh my God, here comes Ross. He's gonna flip out.ScenesAmy: Why, did something happen to his falafel cart?ScenesRachel: Ugh. (takes the hat and covers Emma's head and half her face with it)Scenes(Ross enters)ScenesRoss: Hey guys. ScenesMonica and Chandler: Hi Ross.ScenesRoss: Hey Emma. Oh, why is she wearing her hat so low? She can barely see. (Wants to take the hat off, but Rachel tries to stop him).ScenesRachel: Nah, I don't really want her to see.ScenesRoss: Why not?ScenesMonica: Because there are so many terrible sights in this world.ScenesChandler: Like war. Or that thing in Joey's refrigerator. Remember? It was in a milk carton but it looked like meat?ScenesRoss: Come here (Removes Emma's hat) Oh! There she is! Hi!Scenes(Rachel looks worried)ScenesRoss: (sees how strangely Monica, Chandler and Rachel are looking at him) What?ScenesRachel: Nothing.ScenesRoss: (Back to Emma) Hi! (Looks at her) What... (Moves the stroller away from him so he can get a better look at her. He looks at her confused. Finally he realizes the difference and gasps). Please tell me those are clip-ons.ScenesRachel: Oh, they're real!ScenesRoss: Did she (points at Amy) do this to her? I told you we shouldn't have left Emma with her!ScenesRachel: I know, I know, and you were right Ross. (To Amy) You are soo irresponsible I am never letting you baby-sit ever again!ScenesAmy: Hey you know what, this kid needs me, okay? She needs to have a cool fun aunt!ScenesMonica: I'm a cool, fun aunt!ScenesAmy: (Sarcastically) O-Okay!ScenesChandler: Hey! Monica can be cool and fun at organized indoor projects!ScenesRachel: I can't believe this. All I wanted to do was help you try to figure out what to do with your life and this is how you repay me?ScenesAmy: Well, I don't need you to help me, because I already know what I'm going to do with my life.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah? Since when?ScenesAmy: Since today... I am going to be a baby stylist.ScenesRachel: (looks at Ross and then at Amy again in disbelief) What?ScenesRoss: That's not a thing!ScenesAmy: Well, it should be. I'm gonna help babies learn how to accessorize, what colors to wear, what clothes are slimming...ScenesRachel: (shouting) Babies don't care if they're slim.ScenesAmy: Enter Amy!ScenesRoss: (very angry) Amy, I ju... I just... I just wanna...ScenesAmy: What? What are you gonna do?ScenesRoss: (pointing at Amy, shouting) No more falafel for you!Scenes(Amy looks at Ross, angrily. Rachel clearly doesn't understand what he meant and looks at Ross who gestures "later".)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Madison Square Garden. Phoebe and Mike are watching the game. There's cheering, but Phoebe seems distracted.]
rows.Content: ScenesMike: Great game, huh?ScenesPhoebe: Uhuh, uhuh... (seems distracted)ScenesMike: Why do you keep looking at the screen?ScenesPhoebe: I'm not. I'm praying. (looking up) Please let the Knicks win... Thank you Thor! (Mike is standing up) Where... where are you going?ScenesMike: Going go to the bathroom.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think you should wait.ScenesMike: Why?ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you don't... if you don't hold it in, you don't get all the nutrients.ScenesAnnouncer: Knicks fans, please turn your attention to the big screen on the scoreboard. Someone has a special question to ask.Scenes(We see the screen where it says: "Mike will you marry me?" and then we see Phoebe and Mike on the screen. Phoebe stands up and kneels in front of Mike.)ScenesPhoebe: Mike Hannigan... will you marry me? (Mike looks bewildered)ScenesAnnouncer: Get a load of this... She's proposing to him. Guess we know who wears the pants in that family. (people are laughing, while Mike still seems bewildered)ScenesPhoebe: That's not very enlightened!Scenes(There's booing around them, and Mike sinks in his chair, holding his hand in above his eyes, hoping no-one would recognize him)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, hey! (shouting) Boo us? Boo you!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey's. Joey is in the kitchen and the telephone rings.]
rows.Content: ScenesJoey: (picks up the phone) Hello? Yeah, this is Joey Tribbiani... Oh, hi! Well, I'm glad you liked my letter... No my mommy and daddy aren't home right now... (looks puzzled) Okay, bye bye. (hangs up) (to himself) She was nice!Scenes(Rachel and Amy enter)ScenesRachel: Joey, get Amy's bags, she is moving out!ScenesJoey: Whoo-hoo! (and leaves for Rachel's room)ScenesAmy: You're kicking me out?ScenesRachel: You put holes in my baby's ears!ScenesAmy: Yeah well, at least now people will know she is a girl!ScenesRachel: (gasps) I can't believe I ever even tried to help you. You are so beyond help.ScenesAmy: You know what? Ever since I got here, you have been nothing but negative.ScenesRachel: Excuse me?ScenesAmy: You didn't want me to marry the old guy with the great apartment. Then, I tried to help your daughter to de-emphasize her flaws (frantically pointing at her nose) And suddenly I am the bad guy?ScenesRachel: (yelling) Joey, where are those bags?ScenesJoey: (Yelling from Rachel's room) She has a lot of crap!ScenesAmy: You know what? When I moved in here I thought: This is gonna be so great. Just us sisters, back together again like when we were kids, except without that stupid Jill... Oh! Who has gotten fat by the way...ScenesRachel: (doesn't believe what she's hearing) Seriously?ScenesAmy: hm-mmm... Mom said she gained like fifteen pounds.ScenesRachel: Hips or thighs?ScenesAmy: Ass and face.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh! Oh my God! I thought she was on Atkins.ScenesAmy: She was. Carbs found her... See, this is what I wanted. Two sisters, talking about real stuff.ScenesRachel: (embarrassed) Oh, I can give you that.ScenesAmy: You can?ScenesRachel: Yeah. I just, I kept trying to make you a better person, but you're... you're already a pretty perfect version of what you are.ScenesAmy: (touched) Thank you. I've got to admit, Emma does look cute.ScenesRachel: Did you just say Emma?ScenesAmy: Ugh, I'm sorry... Ella.

rows.Scenes: Mike and Phoebe at a restaurant.]
rows.Content: ScenesPhoebe: That woman at the game didn't know what she was talking about. Mike, obviously you have balls.ScenesMike: But please, let's just forget the whole thing.ScenesPhoebe: (the waiter puts a piece of cake on the table) I would love it. Consider it forgotten... But just so you know... however and whenever you decide to propose, I promise I'll say yes. Whether... whether, you know, it is in a basketball game, or in sky writing, or you know, like some lame guy in a cheesy movie who hides it in the cake.Scenes(Mike's face changes from happy to sad, and he looks at the cake, disappointed.)ScenesPhoebe: It's in the cake, isn't it?ScenesMike: (puts on a fake smile) Where else would lame Mr. No Balls hide it? (he takes the ring from the cake, and cleans it with a napkin)ScenesPhoebe: What's the matter with me? How do I keep ruining this? I'm sorry, I'm sorry!ScenesMike: No! It's my fault. I keep trying to propose in these stupid ways and all I wanna do is tell you that I love you and I want to spend the rest of my life with you.Scenes(Phoebe has this weird, anxious, nervous look on her face)ScenesMike: I'm gonna do this now.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!Scenes(Mike starts to kneel in front of Phoebe.)ScenesMike: Phoebe, I...ScenesPhoebe: Wait! Oh wait! (she takes off a ring that was already on her left ring finger. After that Mike starts to kneel again, but then...) Oh no! (She was wearing rings on all her fingers and her thumb, and takes all of these off.)ScenesMike: Ready?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh! (and now Mike kneels properly)ScenesMike: Phoebe, I love you. There's no-one else in the world I would ask to marry me... three times. But I wanna take care of you, have babies with you, and grow old with you... Phoebe Buffay, will you marry me?ScenesPhoebe: Yes!Scenes(Mike puts the ring on her finger)ScenesMike: I love you!ScenesPhoebe: I love you more!ScenesMike: Not possible! (they kiss, and then Mike says proudly...) She's gonna be Mrs. No Balls.Scenes(They kiss again, and Phoebe looks at the ring.)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAKScenes

rows.Scenes: The street in front of Central Perk. Rachel and Amy are walking on the sidewalk.]
rows.Content: ScenesRachel: So how is the uhm... baby styling business going?ScenesAmy: Not that great. It's almost if people don't want to hear that their babies are ugly.ScenesRachel: That's shocking!ScenesAmy: Oh! It's Ross... Hey Ross! (She says hey to the guy at the falafel stand, whose only similarity with Ross would be his black hair.) Hello-oo Ross! (to Rachel) He's rude!ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1006 - The One With Ross' GrantScenesWritten by: Sebastian JonesScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & Vanessa ScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe is there]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (she enters) Hey...ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, what's wrong?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I'm just so exhausted from dragging around this... (she shows her ring) HUGE engagement ring!ScenesAll: OH!ScenesRachel: My God!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRachel: Congratulations! Wow!!ScenesRoss: So, did he get on one knee, did he have a speech prepared, or (in a tender way) did he cry? (the guys look at him) Yeah, big surprise, I like proposals!ScenesPhoebe: Well, it was really sweet, and like the most romantic thing ever.ScenesJoey: Well, hey! Well... (he takes his mug to toast Phoebe) Here's to Phoebe, who's found the greatest guy in the world! To Phoebe and... (a bit uncertain) I wanna say Mike? (pause) To Phoebe and Mike!ScenesAll: Whoo!ScenesPhoebe: Thank you! (to Rachel) Oh, and I have something for you!ScenesRachel: Mmh-mmh!ScenesPhoebe: It's, yes, my little black book. It's got the numbers of all the guys I've dated.ScenesRachel: Oh, Pheebs, baby, that's nice but, you know what, I think I'm ok. Why don't you give it to one of your other single girlfriends?ScenesPhoebe: I would, but you're the last one.ScenesRachel: (angrily) GIVE ME THE BOOK! (she takes it and start reading) Pablo Diaz, Brady Smith, huh, "Guy-in-van"?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my first love!ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesMonica: What does the red X next to Bob Greenmore's name mean?ScenesPhoebe: Dead. (everyone is a bit upset) Oh, it's OK, no, he was old, yeah! And he lived a full life, he was in the first wave at Omaha Beach.ScenesChandler: Hey, I'm sorry, I should have given you guys my black book when I got married! Although it wasn't so much a book as a... napkin. With Janice's phone number on it.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, isn't Jethro Tull a band?ScenesPhoebe: (proud of herself) Oh yes, they are.ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
rows.Content: ScenesChandler: (he enters) Hey honey!ScenesJoey: (Looking inside the fridge, and we only see his back. Then he closes the door, and we see it's Joey.) Hi sweetie!ScenesChandler: Is Monica not here?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesChandler: Oh, then I'll tell you. My agency was bidding for a big account and they got it! It's my first national commercial!ScenesJoey: Cool!ScenesChandler: Yeah, and I don't wanna brag but a lot of the ideas were mine! (silence) Hell, you weren't there? All the ideas were mine!!!ScenesJoey: That's great! Hey, can you cast me in it?ScenesChandler: Oh... I don't know, I really don't think you're right for the part.ScenesJoey: What do you mean? I can do anything, I'm a chameleon! Huh? (he mimes an old man with a beard) I'm old! (then he yawns) I'm tired! (then he mimes someone who's hot...) Hey, I'm hot (...and cold) I'm cold!! Huh?? Come on! What can't I do?ScenesChandler: First of all. Bravo. Uh, but I really don't think you're right for this. The part calls for a stuffy college professor.ScenesJoey: I can do that! (in a deeper voice) "Hello, I'm your professor. When I'm not busy thinking of important things or... professing. I like to use..." Oh, what's the product?ScenesChandler: Software that facilitates inter-business networking e-solutions?ScenesJoey: (after a long pause he starts miming again) I'm cold!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Charlie is sitting on the couch and Ross enters.]
rows.Content: ScenesRoss: (to Charlie) Hey!ScenesCharlie: Hey!ScenesRoss: Guess who's a finalist for a huge research grant! I'll give you a hint, he's looking right at you.ScenesCharlie: Ah, well, unless it's the creepy guy with his hand up his kilt, I'm gonna say congratulations!ScenesRoss: Oh, I'm so excited, I mean, apparently I beat out hundreds of other applicants, included five guys I went to graduate school with. Not that I'm keeping score or anything... five!ScenesCharlie: Wow, that's great! So, tell me about the grant!ScenesRoss: Well, ok, it's for 25 thousand dollars. And if I get it, I'll finally be able to complete my field research! And there will be an article about me in the "Paleontology Review"! Yeah! That'll be the first time my name is in there, without people raising serious questions about my work!ScenesCharlie: Wait. Are you talking about the Dewar grant?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Why?ScenesCharlie: Benjamin Hobart is administering that grant.ScenesRoss: Your ex-boyfriend?ScenesCharlie: Yeah.ScenesRoss: So, your ex-boyfriend is gonna determine if your new boyfriend gets this grant? Wow, your new boyfriend is screwed!ScenesCharlie: No, no, we ended up in great terms. I mean, if anything, I think this could help you. You know what? Why don't we all go out to dinner together, and I can introduce you.ScenesRoss: Well, if you think it would help.ScenesCharlie: Yes, absolutely. I'll call him.ScenesRoss: Ok, now, is there anything I can do to... you know, butter him up? Anything he really likes?ScenesCharlie: Mmh... he does have a pretty serious latex fetish.ScenesRoss: We'll see how dinner goes.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Phoebe's apartment. She is packing a few tings into boxes.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (looking at Monica entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey, you wanna go to see a movie?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I told you I had to spend all the day clearing out stuff, so Mike could move in.ScenesMonica: Oh, right.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Oh, well. Now that I'm here I might as well help you with the cleaning and organizing! Just happen to have my label maker!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it's so hard to get rid of stuff! Did you and Chandler have to make compromises when you first moved in together?ScenesMonica: Uh, Chandler did! What does he want you to give up?ScenesPhoebe: A bunch of stuff. And the worst one... he wants me to get rid of Gladys.ScenesMonica: Who's Gladys? (Phoebe shows her a horrific painting with a half-a-body girl dummy coming out of the frame. Monica's frightened and she gasps.) Oh! What a tragic loss!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I really hate to give her up. Oh, I know!! Oh, you should take her!ScenesMonica: (faking happiness) Well, I-I-I-I... I don't know...ScenesPhoebe: Why, you don't like her?ScenesMonica: Well, of course I do. What's not to like! I'll take her in a minute! But, you know, I think that you're giving up too easy, honey. I think that you need to fight for her!ScenesPhoebe: Really? You think?ScenesMonica: Absolutely! Yes, you say to him "I'm sorry Mike I can't live without her, she means too much to me!ScenesPhoebe: Ok, I'll fight for her. Ok! Oh, wait, oh I just realized... if I do that, that means you don't get her.ScenesMonica: Damn it, I did not think this through!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel, Joey and Emma are there.]
rows.Content: ScenesChandler: Hey you guys.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoey: Oh! Any word on casting yet?ScenesChandler: Joe, I told you, you're just not right for the part.ScenesJoey: What do you mean? Rach, don't I seem like a professor you'd buy some kind of e-crap from?ScenesRachel: I'm sorry, this sounds like something I'm never gonna be interested in.ScenesJoey (to Chandler): Look, c'mon, please? It's not like I'm asking for some crazy favour. This is what I do for a living. I am a professional actor! (he glances at his watch and sees the time) Oh, man, I'm two hours late for work! (he stands, ready to go). Look, here's a copy of my reels. It's got all the commercials that I've been in.ScenesChandler: Joe...ScenesJoey: Just watch it, and if you don't like it, you don't pass it on to your bosses!ScenesChandler: Fine!ScenesJoey: Thank you. (he sits down)ScenesChandler: Work, Joe!ScenesJoey: Damn it! (he leaves)ScenesChandler (to Rachel): What am I gonna do now?ScenesJoey: Just pass it to your boss!ScenesChandler: He's not right for the part. So if I suggest him, my bosses are gonna think I'm an idiot! And that's something they should learn on their own!ScenesRachel: Just tell Joey that you watched the tape and you liked it, but your bosses didn't. Then that way, you're the good guy and they're the bad guys.ScenesChandler: That's good! I liked it, they didn't. (he sees Joey out of the window hitting on a girl) Joey, for God's sake, go to work! (Joey runs away).

rows.Scenes: A restaurant. Ross and Charlie are waiting for her ex-boyfriend, Benjamin Hobart]
rows.Content: ScenesRoss: I can't believe I'm about to meet Benjamin Hobart. I've always thought of him as one of the people I'd invite to my fantasy dinner party. Do you think there's any chance he'll bring Christie Brinkley or C3PO?ScenesCharlie: (glances over Ross' shoulder) Sorry, looks like it's just him.ScenesBenjamin: Charlie! My God, you look absolutely stunning!ScenesRoss: Well, I... I am having a good hair day.ScenesBenjamin: So good to see you.ScenesCharlie: Me too. (she and Benjamin are hugging for very long and Ross starts pretending to clear his throat, until they stop)ScenesRoss: I'm ok.ScenesCharlie: I'm sorry... (introduces them to each other) Ross Geller... Benjamin Hobart.ScenesRoss: It's an honor to meet you. I can't tell you how long I've been an admirer of your work, I mean, that Nobel prize, (he thumbs up) whoooo! I mean, I have to tell you that, you're one of the reasons I got into the field.ScenesBenjamin: Oh, well, likewise. Actually, not likewise. I've never heard of you until this morning, but, it's nice to be nice!ScenesCharlie: Shall we? (they sit down and Benjamin takes Ross' chair).ScenesBenjamin: (to Ross) Thank you! (to Charlie). I can't believe that you chose this restaurant! Do you remember the night?ScenesCharlie: Oh my God, I completely forgot! (they laugh) Oh my God! I can't believe they let us back in this place! (they laugh more, and Ross start laughing too).ScenesBenjamin (to Ross): You weren't there!ScenesRoss: No, but, it's, you know, it's just a funny image, you know, the two of you, in this restaurant, with... (laughs nervously)tzz-zzz, mmm.ScenesCharlie: Ross, why don't you tell Benji about your proposal, while I go to the ladies room?ScenesBenjamin: So, tell me about it.ScenesRoss: Ok well, I would like to do a dig in the painted desert.ScenesBenjamin: M-m.ScenesRoss: See, there are still several areas that haven't been fully excavated.ScenesBenjamin: Break up with Charlie!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesBenjamin: What?ScenesRoss: Did you just say "break up with Charlie"?ScenesBenjamin: Well, yes, and now. Yes I did say it, and no, I didn't not say it.ScenesRoss: Kind of inappropriate, don't you think?ScenesBenjamin: I'm sorry. I just haven't seen her for so long! All these feelings are rushing back! I'm starting to realize how much I missed her, and I'm gonna need you to break up with her.ScenesRoss: Are you serious?ScenesBenjamin: If you say yes then I'm serious, if you say no then I'm joking!ScenesRoss: No!ScenesBenjamin: Joking it is!

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Phoebe enters the room.]
rows.Content: ScenesPhoebe: Hi! Sorry, I'm late.ScenesMonica: Hey, how did it go with Mike, is he gonna let you keep the painting?ScenesPhoebe: No, he really hates it. But he's gonna let me keep my box of human hair! So you got to pick your battles. But the good news is, Gladys is yours!ScenesMonica: Wow, what's the bad news!ScenesRachel: Who's Gladys?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she's that work of art I made, you know, with the woman coming out of the frame.ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Oh, and Monica gets to keep her? In her house? I am so jealous!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I didn't know you wanted her too!ScenesMonica: Huh!ScenesRachel: Well, I mean, sure, of course. But... you already gave that to Monica, so...ScenesMonica: You know, I would give her up, for you.ScenesRachel: No, I couldn't let you do that.ScenesMonica: But I want to.ScenesRachel: But I don't want you to.ScenesMonica: But I insist!ScenesRachel: But I insist harder!ScenesPhoebe: Girls, girls, stop, ok? We'll flip a coin. Heads, she's Rachel's, tails she's Monica's. (she flips the coin). Tails! Monica, she's yours!ScenesMonica: No, that landed in your food!ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) No, no, that's ok. You won fair and square. I'm so sad!

rows.Scenes: Chandler walks into Joey's apartment]
rows.Content: ScenesChandler: Hey Joe!ScenesJoey: What's up?ScenesChandler: Bad news. I watched the tape and passed it along to my bosses and they weren't interested.ScenesJoey: (sounds disappointed) Oh.ScenesChandler: (Hands the tape back to him) I'm sorry man.ScenesJoey: (looks at him suspiciously) But, ehm... you watched the tape?ScenesChandler: (sounds nervous) Yeah! I... I... I liked it! (Joey continues to look at him suspiciously) But, ehm... my bosses didn't go for it. Stupid sons of bitches!ScenesJoey: (sounds confident) You didn't watch the tape.ScenesChandler: (looks surprised) What!? Of course I did!ScenesJoey: Look, it's one thing not to cast me, but to lie to me?ScenesChandler: I'm not lying to you, I watched it!ScenesJoey: Well, you lied again! (Rachel comes out of her room and is observing the conversation)ScenesChandler: I watched it!ScenesJoey: Keep going Pinocchio!ScenesChandler: (now yelling) (pretending to look shocked) I did!ScenesJoey: (yelling back) No you didn't! (turns and goes towards his room)ScenesChandler: (following him) I'm telling you, I watched the tape. (Reaches Joey's room and Joey slams the door in his face)ScenesRachel: Did you watch the tape?ScenesChandler:(In a sarcastic "of course not"!-tone) No!

rows.Scenes: Interview room. Ross and two other professors (one man, one woman) are sitting on one side of a long desk. Benjamin Hobart is sitting on the other side]
rows.Content: ScenesBenjamin: The selection committee has chosen the three of you as our finalists today. The ultimate decision will be based upon the answers you give to the questions I ask here. I'm gonna start with Dr. Li. Dr. Li, you claim the field is too reliant on the Linnaean taxonomic system. How do you propose to correct this problem?ScenesDr. Li: Well, I believe that the answers lie in the osteological evidence. I plan to begin there.ScenesBenjamin: (nods) Interesting.ScenesRoss: (Rolls his eyes) I guess!ScenesBenjamin: Dr. Biely, your proposal includes some field work. Where might that take place?ScenesDr. Biely: Primarily in the Pierre Shale region of South Dakota.ScenesBenjamin: Certainly. Very well. And Dr. Geller, when is my birthday?ScenesRoss: (shocked and confused by the question) What? I... I... (Benjamin looks at him as if to say "What's wrong? Answer the question")ScenesBenjamin: Care to venture a guess?ScenesRoss: (annoyed) May 12th?ScenesBenjamin: (looks surprised and un-impressed) That's not even kinda close! (Ross looks around confused) Dr. Li, how many graduate students you'd be needing?ScenesDr. Li: Half a dozen.ScenesBenjamin: I see, and Dr. Biely?ScenesDr. Biely: Three for excavation and two for analysis.ScenesBenjamin: Certainly. Dr. Geller, which 1965 Shirelles hit was later covered by a popular British invasion band?ScenesRoss: (even more shocked) Wha..? I need 6 graduate students.ScenesBenjamin: No! I'm sorry, we were looking for "Baby It's You". Baby It's You.ScenesRoss: Wha...? Wait, wait, wait, just a minute. None of my questions have anything to do with Paleontology.ScenesBenjamin: You're right, I apologize. Scratch the last question. Spell "Boscodictiasaur".ScenesRoss: (annoyed) um... I've never heard of a "Boscodictiasaur".ScenesBenjamin: Yeah, I just made it up. Spell it.ScenesRoss: (stares at him angrily) Ok. (determined to spell it correctly) B - O - S ...ScenesBenjamin: No, it starts with a silent "M".ScenesRoss: Oh come on!!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Chandler and Rachel are talking.]
rows.Content: ScenesChandler: I can't believe Joey. I hate being called a liar!ScenesRachel: But you are a liar.ScenesChandler: What did I just say?Scenes(Joey comes out of his room)ScenesJoey: You still here?ScenesChandler: Yes, and I have to say, I am not just hurt. I am insulted. When I tell somebody I did something...ScenesJoey: Ok whoah-hey... Let me just stop you right there, ok? First, you lied, right? Then, you lied about lying, ok? Then you lied about lying about lying, ok? So before you lie about lying about lying about lying about... lying... (loses count and begins to count the number of 'lyings' in the air but gives up.) (yelling) Stop lying!ScenesChandler: Why are you so sure I didn't watch this tape?ScenesJoey: (very angry) You wanna know wh...? You wanna know why? (goes back into his room)ScenesRachel: Well, this is going well. (Chandler looks worried)ScenesJoey: (comes out holding the tape) Here's how I know you didn't watch the tape, ok? (puts it into the vcr) If you had seen what was on this tape, believe me, you would have some comments. Alright, now remember, I got paid a lot of money for this and it only aired in Japan. (presses play and he appears on the TV screen and a TV commercial begins)Scenes(The commercial:ScenesJoey says "Ichiban". It displays a few girls dancing around and Joey fills most of the screen, he puts something blue on his lips and smacks them saying "Lipstick For Men!" It goes on to show him playing a guitar and putting on more blue lipstick. In the end he says seductively "Ichiban... Lipstick For Men" and "Sahiko" and it ends. Chandler and Rachel are speechless.)ScenesJoey: (Yelling at Chandler) And that's how I know you didn't watch the tape! (goes back to his room and slams the door).Scenes(Silence)ScenesChandler: He really is a chameleon.

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Phoebe enters carrying the horrific 'painting' of Gladys. Monica and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: ScenesPhoebe: (smiling from ear to ear) Well, Gladys say hello to your new home! (she holds out the 'painting')ScenesMonica: (faking happiness) Oh, my!ScenesRachel: (surprised by how ugly it is) Wow! (sarcastic) Oh, she's so nice and big! Oh, Monica, where are you going to display Gladys oh so proudly? (looks around for a spot)ScenesMonica: (sounds desperate, knowing what Rachel is trying to do) I haven't really settled on a spot yet!ScenesRachel: Well, hey! How about right above the TV? (Points to the spot where her famous French poster is hanging). That way, it will be the first thing that you see when you walk in the door!ScenesPhoebe: (genuinely excited about it) Yeah, yeah! And you can get rid of that French poster.ScenesMonica: (offended) I like that poster!ScenesPhoebe: Really? It doesn't have anything coming out of it. Or maybe there is some place for her in your bedroom?ScenesRachel: (jumps at the chance to make that happen) Oh! There's nothing above your bed!!ScenesMonica: (Impatient with Rachel) Are you still here?

rows.Scenes: Ross' office. Ross is pacing and Benjamin enters]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh hi! Hello! Uh, have you come to ask me some more paleontology related questions? Uhm... your grandmother's nickname, perhaps? (Now yelling) Aunt Margaret's pants size?ScenesBenjamin: I've come here to apologize. I think I may have let my feelings for Charlie interfere with the interview process.ScenesRoss: (Sarcastic) No! Stop!ScenesBenjamin: Anyway, I've decided to offer you the grant.ScenesRoss: (Skeptical) Really?ScenesBenjamin: Well... there is just one small... stipulation...ScenesRoss: I have to break up with Charlie?ScenesBenjamin: Hey, you got one right!Scenes(Ross shakes his head)ScenesRoss: You're crazy.ScenesBenjamin: Crazy, or... romantic?ScenesRoss: Crazy!ScenesBenjamin: Ooor...ScenesRoss: (Yelling) Get out! (Benjamin leaves)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment.]
rows.Content: (Rachel enters, checking the mail, then looks up and sees Gladys placed on the barcalounger.)ScenesRachel: O-oh my God!ScenesJoey: (enters from his bedroom) What?ScenesRachel: Joey, what... is... this...thing... doing here?ScenesJoey: I got it from Monica. She sold it to me for a very reasonable price.ScenesRachel: Joey, we're not keeping this!ScenesJoey: But it's an original Buffay...ScenesRachel: Alright, fine. You can keep it. As long as you don't mind that she's haunted.ScenesJoey: Hey? what? what? wey! whoo! what? what!?ScenesRachel: Well, legend has it Joey, that... she comes alive when you're asleep.Scenes(Joey's eyes are twice their size now, and looks nervously from Rachel to Gladys and back.)ScenesRachel: She climbs out of the frame, and then drags her half-a-body across the floor, just looking for legs to steal. (in a spooky, slow voice) And then with her one good hand, she slo-o-owly re-e-a-aches up and turns your doorknob.ScenesJoey: GET THAT LEGLESS WITCH OUT OF HERE!Scenes(Joey leaves for his bedroom, and Rachel grins. She then takes Gladys and enters Monica's apartment.)ScenesMonica: Hey! I sold that to Joey.ScenesRachel: Well, why I told him it's haunted. Two can play at this game. (gives Gladys to Monica)ScenesMonica: No, too late. You can't give it back! (she pushes the painting back to Rachel)ScenesRachel: Yes I can! (pushes her back again)ScenesMonica: No you can't. She's yours!ScenesRachel: She's yours!ScenesMonica: SHE'S YOURS!ScenesRachel: She's yours!Scenes(While they are both pushing the painting towards each other, Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey! (there's a pause)ScenesRachel: She's mine!ScenesMonica: She's m-i-i-ne!ScenesRachel: She's mine!ScenesMonica: She's mine!ScenesPhoebe: You guys! You guys! You don't have to fight over her anymore. (she goes out into the hallway and enters with an even more hideous painting/collage. One of those faceles mannequins heads wearing a blueish dress and orange gloves reaching out into the room. Around the head 3 small dolls are hovering.) Whoever doesn't get Gladys gets Glynnis. (Rachel and Monica are gasping for air at the sight of this monstrous piece of art.)ScenesRachel: I want Gladys!ScenesMonica: She's mine!ScenesRachel: She's mine!ScenesMonica: She's mine!ScenesRachel: She's mine!

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Joey's. Joey's home alone, reading a Sports Illustrated magazine when Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Look, I'm sorry I didn't give them your tape. And I promise, next time to submit you whether I think you are right for the part or not.ScenesJoey: That's not the point Chandler. The point is that you lied.ScenesChandler: I know. You're right. What's it gonna take for you to forgive me?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Monica, Phoebe and Rachel are on the couch.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh my God!Scenes(we see Joey and Chandler standing there, and Chandler is wearing the blue Ichiban lipstick!)ScenesRachel: Excellent!ScenesJoey: Now, what do you say?ScenesChandler: Lying is wrong!ScenesJoey: And?... AND?ScenesChandler: I'm a pretty little girl.ScenesPhoebe: I knew it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Some time later that day. The group has left and Charlie is there when Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Your ex-boyfriend is insane.ScenesCharlie: Did you get the grant?ScenesRoss: No I didn't, and you want to know why? Because your ex-boyfriend is still in love with you.ScenesCharlie: What?ScenesRoss: Yeah. He wouldn't give me the grant, because I wouldn't give you up.ScenesCharlie: Benji isn't in love with me. I mean, he broke up with me. And besides, he's a very ethical man.ScenesRoss: Really? Is it ethical to ask someone in a grant review, who was the voice of "Underdog"?ScenesCharlie: I'm sure he was just joking, Ross.ScenesRoss: If you don't believe me, let's go talk to him, okay? I'm telling you, he didn't ask me one paleontological question.ScenesCharlie: Seriously?ScenesRoss: Oh, I'm sorry, no. He did ask me one. Uhm... How do you spell Mboscodictiosaur?ScenesCharlie: Well, if it's like the lake Mbosco in Congo, then M-B-O...ScenesRoss: Damnit!

rows.Scenes: Benjamin's office. Ross and Charlie are entering.]
rows.Content: Benjamin: Dr. Geller...? Charlie... What are you... what are you doing here?ScenesRoss: I want you to tell her everything. About the deal you tried to make with me, about the crazy questions you... Wally Cox! That's the voice of Underdog!ScenesBenjamin: Like I tried to tell you in the interview Ross, this grant is not based on your knowledge of pretty useless trivia.ScenesRoss: No, no, no. Don't do that! I want you to look her in the eyes, and tell her the truth.ScenesCharlie: Benji?ScenesBenjamin: Alright, it's true. I behaved horribly. But it's only because I still love you. And I would do anything to have you back in my life.ScenesRoss: Too little, too late, Benji!ScenesCharlie: I can't believe this.ScenesBenjamin: I never should have broken up with you. I think about you all the time. I mean, do you ever still think about me?ScenesRoss: (indignant) No!ScenesCharlie: Yes!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesCharlie: I don't know what to say, Benji. This is all so.... romantic.ScenesRoss: or...ScenesBenjamin: Listen, I know, I may be way out of bounds here, but is there any chance you will take me back?ScenesCharlie: Maybe...ScenesRoss: Sweetie, this conversation is starting to make me a little uncomfortable.ScenesCharlie: Oh God! I am so sorry, but... (she puts her hand on Ross's cheek) I mean it's... there's so much history between us, you know...ScenesBenjamin: (puts his hand on Ross's other cheek) I'm sorry too...Scenes(Charlie and Benji both let their hands slide down Ross's face, until their hands meet, and they hold hands.)ScenesBenjamin: I love you!ScenesCharlie: I love you too! (and they start to kiss)ScenesRoss: Okay, that's it. WE ARE SEEING OTHER PEOPLE!ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Joey's bedroom. Joey's asleep with Hugsy, the penguin right next to him.]
rows.Content: (There are scratching and squeaking noises coming from the living room, and Joey wakes up, terrified. He pulls his blanket higher. The doorknob is turning.)ScenesJoey: Gladys?Scenes(The door opens, and there is Gladys, still in her frame though. Joey panics and moves frantically, screaming. Then there is laughing, and the painting is lowered. It was Rachel holding Gladys.)ScenesRachel: Ha ha ha, third time this week. Man, this does not get old.ScenesJoey: You're mean!ScenesRachel: Oh, don't be such a baby!Scenes(She closes his door again, and turns around. Then she starts screaming, terrified. There is Glynnis... And Monica holding her up, laughing.)ScenesendScenes ScenesFriends Scenes1007 - The One With The Home StudyScenesWritten by: Mark KunerthScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: (Joey and Ross enter. Phoebe and Mike are sitting on the couch, reading a magazine.)ScenesRoss: Hey you guys!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, what are you doing?ScenesMike: Oh, figuring out our wedding plans.ScenesChandler: That's funny, we were doing the same thing!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: It's really crazy! The hall, the dress, the food... I-I had no idea how expensive this stuff was!ScenesChandler: Yeah it is really pricey. I mean, I freaked when I first heard the numbers.ScenesPhoebe: So what did you two do about it?ScenesChandler: It was pretty simple actually, I came up with a couple of cost-cutting solutions, wrote out a list and Monica told me to go to hell.ScenesRoss: There's no way around it Pheebs, you just gonna have to accept the fact that this is gonna cost you a lot of money.ScenesMike: I heard that weddings are like a 40 billion dollar a year industry.ScenesRoss: Yeah, and I'm responsible for just like half of that.ScenesPhoebe: But really, it does seem like this money could be put to better use?ScenesMike: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Now, how would you feel if we gave all the wedding money to charity and we just got married at City Hall?ScenesMike: I think it would make me wanna marry you even more. (he kisses her)ScenesRoss: I've got to say you guys, that's an incredible gesture!ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Maybe you do that next time you get married!ScenesRoss: No, no, no. The next time it's gonna be a Hawaii at sunset. [pause] But maybe the time after that!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment]
rows.Content: (Monica is cleaning the table, Chandler is sitting on the sofa. Joey enters.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: What's going on?ScenesChandler: Our adoption social worker is coming by today so we are cleaning the apartment.ScenesMonica: (sarcastically) We?ScenesChandler: You know you don't want me to help. You can't have it both ways!ScenesJoey: Hey, is this person who decides whether or not you... get a baby?ScenesChandler: Kind of. She's coming by to interview us and see where we live.ScenesMonica: And it has to go perfectly, because if she doesn't like something about us she can keep us off every adoption list in the state.ScenesJoey: Hey, maybe I should stop by! She could be a soap opera fan! It's very impressive when the little people know a celebrity.ScenesChandler: (pointing at himself) Little people?ScenesJoey: (pointing at himself) Celebrity.ScenesMonica: Ok, so I think I'm just about done here, unless you have any bad stuff hidden somewhere, like... porn or cigarettes?ScenesChandler: What...? NO!ScenesMonica: Chandler?ScenesChandler: (he stands up and he feels very offended) I don't, and I'm offended by the insinuation!ScenesMonica: Ok, so there's not a magazine under the couch, or a pack of cigarettes taped to the back of the toilet tank, or a filthy video in the VCR?ScenesChandler: I'll admit to the cigarettes and the magazine, but that tape is not mine.ScenesMonica: It isn't mine!ScenesJoey: (going out with the VCR in his hand) Well, I guess we'll never know whose it is!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The New York City Children's fund hallway.]
rows.Content: Charity guy: May I help you?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. We're here to make a rather sizeable donation to the children.ScenesCharity guy: Well, any contribution, large or small, is always appreciated.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think you're gonna appreciate it the crap out of this one (she gives him a check)ScenesCharity guy: Well, this is very generous!ScenesPhoebe: And we don't want any recognition. This is completely anonymous.ScenesMike: Completely anonymous. From two kind strangers.ScenesPhoebe: Mr. X and Phoebe Buffay.ScenesCharity guy: Well if you like, we can include your names in our newsletter.ScenesMike: Not necessary.ScenesPhoebe: Buffay is spelled B-U-F-F-A-Y.ScenesMike: And "X" is spelled uhm... "Mike Hannigan".ScenesCharity guy: Right. Well, on behalf of the children: thank you both very much.ScenesPhoebe: Sure, I so glad we did this. It feels so good!ScenesMike: It does. It feels really good!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, look! And we get these free t-shirts! (she takes a t-shirt which was on the counter)ScenesCharity guy: Oh, actually, that's the shirt I wore to the gym.ScenesPhoebe: Mhm... it's moist.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment.]
rows.Content: Ross: (he enters) Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! Emma will be up in a minute!ScenesRoss: Oh, good!ScenesRachel: Oh hey Ross... Listen, I heard about you and Charlie. I'm really sorry.ScenesRoss: Oh, that's OK. I'm sure there are tons of other beautiful paleontologists out there.ScenesRachel: Absolutely.ScenesRoss: There was one! She's it! All the rest look like they should live under a bridge!ScenesRachel: So, uhm... what are you gonna do today?ScenesRoss: Well, I was thinking of taking Emma to the playground!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, what!?ScenesRoss: Like I said I was thinking of taking Emma to the museum of knives and fire!ScenesRachel: Ok, look, Ross. I do not want Emma going to the playground.ScenesRoss: Be-caaauuuse...ScenesRachel: (upset) All right, well, if you must know... I had a traumatic... swing incident... when I was little.ScenesRoss: Seriously?ScenesRachel: Yes, I was 4 years old and I was on the swing and then all of a sudden my hair got tangled in the chain. And to get me out my mom had to-had to cut a big chunk of my hair! (crying) And it was uneven for weeks!ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) And you made it through that? I wonder who's gonna play you in the movie!ScenesRachel: Ok, fine! You can make fun of me. I do not want Emma going there. And I was thinking Claire Danes.ScenesRoss: Look, I'm sorry to hear about your tragedy, ok? But the swings are perfectly safe, and besides Emma loves them. You know what, you should come with us and you'll see!ScenesRachel: Ross, those things go like 40 miles an hour! Ok? When you're... and there is that moment when you are at the top, when you just don't know if you're gonna return back to earth!ScenesRoss: Space is filled with orbiting children. (pause) Look, please, just come on, you know, when you’ll see the look on Emma’s face, I swear you won’t regret it.ScenesRachel: All right!ScenesRoss: Good, you don’t want to be one of those mothers who pass on their irrational fears on their children, do you?ScenesRachel: Irrational, huh? All right, well, I’ll remember that the next time you freak out about a spider in your apartment!ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, that’s the same, I am sure there are thirty different species of poisonous swings!

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Somebody knocks the door]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh my God, the adoption lady is early!ScenesChandler: Ok, ok, here we go.ScenesMonica: Ok.ScenesChandler: Here we go. Stand up straight. (smiling) Big smile. (opens the door and both are smiling exaggeratedly)ScenesPhoebe: Hello, is this the creepy residence?ScenesMonica: We’re waiting for the adoption lady, but, hey, I’m glad you’re here. I was cleaning this morning and I found this (she puts a box on the table and opens it). I don’t know if you wanna use it, but…ScenesPhoebe: Awe, this is so sweet of you! But you know what? I won’t be needing a veil, I actually won’t be wearing a dress at all!ScenesMonica: I told you! I am not coming to a naked wedding!ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, we’re not having a big reception, we took the money we were gonna spend on a wedding and we donate them to the children charity.ScenesMonica: That’s crazy! (Phoebe looks bewildered). I am sorry. I just can’t imagine giving up my one wedding day like that!ScenesPhoebe: We, you know, we’re different! We don’t care about having a huge party. (She picks up the veil) This is really nice for you, but, oh, please, I put this on? (she puts it on) And, ow, I look (she looks her reflex image on a toaster), why, well, radiant. (pause) All right, well, who cares, I don’t need a pretty veil and a fancy dress.ScenesMonica: That’s right. You’re making a commitment and that’s the same, whether you do that at the Plaza or, where are you gonna do it?ScenesPhoebe: City Hall.ScenesMonica: Ow! (Chandler slaps her on her back) Oh, that sounds nice! I am just there for jury duty. They really spruce that place up!ScenesPhoebe: It’s ok, it’s ok. I made my decision.
