What I really want is a great big wedding (she covers her mouth)ScenesMonica: Yay!ScenesChandler: But you already gave all your money to charity!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I’ll just ask for it back!ScenesChandler: I don’t think you can do that!ScenesMonica: Why not! This is her wedding day, this is way more important than some stupid kids!ScenesChandler: That’s sweet, honey, but save something for the adoption Lady.

rows.Scenes: The playground. Ross put Emma on the swing and they’re ready to play]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ok, careful.ScenesRoss: Ok.ScenesRachel: Careful, watch her hair. WATCH HER HAIR!ScenesRoss: Rach, she’s got like three hairs!ScenesRachel: I know (she touches Emma’s head) but they’re just so beautiful! Oh, my God, I just pulled one out.ScenesRoss: I promise you she’s safe! No watch how much she loves this.ScenesRachel: Ok.ScenesRoss (to Emma): Ready sweety?ScenesRachel: Ok.ScenesRoss: Here we go! (He starts pushing Emma)ScenesRachel: Ok, careful, ok. (Emma giggles) Oh, she’s smiling! Oh my God, she does like it!ScenesRoss: See, I told you!ScenesRachel: Awe! (Emma laughs) Oh my God! Looks, she’s a little dare-devil! Oh, let me push, can I push?ScenesRoss: Oh, absolutely!ScenesRachel: Ok. Oh God. (To Ross) Get the camera, it’s in the diaper bag.ScenesRoss: Ok! (he takes the camera and walks backwards to take a shot) See? Scared of swings, I bet you feel pretty silly (a swinging boy knocks him down) Ow!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The New York City Children's fund ]
rows.Content: Mike: We’re seriously asking for our money back?ScenesPhoebe: It’s for our wedding day! Right, now, is this guy gay or straight, because one of us gonna have to start flirting.ScenesCharity guy: Wow! Are you here to make another donation the same day? I don’t think that that’s ever happened before.ScenesPhoebe (to Mike): Gay, go.ScenesMike (to the charity guy): Oh my God, I love your shirt!ScenesPhoebe: The donation we made earlier, we k…, we w…, we want it back.ScenesCharity guy: Excuse me?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. See, that money was for a big wedding, that we thought we didn’t want, but it turns out we do.ScenesCharity guy: So you’re asking us to refund your donation to the children?ScenesMike: Yeah! This feels really good.ScenesPhoebe: I am sorry. I am, but this wedding is just really important to me.ScenesCharity guy: Hey, it’s not my business, (he takes their check from a drawer) besides it’s probably a good thing. We really would have been spoiling the children, all those food, and warm clothing…ScenesPhoebe: Hey, that’s not fair! A person’s wedding is important! And especially to me! Ok? I didn’t have a graduation party! And I didn’t go to Prom. And I spent my sweet sixteen being chased round a tire yard by an escaped mental patient who is his own words wanted to “kill me” or whatever. So I deserve a real celebration and I am not gonna let some sweaty little man make me feel badly about it.( She storms out)ScenesMike: She could have been talking about either one of us.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Somebody knocks the door]
rows.Content: Laura: Hi, I am Laura, I am here for your adoption interview.ScenesMonica: Hi, I am Monica and this is Chandler. Please come in.ScenesLaura: Thank you!ScenesMonica: Would you like something to drink?ScenesLaura: Oh, water would be fine.ScenesMonica: Ok. Great. I am so glad that you are here. We’re really excited about getting this process started.ScenesChandler: Oh, because we love kids. Love ‘em to death.Well, not actually to death, that's just a figure of speech - we love kids the appropriate amount... as allowed by law.ScenesLaura: Your place is just lovely.ScenesMonica: Ah, thank you. This building does have a wholesome family feel to it.ScenesLaura: You know, I... I feel like I've been here before. Are any other couples in the Scenesbuilding adopting?ScenesMonica: Is that that couple on the first floor? Because we should get a baby before Scenesthem. Yeah! That guy tried to sell me drugs. (Laura looks shocked)ScenesChandler: But other than that... wholesome, wholesome building.ScenesLaura: Oh...ScenesChandler: What?ScenesLaura: I just realized why I remember this place.ScenesMonica: Really? What is it?ScenesLaura: Oh, it's nothing. I went on a date with a guy who lived in this building and it Scenesdidn't end very well.ScenesMonica: Ohh... that wouldn't by any chance be... Joey Tribbiani?ScenesLaura: Yes!ScenesChandler: Of course it was!ScenesLaura: Yeah, we had a really great night and in the morning he promised he would call Scenesme and he didn't.ScenesChandler: RAT BASTARD!ScenesLaura: So you're not friends with him?ScenesMonica and Chandler: OH GOD NO! Nope, no, no, no. No! No, no. Nope! No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. NO! (finally Monica concludes) No!ScenesLaura: Well, I'm sorry I brought it up. So, are either one of you planning on staying at Sceneshome with your child... (someone knocks on the door)ScenesJoey: (form the other side of the door) Hellooo? Anybody in there order a celebrity? Scenes(He starts to enter the apartment and Chandler runs to the door and shuts it back in Sceneshis face) OW!ScenesLaura: What was that?ScenesChandler: Oh, it's just some crazy guy who roams the halls here. He's great with Sceneskids though.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel are at the playground with Emma. Rachel in putting her back in the stroller and Ross is tending to his wound]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, oh Ross, oh my God, are you okay?ScenesRoss: SON OF A BITCH! (turns to his right to see three kids staring at him) (To the Sceneskids) Oh relax! I didn't say the 'F' word! (They go away)ScenesRachel: Ross, see! I told you, those swings are evil! Alright, that is it. That is Scenesthe last time Emma is getting on one of those things for her entire life.ScenesRoss: No! No, no, no, no, okay, it wasn't the swing's fault. It was my fault and kind Scenesof that (point to the kid that kicked him) kids fault. Who is still laughing. Nice.ScenesRachel: Ross, c'mon, please. Can we just get out of here, before somebody else gets Sceneshurt?ScenesRoss: No wait, okay, okay, I have an idea. I want you to get on the swing, okay? And Scenesyou'll see that there's nothing to be afraid of.ScenesRachel: (looks at him suspiciously) I know what this is all about... You've always been Scenesjealous of my hair.ScenesRoss: Look, I just think you're an adult, okay? And you should get over your silly Scenesfears.ScenesRachel: Alright fine. I'll do it.ScenesRoss: Good.ScenesRachel: If you hold a spider.ScenesRoss: (He freaks out and starts jumping around brushing his sweater) WHAT? WHERE? WHERE?ScenesRachel: IF you hold a spider.ScenesRoss: I know. (Rachel bends down to Emma and Ross looks over his shoulder again, Scenesafraid)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Chandler is still leaning against the door, keeping Joey out, who is still banging and shouting on the other side.]
rows.Content: Joey: Guys? Everything ok? It's me, Joe...ScenesChandler: (Screams to interrupt Joey) AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA......AAAaaa-doption!!ScenesLaura: What's going on?ScenesChandler: Oh, just like I said. That crazy... Bert... roaming the halls. (Joey bangs on Scenesthe door again)ScenesJoey: Guys!?ScenesMonica: Keep on roaming Bert! We don't want any crazy today!ScenesJoey: What's going on?ScenesChandler: WE'LL TALK TO YOU LATER, BERT. EVERYTHNG'S FINE!!Scenes(cut to Joey on the other side, who finally leaves the door and goes to his apartment)ScenesJoey: Everything doesn't sound fine!ScenesLaura: Is he alright out there by himself?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! He has a caretaker. His older brother... Ernie.ScenesLaura: Bert and Ernie!ScenesChandler: (nervous smile) You can't make this stuff up!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe and Mike enter]
rows.Content: Mike: You never told me about that guy on your sweet sixteen. Oh, ugh. I'm sorry about Scenesthat.ScenesPhoebe: (Lightly) Oh! It ended okay. One of my friends shot him.ScenesMike: Well, hey, at least you're getting a proper wedding. I mean, you really deserve that.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I really do. You know, I had nothing growing up. (thinks for a few Scenesseconds) Just like the kids I took the money from.ScenesMike: No! No, no. I see where this is going. Don't make me go back there.ScenesPhoebe: Look, I can't have a wedding with this money now. It's tainted.ScenesMike: Alright, fine. We'll give the money back.ScenesPhoebe: And if that guy at the charity gives us a hard time, my friend hasn't shot Scenesanyone in a really long time.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's. They are preparing to show Laura around. Laura is standing with her back to the window, Chandler and Monica are standing on either side of her, facing each other.
rows.Content: Laura: Well, I must say, this seems like a lovely environment to raise a child in.ScenesMonica: Oh, by the way, you are more than welcome to look under any of the furniture, Scenesbecause, believe me, you won't find any porn or cigarettes under there!ScenesLaura: Oh! Well, actually, before we look around, let me make sure I have everything I need Scenesup to here...Scenes(She starts checking her form. Chandler sees movement near the window from Scenesthe corner of his eye and when he looks he spots Joey climbing up the fire escape and Scenesonto their balcony. He warns Monica silently.)ScenesMonica: (Pulls Laura into the spare room) Why don't I show you the baby's room?Scenes(Joey enters through the side window and jogs towards the kitchen holding a baseball bat)ScenesChandler: What the hell are you doing?ScenesJoey: Well, you wouldn't let me in, so I thought you were in trouble.ScenesChandler: Well, we're not.ScenesJoey: But you called me 'Bert'!? That's our code word for danger!ScenesChandler: We don't have a code word.ScenesJoey: We don't? We really should. From now on, 'Bert' will be our code word for danger.Scenes(Monica talks loudly in the baby's room)ScenesMonica: So that was the baby's room. (They come out and Chandler throws Joey behind Scenesthe couch and puts his foot on him. Monica looks at Chandler)ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) What room should we see next?ScenesChandler: Any room that isn't behind this couch! (laughs nervously)ScenesMonica: (laughs nervously as well, Laura looks confused) (To Laura) Some people don't Scenesget him, but I think he's really funny! (She takes Laura to their own bedroom).Scenes(Joey gets up and look annoyed)ScenesJoey: (quivering with anger) I did not care for that!ScenesChandler: (escorting Joey to the door) You have to get out of here. You slept with Scenesour social worker and you never called her back and she is still pissed, so she can't Scenessee you.ScenesJoey: Ok, ok! (He leaves)ScenesChandler: Ok!Scenes(Joey leaves and closes the door behind him. Chandler walks towards the living room, but then Joey enters again.)ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: I forgot my bat.Scenes(He picks up his bat and holds it up, but then Monica and Laura enter the living room again. When Laura sees Joey, she freezes...)ScenesLaura: Oh my God!ScenesChandler: And for the last time, we do not want to be friends with you! And we don't want to buy your bat! (Joey lowers his bat)ScenesLaura: What are you doing here?ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Bert! Bert! Bert! Bert!ScenesLaura: Are you friends with him?ScenesChandler: I can explain... Joey...ScenesJoey: Uhm... ok... uhm... Well, yeah... You have got some nerve, coming back here. I can't believe you never called me.ScenesLaura: Excuse me?ScenesJoey: Oh... yeah... Probably you don't even remember my name. It's Joey, by the way. And don't bother telling me yours, because I totally remember it... lady. Yeah! I waited weeks for you to call me.ScenesLaura: I gave you my number, you never called me.ScenesJoey: No, no! Don't try to turn this around on me, ok? I'm not some kind of... social work, ok, that you can just... do.ScenesLaura: (embarrassed towards Chandler and Monica) Well, I'm pretty sure I gave you my number.ScenesJoey: Really? Think about it. Come on! You're a beautiful woman, smart, funny, we had a really good time, huh? If I had your number, why wouldn't I call you?ScenesLaura: I don't know... Well, maybe I'm wrong... I'm sorry...ScenesJoey: No, no, hey, no! Too late for apologies... ok? You broke my heart. You know how many women I had to sleep with to get over you? (and he leaves the apartment, leaving her shocked)ScenesLaura: Joey, wait!ScenesJoey: (acting sad) NO! I waited a long time, I can't wait anymore... (and closes the door behind him)ScenesLaura: (laughing nervously) I'm sorry that you had to see that. I'm so embarrassed...ScenesChandler: Oh, that's really ok.ScenesMonica: Yeah, that we totally understand. Dating is hard.ScenesLaura: Boy, you people are nice... And I've got to say... I think you're going to make excellent parents.Scenes(Chandler and Monica hug each other, and then Joey enters the apartment again.)ScenesJoey: LAURA! (and points to her, very confident)Scenes

rows.Scenes: The New York City Children's Fund building. Phoebe and Mike are entering.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the Charity guy) We're back!ScenesCharity guy: Are you here to take more money? Because, I think what you're looking for is an ATM.ScenesMike: No, no, we're here to give the money back.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, because you know what, it's... it's all about the children.Scenes(the Charity guy smiles wanting to take the check, but Phoebe pulls it back again. His smile fades.)ScenesPhoebe: Although... it's also about the wedding... Ugh, alright... here. (she gives the check and pulls it back again) No... Oh God... Oh!ScenesCharity guy: If I haven't said so already sir, (sarcastically pointing to Phoebe) congratulations!ScenesMike: (takes the check from Phoebe) Ok, look! Enough! Alright? I'm stepping in. I'm putting my foot down! As your future husband I'm going to make this decision for us. (thinking) Now... what do you think we should do?ScenesCharity guy: You know what? It's not your decision anymore.ScenesMike: What?ScenesCharity guy: On behalf of the Children of New York, I reject your money.ScenesPhoebe: But... but... but we're giving you this!ScenesCharity guy: Yeah... And I'm giving it back to you... Come on! Consider it a contribution. (gives the check to Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: (looks at the amount on the check, and gasps) Well, this is very generous!ScenesCharity guy: Please, take the check, go have a great wedding and a wonderful life together.ScenesMike: Well, I mean... It sounds good to me. And that way we can save up, come back in a few years and make an even bigger donation.ScenesCharity guy: Absolutely! And when you do, make sure you ask for Brian.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, is that you?ScenesCharity guy: No!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. They are sitting in their living room when the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hello...? Oh hi... Oh my God...! Really...? I can't wait to tell Chandler... Ok, goodbye. (hangs up)ScenesChandler: Wrong number?ScenesMonica: It was Laura... She gave us a great report and we are officially on the waiting list.ScenesChandler: That's great!ScenesMonica: Now we just have to wait for a call and... and someone tells us there's a baby waiting for us. Oh...Scenes(Chandler and Monica hug and after a while the telephone rings again... Monica's eyes get bigger. Chandler answers.)ScenesChandler: Hello...? Have you seen Joey's bat?ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: The playground. Ross, Rachel and Emma are still there. Rachel comes walking to Ross and Emma with something between her hands.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ok... I got a spider. There were two, I picked the bigger one.ScenesRoss: (nervously) Ok...ScenesRachel: Ok... (and passes the spider to Ross who holds it in between his hands)ScenesRoss: (Gasps and speaks at a higher pitch) This feels perfectly normal. Ok, get on the swing!ScenesRachel: (reluctantly) Ok... O-k...Scenes(She slowly grabs the chains of the swing, swings her hair back, and sits down.)ScenesRachel: (more confident) Ok...Scenes(She slowly walks forward and backward, to gain speed...)ScenesRachel: whoo... ok... wow... ok... OH!ScenesRoss: See?ScenesRachel: A-alright! I can do this.ScenesRoss: There you go! Good for you! And you know what, I'm actually getting used to this little guy. I don't really even feel him in here anymore.ScenesRachel: That's because he's on your neck.ScenesRoss: Well... (realizes, screaming like a little girl, trying to get rid of the spider) Whaa... aaah... aaahhh...Scenes(Ross is now preoccupied with the spider, and forgets that Rachel is still using the swing. While trying to get rid of the spider, he stands in front of Rachel, who bumps into him, throwing him on the ground again.)ScenesRachel: ROSS!Scenes(Rachel tries to stop mid-swing, and the swing starts to turn from side to side)ScenesendScenesFriends Scenes1008 - The One With The Late ThanksgivingScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy Knoller ScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Monica and Chandler enter, the others are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: We need to talk to you about something.ScenesChandler: Yeah. We don't feel like we can host Thanksgiving this year.ScenesAll: What?ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Are you kidding?ScenesChandler: Well, it's just with uhm, work and the stress of adoption, we just don't feel like we have the energy. Plus, we don't think it's fair that every year the burden falls on us.ScenesRoss: (skeptical) That doesn't sound like you... That's Monica talking!ScenesChandler: No, no! We made this decision together.ScenesRoss: She's putting words in your mouth!ScenesJoey: Don't you put words in people's mouths, you put turkey in people's mouths!ScenesRachel: I can't believe this! This is Emma's first Thanksgiving!ScenesMonica: No, it's not!ScenesRachel: It's not? (whispering to Ross) When was she born?ScenesPhoebe: Well, personally I think it's great you're giving yourself a break.ScenesMonica: Thank you, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Sure. It's just as well... I mean, last year wasn't very good. I think she's losing her touch.ScenesMonica: What? You are way off, lady!ScenesPhoebe: Am I? Really? Am I? Well, why don't you cook Thanksgiving dinner and prove me wrong! Well, think about it, think about it, you'll be trying to top than you did last year. You'd be in competition... with yourself.ScenesMonica: That's my favourite kind! Okay, we are doing this!ScenesChandler: Don't let yourself get manipulated this way!ScenesMonica: Hey, stay out of this, Chandler! This is between me... and ME!ScenesChandler: We are supposed to make these decisions together! Did you not watch the Doctor Phil I taped for you?ScenesOPENING CREDITSScenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Rachel and Monica are in there, and Phoebe enters]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi! Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, happy needless-turkey-murder day.ScenesMonica: You guys, I ordered some chocolate pies from that bakery on Bleecker. Could you pick them up for me?ScenesPhoebe: You're not making the pies yourself?ScenesMonica: No, no, no, I don't make chocolate pies. When I was younger I-I enter in this pie-eating contest. I ate so many that just the thought of them made me sick.ScenesRachel: Did you at least win the contest?ScenesMonica: 2 minutes, 12 pies and a part of one tin! Okay, I see you guys at 4.ScenesRachel: Can't wait!ScenesMonica: This dinner is gonna be so great! In your face, last year "me"!Scenes(Monica leaves)ScenesPhoebe: Hey Rach.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: What's Emma doing today?ScenesRachel: Well, let's see... uh... I know that she has a meeting with her lawyer and then she has to make a very big poop. Why?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I wanna enter her in a baby beauty pageant.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! That's the creepiest thing I've ever heard!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but, well, before you say no, my friend Susanne is entering her kid and compared to Emma she's a real dog!ScenesRachel: Oh! Phoebe, all babies are beautiful!ScenesPhoebe: (sarcastic) Oh... okay.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, just the idea of pitting one baby against another, I mean, you know, and judging who's cuter just for a trophy...ScenesRachel: And a thousand dollars.ScenesRachel: ...is something I'm very interested in! Oh please, do not tell Ross. He still believes that (in a deep voice, mocking Ross) what's in the inside is important...ScenesPhoebe: Okay, oh, and Emma needs a cowgirl outfit for the competition.ScenesRachel: Where am I gonna get a cowgirl outfit on Thanksgiving?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I was thinking...ScenesRachel: Oh, take the clothes of Joey's Cabbage Patch Kid.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Chandler is watching TV and Monica is cooking]
rows.Content: Monica: (Chandler's laughing) Did someone drop the baton again?ScenesChandler: Why come all the way from Kansas to do that?ScenesMonica: (she tastes what she has cooked) I don't get older. I just get better!ScenesChandler: You know what just occurred to me? This could be our last Thanksgiving just the two of us. I mean, we could be getting a baby soon!ScenesMonica: You don't know that.ScenesChandler: Somebody is gonna pick us.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but we haven't heard a thing from the adoption agency and it has been weeks!ScenesChandler: I'm telling ya! It's gonna happen. Next year it's gonna be you, me and the little Hemingway Bing. (pause) What, he's my favourite author!ScenesMonica: Name one of his books.ScenesChandler: (after a long pause) "The Firm"?ScenesMonica: Ok, let's see... uhm, okay, the turkey is in the oven, the stuffing is ready...ScenesChandler: You know, you always cook this meal all by yourself. Let me help this year.ScenesMonica: Oh, Chandler, that's sweet. But you don't have to do everything Doctor Phil tells you to do.ScenesChandler: I'm serious, let me do something, just not the turkey or the stuffing, nothing "high profile".ScenesMonica: Ok, let's see... Oh, the cranberry sauce, it is easy to make and no-one really cares about it.ScenesChandler: Tell me more.ScenesMonica: Okay, I'm gonna go check on something across the hall. You start by washing these (she gives Chandler a bowl with cranberries. Then, while she's going outside, she sees him with a bottle of soap in his hands) Not with soap!! (she leaves)ScenesChandler: You obviously haven't tasted my Palmolive potatoes!Scenes(Ross and Joey enter)ScenesRoss: Hey! Hey, guess what Joey has!ScenesJoey: Three tickets to today's Rangers game!!ScenesRoss: Dude, I wanted him to guess.ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: Yeah, they're great seats too!ScenesRoss: Guess where they are?ScenesJoey: Center ice.ScenesRoss: Did I do something to you?ScenesChandler: Hmm, the game's at one.ScenesRoss: So?ScenesChandler: Dinner is at four, we'll never gonna make it back.ScenesJoey: So we'll leave before it's over, we'll be back in time.ScenesChandler: You say that now, but it could take us a long time to get back home. Plus Joey could get lost and and they could have to page us to go pick him up.ScenesJoey: Dude, two times that happened!ScenesChandler: Look, Monica has been working hard all day, she didn't wanna host this thing in the first place, we shouldn't go!ScenesRoss: He's right, man.ScenesJoey: Right, I guess. Alright, so see you at four.ScenesChandler: Okay. (pause) And get ready to taste my very special cranberries. Or should I say... chanberries!ScenesJoey: That's some gentle comedy, dude. (he and Ross leave)ScenesRoss: We're still going at the game, right?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Yeah.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Baby beauty contest]
rows.Content: Host: This is contestant number sixteen, Rebecca...ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesRachel: Oh Phoebe, listen. Well, I think we gotta go. This place is really freaking me out. I've been watching this guy over there, I don't think he came with a kid!ScenesPhoebe: We can't leave now! There was this one baby, Haley, who was favourite to win and she got croup, so she had to stay home! This competition just blew wide open, folks!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, I think... It's just too weird, I just saw a one year old running around with pantyhose on!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I know, we should have been more prepared. (she looks around) It's okay. Now, the way I see it, our real competition now is Cameron. Oh my God, they just took her sweater off. Look at those arms! Hello Michelin Man.ScenesRachel: Oh, Phoebe! Come on! You know what, it's already three o'clock and they haven't even gotten to Emma's group yet. We gotta go, we got dinner!ScenesPhoebe: (panicking) But Emma's got what it takes, she could go all the way!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, you have to calm down.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Rachel, the hottest babies in the Tri-State Area are in this room right now! I overheard one of the judges say that not one of them holds a candle to Emma!ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: You heard them say that?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: All right, okay. Alright, let's give to these babies something to cry about!ScenesPhoebe: Good! Oh yay! Let's get down to business! Emma needs some makeup!ScenesRachel: No, what?ScenesPhoebe: Well, she's gonna look all washed out next to the other contestants!ScenesRachel: No Phoebe, I am not letting you put makeup on my baby!ScenesPhoebe: Why not!ScenesRachel: Because I already did!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Madison Square Garden]
rows.Content: (there's a lot of shouting and yelling)ScenesJoey: Oh, Bob, get off the guy!ScenesRoss: Oh! What a game, huh?ScenesJoey: I know, yeah.ScenesRoss: I can't believe Chandler is missing this!ScenesJoey: Yeah. I am sorry he's not here too, but I got to say, (takes some nachos from a plate on the seat where Chandler should have been) I am really enjoying Nacho Chair.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I'd probably enjoy it more if you didn't keep batting my hand away.ScenesJoey: Ohhhh! These seats are great!ScenesRoss: I know, I know! When I was here for Holidays on Ice (Joey looks around worried hoping no one heard that) I was sitting so far away Michelle Kwan couldn't read my banner!ScenesJoey: (looks at the time) Wow, hey, we'd better get going. If we don't leave right now, we'll be late for dinner.ScenesRoss: Oh, but it's a kind game! So we're a little late, you know, the girls will be there, let's stay just for one more goal.ScenesJoey: I don't know...ScenesRoss: One more fight!ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment.]
rows.Content: Monica: Where is everybody? They're forty-five minutes late!ScenesChandler: I can't believe they are not here! I slave and I slave for what? They've ruined cranberry day!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The corridor. Ross and Joey have just arrived.]
rows.Content: Joey: How late are we?ScenesRoss: Forty-five minutes.ScenesJoey: Wow (He opens his apartment door and throws their stuff in.)ScenesRoss: (handing him his coat) Here!ScenesJoey: Okay. Rachel and Phoebe are already there, okay? So they probably started without us. We could just slip in and no-one needs to know where we were! (he raises his hands and on his right one there's a Rangers foam finger)ScenesRoss: You may want to lose the foam finger!ScenesJoey: Oh, no, no, no, no, no. You just want to put it on your hand!Scenes(Rachel, Phoebe and Emma arrive)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesJoey: You are not at Thanksgiving?ScenesRachel: No...ScenesPhoebe: No, we're late!ScenesRachel: What are you doing here!ScenesRoss: We're late too! (Rachel screams)ScenesJoey: We figured we could be late because you guys were gonna be on time (he points the foam finger at the girls)ScenesPhoebe: Don't point that thing at me, Tribbiani!ScenesRoss: So, nobody's here? Monica's gonna kill us!ScenesJoey: Yeah, where were you!ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah, what's with the trophy!ScenesPhoebe: Uh, we were at the Spelling Bee!ScenesRachel: And I won!ScenesRoss: You won an adult Thanksgiving day spelling bee.ScenesRachel: Yes! (spells it) Y-E-S. Yes!ScenesRoss: Let me see this... (he takes the trophy from Rachel's hands) Grand Supreme Little Darling, New York Division.ScenesRachel: Yeah. That's me!ScenesRoss: You entered Emma into a Beauty Pageant?ScenesPhoebe: And it looks like she put makeup on her!ScenesJoey: Wait a second, wait a second, where have I seen that cowgirl outfit before...ScenesRoss: I can't believe this, she's our daughter! That you would treat her like some kind of showdog is inexcusable!ScenesRachel: She won a thousand dollars!ScenesRoss: So this is an annual thing?ScenesJoey: (realizing) Oh! That's Alicia Mae Emory's outfit!ScenesPhoebe: You guys, there are people in there who are not getting any happier!ScenesRoss: Yeah. What are we gonna do?ScenesRachel: Well, I don't know, you guys figure it out, I got to put Emma down for a nap.ScenesJoey: All right. Hey Rach, while you're in there, throw something on Alicia Mae.ScenesPhoebe: Alright, what are we gonna say?ScenesRoss: Ooh, we'll say that we were mugged! You can't get mad at someone who's been mugged!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, good, that's good, but you don't look like you were mugged!ScenesJoey: No. Here (he tears off the pocket from Ross' shirt, and tears off everything below that as well.)ScenesRoss: (to Joey) HEY!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment.]
rows.Content: Monica: Do you hear something? (Chandlers stands up and goes to the door to look out from the peephole)ScenesChandler: (peeping) They're out there!ScenesMonica: Ohhh! Let me see! Oh God, I can't believe this! They're an hour late and they're just staying out there, talking!ScenesChandler: (peeping) Everything is so distorted! Looks like Joey has a giant hand! Which says "Rangers" on it. They went to the game!ScenesMonica: (gasps) Oooh! They are in for a world of pain!ScenesChandler: (looking through the peephole again) Ross' shirt is torn.ScenesMonica: Oh! They're late and they're sloppy!Scenes[Cut to the hall]Scenes(Rachel comes out of her apartment}ScenesRachel: Alright, Emma is napping... (then to Ross) what happened to your shirt?ScenesRoss: I got mugged. And they stole my pocket.ScenesPhoebe: We're just... we're trying to figure out an excuse. Hey! Ooh! How about this: We can say that Monica told us 5 o'clock, not 4 o'clock. That way we're right on time! (Others start to agree but she continues) OR... or, we can plant PCP in the apartment and call the cops on her.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) That would be a good way to get rid of all the PCP we have lying around.ScenesRachel: You know what, we just say that she said it was 5 o'clock. We'll just act casual. We're not late, we're right on time. (When she finishes talking, a note is pushed from under Monica's and Chandler's door, into the hall. Ross picks it up and reads it out loud)ScenesRoss: (Reading the note) We know you're out there. (Rachel gasps)ScenesJoey: (whispering) Who do you think its from?Scenes[time lapse – they are still in the hall]ScenesRachel: Oh, God. This is bad. This is so bad.ScenesRoss: Well, let's just go in there and face them.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm not going in first. I bet that vein on Monica's forehead is popping like crazy.ScenesJoey: I hate that thing, it's like a... bolt of lightning.ScenesRachel: Oh, hey, I have an idea. Why don't we play rock-paper-scissors, and whoever loses goes in first. (they all agree) Ready? (they do the rock-paper-scissor thing with they hands and Rachel has paper, Phoebe and Ross both have rock, while Joey is doing a strange upward wiggling with his fingers. They all look a him confused).ScenesJoey: (smiling from ear to ear) Ah-haah! I win!!ScenesRoss: What is that?ScenesJoey: That's fire. Beats everything.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, really? Does it beat water balloon? (She places her hand over his "fire" and mimics a bursting water balloon, thus putting the fire out).ScenesJoey: Ooh! Well played, Phoebe Buffay, well played.ScenesRachel: Alright, enough, enough, come on. Let's just all go in at the same time.ScenesAll: Alright, okay. (Phoebe reaches for the door, and tries to open it but it's locked)ScenesPhoebe: It's locked.ScenesRoss: Wha...? Oh sure, now they lock it, but when they're having sex on the couch, its like: "Come on in, my butt is surprisingly hairy".ScenesRachel: Alright, come on... (starts to knock on the door) Alright, you guys. We're so sorry we're late. Please let us in, so we can have dinner together.Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: No! Everything's cold. The turkey's dried out and the... the stuffing is all soggy.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and there's a bowl of cranberry sauce that... (speaking lower to Monica) what happens to cranberry sauce?ScenesMonica: (Rolling her eyes) Nothing. It's fine.ScenesChandler: (relieved) Oh thank God!Scenes[cut to the hall]ScenesRoss: Come on you guys, we're sorry, alri...? Our subway broke down.ScenesChandler: (looking through the peephole) That's a lie, you went to the game, I can see Joey's hand.ScenesRoss: (to Joey, who is wearing a blue, 3 foot hand) FOR THE LOVE OF GOD TAKE IT OFF!! (takes it off his hand and throws it on the floor)ScenesRachel: You guys, come on, it doesn't matter why we're late. We're all here now, please let us in so we can have some of your delicious turkey. (A slice of turkey on a piece of aluminum foil is slid under door)ScenesJoey: I had a dream once about a fax machine that did that. (Ross picks it up)Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: That's all the turkey you're gonna get.Scenes[cut to the hall]ScenesRoss: How are we gonna decide who gets this?ScenesJoey: (holds his fist up) WATER BALLOON! (he stuffs the slice in is mouth and gives the foil back to Ross)ScenesPhoebe: What are we gonna do? I'm starving.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh, I just remembered. We do have something to eat. Monica put something in our oven this morning.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah!Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: Hey, you touch that and you will be sorry.ScenesChandler: Guys, I'd listen to her. The vein is bigger than I've ever seen it. (Monica looks at Chandler)Scenes[cut to the hall]Scenes(Rachel comes out of the apartment holding a pot. Joey holds in anticipation and Rachel opens it)ScenesRachel: Huh... OH MY GOD IT'S BRUSSELS SPROUTS. (they all look appalled)ScenesRoss: That's worse than no food.Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]Scenes(Monica looks insulted)ScenesChandler: HA-HA! All you got was Monica's stinky Brussels sprouts!ScenesMonica: Stinky?!ScenesChandler: Please let me stay on this side of the door.Scenes[cut to hall]ScenesRachel: Oh, I know... I still have my old key! (She goes in to get it and comes back with her keys) We can just unlock the door.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I don't know if that's such a good idea. They clearly don't want to be with us.ScenesRachel: You know what? I don't want to be with them either, but it's Thanksgiving and we should not want to be together, together. (Goes to unlock the door)ScenesJoey: (to Ross) Just get in there and make a face to face apology, you know? Look them in the eye. I know I can get them to forgive us.ScenesRoss: I don't know...ScenesJoey: I'm telling ya... (his eyes open wide and he looks like his eyes are about to pop out. He stares at Ross like this without blinking) I can do it.ScenesRoss: (Staring back, and then breaks off) (To Phoebe and Rachel) Yeah, he can do it!Scenes(Rachel finally manages to open the door, but the door chain is on.)ScenesRachel: Oh!Scenes(Joey sticks his head through the gap. Monica and Chandler are now sitting at the dinner table. There is another smaller table full of food standing in front of the front door)Scenes(Monica and Chandler do not look amused by Joeys head in the door)ScenesJoey: Oh! It all looks so beautiful: the turkey, the stuffing...Scenes(Monica is now smiling)ScenesChandler: The cranberries...?ScenesMonica: Oh! Enough! A monkey could have made 'em!ScenesJoey: (still with his door wedged in the door gap, now opens his eyes wide and stares at Monica and Chandler as he did with Ross earlier in the hall) Hey listen guys, we feel really terrible.ScenesChandler: He's doing that weird eye contact thing. Don't look at him, don't look at him! (They both look away)ScenesJoey: Come on you guys, we want you to know we're (His eye widen even more) very very sorry. (Monica and Chandler are now covering their eyes with their hands) (then to the others in the hall) Right guys?Scenes(Ross head appears above Joey's, Rachel's below Joey's and Phoebe's at the bottom)ScenesRoss: I feel terrible.ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: So, so sorry.ScenesJoey: (smiling) Now let's not ruin this day. You worked so hard. Let's move past this and try to have a nice meal all together, huh?ScenesChandler: The floating heads do make a good point.ScenesMonica: Yeah, they do seem to feel pretty bad.ScenesRachel: So bad.ScenesRoss : So bad.ScenesPhoebe: So bad.ScenesMonica: (Gets up) Okay, okay. You two (to Phoebe and Rachel) go get the dessert. And I'll let you in.ScenesRachel: Dessert?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I asked you and Phoebe to pick up the pies. You did remember, right?ScenesPhoebe: Pies, oh, we thought you said priiiize (goes to the hall and comes back with Emma's trophy in her hand). Here! (gives it to Monica).Scenes(Monica takes it and reads the label)ScenesMonica: Grand Supreme Little Darling?ScenesRachel: Congratulatioooons!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! YOU FORGOT THE PIES? Well, I cannot believe this. You force me to make dinner, then you're an hour late and you forget the one little thing that I asked you to do.ScenesRoss: Really girls, not cool.ScenesChandler: Well, you manheads aren't any better. You lied about going to the game. You knew it would make you late, and you still went anyway.ScenesJoey: Hey! I'm getting a little tired of this okay? We said we're sorry. It's Thanksgiving for Pete's sakes! A day of forgiveness!ScenesRoss: It's a day to be thankful.ScenesJoey: (to Ross, mouthing) Don't make me come up there!ScenesMonica: It's too late for apologies.ScenesJoey: Fine! Let's just go. I don't need your stupid dinner.ScenesChandler: That would be a lot more convincing if you weren't drooling.ScenesRachel: Ewww, is that what that is?ScenesJoey: Sorry!ScenesPhoebe: Come on you guys, let's just do our own Thanksgiving.ScenesRachel: Yeah! I'll cook!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Let's go out.ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: Yeah! You three have a nice Thanksgiving.ScenesMonica: The three of us?ScenesJoey: Yeah! You, Chan, and the vein!Scenes(Monica gasps and holds her forehead. Phoebe, Rachel and Ross pull back their heads)ScenesJoey: Ha!Scenes(When Joey tries to pull back his head, he notices he is stuck)ScenesJoey: Oh-oh! I'm stuck!ScenesMonica: Joey, that is not gonna work.ScenesJoey: No seriously... I'm really wedged in here.ScenesPhoebe: I'll pull you through.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJoey: (in agony) aaw-ahhh-aaahhh STOP! STOP! I'm worried about damaging my head.ScenesChandler: A little late for that.ScenesJoey: Alright, hurry up, you gotta do something.ScenesMonica: Alright, well, this does not change anything. (to Chandler) Okay, we need to get something to grease the sides of his face.ScenesChandler: Uhm, we've got turkey grease.ScenesMonica: Bring it.ScenesJoey: I just wanna say that I'm sorry I referred to the vein as a seperate person...Scenes(Chandler gives Monica a footlong "eye dropper" with the turkey grease in it)ScenesMonica: Here you go!Scenes(She squirts some of the grease along Joey's face.)ScenesJoey: Oh, that smells good!Scenes(And he starts licking the grease which trickles down his face. Monica also squirts some on the other side of his face, and his tongue follows her movements.)ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay, try it.Scenes(Joey tries to pull back at all his might.)ScenesJoey: It isn't working.ScenesMonica: Alright, we're gonna have to unscrew the chain.ScenesJoey: Well hurry, I can't feel my ears!ScenesChandler: Can you ever feel your ears?ScenesJoey: Interesting...ScenesMonica: Chandler, where are your tools?ScenesChandler: (sarcastically) Oh, I left them on my bulldozer... I don't have tools!ScenesMonica: I do, but Rachel borrowed them.ScenesRachel: I lent them to Ross.ScenesRoss: I gave them to Joey.ScenesJoey: I left them at the park.ScenesMonica: Oh!ScenesRoss: (looking at Joey's butt) I'm finding it really hard not to mess with him.ScenesPhoebe: I've already stuffed a bunch of Brussel sprouts down his pants.ScenesRoss: Nice!Scenes(The phone rings in Chandler and Monica's apartment)ScenesMonica: Okay, I have to get that. Now when I get back, I want you and your friends to be gone. Thanksgiving is over. The Vein has spoken.ScenesJoey: It's really starting to hurt.ScenesChandler: Okay, look, I'm gonna pull on the door and you guys push as hard as you can. Maybe we can get enough room to wiggle him out, okay? Okay, so PUSH!ScenesPhoebe: Just a sec., we're kind in the middle of something here.Scenes(Rachel, Ross and Phoebe have their hands full and are stuffing all kinds of things down Joeys pants.)ScenesJoey: Ooh! Stop putting things down my pants!ScenesChandler: Come on guys, PUSH!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Come on!ScenesJoey and Chandler: PUSH! PUSH! PUSH!Scenes(The chain breaks loose from the wall, and because Joey was pushing with all his might, he propells into the kitchen, towards the table with all the food. This table has wheels underneath it, and when Joey falls on this table, he rides into the living room, with all the food falling off, until finally Joey also falls off... Joey gets up quickly, a bit agitated, and acting as nothing happened. He is covered in food stains.)ScenesChandler: My cranberries!ScenesJoey: (looking at himself) Man, I've got food all over me.Scenes(He licks his fingers, liking it. He offers Chandler a taste.)ScenesChandler: Argh! I can't believe what you did. Monica's gonna kill you!Scenes(Monica enters from the spare bedroom.)ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Look! Look! Look what the... Look what... Look what the floating heads did!ScenesMonica: (very emotional) I don't care.Scenes(Chandler can't believe what he's hearing. He looks at Monica, then at the others, then back at Monica.)ScenesChandler: What's going on?ScenesMonica: That was the adoption agency...ScenesChandler: And?ScenesMonica: WE'RE GETTING A BABY!ScenesChandler: Are you serious? (they hug)ScenesMonica: There's a pregnant woman in Ohio, and she picked us!Scenes(They all cheer and Rachel, Ross and Phoebe join in for a group hug. Joey also joins, but he stands back a bit, because he is all sticky of the food on him)ScenesRachel: I'm so happy for you!ScenesMonica: This Thanksgiving kicks last Thanksgiving's ass!Scenes(They all cheer and hug again, but Joey's eating the food off his shirt)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. The table is set, and there's food on the tables again. They're all there, toasting.]
rows.Content: Rachel: To Monica and Chandler... and that knocked up girl in Ohio.ScenesRoss: I'm just so happy you guys are finally getting a kid.ScenesPhoebe: I know. Have you considered pageanting?ScenesMonica: I can't believe they called, and we're actually getting a baby. (she kisses Chandler)ScenesJoey: Oh, I know how you feel...Scenes(Monica and Chandler are looking curiously at Joey.)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Sure. I went through the exact same thing with Alicia Mae Emory... The waiting, the wandering... Then one day... I get that call from Toys "R" Us... She was in stock!ScenesChandler: That is the exact same thing.ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1009 - The One With The Birth MotherScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everyone's sitting on the couch.Monica and Chandler enter]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: We're just here to say goodbye, we're off to Ohio.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, right! Your adoption interview!ScenesMonica: Yep, we're gonna meet the lady who could be carrying our baby.ScenesJoey: I can't believe it. When you guys come back, you're gonna have a baby! That is so weird!ScenesChandler: And so incorrect!ScenesMonica: She's only a couple of months pregnant. She liked our application but who knows if she's gonna like us.ScenesRoss: Come on, she's gonna love you guys!ScenesChandler: Uhm, thank you, but we're really trying not to get our hopes up.ScenesMonica: And a lot could still get in our way.ScenesChandler: Yeah. I mean, this girl could decide against adoption or she could like another couple better..ScenesPhoebe: What are you gonna name the baby?ScenesChandler: I can develop a condition in which I talk and talk and no one hears a word.ScenesJoey: But just think, ok? What if everything goes right? What if this woman does pick you guys?ScenesMonica: Oh my God. She's gonna pick us!ScenesChandler: So we're standing firm on the 'not getting our hopes up'?ScenesMonica: You know, I know that things could still go wrong but if they don't? If this works out, we're gonna have a baby Chandler, a baby!ScenesChandler: Yes, but...ScenesMonica: Oh my God, it's gonna WORK! We're gonna make it work! I'm gonna be a mummy and (to Chandler) you're gonna be a daddy! All right, I'll see you suckers. I'm gonna get me... A BABY! {she leaves)ScenesChandler: Oh, screw it, I'm gonna be a daddy!!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe's speaking to a girl.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (to Joey) Hey, who's Phoebe with?ScenesJoey: I'm gonna say someone I'm gonna have sex with. (the girl leaves and Phoebe goes toward the couch) (to Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: So... who's your friend?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, that's Sarah. No, no. Don't you get any ideas, ok? No, I'm not setting you up with any more of my friends!ScenesJoey: OW, why, why, why?ScenesPhoebe: Because you'll date her once, sleep with her and then forget she exists!ScenesJoey: Oh, name one friend of yours that I did that with.ScenesPhoebe: Mandy.ScenesJoey: Mandy, uh? Uh... really hot blonde, big boobs?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesJoey: I know why I don't remember her, huh? (he winks at Rachel)ScenesRachel: Do you think I'm someone else?ScenesJoey: Ok, I may not have treated your friends well in the past, but I have grown up a lot, really. Honest, Rach?ScenesRachel: Well, believe it or not, it's true. When Joey and I were together, he was wonderful. He was thoughtful and mature. And for the one week that we went out, he didn't sleep with anybody else!ScenesJoey: (pointing at himself) Growth!ScenesPhoebe: Fine, I'll give you her number.ScenesJoey: Ok, thank you. And I promise you I will not forget this one. (he starts writing on his hand) Mandy.ScenesPhoebe: SARAH!ScenesJoey: Saraaah.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey you guys, I need some fashion advice.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesRoss: (he takes a baby blue beret out of a shopping box and puts it on) How does this look?ScenesRachel: Well, it's a little low... pick up a little... (Ross picks it up) a little bit more... (he picks it up again) a little bit more... (he takes it off) There you go! (pause) Now throw it away!ScenesRoss: C'mon! This looks good!ScenesRachel: Ross, please, trust me. I buy 30 fashion magazines a month. Now, I don't know who's running for president or who that... NATO guy is, but I do know that you have to get as far away as you can from that hat.ScenesRoss: Damnit! I have this date tomorrow night and I have to look cool!ScenesPhoebe: Well, you know, if you want fashion help, Rachel and I are going shopping tomorrow. You're more than welcome to come with us, right?ScenesRoss: Really? That would be great. I mean, I have to do something, she kinda teased me about how I dress.ScenesJoey: I can see why, nice shirt!ScenesRoss: You're wearing the same shirt.ScenesJoey: Stupid Gap on every corner!

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are entering with a man.]
rows.Content: Agency guy: Please, make yourself comfortable and I will back in a moment with Erica.ScenesMonica: Ok, thank you.(the man leaves) Uh, well this is it. Are you OK?ScenesChandler: Yeah. Just weird, you know. It's like: "Hi, I'm Chandler. May I have the human growing inside you?ScenesMonica: Uh, we're gonna be great.ScenesChandler: You're gonna be great.ScenesMonica: Well... obviously!ScenesAgency guy: (he enters with Erica) Monica, Chandler. I'd like you to meet Erica.ScenesMonica: Hi. It is so, so nice to meet you.ScenesErica: (whispering) Hi...ScenesChandler: Thank you so much for agreeing to see us.ScenesErica: Hi.ScenesAgency guy: I'll let you get acquainted.ScenesChandler: Ok.ScenesErica: So, it's Monica and Chandler. I only know you as file 0W33815-D.ScenesChandler: That's what our friends call us.ScenesErica: Gosh, you know, you're just such an amazing couple. It's... kind of intimidating.ScenesMonica: I don't know about that.ScenesErica: You're kidding me? I mean, it's enough that you are a doctor. But on top of it, you're married to a reverend?ScenesChandler: (astonished) I don't think that's exactly...ScenesMonica: (overlapping) Let her finish, doctor.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my friend Sarah had a great time last night.ScenesJoey: Well...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! So you're gonna call this one back?ScenesJoey: Nope.ScenesPhoebe: What are you talking about? Sarah's great!ScenesJoey: Oh, really? You know what your great friend did? We're out to dinner, ok? (he starts talking about the date and we can see what happened through a flashback video) We're getting along, having a really nice time. I was thinking she was really cool. And then, out of nowhere...Scenes(Sarah picks up some fries from Joey’s plate and Joey looks very angry. Then we’re back to Central Perk and Joey does a you-see-what-I-mean look to Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: That’s it? That’s why you won’t go out with her again? So, she took some fries, big deal!ScenesJoey: Hey, hey, look! It’s not about a few fries... it’s about what the fries represent.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: ALL FOOD!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I can’t believe I set you up with such a MONSTER!ScenesJoey: Hey, hey, hey, hey. Look. I take a girl out, she can order whatever she wants! The more, the better! All right? Just don’t order a Garden salad and then eat my food! That’s a good way to lose some fingers!Scenes(Rachel enters from the main door)ScenesPhoebe: (to Rachel) OhScenesRachel: HiScenesPhoebe: Thank God you’re here. Listen to this!ScenesRachel: what?ScenesPhoebe: Joey and my friend were out last night and having dinner and she reaches over and takes a few of his fries...ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, no!Scenes(Joey looks satisfied)ScenesPhoebe: What? You know about the plate thing?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah. Joey doesn’t share food. I mean, just last week we were having breakfast and he had a couple of grapes on his plate and ...ScenesPhoebe: (to Joey) You wouldn’t let her have a grape?ScenesRachel: Oh no! Not me! Emma!Scenes(Phoebe looks horrified and she turns to watch Joey)ScenesJoey: (mad and pointing a finger to himself) JOEY DOESN’T SHARE FOOD!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I still think that it’s a stupid reason not to call someone again. You are calling her! And if you need to, just get an extra plate of fries for the table!ScenesJoey: (he thinks a little, considering the option and seems to be quite satisfied) I like that! A sharing buffer! Yeah! I’ll order some extra fries! Maybe a plate of onion rings. Yeah. And a shrimp cocktail. And some buffalo wings. Maybe an individual pizza, uh? And some mozzarella sticks. (he looks absorbed in his food thoughts) What were we talking about?

rows.Scenes: A clothes store. Ross and Phoebe are shopping]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Ross) This place is awesome!ScenesRoss: You know, we should just go, I’m not gonna find anything here! This stuff is ridiculous!Scenes(Rachel arrives with a lot of clothes)ScenesRachel: Ah, this place is great!ScenesPhoebe: Wow!ScenesRoss: Rach, come on, I’m not gonna wear any of this! (he picks up a shirt) Nothing silver. (Rachel sighs). Ok? Nothing with hair! (Rachel sighs again) And nothing with padlocks on it! (Rachel heaves a long disappointing sigh).ScenesRachel: Ross, look, I know that some of this stuff is out there, but I mean, come on, look at this, look at this sweater! (she picks up a blue sweater). I mean, this is just beautiful!ScenesRoss: (feeling the fabric) Wow, this is really soft (he looks the price). Three hundred and fifty dollars?ScenesRachel: Yeah, down from seven hundred, you are saving like two hundred bucks!ScenesRoss: Both logic and math are taking a serious hit today.ScenesPhoebe (walking to Ross carrying a black leather jacket): Hey, check this out! It’s totally you!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!Scenes(Ross wears the jackets and look at himself in the mirror)ScenesRoss: Actually this looks like pretty good! Yeah!(he turns and watches his back and there’s a sign on the back of the jacket, “boys will be boys”) Boys will be boys?ScenesPhoebe: What? They will be!ScenesRoss: All right, that’s it, I’m getting out of here.ScenesRachel: No, no, no, no! Ross, wait! Come on! You know, there’s other stuff. Here’s a nice shirt, look at these nice pants...ScenesRoss: Uh, actually these might look pretty good on me.ScenesRachel: Yes, they will! You know what you should do? Just go take a walk, all right? I know your size and I’m... I’m gonna pick up some really good stuff for you.ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesRachel: Yes! And I know what looks sexy on guys. Please, just wear what I suggest, and she’s gonna go nuts for you.ScenesRoss: So, you’re saying, uh, if I wear these pants I might be getting into hers?ScenesRachel: (to Phoebe) Why do men keep talking to me like this?

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are still talking with Erica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So, the fact that I am a doctor, and my wife’s a reverend, that’s important to you?ScenesErica: Yeah, I read some great applications, but then I thought “who better then a minister to raise a child!”ScenesMonica: Amen.ScenesChandler: Plus I thought the baby would be in good hands with a doctor!ScenesMonica: Uh, good hands. (she holds Chandler hands) Healing hands.ScenesErica: Reverend, can I ask? Does the bible say anything about adoption?ScenesMonica: It says “Do it!”. And behold she did adopt onto them a baby. And it was good.ScenesErica: Wow.ScenesChandler: Yeah, wow.ScenesErica: I was wondering you both have such serious jobs. (to Monica) Would you have time to take care of a baby and your flock?ScenesMonica: Oh, you know, my flock is good, I mean, yeah, my flock pretty much takes care of themselves at this point. Good flock. Flock, flock, flock.ScenesErica: (to Chandler) Being a doctor must take up a lot of time.ScenesChandler: No-ot for me it doesn’t.Scenes(The agency guy enters the room)ScenesAgency guy: So, how’s everything going in here?ScenesErica: We’re great, I think I may have asked all my questions.ScenesAgency guy: Do you have any question for Erica?ScenesChandler: Yeah, actually. So, you read a file that you liked and you gave the agency the serial number and they contacted us?ScenesAgency guy: Yes, our system assures total anonimity. We’re very proud of it.ScenesChandler: You should be. You’re really on top of stuff..ScenesAgency guy: (to Erica) Well, then if there’s nothing else, then the two of us should talk.ScenesErica: Actually, I don’t think we have to.ScenesMonica: We don’t?ScenesErica: Yeah, when I read about you two, I was pretty sure I wanted you, but I just thought we should meet face to face. (to the agency guy). I've made my decision. I choose them.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, this is great! This is so great! (to Chandler, who looks bewildered). Did you hear that?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I did.ScenesMonica: (to Erica) Hey, thank you. Thank you so much. (they hugs). You are SO going to Heaven!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Rachel and Phoebe walk in, loaded with bags.]
rows.Content: Rachel: We got some really great stuff!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah but I am not sure about some of the bra's I got.ScenesRachel: Oh! Really? Do you wanna try some of them on for me?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! okay. Wait, are we in Joey's imagination?ScenesRachel: (looking into one of her shopping bags) Oh no! I took one of Ross' bags by Scenesmistake, and one of mine is missing.ScenesPhoebe: oh, well, Ross probably has it, you can get it from him later.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross walks into Central Perk, wearing a pink and white ladies shirt. Joey is on the couch]
rows.Content: ScenesRoss: (to Joey) So? What do you think? (Shows himself - Joey observes him with a strange look on his face.)ScenesJoey: I think were not wearing the same shirt anymore!!ScenesRoss: (not getting it) Yeah! Yeah! Rachel picked it out for me. She told me to trust her and you know what? I'm glad I did! I turned quite a few heads on my way over here.ScenesJoey: (now laughing a little) Dude, I really don't think you should be wearing that.ScenesRoss: Oh, I see, somebody is afraid of a little competition with the ladies?ScenesJoey: (looking a little agitated now) Looks like someone IS the ladies!!ScenesRoss: You're just jealous because you couldn't pull this off. Yeah, now if you'll excuse me (getting up and taking his coat) I have a date. (As he is walking out, everyone turns and stares at him) See? (To Joey) ALL eyes on ME!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's hotel room. They enter.]
rows.Content: Chandler: We are NOT signing those papers.ScenesMonica: Why not?ScenesChandler: It's wrong. They made a mistake. They think we're somebody else.ScenesMonica: God works in mysterious ways.ScenesChandler: You have gotta stop!ScenesMonica: But she liked us.ScenesChandler: She likes Doctor Chandler and Reverend Monica.ScenesMonica: Well, if you think about it, I am kind of like a Reverend. I mean, as a chef, I serve God, by feeing the hungry and poor. (looks very convinced about what she just said)ScenesChandler: Your Veal Chop is $34,95!ScenesMonica: C'mon Chandler, I think we have been given an opportunity. I mean, the mistake has already been made. They are writing up the paper right now.ScenesChandler: But we are not the one she chose! How can you feel okay about this?ScenesMonica: (very emotional) Because... We may not be who she thinks we are but no-one will ever love that baby more than us.ScenesChandler: I know..ScenesMonica: I mean, who knows how long it's gonna take for someone else to give us a baby? What if, what if no one ever picks us?ScenesChandler: oh, honey..ScenesMonica: (Almost crying) Please.. please, we are so close.ScenesChandler: Monica, I want a baby too, but this woman is giving away her child. She deserves to know who it's going to. ScenesMonica: (realizes Chandler is right. She's almost crying) okay, right. (They hug)ScenesChandler: So, we'll tell the truth and who knows, maybe she'll like us for us.ScenesMonica: (sniffing) Maybe she will. Uh! Why couldn't I have been a Reverend?ScenesChandler: You're Jewish.ScenesMonica: Technicality!Scenes

rows.Scenes: A restaurant. Joey is on his date with Phoebe’s friend, Sarah. They are sitting opposite each other on a table for two. Their waiter approaches with two plates.]
rows.Content: Waiter: A garden salad for the lady (sets the plate down)ScenesJoey: Oh, that looks great! Good ordering!ScenesWaiter: Seafood platter for the gentleman and extra fries. Enjoy!ScenesSarah: Mmmh, those fries look delicious.ScenesJoey: oh, I didn't know you liked French fries. Help yourself! What's mine is yours. (Sarah reaches over and takes a few fries)ScenesSarah: (looks over at Joey's platter) Oh wow, are those stuffed clams?ScenesJoey: Uuuh.. yes, they are my stuffed clams.Scenes(Sarah, is grinning and starts to reach over to Joey's plate to take a few clams)ScenesJoey: How about those fries though, huh? (Holds the plate between Sarah’s fingers and his plate, thus blocking her from reaching his)ScenesSarah: They are delicious (takes a few from the plate, puts one in her mouth and places the rest on her plate, then starts to reach over to Joey's platter again)ScenesJoey: (Spotting her movements takes her hand into his own) You are beautiful, you know that?ScenesSarah: Oh, that is so sweet..ScenesJoey: Oh (grinning, trying to hold in his impatience with her) okay.. (she takes her hand back)Scenes(Then she reaches over again and Joey moves his plate a little to the left, and she misses, then she reaches out again, and he moves his plate to the right , so she misses again. She tries a third time and this time, Joey pushes his plate so far to the left, it drops off the edge of the table)ScenesJoey: (Visibly annoyed) NOW look what you did!!ScenesSarah: What? what is the matter with you?ScenesJoey: I don't like it when people take food off of my plate, okay?ScenesSarah: But you just said "What's mine is yours"?ScenesJoey: WELL, I DIDN'T MEAN IT!ScenesSarah: Fine, I'm sorry, I didn't think it was that big a deal.ScenesJoey: I'm sorry, I'm overreacting. Okay, It's just when it comes to food, I have certain rules, okay, I mean (bends down and with his plate and his hands, scrapes the dropped dinner back onto the plate and puts it back on the table) There are things you do..and you now, things.. (takes something from the plate and blows it a little) that you don't do (He takes a bite from it).Scenes(Sarah looks a little disgusted)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross and his date walk into a lobby. They are both wearing their jackets]
rows.Content: ScenesGirl: Wow, this place looks great.ScenesRoss: Oh! You are gonna love it! (The girl is looking in the other direction as Ross is taking off his own coat, revealing the pink and white ladies shirt) and I'm so glad, we're finally doing this.ScenesGirl: Me too! (starts to take her coat off)ScenesRoss: Here (gets behind her to help. When the coat comes off we see she is wearing the exact same shirt Ross is wearing. They look at each other, shocked. They abruptly put their coat back on) So this was fun! (They leave the room and head into opposite directions)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Back at the restaurant with Joey and Sarah. Joey is holding Sarah's hands]
rows.Content: Joey: I really am sorry about, you know..before. I just want to make sure you know that I really do like you.ScenesSarah: Sure (smiling) Just not as much as clams.ScenesJoey: (Jokingly) Well, stuffed clams.Scenes(The waiter arrives with their deserts)ScenesWaiter: Chocolate Torte for the lady, cheesecake for the gentleman.ScenesJoey: Uh, excuse me sir, there seems to be some sort of red crap on my cheesecake.ScenesWaiter: Yes, that's Raspberry coule.ScenesJoey: (More to himself than anyone else) So stupid, ordering cheesecake, trying to Scenesbe healthy. (pushes it aside)ScenesSarah: (tasting hers) Oh my God! (Looks at the waiter and then to Joey)ScenesJoey: Oh, all right, I'll just have what she's having instead.ScenesWaiter: Oh, I'm sorry sir, that was our last piece.ScenesSarah: Mmmm! Mmm!Scenes(Sarah's beeper starts bleeping)ScenesSarah: Oh, no! This is work. I should call in. Can you excuse me?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure. No problem.Scenes(Joey's looking at Sarah's dessert, and takes her plate.)ScenesSarah: What are you doing? I thought you don't share food.ScenesJoey: Sure I do. (holding up his own dessert) Coule?ScenesSarah: (laughing) No. If I can't have your clams, you can't have my dessert. This is a two way street.ScenesJoey: (laughing) Really?ScenesSarah: Really! Now this all better be here when I come back. (puts her plate back at her side of the table)ScenesJoey: Yeah, of course. I can control myself. (laughs uneasily and Sarah leaves the room)Scenes(Joey sits sideways on his chair, looking at Sarah's chocolate torte, and then looking away from it, nervously playing with his fork, drumming with it on the table every now and then.)ScenesJoey: (to the torte) Stop staring at me!Scenes(He then straightens himself, and looks at the torte)ScenesJoey: Why, just a tiny little...Scenes(He takes a little piece of Sarah's dessert. At first he doesn't think it's that special, but then...)ScenesJoey: Oh-oh!ScenesTIME LAPSEScenes(Sarah enters the room again, and stops when she sees her dessert is missing. Joey has emptied her plate, and has a chocolate covered mouth, just like a kid.)ScenesJoey: I'm not even sorry.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are entering.]
rows.Content: Erica: Hi!ScenesAdoption Agency guy: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesAgency guy: So, these are the preliminary forms for an open adoption. There's a lot to go over, but I'll explain everything as we go through it.ScenesMonica: (pointing to a picture on the table) I-Is... Is that a picture?ScenesErica: Yeah. It's a sonogram they took of the baby last week. I thought you might want to see it. (gives it to Monica, who looks at it for a long time, and then shows it to Chandler)ScenesMonica: Look, doctor!Scenes(Chandler takes Monica's hand, and gets serious) Look, before we sign anything we really have to talk...(pause) We're not who you think we are.ScenesAgency guy: I don't understand.ScenesChandler: The agency must have made some mistake. My wife is not a reverend and I'm not a doctor.ScenesErica: What?ScenesAgency guy: That's impossible.ScenesChandler: I could perform an operation on you and prove it if you'd like.ScenesAgency guy: I'll go check your file. Excuse me.ScenesErica: So who are you?ScenesChandler: Well, our names really are Monica and Chandler. We're from New York.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but the important thing to know about us, is how much we would care for this little baby. (holds up the sonogram)ScenesErica: So you lied to me before?ScenesMonica: Well, we... (makes quotation signs in the air) "bore false witness"... See I could be a reverend.ScenesErica: I can't believe this.ScenesMonica: But we were hoping that since we told you the truth that you still might consider...ScenesErica: Giving you my baby? You think I'd give you my child after this?ScenesMonica: Well, you don't have to decide right now, but if you could just look at our file...ScenesErica: I don't want to look at your file! This is over.Scenes(She leaves the room, but Chandler runs after her. They meet in the hallway.)ScenesChandler: Erica wait!ScenesErica: I've nothing to say to you. (walks a few paces)ScenesChandler: You have every reason to be upset. We did lie. But only because we've been waiting and trying to have a baby for so long. Now we don't know how long it's gonna be before we can get another chance again.ScenesErica: Why don't you ask the reverend to pray on it?ScenesChandler: Erica, please. Just consider us. Ask them to see our file. Our last name's Bing. My wife's a chef and I'm in advertising.ScenesErica: Oh yeah. I actually liked you guys. But it doesn't matter, because what you did was wrong. (walks away again, but Chandler catches up with her again)ScenesChandler: But you did like us. And you should. My wife's an incredible woman. She's loving and devoted and caring. And don't tell her I said this but the woman's always right... I love my wife more than anything in this world. And I... It kills me that I can't give her a baby... I really want a kid. And when that day finally comes, I'll learn how to be a good dad. But my wife... she's already there. She's a mother... without a baby... Please?Scenes(They look at each other. We switch back to Monica. Chandler opens the door and she turns to look at him.)ScenesChandler: You still want that baby?Scenes(Monica plays those words back in her mind and then smiles and runs to Chandler, who is twisting with joy. They hug.)ScenesMonica: God bless you Chandler Bing!ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Joey's on the couch when Ross walks to him, with his jacket closed.]
rows.Content: Ross: Turns out this sweater is made for a woman.ScenesJoey: (nods) So, why are you still wearing it?ScenesRoss: Because it's soft... Hey, so how was your date?ScenesJoey: Ooh... Not so good.ScenesRoss: Well, looks like it's just the two of us tonight, huh old buddy?ScenesJoey: Yeah, and you know what? We could do a lot worse.Scenes(they shake hands the way friends would. There's a muffin on the table, and Ross breaks off a piece and wants to put it in his mouth.)ScenesJoey: (shouting to Ross) JOEY DOESN'T SHARE FOOD!Scenes(Ross puts the piece back on the plate)ScenesendScenesFriends Scenes1010 - The One Where Chandler Gets CaughtScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesProduced by: Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFlashback clips transcribed by: Guineapig, Dan Silverstein, Ruth Curran, Eric Aasen and Mindy Mattingly Phillips, and compiled by Eleonora.ScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everybody's sitting on the couch and Monica is eating a chunk of cake.]
rows.Content: Monica: (really excited) Mmh... this cake is amazing!ScenesRachel: My God, get a room!ScenesMonica: I would get a room with this cake. I think I could show this cake a good time!ScenesPhoebe: If you had to, what would you give up, food or sex?ScenesMonica: (with no hesitation) Sex!ScenesChandler: (looking at her) Seriously, answer faster!ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm sorry honey, you know, but when she said "sex" I wasn't thinking about "sex with you"!ScenesChandler: (to Phoebe) It's like a giant hug.ScenesPhoebe: Ross, how about you. What would you give up, sex or food?ScenesRoss: Food.ScenesPhoebe: Ok, how about... uhm... sex or dinosaurs?ScenesRoss: Oh my God. It's like Sophie's Choice.ScenesRachel: Oh God. What about you, Joe? What would you give up, sex or food?ScenesJoey: Uhm... oh... I don't know, it's too hard.ScenesRachel: No, you gotta pick one!ScenesJoey: Oh... food. No, sex. Food! Sex! Food! Se-I don't know! Good God, I don't know, I want girls on bread!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel and Phoebe are looking at some photos and they're sitting next to the window.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You gotta see these latest pictures of Emma.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how cute!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she looks just like a little doll!ScenesRachel: Oh, no, no. That is a doll.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank God, 'cause that thing's really creepy! (looking outside the window) Look, there's Chandler. (he's on the street, talking to a woman)ScenesRachel: Oh. Who is the blonde, she's pretty.ScenesPhoebe: OH! He's having an affair.ScenesRachel: He's not having an affair!ScenesPhoebe: You know, I'm always right about these things.ScenesRachel: No, you're not! Last week you thought Ross was trying to kill you!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm sorry but it's hard to believe that anyone would tell a story that dull just to tell it! (looking outside) See, there's something going on with them. Look, he's getting into the car with her!ScenesRachel: Oh, that doesn't mean anything.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah? Well, let's see. (she takes her mobile phone) Ok, duck down. (they both get down to hide themselves. Phoebe calls Chandler)ScenesChandler: (picking up the phone) Hello.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hi Chandler. It's Phoebe. Uhm... I know that Monica is working today so...(back to Central Perk) ...I was wondering if you want to come to the movies with me and Rachel.ScenesChandler: Oh, uhm... I have to work too. Yeah, I'm stuck at the office all day.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) Oh, well, it's a shame that you-that you miss the movie 'cause we were gonna see, you know, either "Liar, Liar" or "Betrayal", or... "An Affair To Remember".ScenesChandler: Those are all really old!ScenesPhoebe: Ok, then maybe it'll be, uhm...ScenesRachel: (whispering) "Dude, Where's My Car?ScenesPhoebe: (glancing at her) What?ScenesRachel: They're in a caaar...ScenesPhoebe: (to Chandler at the phone) Okay, we-we'll talk to you later. Okay, bye.ScenesRachel: Geez!ScenesPhoebe: Ok. Quick. We gotta find a cab and follow them.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, ok. Let me just grab my night vision goggles and my stun gun.ScenesPhoebe: (patting her bag) I got them!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Chandler enters the door.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey! You smell like perfume and cigarettes.ScenesChandler: I was in the car with Nancy all day.ScenesMonica: Nancy doesn’t smoke!ScenesChandler: Well, at least the perfume is not mine, be thankful for that!ScenesMonica: So? What do you think of the house?ScenesChandler: It’s perfect. It’s everything we’ve been looking for.ScenesMonica: Isn’t it? Then what about the amazing wainscotting and the crown molding and the dormer windows in the attic?ScenesChandler: And the wiggle wharms and the zip zorps? (pause) What were the things you said?ScenesMonica: Don’t you love the huge yard?ScenesChandler: And the fireplace in the bedroom.ScenesMonica: And Nancy said that it's really under price, because the guy lost his job and has to move in with his parents!ScenesChandler: This is bringing out a lovely color in you!ScenesMonica: So? Do you think we should get it?ScenesChandler: I don’t know. What do you think?ScenesMonica: I think we should.ScenesChandler: I do too.ScenesMonica: This is huge!ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesMonica: How bad you wanna smoke, right now.ScenesChandler: I don’t know what you mean, giant talking cigarette! Oh, by the way, Phoebe called just as I was getting into Nancy’s car, so if she asks you, I was at work all day.ScenesMonica: Gotcha. When do we tell them about this?ScenesChandler: We don’t. Not until it's a hundred percent. I mean, why upset everybody over nothing.ScenesMonica: Okay. Right. Oh my God that is gonna be so hard.ScenesChandler: I know. Gooooood luck with it.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Everybody except Monica and Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Ross: I just can’t see Chandler cheating!ScenesRachel: I’m telling you guys, we followed them out to a house in Westchester, the went in for like forty-five minutes and then they came out looking pretty happy!ScenesJoey: Chandler? Forty-five minutes? Well, something is not right. I just can’t believe he would do this to Monica!ScenesRoss: I know, and with the baby coming?ScenesPhoebe: So, should we tell her?ScenesRoss: I don’t know. Phoebe, if one of us saw Mike with another woman would you want us to tell you?ScenesPhoebe: Why? Who’d you seen him with?ScenesRoss: No one, I’m just saying if... (Phoebe starts pinching him in his neck)ScenesPhoebe: TELL ME WHAT YOU KNOW!ScenesRoss: (yelling in pain) I know nothing! Mike’s a great guy, it was hypothetical!ScenesPhoebe: All right. (she releases him). He is a good guy. You’re right, he wouldn’t cheat.ScenesRoss: Believe me, if I did see with someone, there’s no way I... (Phoebe starts pinching him again)ScenesPhoebe : WHO DID YOU SEE HIM WITH?Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Monica is cleaning with a vacuum and then she cleans it with a dust buster. The guys enter the room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, look at her, so happy!ScenesMonica: If only there were a smaller one to clean this one!ScenesJoey: Hey, is uhm... is Chandler here?ScenesMonica: No, he’s picking up dinner, why, what’s up?ScenesPhoebe: Well, look, whatever happens, we’re here for you and we love you.ScenesMonica (puzzled): All right...ScenesRoss: We think Chandler might be having an affair.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: Phoebe and I saw Chandler with a blonde woman today outside on the street and then we followed them to a house in Westchester.ScenesPhoebe: They went in together. So sorry.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Oh my God that’s awful! What did you think of the house?Scenes(they all look confused and sorry for her)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: (walking towards her to hold her and support her) Monica, you understand what we are saying, right?ScenesMonica: Yeah, sure... uhm, I'm devastated, obviously... (to the rest) Did you think the neighborhood was homey? (Chandler enters)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) You son of a bitch!ScenesChandler: Is it me, or have the greetings gone downhill around here?ScenesMonica: (goes to Chandler) Phoebe and Rachel saw you with Nancy today and... em... they think you're having an affair.ScenesRachel: Who's Nancy?ScenesRoss: What's going on?ScenesMonica: (turns to them) Ok, alright, you guys, you'd better sit down, this is pretty big.ScenesChandler: Yeah (motions them to sit and they do) I'm not having an affair. Nancy is our realtor.ScenesJoey: I knew he couldn't be with a woman for 45 minutes!!ScenesPhoebe: Why do you have a realtor?ScenesMonica: Uhm, she has been showing us houses outside of the city.ScenesJoey: (clearly shocked) What?ScenesRachel: Are you serious?ScenesMonica: When we found out that we're gonna get this baby, Chandler and I started talking and we decided that we didn't want to raise a kid in the city.ScenesPhoebe: So you're gonna move?ScenesRoss: Oh my God.ScenesJoey: Shouldn't we all vote on stuff like this?!ScenesRachel: What is wrong with raising a kid in the city? I'm doing it, Ross is doing it, Sarah Jessica Parker is doing it!ScenesMonica: And that's great for you guys, but we want a lawn and a swingset...ScenesChandler: ...and a street where our kids can ride their bikes and maybe an ice-cream truck can go by.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) So you wanna buy a house in the 50's?ScenesPhoebe: Have you thought about what you would be giving up? You can't move out of the city, what if you want Chinese food at 5am? Or a fake Rolex that breaks as soon as it rains or an Asian hooker sent right to your door?ScenesRoss: You know what, if you wanna look for a house, that's okay.ScenesJoey: No, no, it's not, don't listen to him! (to Ross) I'm gonna thump you! (points his fist at him)ScenesRoss: (to Joey) It's ok, because they have to get it out of their system, okay (back to Mon and Chan), but you're going to realize, this is the only place, you wanna be.Scenes(pause before Monica and Chandler speak, they look like they are looking for the right words)ScenesChandler: Actually, we already found a house we love.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: And about an hour ago, we made an offer.Scenes(All the friends looked shocked and confused. There is a long silence.)ScenesChandler: Bet you wish I was having an affair now, huh?ScenesTIME LAPSEScenesRoss: You put an offer on a house?ScenesMonica: (smiling) It's so sweet. It really is. It has this big yard that leads down to this stream and then there's these old maple trees... (gets cut off)ScenesPhoebe: Wha..? Again with the nature, what are you? Beavers?ScenesChandler: I know this is really hard and we're really sorry.ScenesJoey: Is this because I come over here without knocking and eat your food? (Walks towards the fridge) Because I can stop doing that, (looks at the fridge) I really, really think I can!ScenesChandler: (goes towards Joey) You know that's not the reason Joe. (Joey hugs him and after, he takes something from the fridge and puts it in his mouth. He goes back to where he was standing before)ScenesMonica: We think if you saw it, you'd understand. I mean you guys were there. (Points to Rachel and Phoebe) It is beautiful, isn't it?ScenesRachel: Yeah it is.ScenesJoey: What the hell are you doin'?ScenesRachel: Well, it is, all right? When we were out there today, all I kept thinking was: I can't believe Chandler is screwing this woman, but MAN this would be a nice place to live!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but so is this.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I mean, if you moved there, you have to leave here. I mean, how can you leave this place?Scenes Scenes[We fade to some flashback scenes.]Scenes(from 1.01 - "The One Where Monica Gets a New Roommate - The Pilot")ScenesRachel: (talking on the phone) C'mon Daddy, listen to me!
