I mean he is a doctor, you don't expect doctors to get sick!ScenesRoss: But we do! (pause) It's gonna be ok, Rach!ScenesRachel: (she's sad) Ow. I don't want him to wake up alone! I should go to the hospital!ScenesRoss: What? No, no! Hey, hey, hey look...ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: They gave him a lot of medication, ok? He wouldn't even know if you were there. Look, we'll go see him first thing in the morning, ok?ScenesRachel: Really, I shouldn't feel guilty?ScenesRoss: No, God! Hey, Rach, you've been an amazing daughter, ok? Right now you just need to get some rest.ScenesRachel: Ok, maybe you're right.ScenesRoss: (he kisses her on her forehead) Good night.ScenesRachel: Wait, wait, wait, wait. Would you stay here with me for a little while?ScenesRoss: Sure!ScenesRachel: Ok. (She sits on the bed and Ross sits near her) Thank you for coming with me today.ScenesRoss: Oh, of course...ScenesRachel: Rachel Green is very happy you're in her room!ScenesRoss: Me too. Come here. (They hug)ScenesRachel: I just don't want to be alone tonight.ScenesRoss: Ok, well, uh, I can maybe grab a sleeping bag, or...(There's one of those moments. They're staring at each other, no word uttered, and then she leans toward him in order to kiss him, but he ducks and avoids her more than once.) Oh, oh. (he then hugs her and when she tries to kiss him again, he stands up and she falls down on the bed). No, Rach! I'm sorry, I just don't think this, this, this is a good idea.ScenesRachel: Wait, we won't know that until we do it, will we?ScenesRoss: No, look, uh. You are upset about your father and you're feeling vulnerable and I just don't feel it would be right, I'd feel like I'd be, you know, taking advantage of you.ScenesRachel: Taking advantage? I'm giving you the advantage, enjoy!ScenesRoss: Look, I'm sure it would be great, but I-I think one of us has to be thinking clearly, so, I'm gonna go!ScenesRachel: Wow. Ok.ScenesRoss: I'll see you in the morning (he leaves).ScenesRachel: Mhm-mh!ScenesRoss: (outside her room, talking by himself) Haven't had sex in four months, I should get a medal for that!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Monica and Erica have just arrived.]
rows.Content: Erica: Thanks so much for taking me to all those places. I had a great time.ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm glad. Listen, I want to apologize about Chandler, though. I just did not see this coming.ScenesChandler: (enters the room wearing an "I love New York" t-shirt, a "Statue of Liberty" hat and carrying bags) New York is awesome!ScenesMonica: What is with you?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I've been to these places before, but I've never really seen them, you know.ScenesMonica: Yeah, you miss alot, when you're moo-ing.ScenesErica: Thanks so much for showing me around.ScenesMonica: Oh! It was our pleasure. We are so much enjoying getting to know you.ScenesErica: Well, if there is anything else you wanna know... (Monica and Chandler look at each other)ScenesChandler: Oh, uhm, okay, uhm, do you mind if we ask you some questions about the father?ScenesErica: Oh, sure. Yeah, well, he was my high school boyfriend. Captain of the football team, really cute and he got a scholarship and went off to college. (Monica and Chandler are smiling from ear to ear)ScenesChandler: That's great.ScenesErica: Yeah... it's almost definitely him. (Monica and Chandler look confused now)ScenesMonica: How's that now?ScenesErica: Well, there is a chance it's another guy. I mean, I have only ever been with two guys, but they sorta overlapped.ScenesChandler: So, what does the other guy do? Does he go to college too?ScenesErica: No, he's in prison. (More shocked looks from Monica and Chandler)ScenesMonica: Was he falsely accused of something? (They look hopeful)ScenesErica: No... he killed his father with a shovel. (Monica and Chandler's jaws drop) But other than that, he's a great guy.ScenesChandler: I'll bet his dad doesn't think so.Scenes(Time lapse. Chandler and Monica are in bed now)ScenesMonica: Are you awake?ScenesChandler: Of course I'm awake. Assume from now on that I'm always awake! (He turns the light on)ScenesMonica: Alright, we don't know that it's him. I mean, it could be the football guy.ScenesChandler: Honey, it's us. Of course it's the shovel-killer.ScenesMonica: Alright, lets say that it is him, would we not want the baby? No! Would we treat him any differently?ScenesChandler: I'd keep an eye on him! We have to find out which one the father is.ScenesMonica: How?ScenesChandler: I dunno, aren't there tests for these things, right?ScenesMonica: Yeah, but maybe we're just over-reacting.ScenesChandler: Pff, easy for you to say, he's a father killer. He probably loves him mommy. He's probably got a tattoo that says "mom" on his shovel-wielding arm!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. He is sitting on the barcalounger holding a French study book and listening to a French learning tape.]
rows.Content: Tape: We will now count from one to five. Un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq.ScenesJoey: Huh, un, blu, bla, flu, flenk!ScenesTape: Good job.ScenesJoey: Thank you.Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Listen, I feel really badly about yesterday and I thought about it a lot and, and I know, I was too impatient. SO lets try it again.ScenesJoey: Oh, no, that's okay, I don't need your help. I worked on it myself and I gotta say, I am pretty good!ScenesPhoebe: Really, can I hear some of it.ScenesJoey: Sure, sure. Ok, (clears his throat and starts to read from his script. He starts talking in a fake French accent, making gestures with his hands) "Bleu de la bleu, de la blu bla bleu" (Phoebe looks astonished, annoyed and disgusted, Joey seems very proud though) See?ScenesPhoebe: Well, you're not, (she tries to smile and contain her anger, but loses it) You're not... you're not... again, you're not SPEAKING FRENCH!ScenesJoey: (offended) Oh well I think I am, yeah and I think I'm definitely gonna get the part.ScenesPhoebe: How could you possibly think that?ScenesJoey: For one thing, the guy on the tape said I was doing a good job!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The hospital. Rachel is pouring her self a cup of coffee. Ross approaches from behind.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Rach, can you grab me a cup of coffee?ScenesRachel: (She turns around very slowly, looks at him for a second and then turns back to her coffee) Sure. (She gives him the cup she was pouring for herself without looking at him)ScenesRoss: You've been quiet all morning. Is everything okay?ScenesRachel: Hmm-hmm. (starts to pour herself a cup of coffee, never looking at Ross)ScenesRoss: You sure you're alright?ScenesRachel: (coldly) Yep.ScenesRoss: (knowing she's not alright) O-kay. Well, I'm gonna go grab us some breakfast. (He starts to leave)ScenesRachel: FYI..ScenesRoss: (knew this was coming) There it is... (he comes back)ScenesRachel: In the future, when a girl asks for some ill-advised sympathy sex... just do it. (she smiles fakely at him)ScenesRoss: (half amused) Wait, wait, (looks around a little) You're mad at me about last night? I was just trying to do the right thing.ScenesRachel: (sarcastically) Really? Well, it seems to me if you'd done the right thing, I would not have woken up today feeling stupid and embarrassed, I would have woken up feeling comforted and satisfied!ScenesRoss: (acknowledging the last part of her sentence) Well...ScenesRachel: Oh stop that!ScenesRoss: I can't believe this. I was just being a good guy. I treated you with respect and understanding.ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Oh, that is so hot. She walks around him to the other side)ScenesRoss: Hey, I was looking out for you.ScenesRachel: Oh, really, well Ross, you know what? I am a big girl. I don't need someone telling me what is best for me.ScenesRoss: I gotta say, I have not had sex a lot of times before, this is the worst ever.ScenesRachel: Oh, really, really? Well, it wasn't very good for me either. (She turns to leave and Ross over takes her and stands infront on her, his back to the row of doors leading to the hospital rooms)ScenesRoss: Hey you know what? You know what? To avoid this little thing in the future, let's just say, you and me, never having sex again.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: That's right, sex is off the table. (The door starts to open behind him and Dr. Green emerges) I am never having sex with you again. (Rachel stays quiet and after a few moments Ross realizes what has happened. He turns abruptly) Dr. Green, are you feeling better? (Rachel's dad glares at him with a deadly look)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Monica and Erica enter, Chandler is in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! How was lunch?ScenesErica: (To Chandler) We had a good time. By the way, I wanted to ask you something. It would really mean a lot to me, if the baby was a boy, that you name him after my father, Jiminy Billy Bob (Monica smiles at Chandler and his he looks shocked and scared, getting no support from his wife)ScenesChandler: (struggling) Oh, really?ScenesErica: No! (To Monica) You we're right, that was fun! I'm gonna go finish packing.ScenesChandler: O-okay. (steps closer to Monica and speaks softly) So, is she gonna take the test?ScenesMonica: Nope, she doesn't have to, I found out who the father is.ScenesChandler: Oh God. It's shovely-Joe, isn't it?ScenesMonica: (smiling) No it's not.ScenesChandler: How do you know?ScenesErica: Well, it turns out that Erica didn't pay much attention in Sex Ed class, because the thing she did with that prison guy... it'd be pretty hard to make a baby that way.ScenesChandler: Oh God! What was it? The thing that we hardly ever do or the thing we never do?ScenesMonica: The thing we never do.ScenesChandler: (nods in appreciation) Shovely Joe!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The theatre where Joey is auditioning. Phoebe enters when Joey's on stage and she sits down. He hasn't seen her.]
rows.Content: Director: Whenever you're ready Joey.ScenesJoey: Right. (clears his throat) Dja bu bu Claude. Uh, c'est la pu les la lu blah bloo.ScenesCasting assistant: I'm sorry, what's going on?ScenesJoey: Dude, come on! French it u-up!ScenesDirector: Joey, do you speak French?ScenesJoey: Toutes la smore! Bu blu-ay bloo blah ooh! Pfoof!ScenesDirector: You know what. I think this audition is over. (Joey looks disappointed, but understands.)ScenesPhoebe: (in a French accent) Uh, excuse me. Uh, I am Reginé Philange. I was passing by when I heard this man speaking the regional dialect of my French town of Estée Lauder.ScenesDirector: You really think this man is speaking French?ScenesJoey: Sa-sa-saw!ScenesPhoebe: Écoutez, je vais vous dire la vérité. C'est mon petit frère. Il est un peu retardé. (Translation: Listen, I will tell you the truth. He's my little bother. He's a bit retarded.)Scenes(The director looks at Joey and he nods.)ScenesPhoebe: Alors, si vous pouviez jouer le jeu avec lui... (Translation: So, would you please just humor him?)ScenesDirector: (to Joey) Good job, little buddy. That was some really good French. But I think we're gonna go with someone else for the part.ScenesJoey: Ah. All right. But my French was good?ScenesDirector: It was great.ScenesJoey: (to Phoebe) Oh-hoh! Ha-hah! See!ScenesPhoebe: (to the director) Merci. Au revoir. (Translation: Thanks, goodbye.)ScenesJoey: Yeah-hah. Toute-de-le-fruit.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting at the kitchen counter and Ross enters from Rachel and Emma's room.]
rows.Content: Ross: Emma's down for the night.ScenesRachel: Oh, good.ScenesRoss: So uh... I guess I wanna take off.ScenesRachel: Okay... Hey listen, just before you go I-I again, I just wanna say "thank you" for coming with me.ScenesRoss: Oh, no problem.ScenesRachel: And also, you know I uh, I was thinking about what you said, you know, about the whole sex thing and... it's probably not a great idea to go down that road again.ScenesRoss: Thank you. I'm glad you agree.ScenesRachel: It's a shame though, I mean, when we did it, it was pretty good.ScenesRoss: Yeah... Yeah, that's true.ScenesRachel: Hey uhm, do you remember that one really great time...?ScenesRoss: Oh, ye-ah!ScenesRachel: You know it was you're uhm... birthday...ScenesRoss: ...Valentine's day...ScenesBoth: (long pause, they realize) Oh yeah!ScenesRachel: Well, I guess that's all in the past, now.ScenesRoss: Hmmm-mmmm.ScenesRachel: (after a pause) Not even one more time?ScenesRoss: Not even once.ScenesRachel: No matter how much we want it.ScenesRoss: Even if we want it really bad.ScenesRachel: That's what we decided.ScenesRoss: Uhm, right!ScenesRachel: ...It's kinda hard though!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: You know, when two people have a connection, you know, that's... just seems like such a... waste.ScenesRoss: ...I hate waste.ScenesRachel: ...Ross?ScenesRoss: Yes?ScenesRachel: Just so you know... With us... it's never off the table. (she enters her room and closes the door.)ScenesRoss: Damn it. It's never off the table. (he leaves the apartment)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe and Joey are "updating" Joey's resumé.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, can you really tapdance?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: It's off the resumé. (she strikes it through with a pencil)ScenesPhoebe: Archery?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Horseback riding?ScenesJoey: Would fall off a lot.ScenesPhoebe: You can drink a gallon of milk in 10 seconds?ScenesJoey: That I can do.ScenesPhoebe: Come on! You can drink a gallon of milk in 10 seconds?ScenesJoey: All right, watch me! (he takes a full container of milk from the fridge) Okay, you time me. Ready?ScenesPhoebe: Ready... GO!Scenes(Joey takes the plastic container to his mouth and starts to drink. Most of the milk gushes from the bottle down his chin and over his clothes to the floor. He keeps "drinking" and all of a sudden he lifts it up and half the bottle of milk pours out in an instant. He then continues to drink the rest. He then puts the empty container down on the counter.)ScenesPhoebe: (checking her watch) You did it!ScenesTHE ENDScenes ScenesFriends Scenes1014 - The One With Princess ConsuelaScenesTeleplay by: Tracy Reilly ScenesStory by: Robert Carlock ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. They are having a diner party with Phoebe and Mike.]
rows.Content: Mike: (raising his glass) Thank you guys for having us over.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Yeah, this is fun, couples night.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I don't know why we hang out with married couples more often.ScenesMonica: Well, because every time we do, you make jokes about swinging and scare them away.ScenesChandler: You mean that Portuguese couple? Yeah, like you wouldn't have done it. (she shrugs)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey, you guys... I have great news.ScenesMonica: Ross, we're kind of in the middle of diner here.ScenesRoss: Oh, well, er, I already ate, but sure...! (they all look at each other when Ross grabs a plate) Guess what happened at work today...ScenesChandler: A dinosaur died a million years ago?ScenesRoss: Try sixty-five million years ago, and then try sssshhhhhh.... My tenure review board met today and I hear it's looking really good.ScenesPhoebe: Wow!ScenesRoss: Yeah. Do you have any idea what this means in academic circles, uh? I am gonna get laid.ScenesRachel: (while entering) Hi you guys.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesRachel: Ooh, Italian! (she also grabs a plate)ScenesMonica: No one wanted seconds, right?ScenesRoss: No, no. I-I'm good.ScenesRachel: Hey you guys... You're never gonna believe it. This headhunter called me. I have a meeting tomorrow with Gucci. Gucci wants me.ScenesRoss: I'm up for tenure.ScenesRachel: Congratulations!ScenesRoss: You too! What are the odds?ScenesRachel: Ooh! (they hug)ScenesJoey: (enters) Guess what? (they all look expectantly at him) I finally got that seed out of my teeth.ScenesMonica: I don't know who I'm happiest for...ScenesPhoebe: I do, he's been working on that all day! (looking at Joey)Scenes ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler on their couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey Mon? Was it weird changing your name to Geller-Bing?ScenesMonica: No, no. It felt nice to acknowledge this. (pats Chandler on his leg)ScenesPhoebe: Where did you go to do it?ScenesMonica: Uhm the... the ministry... of names... bureau...ScenesChandler: YOU NEVER DID IT!ScenesMonica: I'm sorry. It's just the idea of being an official Bing.ScenesChandler: Hey! I will have you know that... aah, who am I kidding. Let's call the kid Geller and let Bing die with me.ScenesMike: (walks to the couch with coffee for Phoebe) Here you go.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks! Honey, would you want me to take your name?ScenesMike: Oh, it's just... It's up to you. It's your name. You've got to live with it.ScenesPhoebe: All right, let's see, call me mrs Hannigan.ScenesChandler: Mrs Hannigan?ScenesPhoebe: What? Can't you see I'm in the middle of something? Ooh, I like it.ScenesJoey: (enters) Hey guys.ScenesChandler: Hey Joe! We've got a couple of things we've got to check out at the new house. You want to come with us?ScenesJoey: No, thank you.ScenesMonica: All right. I know you're not happy about us moving, but you're the only one who hasn't seen the house.ScenesChandler: Yeah, come with us. You'll see how close it is to the city.ScenesJoey: But no, it's not close. You said it was in escrow? I couldn't even find it on the map.ScenesMonica: Joey, please come. It would mean so much to us.ScenesJoey: You know what? You are my friends, I wanna be supportive, I will come with you. SHOTGUN!ScenesChandler: Damn it.ScenesMonica: See you guys later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesMonica: (to Joey) I'll pick you up at eleven. So glad you're coming.ScenesPhoebe: Good for you. That was really mature.ScenesJoey: What? No, the only reason I'm going to their stupid new house, is so I can point out everything that's wrong with it, so they don't move. I'm gonna make them stay here.ScenesMike: You're a strange kind of grown-up.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, you can't make someone do something they don't want to do. Believe me, there's something I've been trying to get Mike to do in bed and there's... he's just...ScenesMike: Woo-wo-hey-hey-hey... Can we not talk about that right now?ScenesPhoebe: All right, prude... Look, Monica and Chandler really love this house. You are not gonna talk them into staying here.ScenesJoey: Hey, hey... I can convince people to do anything, you know. I bet I can even get Mike to do that "thing". What is it?Scenes(Phoebe whispers something in Joey's ear, but after hearing it he jumps up, shocked)ScenesJoey: I AM NOT GONNA HELP YOU DO THAT! Goodbye! (he leaves)Scenes

rows.Scenes: A restaurant. Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (to maitre d') Hi, I'm here to see mr Campbell... with Gucci. The reservation is probably under Gucci. It's spelled like Gukki, which could be confusing.ScenesMaitre d': Mr Campbell's not here yet. Let me show you to his table.Scenes(They walk to the table, but Rachel suddenly gasps. Sitting there is mr Zellner, her boss from her current job at Ralph Lauren.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! That's my boss. You have to seat us somewhere else.ScenesMaitre d': I'm sorry. That's always mr Campbell's table.ScenesRachel: But my... but my boss cannot see me. I'm interviewing for another job.ScenesMaitre d': I know. With GukkiScenesRachel: Sssshhhh!ScenesMr Zellner: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Hi... I'm on a date...ScenesMr Zellner: (confused) That's great!ScenesRachel: Yeah, it is. Yeah, you know, it's tough. Single mom, career... You gotta get out there.ScenesMr Zellner: Well, you got uhm... good energy.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesMr Campbell: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yes, hi!ScenesMr Campbell: James Campbell...ScenesRachel: Hi! (to mr Zellner) Excuse us.ScenesMr Campbell: Please... (shows her to sit)ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh, yeah... (whispering to mr Zellner) Oh he's cute!ScenesMr Campbell: So... your resumé is quite impressive. (Mr Zellner who sits behind Rachel shrugs)ScenesRachel: Wha... My resumé? I wouldn't... I wouldn't call my online dating profile a resumé.ScenesMr Campbell: Dating profile? I-I-I'm talking about the work resumé.ScenesRachel: (starts singing la la la la) Whatever happened to just singing for no reason? Huh?ScenesMr Campbell: Maybe people... found it weird.... So, why do you want to leave Ralph Lauren?ScenesRachel: What? I-I don't.ScenesMr Campbell: You don't?ScenesRachel: No, I-I-I love it there.ScenesMr Campbell: Well, if you don't want to leave, why are we having this lunch?Scenes(Rachel mimes and mouths to mr Campbell "That is my boss", pointing to mr Zellner)ScenesMr Campbell: What?Scenes(Rachel now silently whispers "That's my boss".)ScenesMr Campbell: That's Hugo Boss?Scenes(Rachel holds her hand in order to support her head. Mr Zellner obviously overheard the conversation.)Scenes

rows.Scenes: A counter at a government building. Phoebe's waiting in line.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the woman behind her) This place is so depressing. If I had to work here I'd kill myself. (she turns around and the clerk behind the counter heard her.) But you obviously haven't.ScenesClerk: How can I help you?ScenesPhoebe: I need to change my name, please. See, I need to change it because I'm-I'm hiding from the law. (the clerk shows no change in expression whatsoever) You're fun.ScenesClerk: You need to fill out this form. (motions for the next person in line)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well, I just don't, I don't know how it works exactly. See, my name is Buffay and my husband's name is Hannigan, so is it supposed to be Buffay-Hannigan or Hannigan-Buffay?ScenesClerk: It can be anything you want.ScenesPhoebe: Well, not anything, I mean...ScenesClerk: Yeah... anything.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this could take a while.ScenesClerk: Get out of my line.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Chandler and Monica are there when Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, not anymore. I changed it today.ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm sorry, mrs Hannigan.ScenesPhoebe: Wrong again! Apparently you can change it to anything you want. So I thought, all right, here's an opportunity to be creative. So meet Princess Consuela Banana Hammock.ScenesChandler: That's what we were gonna name the baby.ScenesMonica: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Uh! Princess Consuela.ScenesMonica: You seriously changed your name to that?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!ScenesMonica: Okay, so from now on we have to call you Princess Consuela?ScenesPhoebe: Uhm, no. I'm gonna have my friends call me Valerie.Scenes(Rachel enters, looking depressed)ScenesChandler: Hey, how'd the interview go?ScenesRachel: Oh! It's not good.ScenesChandler: You know, I always feel that way after an interview. I'll bet it went better than you think.ScenesRachel: Well, I didn't get the job at Gucci and I got fired from Ralph Lauren.ScenesChandler: That is a bad interview.ScenesPhoebe: What are you, what are you talking about? How did this happen?ScenesRachel: Well, my boss was at the same restaurant where I was having my interview and he heard everything. So later he calls me to his office and he tells me that he's gonna have to let me go, because I'm not a team player. And I said "Wait a minute! Yes I am." and I had to sit there for 45 minutes while he proved that that in fact... was true.ScenesMonica: Oh God. I'm so sorry.Scenes(Ross enters with a bottle in his hand)ScenesRoss: Hey! Wha-hoo! What's this? (showing the bottle) Well it's a, it's a bottle of champagne. Why is this here?ScenesPhoebe: Ross...ScenesRoss: I guess it's here because I GOT TENURE!ScenesAll (except Rachel): Congratulations! (Rachel looks devastated)ScenesRoss: This is the single greatest day of my professional career. Gunther, six glasses!ScenesGunther: Six? You want me to join you?ScenesRoss: Oh, I thought Joey was here. Five is good. (Gunther leaves, hurt) Well, I'm gonna have a loogie in my coffee tomorrow.ScenesChandler: Ooh! Israeli champagne. And it's vanilla!ScenesRoss: I got tenure. I didn't win the lottery... Hey Rach, so uh... how did your thing go?ScenesRachel: Oh it... good! Yeah, but I'm not gonna hear from that for a couple of days.ScenesRoss: Oh, you know what? You're gonna get it. I-I-I-I can feel it.ScenesPhoebe: Can you?ScenesRachel: Ah, all right. Here's to Ross!ScenesRoss: And-and to years of hard work finally paying off.ScenesPhoebe: And to knowing that your career doesn't mean everything. (Rachel mouths "aah")ScenesRoss: But also knowing it means a lot.ScenesMonica: But more importantly to full well-rounded lives.ScenesRoss: ...that center around work.ScenesChandler: To Ross!ScenesAll (except Rachel): Ross!Scenes(they all drink from the champagne, but clearly dislike the taste of it)ScenesRoss: You know what the best part about this is? I can never be fired.ScenesPhoebe: Oh God!ScenesRoss: No seriously. I have job security for life. You know, I never have to worry. (Rachel starts crying) Oh, look at you. Look how happy you are for me.ScenesRachel: (crying) No, it's not that. I got fired today. And I didn't get the other job.ScenesRoss: Rach, I'm so sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesRoss: Great. I feel like an idiot.ScenesRachel: No, it's okay, you didn't know.ScenesRoss: Oh... (to the others) Little heads-up would have been nice.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's future house. They enter the living room with the realtor and Joey.]
rows.Content: Monica: Thank you for letting us see the house again.ScenesChandler: And thank you for explaining to us what escrow means... I've already forgotten what you said, but thank you.ScenesRealtor: Take as long as you want. Just let me know when you're through. (she leaves the room)ScenesMonica: Ah, so glad you decided to come.ScenesJoey: Me too. Yeah, this place is great. I'm so happy for you guys. Although, you know, I hope you like fungus.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Fungus! Yeah. Place is full of it.ScenesMonica: No it's not. We had an inspection and they didn't find anything.ScenesJoey: Okay. Then I guess I have dry eyes and a scratchy throat for no reason.ScenesMonica: Maybe because it's you hung your head out of the window like a dog the whole ride here.ScenesJoey: Maybe. So this is the living room huh? Ooh, it's pretty dark. (starts feeling around him like he's in a completely dark room, touching Chandler, who backs out and hits him)ScenesMonica: No it's not!ScenesJoey: (squinting his eyes) Are you kiddin'? I think I just saw a bat in the corner!ScenesChandler: When your head was hanging out the window, it didn't hit a mailbox, did it?ScenesJoey: (glares at him for a moment, then admits grudgingly) Maybe. Well, I just think you guys can do better than this house, you know? Or any other house for that matter.ScenesMonica: Oh Joey, look, we know you're having a hard time with this, but we really, we love it here.ScenesJoey: FINE, ok, if you love this house so much, then you should just live here, okay? I just hope you get used to that weird humming sound. (He turns his back to them and starts humming) Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...ScenesMonica: Joey, we know that's you.ScenesJoey: no... hmmmmm... it's not... hmmmmmmmmmmScenes

rows.Scenes: Phoebe is at Central Perk. Mike enters.]
rows.Content: Mike: Hey (He kisses Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: Welcome back!ScenesMike: Ah! I missed youScenesPhoebe: Oh, me too!ScenesMike: So, what's new?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm no longer Phoebe Buffay.ScenesMike: That's great! You changed you name?ScenesPhoebe: Yes I did! Meet: Princess Consuela Banana Hammock! (She smiles from ear to ear)ScenesMike: (afraid) You're kidding right?ScenesPhoebe: Nope.ScenesMike: You really did that?ScenesPhoebe: Yep.ScenesMike: Yeah, but you can't do that.ScenesPhoebe: Why? It's fun, it's different, no-one else has a name like it.ScenesMike: (looks at her astonished) Alright, then I'm gonna change my name.ScenesPhoebe: Great, okay, what are you gonna change it to?ScenesMike: Crap Bag.ScenesPhoebe:(not amused) Mike Crap Bag?ScenesMike: No, no Mike, just Crap Bag. First name Crap, last name Bag.ScenesPhoebe: You're not serious, right?ScenesMike: Yeah, I'm serious. (sarcastic) It's fun, it's different and no-one else has a name like that!ScenesPhoebe: Uhu, uhu, well, then, great. If you love it, I love it.ScenesMike: I do love it, and I love your name. I love Princess Consuela.ScenesPhoebe: And I love Crap.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey is in Monica and Chandler's future house, sitting in a child's bedroom, looking at a quiz card which has "5+10=" printed on one side.]
rows.Content: Joey: (turns the card around, obviously had the wrong answer) Ow!Scenes(A young girl enters)ScenesGirl: Who are you?ScenesJoey: Oh, hi, I'm Joey. My stupid friends are buying this house. Who are you?ScenesGirl: I'm Mackenzie. My stupid parents are selling this house.ScenesJoey: (understanding) Oh.ScenesMackenzie: (sighs) I hate my parents.ScenesJoey: I hate my friends. (They shake on it as if they just made a pact) Alright, look. There's gotta be a way that we can stop this from happening.ScenesMackenzie: Like what?ScenesJoey: (thinking) Uhm... oh! Okay. You come with me, and you tell them that the house is haunted!ScenesMackenzie: What are you? Eight?ScenesJoey: Woah, uh! Okay, let's hear your great idea.ScenesMackenzie: I don't have any great ideas. I am eight.ScenesJoey: (frustrated) Ahh! There's gotta be a way. I mean, you know, if Monica and Chandler move out here and now Phoebe is married to Mike. That just leaves me and Ross and Rach, you know what I mean?ScenesMackenzie: I really don't.ScenesJoey: What am I gonna do, I feel like I'm losing my friends.ScenesMackenzie: My parents say I'm gonna make new friends.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, sure, easy for you, you're young. Me, I'm set in my ways.ScenesMackenzie: This is what my mom was talking about. Whiners are wieners. (Joey glares at her angrily) Look, you want your friends to be happy, right?ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, I guess.ScenesMackenzie: Well, if moving here is gonna make them happy, don't you want them to do it?ScenesJoey: (having difficulty admitting it) Yeah, maybe.ScenesMackenzie: Then you gotta let them go.ScenesJoey: (In near tears, realizes she is right) I hate to admit it, but you're probably right. How did you get to be so smart?ScenesMackenzie: I read a lot.ScenesJoey: (his mood changes instantly) Just when I thought we could be friends. (he leaves the room)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Outside Ralph Lauren building. Rachel just walked out carrying a box of her stuff, and a strange man approaches her.]
rows.Content: Man: Hey Rach, I just heard. I'm so sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh, thank you... (looks at his face trying to remember his name)ScenesMan: You still don't know my name, do you?ScenesRachel: (Is embarrassed for a moment, but it quickly passes) Well, now I don't have to. (The man leaves instantly)Scenes(In the meantime, Ross is trying to squeeze and push a rather large chair through the revolving doors of the Ralph Lauren building.)ScenesRachel: (annoyed) Ross, what is taking you so long?ScenesRoss: (stares at her through the door and starts pushing the chair harder, looking very annoyed. He finally manages) (sarcastic) I'm sorry, it's almost as if this wasn't built for a quick getaway!Scenes(Mark, approaches from behind and recognizes her)ScenesMark: Rachel?ScenesRachel: (turns around) Mark? Oh my God! (puts the box on the chair and they hug each other)ScenesMark: How've you been?ScenesRachel: I'm fantastic. You remember Ross?ScenesMark: Sure, sure. (To Ross) What's with the chair. (Rachel signals him not to mention she's been fired)ScenesRoss: Uh, you know, you can't always get a seat on the subway, so... (laughs stupidly)ScenesMark: Clever. (back to Rachel) So how are you?ScenesRachel: Oh, well, (looks at her box and chair) you're not catching me on my best day.ScenesMark: Yeah, a box full of your desk stuff doesn't exactly say big promotion.ScenesRachel: No, but it's good, you know, I'm gonna take some time off and do some charity work.ScenesMark: Are you sure, because we may have something at Louis Vuitton.ScenesRachel: Well, screw charity work. What've you got?ScenesMark: Why don't we have dinner tonight and talk about it?ScenesRachel: Great! I'll call ya!ScenesMark: (shakes Ross' hand) Nice to see you.ScenesRoss: Yeah! yeah, I got tenure! (Mark looks at him strangely and walks off)ScenesRachel: (very excited) Oh my God!ScenesRoss: See? I told you something good would come along. And he seemed really nice. I've met him before?ScenesRachel: Ross! That's Mark. From Bloomingdales? You were insanely jealous of him.ScenesRoss: (realizing) That is Mark?ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesRoss: I hate that guy.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: No, no, NO, you cannot go to dinner with him.ScenesRachel: What? You don't want me to get a job?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, I'm sure he's gonna give you a job. Maybe make you his SEXretary.ScenesRachel: Ugh.ScenesRoss: I'm serious. I just don't trust that guy, okay?ScenesRachel: Ross, you know what? (looks over to the door and sees security staring at them) Okay, let's talk about it later, there comes security. (Takes her box and leaves. Ross follows her and then returns for the chair. He stands for a moment, then pushes it quickly in the general direction Rachel went into, and out of the camera's view, and then nonchalantly walks away)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's new house. Sitting near the window, they look at the neighborhood.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, I love this street. The trees, the big front yards, the actual picket fences.ScenesChandler: Man, those two dogs are going at it!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey, where have you been?ScenesJoey: Oh, just er... you know, looking around. But you know what? This house... is great.ScenesChandler: Really? What changed your mind?ScenesJoey: Oh well, the little girl who lives here made me feel a lot better about the whole thing.ScenesChandler: Joey, there was a little girl who lived here, but she died like 30 years ago.Scenes(Joey's eyes double in size)ScenesJoey: (frightened) What?ScenesChandler: Ha! I'm just messing with you.ScenesJoey: That's not funny! You know I'm afraid of little girl ghosts!ScenesMonica: Joey, now that you're okay with the house, do you wanna go see your room?ScenesJoey: What? I get my own room?ScenesChandler: You don't think we'd buy a house and not have a Joey room do you?ScenesJoey: Oh my God! (they all hug) Oh! Hey, can I have an aquarium? And a sex swing?ScenesChandler and Monica: No!ScenesJoey: Why not? I'll keep the tank clean.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe and Mike are leaving.]
rows.Content: Mike: After you, miss Banana Hammock.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you, mister Bag.Scenes(a woman enters and recognizes Phoebe)ScenesWoman: Oh hey, how are you?ScenesPhoebe: Oh hi Rita! Good! (to Mike) Oh, Rita's a massage client.ScenesMike: Oh! Why don't you introduce me?ScenesPhoebe: (shrugs) Er, Rita, this is my husband.ScenesRita: Oh! (they shake hands)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMike: Why don't you tell her my name?ScenesPhoebe: (without moving her lips, wearing a fake smile) Okay, I will. (to Rita) This is my husband Crap Bag.ScenesRita: Crap Bag?ScenesMike: If you need an easy way to remember it, just think of a bag of crap.ScenesRita: Okay. Excuse me...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah... Ogh... Okay, fine. You made your point. Can you please just be Mike Hannigan again?ScenesMike: Only if you'll be Phoebe Buffay.ScenesPhoebe: How about uhm... How about Buffay-Hannigan?ScenesMike: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I'm Phoebe Buffay-Hannigan Banana Hammock.ScenesMike: Do you even know what a banana hammock is?ScenesPhoebe: It's a funny word.ScenesMike: It's a Speedo.ScenesPhoebe: ...Oh crap!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, is Rachel here?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRoss: She's still at dinner?ScenesMonica: I guess. Why? Who's she with?ScenesRoss: That guy Mark. From Bloomingdale's... She thinks he's just being nice to her. But I know he really wants to sleep with her.ScenesChandler: It's seven years ago. (he looks surprised) My time machine works!ScenesRoss: We ran into him on the street today and he said he might have a job for her. But I know he just wants to get into her pants.ScenesMonica: So what if he wants to sleep with her? I mean, she's single and he's cute.ScenesChandler: Excuse me?ScenesMonica: Oh please! Yesterday on the subway? You couldn't stop staring at that woman with the big breasts the whole time.ScenesChandler: For your information, I was staring at her baby. We're about to be parents.ScenesMonica: Oh, sorry!Scenes(She looks at Ross, a bit ashamed. Chandler mimes "big breasts" to Ross and lip syncs "Wow". Ross looks at him, astonished and then Monica looks at Chandler again. A little too late he changes the "big breasts" mime into "rocking a baby". When he realizes Monica might have seen it he also strokes his imaginary baby's head.)ScenesRachel: (entering) Hi you guys!ScenesRoss: Hey, so uhm... How was dinner?ScenesRachel: Oh, it was great. Mark is so sweet.ScenesRoss: (speaking without pause, agitated) Oh yeah? Yeah? I wonder why? What could that smarmy letch possibly want?ScenesRachel: Oh Ross, come on. He's happily married. His wife just had twins.ScenesRoss: Should we send something?ScenesChandler: How did the job stuff go?ScenesRachel: He offered me one.ScenesChandler: That's great!ScenesRoss: Congratulations!ScenesRachel: I know, it's amazing. It's amazing. It's so much better than what I had at Ralph Lauren. The money is great...ScenesRoss: Can we, can we just stop for a second? Who said something better would come along, huh? You didn't believe me. I told you everything was gonna work out. (gasps) You know what? This calls for a bottle of Israels finest.ScenesRachel: The job is in Paris. (they all stare at each other)Scenes ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's. Joey's on the phone.]
rows.Content: Joey: I mean, this soap opera is a great gig, but... am I missing opportunities? You know, I've always thought of myself as a serious actor. I mean, should I be trying to do more independent movies?ScenesMackenzie: (at the other end of the line) I don't know... You know what? I'm gonna put you on with my bear. Hold on. (she puts the phone at the bears ear)ScenesJoey: Hey bear, I need some career advice.ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1015 - The One Where Estelle DiesScenesTeleplay by: Tracy Reilly ScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted Cohen ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Sebastiano & VanessaScenes[Flashback scene from last week, Monica and Chandler's kitchen, Rachel, Ross, Monica and Chandler are there.]ScenesJennifer: Previously on Friends...ScenesChandler: How did the job stuff go?ScenesRachel: He offered me one.ScenesRoss: (gasps) You know what? This calls for a bottle of Israels finest.ScenesRachel: The job is in Paris. (we see Ross stare in disbelief)ScenesFADE OUTScenesRachel: Oh, God! Please, somebody say something.ScenesRoss: So if you take this job you'll be moving to Paris?ScenesChandler: Or facing a bitch of a commute.ScenesRachel: I know, it's huge, and it's scary, and it's... really far, far away from you guys, but this is such an incredible opportunity for me. And I've already talked to them about our situation with Emma, and they said they'll do whatever we need to make us feel comfortable.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: I mean, I'll fly back and forth, they'll fly you out... Anything we want.ScenesChandler: My boss said I might be getting a new lamp in my cubicle. (Monica looks at him and can't really place what he just said)ScenesRoss: All right, we'll work it out.ScenesRachel: Thank you! Thank you!ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah! (they hug) You sure this is what you want?ScenesRachel: I think it is. (Ross looks very sad. Phoebe and Joey enter.)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, what's going on?ScenesRachel: I got a really incredible job offer.ScenesJoey: Hey, great! All right!ScenesPhoebe: Good for you!ScenesRachel: It's in Paris.ScenesJoey: What? No, no, no! No, no... no... no, no... No, too much is changing, okay? First, Phoebe getting married (to Phoebe) Congratulations! (pointing to Monica and Chandler)... and then these two move into a stupid house in the stupid suburbs...ScenesMonica: Hey, this afternoon you said you'd be supportive...ScenesJoey: Well, it comes and goes. I wouldn't trust it.ScenesRachel: Look, you guys... this is really, really important to me. And it means a lot if you could try to get on board.ScenesPhoebe: Of course we can. Congratulations. (they hug, but Joey shakes his head.) Yay! (she gestures Joey to come and join in) Joey...ScenesJoey: No, no, no. My hugs are reserved for people STAYING IN AMERICA.ScenesRachel: (walking towards Joey) Joey, it would mean so...ScenesJoey: Hey! No! Get your France-going-arms away from me. (He walks out, and Rachel follows him)ScenesRachel: Joey...ScenesPhoebe: You okay with this?ScenesChandler: Well, it makes me feel sad, but...ScenesPhoebe: Talking to Ross.ScenesChandler: I see.ScenesRoss: Well, Rachel moving to another country? Not being able to see her every day. How can I be okay with this?ScenesMonica: I know, but what are we gonna do? She really needs this job.ScenesRoss: Do you think if the Ralph Lauren people offered her her old job back, she would take it?ScenesMonica: How is that gonna happen?ScenesChandler: Is this the best way to use one of your three magic wishes?ScenesRoss: I don't know. I could talk to her boss. Yeah! I met him at that Christmas party. We really hit it off.ScenesMonica: You mean the guy who kept calling you Ron?ScenesRoss: I didn't say we were brothers.ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe's reading a newspaper. Chandler and Monica walk in.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey Phoebe. Hey, tell me what you think. All right. The house next door to the one that we're buying in Westchester? Just went on the market. I wanna take a look at it, but Chandler doesn't.ScenesChandler: We close escrow tomorrow, so seeing another house can only confuse us, and we're easily confused. We're not very bright.ScenesMonica: But what if it is better than ours? Should we at least look?ScenesChandler: What do you think Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think that shirt makes you look like you should work at a Baskin Robbins... Anyway... Hey, isn't Joey's agent Estelle Leonard?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: She died.ScenesChandler: You're kidding!ScenesMonica: That's terrible!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, last Saturday. Wow! She was the first black man to fly solo across the Atlantic. (Chandler and Monica look puzzled) Oh, wait a minute, I read the wrong one.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she was just an agent.ScenesMonica: Joey's gonna be *so* upset.ScenesChandler: I know. *He* always wanted to be the first black man to cross the Atlantic.ScenesPhoebe: Well, we cannot tell Joey about this. He's already flipping out about everything that's changing. This will push him over the edge.ScenesMonica: Seriously, you don't think we should tell him?ScenesPhoebe: Well, not for a little while. Let's just give him a few days to get used to everything else.ScenesMonica: What if he reads it in the paper?ScenesChandler: Unless Snoopy says it to Charlie Brown, I think we're okay.

rows.Scenes: Ralph Lauren. Mr Zelner's office. Ross knocks on the door and enters.]
rows.Content: Mr Zelner: May I help you?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I'm a friend of Rachel Green's. Uhm, actually we met at the Christmas party about two years ago.ScenesMr Zelner: Oh right, uhm, Don?ScenesRoss: Close. Ron. (shakes hands)ScenesMr Zelner: Uh... What can I do for you?ScenesRoss: Uhm, well... I'm here to see if you'll give Rachel her job back.ScenesMr Zelner: Ah, did she ask you to come here and do this?ScenesRoss: Oh, no. At first I have to get you to agree. Then we'll see if she wants to come back.ScenesMr Zelner: Wow, that is tempting.ScenesRoss: Look, she loved her job here. And let's face it: you're not gonna find anyone who did it as well as she did it. Isn't that true?ScenesMr Zelner: She is good!ScenesRoss: (surprised) Huh, I took a shot there.ScenesMr Zelner: But I'm sorry. There's nothing I can do... Ah, it's not true, there is... nothing I want to do.ScenesRoss: I see... Thanks very much. (he gets up and walks to the door. On his way out he looks at the photographs Mr Zelner has near his door. He picks one up.) Is this your son?ScenesMr Zelner: Yeah, his name is Ross. (Ross looks very surprised) What?ScenesRoss: Oh, nothing, it’s just, it’s close to Ron. Does he.. Does little Ross like dinosaurs by any chance?ScenesMr Zelner: Yeah, they're all he talks about, why?ScenesRoss: How would he like to come with me to the Museum of Natural History after everyone else has left, just the two of us, and he can touch anything he wants. (Mr. Zellner looks shocked). I just heard it as you must have heard it and that’s not good. Let me start again. I’m a paleontologist, you’ll be there with us and the touching refers only to bones… fossils!ScenesMr Zelner: You can really arrange that?ScenesRoss: You let Rachel come back, and it’s done.ScenesMr Zelner: Well, I guess having Rachel back wouldn’t be the worst thing in the world.ScenesRoss: Yeah! Yes! Thank you! This is great. Thank you so much. And I swear, your kid is going to have the time of his life.ScenesMr Zelner: That’s great. I worry about little Ross. He’s always reading, he's collecting rocks and he’s obsessed with dinosaurs.ScenesRoss: He’ll be fine.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe’s reading, Joey has just entered the room]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Hey. Everything ok?ScenesJoey: I’m just mad at my agent.ScenesPhoebe: Estelle? Why?ScenesJoey: There’s a part in a TV movie that I would be perfect for and I didn’t even be put up for it! She’d better have a good reason.ScenesPhoebe: I’m guessing she does.ScenesJoey: Well (taking his cell phone out of a pocket) I’m wanna hear it, because she keeps doing this.ScenesPhoebe: Well, no, no, wait, wait, wait. All right, I gotta go. Just listen. Promise me, that you will wait a minute before you call her.ScenesJoey: Ok. Why?ScenesPhoebe: Because a promise between friends means never having to give a reason. (she leaves)ScenesJoey: I love that saying!Scenes(Phoebe is outside, taking her cell phone out of her bag and making a call. Joey is inside, and his mobile phone starts ringing).ScenesJoey: Hello?ScenesPhoebe (doing Estelle): Joey, it’s Estelle.ScenesJoey: I was just gonna call you! That’s weird.ScenesPhoebe-Estelle: It’s a little coincidental, but believable. (Joey nods in agreement). Listen, I’m sure you’re wondering why I didn’t get you an audition for that TV movie.ScenesJoey: Yeah, actually I am!ScenesPhoebe-Estelle: I guess I dropped the ball there. Whoopsie!ScenesJoey: That’s it? You know, it seems all you do lately is drop the ball.ScenesPhoebe-Estelle: Don’t take that tone with me. Who you think you are? Alan Lemond, the first black man to fly solo across the Atlantic?ScenesJoey: No, no, look. All I’m saying is that you’re my agent, ok? And you’re not getting me into any auditions and I’m tired of it.ScenesPhoebe-Estelle: What are you saying?ScenesJoey: I’m saying that… (pause). This isn't working for me anymore, ok? Estelle, you’re fired. Goodbye. (he hangs up the phone).ScenesPhoebe: Man, tough week for Estelle!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Rachel’s there and Ross enters the room with a stuffed dinosaur]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesRoss: Emma left her stuffed t-rex at my house. You know she can’t sleep without it.ScenesRachel: Oh, well, she’s asleep now. Stop forcing that thing on her.ScenesRoss: Ok.ScenesRachel: Oh, you’re not gonna believe what happened to me today! Ralph Lauren called, and gave me my job back!ScenesRoss: Nooo!ScenesRachel: Yee. I mean, it was so weirdest thing. They fired me and then out of nowhere they just hire me back! I mean, that place must have been falling apart without me.ScenesRoss: So, you’re not going to Paris.ScenesRachel: No, I’m still going.ScenesRoss: Wh… wh…what?ScenesRachel: When the Louis Vuitton people found out that Ralph Lauren wanted me back, the offered me more money! Isn’t that great?ScenesRoss: Yeeeah! (They high-five)Scenes

rows.Scenes: house next to the one the Bings are moving into. Chandler and Monica knock, a lady opens the door.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi. We’re buying the house next door, and we were wondering if we could just take a look around.ScenesLady: Oh, sure. I’m showing it to someone else right now, but please, look around.ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesChandler: It feels like we’re cheating on our house. And if we’re gonna cheat, shouldn’t it be with like a hot, younger house, that does stuff that our house won’t do?ScenesMonica: Ours is so much better! This living room is smaller, the dining room looks like a cave! What a hole!ScenesLady: So? What do you think?ScenesMonica: Love it!ScenesLady: Well, we already have one offer on it, and I think the lady upstairs is goning to make another one.ScenesMonica: They could be our neighbors, what are they like?ScenesLady: Oh, the woman upstairs is very nice. She and her husband have two kids, he's on Wall Street and she…ScenesJanice: Oh my God!Scenes(Chandler and Monica are speechless).ScenesChandler (to Monica): Sure.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. He’s there and Phoebe comes in.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey Joey, want come with me to… are you ok?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I just… I just feel bad about firing Estelle. This is got to be killing her.ScenesPhoebe: No, that wouldn’t kill her. Ordinary embolism might.ScenesJoey: I don’t know. She’s got to be taking it hard, I was like her only client. Except for this guy who eats paper. And I’m guessing he eats more money than he makes. Look, I know she’s not a great agent, but she did stick with me for ten years. I’m gonna call her and hire her again.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no! Don't call her! You wait for her to call you (Joey considers it)ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesPhoebe: Because patience is the road to understanding (she thinks) which ... is the key... to a happy heart.ScenesJoey: (impressed) You blow me away.ScenesPhoebe: (picking up her bag) All right, so promise you're gonna wait for her to call you?ScenesJoey: I promise. And that means, never having to give a reason. (Phoebe stops herself from laughing and leaves)Scenes

rows.Scenes: The house Monica and Chandler are viewing. Janice comes down the stairs.]
rows.Content: Janice: What a small world!ScenesChandler: And yet I never run into Beyonce!ScenesRealtor: You two know each other?ScenesJanice: Oh, we go way back. Before Monica made an honest man out of him, Chandler used to be my little love muffin! (does her irritating laugh). So? Are you guys thinking of getting this house too? Ooh! Are we gonna have a bidding war? I'd better warn you, I'm a toughie (playfully punches Chandler, who tries to get away from her)ScenesChandler: (at Janice's punching) Don't, don't! (looks disgusted)ScenesMonica: No, actually, we're buying the house next door. (Janice gasps)ScenesChandler: (To Monica and with bulging eyes) Why!?ScenesMonica: (looks confused and scared) I don't know why.ScenesJanice: Ooh, that decides it then. I was on the fence. But knowing that you two would be our neighbors? Ah! now we have to get it! (Chandler and Monica are utterly shocked) Ellen, we're going to talk numbers. (Grabs Ellen by her elbow and pulls her outside)ScenesChandler: This can not be happening!ScenesMonica: Okay, the realtor said another couple made an offer. Maybe the Janice's won't get it! Maybe the other couple will.ScenesChandler: The only way that that is going to happen, is if the other couple are the Hitlers.ScenesMonica: (Thinks a little more) Okay, Okay, (clapping her hands) All right. What if we got both houses? Huh? We can turn this house into a guest house.ScenesChandler: That is a great idea! And by the way, I don't mean to sound distasteful, but when did you start crapping money!?ScenesMonica: Okay, you come up with an idea.ScenesChandler: Alright alright, we still have three hours till escrow closes on our house. We can still get out.ScenesMonica: But we love our house.ScenesChandler: Will we love it so much with her next door? And she's gonna be louder out here too. Just the crickets and (apes Janice's voice) "Oh My God"!ScenesMonica: Okay, but if we don't get this house, she's stil gonna show up wherever we go! I mean, at least if she's here, it eliminates the element of suprise. I mean, never again will you have to hear the three words that make your balls jump back up inside your body. (She shows this with her index finger, mimicking it pushing something up)ScenesChandler: (looks afraid, but at the same time, knows she's right) Well, we have to do something. We can't have her living next door. (Janice's laughs loudly outside) Oh, that does it too. (Motions with his index finger like Monica did)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Mr. Zellner's office. There is a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: r Zelner: Who is it?ScenesRoss: (enters) It's me. Ron. (Mr. Zellner looks annoyed) Look, I um, I now Rachel turned you down but I think there is a way you might be able to get her to come back.ScenesMr Zelner: This may surprise you, but re-hiring fired employees, is not my main job.ScenesRoss: Just hear me out. How would you feel about offering her a raise? (looks hopeful)ScenesMr Zelner: (obviously amused) Not good, Ron.ScenesRoss: Perhaps I can persuade you. What if you can give your son this (Takes a huge egg out of his back) genuine pterodactyl egg (whispers) replica.ScenesMr Zelner: (Takes a long look at the egg while he considers it) Wow, that's pretty cool (Takes the egg from Ross)ScenesRoss: Huh? So? We have a deal?ScenesMr Zelner: Okay, you got it.ScenesRoss: Yes! yes!ScenesMr Zelner: This is gonna make me very popular.ScenesRoss: Oh, (grins) Believe me, the ladies, they love it!ScenesMr Zelner: (looks at Ross, for a long moment, confused) I meant with my son.ScenesRoss: Good, 'cause the ladies, not so much. (shakes his head, give him a thumbs up and leaves)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. He walks in reading his mail, and plays back his messages on the answering machine]
rows.Content: Answering machine: Joey, this is Al T. Booker, (Looks annoyed that he called him) the guy who eats paper. I'm sure you've heard that Estelle passed away. (Looks shocked) I wanted to let you know there's a memorial for her at the Westside chapel, tomorrow at ten. Hope you can make it.ScenesJoey: Oh my God. (Still in shock when his mobile rings, he picks it up) Hello?ScenesPhoebe: (on the other side of the line, still pretending to be Estelle) Joey, it's Estelle. (Joey's eyes bulge up, he looks afraid)ScenesJoey: Estelle?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I wanted to call and tell you that there's no hard feelings for firing me.ScenesJoey: (still scared) Ok-ay. I just, I can't believe you're calling me?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I didn't think I should just drop by...ScenesJoey: No, no, no! (Starts looking around the room, terrified) Don't drop by, don't drop by!ScenesPhoebe: Anyway, you did what you had to do. I'm okay.ScenesJoey: Can I ask you something? Uhm, what's it like there?ScenesPhoebe: (Looks around) It's alright. Look kiddo, I gotta go. Good luck with the career. You're gonna be huge.ScenesJoey: Thanks for everything Estelle. Bye. (Hangs up and reads the phone display) "out of area". Boy, I'll say.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The house next door to Chandler and Monica's new house. Chandler is pacing worriedly through the living room when Janice enters.]
rows.Content: Janice: Well... I just talked to Sid, we are definitely putting in an offer on the house... a-a-and I'll bet we get it.ScenesChandler: The Hitlers will be so disappointed.ScenesJanice: All right, I got to run. Tell Monica I say goodbye. And... I'll see you later, neighbor. (Janice laugh)ScenesChandler: Wait! I just want you to know that... I'm so happy you're going to be here.ScenesJanice: Oh, me too... (laughs)ScenesChandler: Because... that way... we can pick up where we left off.ScenesJanice: Huh?ScenesChandler: I never stopped loving you.ScenesJanice: Oh... my...ScenesChandler: Yeah, yeah, yeah! I want you... I need you... I must have you Janice Litman Goralnik Neihosenstein.ScenesJanice: Chandler, what are you talking about?ScenesChandler: Now that you live next door, we can be together every day. Sid and Monica never have to know a thing.ScenesJanice: I don't know what to say... I mean, you know, obviously we have this... heat between us.ScenesChandler: (stunned) Obviously.ScenesJanice: But I love my husband. And I know you love your wife. Now, I don't think we should get this house now.ScenesChandler: Don't say that. Don't tangle the dream and take it away.ScenesJanice: Chandler, one of us has got to be strong.ScenesChandler: I understand.ScenesJanice: Although, maybe just... one last moment of weakness... (she kisses Chandler flat on the mouth. Chandler squirms. When she's finished, he looks at her lovingly but uneasily.) Goodbye Chandler Bing. (She leaves)ScenesChandler: (speaking as in pain) They're never coming down now.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment. Ross is working on his laptop when Rachel enters with Emma.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: You are never going to believe what happened to me today.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Ralph Lauren called again and they offered me more money.ScenesRoss: They did?ScenesRachel: Yeah. It was the weirdest thing. Zelner called me and he said we'll do everything we can to get you back. And that I should thank some Ron... I don't even know what department that guy's in.ScenesRoss: So, what are you gonna do?ScenesRachel: Well, I took it.ScenesRoss: That's great! So you're staying in New York!ScenesBoth: YAY! WHOO! YAY!ScenesRoss: You're excited, right?ScenesRachel: (hesitant) Ye-ah. Yeah! You know, the money's great. It's certainly the easier choice...ScenesRoss: Right!ScenesRachel: Yeah, you know, was I looking forward to going to Paris? Sure. You know, was I excited about working in the fashion capital of the world? Ooh, absolutely... Oh...! Yeah, but you know, this is... it's fine. I'm fine going back to a job where I've pretty much gotten everything out of that I possibly can... (she sits down, and Ross who is stunned to hear all this follows her example)ScenesRoss: Uhm, I hadn't no you... I had no idea you were so excited about Paris. Uhm, I mean, you said you were scared.ScenesRachel: Well yeah, but I mean, it was good scared though, you know? Like when I-moved-to-New-York scared. Or uhm, when I-found-out-I-was-gonna-have-Emma scared... But this is... fine. This is gonna be good. (they both stare around)ScenesRoss: (after a long pause) You should go.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: It's what you want. You should go.ScenesRachel: You really think so?ScenesRoss: I really do.ScenesRachel: But I already told Zelner that I would come back...ScenesRoss: (picks up a skull of some carnivore from his side table and puts it in the same bag in which he brought the pterodactyl egg to Zelner) I'm sure he'll understand.ScenesRachel: All right. ALL RIGHT! I'm gonna do it. I'm gonna go to Paris.ScenesRoss: Yeah...ScenesRachel: Yeah! I'm going to Paris. Thank you, Ross!ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah, oh! (They hug)ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, I'm so happy.ScenesRoss: Then I'm happy too. (They're still hugging - fade out)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Estelle's memorial service. Joey is giving a speech. Next to him is a blown op photograph of Estelle behind her desk and there's a man standing next to him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Thank you all for coming. We're here today to pay respects to a wonderful agent and a beautiful woman... (Joey looks at the photograph) ..inside. As Estelle's only two clients we would like to say a few words. (Joey looks for his notes. The man next to him is chewing something.) Dude, where's my speech? (the man swallows something and looks at Joey.) That is entertaining. Al Zebooker everybody. (he applauds and Al shows that there's nothing left in his mouth.)ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1016 - The One With Rachel's Going Away PartyScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy Knoller ScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Joey's place. Rachel and Joey are talking]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, all right, all right, let's play one more time, ok? And remember, if I win you do not move to Paris.ScenesRachel: Ok! Can't believe I'm risking this again, but you're on! All right Joe, you remember the rules! Heads I win, tails you lose.ScenesJoey: Just flip!ScenesRachel (she flips the coin): Ha, tails!ScenesJoey: Damnit!Scenes(Chandler and Monica enter the room)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: So we thought we'd throw you little going away party around seven.ScenesRachel: Oh, that sounds good!ScenesMonica: Hey, Rach, you're leaving tomorrow, shouldn't you be packing?ScenesRachel: It's all done!ScenesMonica: Oh, yeah, right! And after I took a shower this morning I just threw my towel on the floor! Oh God, it hurts to even joke about it.ScenesRachel: I know... Honey, seriously, I did it all. The luggage that I'm taking is in the bedroom, this is Emma's Paris stuff, these are the boxes that I'm having shipped, and that's the sandwich that I made for the plane...ScenesMonica: Ok, so you've done some good work! (pause) What about your carry-ons?ScenesRachel: Oh, well. Everything that I need (she takes her bag) is in here and my travel documents are on the counter organized in the order that I will be needing them.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! I have nothing left to teach you! (they hug)ScenesChandler: Where's your passport?ScenesRachel: It should be right next to my plane ticket.ScenesChandler: Well, it's not.ScenesRachel: What? Maybe I put it in here (she opens her bag). Oh, oh, it's not in there! Oh, no! I must have packed it in one of these boxes!ScenesMonica: Here, let me help you. (they both start opening boxes)ScenesRachel: Shoot. Oh, I can't believe I did this!ScenesChandler (to Joey): At what point did it stop being funny that I took her passport?Scenes ScenesOPENING SEQUENCE

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Monica and Erica are talking about the baby, and Monica is rubbing Erica's tummy.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, wow, can you believe you're like three weeks away?ScenesErica: I know.ScenesMonica: You don't mind me touching your belly, do you?ScenesErica: No, I don't mind you touching my belly, but right now your hand is kind of blocking the part where the baby is gonna come out.Scenes(She takes her hand off Erica. Ross enters the room)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesErica: Hi.ScenesRoss: Hey Erica, welcome back to town! (pause) Wow, look how big you've gotten.ScenesErica: That's because I'm pregnant!ScenesRoss: Right, no, I understand.ScenesErica: Oh, ok. I'm just always afraid that people think I'm just fat with big breasts.ScenesRoss: No, no, I knew (he stares at her breasts).ScenesMonica (to Ross): Okay, well, stop staring at them.ScenesRoss: She brought them up! (pause) I didn't realize you were coming back so soon!ScenesErica: Hey, well, in a couple of weeks I won't be able to travel.ScenesMonica: Yeah, and I wanted her to get to know the doctors and get settled into the hotel.ScenesRoss: Hotel? Why isn't she staying with you guys?ScenesMonica: Because we're moving in a couple of days and it just didn't make sense.ScenesErica: Plus hotels are fun! My room has this little fridge full of free snacks!ScenesRoss: Erica, those things aren't free. In fact they have one of the highest mark-ups of any consumer product...ScenesMonica: Ross! She's giving us her baby. She can eat you if she wants.ScenesErica (standing up): I'll be right back.ScenesRoss: Oh man, I can't believe you guys are leaving this place.ScenesMonica: Oh, I know. I know. Hey, you know, you can take it if you want! The lease is still in Nana's name.ScenesRoss: No, no. This will always be your place. It would be too sad. Plus, how much a month does it cost to feed Joey?ScenesMonica: Yeah, it takes two incomes.ScenesRoss: Hey, is Chandler here? We talked about catching a movie.ScenesMonica: Oh, no. He doesn't have time for that. But if you want, you can go help him and Joey pack up the guest room.ScenesRoss: Mhm, (he balance things) packing - sexy cheerleader comedy.ScenesMonica: Mhm, helpful brother - creepy loner at teen movie.Scenes(Ross takes the tape roll she's handing him and walks to the guest room while mocking Monica's voice)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Guest room. Joey has his head wrapped in bubbled wrap and Chandler is punching him. Ross enters the room.]
rows.Content: Ross: What are you guys doing?ScenesJoey: Try it, I can't feel a thing! (Ross starts punching him too)ScenesMonica (enters the room): Are, are you kidding? This is packing?ScenesChandler: We're taking a break!ScenesMonica: From?ScenesChandler: Jumping on the bed?ScenesMonica: All right, Rachel's party is in a couple of hours and there's a lot to do. Now, Ross, you got Geller blood, you're in charge of these yahoos!ScenesRoss: You got it! (Monica leaves, Ross closes the door). All right, she's right, we gotta get serious. (He grabs a bag of styrofoam peanuts) Let's put styrofoam peanuts down his pants and kick him!ScenesChandler: No, no, no, guys. She's right. We should get to work. I'll take stuff out of the closet, Joey you pack 'em and Ross you re-pack whatever Joey packs.Scenes(Joey takes the bubble wrap off his head)ScenesJoey: You guys hear a ringing?ScenesChandler: (holding a pair of furry handcuffs) What the hell is this?ScenesJoey: Hey! Handcuffs! And fur line, nice! I didn't know you guys had it in ya!ScenesRoss: Chandler, you don't have a sister so you can't understand how much this bums me out.ScenesChandler: I didn't know Monica had these!ScenesJoey: Mhm, maybe she used them with another boyfriend. Maybe Richard!ScenesChandler: Why would she use them with Richard and not me? I can be kinky! I once did a naked dance for her... with scarves!ScenesRoss: Bumming hard, guys, bumming hard.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Phoebe and Ross enter the room.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! Where's Mike?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, he has a gig. I kinda like being married to a rock star, you know. My husband has a gig.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Yeah, where is it?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, he's playing organ for a children's roller-skating party.ScenesRoss: Rock on!ScenesPhoebe (watching the food on the table): Wow, this is quite a spread! (pause) What is all this stuff?ScenesMonica: Well, I thought this would be a great opportunity to use up all the food that I don't want to move to the new house with me! So, enjoy: smoke oyster casserole with a breakfast cereal crust, kidney beans in their own juices, and for dessert, a questionable orange.ScenesJoey: (entering the room) Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey, where's Rach?ScenesJoey: Oh, she's putting Emma down, she'll be over in a second.ScenesRoss: Great.ScenesJoey: Now it just hit her that she's leaving and she's kind of emotional so no one say anything to set her off, ok?ScenesMonica: Yeah.Scenes(Rachel enters the room)ScenesEverybody: Hey Rach, hey you.ScenesRoss: Here she is!ScenesRachel (crying): Hi you guys!ScenesJoey: What did I just say?ScenesRachel: No, no, no. It's ok. I'm gonna be fine.ScenesMonica: Come here, I'll make you a drink.ScenesRoss: Oh, man! I can't believe she's actually leaving. How am I gonna say goodbye to Rachel?ScenesChandler: I know, she's been such a big part of my life. And it feels like when Melrose Place got cancelled. (Ross and Joey looks puzzled) I mean... oh, forget it. I miss Melrose Place!ScenesJoey (to Ross): You know, I had a chance to stop her too!ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Who loses fifty seven coin tosses in a row? Head she wins, tails I lose. (he stops and starts realizing something) Wait a minute...ScenesChandler: Yes, Joe?ScenesJoey: I forgot to pick up my dry cleaning!ScenesPhoebe (to Rachel): You doing ok?ScenesRachel: Well, I've been better.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-hmm.ScenesRachel: You guys are gonna come and visit me, right?ScenesPhoebe: Yes! You know, in six months the Statute of Limitations runs out and I can travel internationally again!ScenesRachel: I'm gonna miss you so much.ScenesPhoebe: I know.ScenesRachel: You know what? Uhm, I have some goodbye stuff that I wanted to say to each of you and I was gonna save it until the end of the night, but come here (they go into the guest room).ScenesRoss: Hey, what do you think they're doing in there?ScenesJoey: Huh, if I had to guess I'd say Rachel is putting on the bubble wrap and Phoebe is doing the punching.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Guest room. Rachel and Phoebe are sitting on the bed.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Pheebs, I don't even know where to start.ScenesPhoebe: Ok well, before you do, I know we weren't supposed to get you going away presents, (she takes something out from her pocket) but I do have something for you.ScenesRachel: Oh, oh. (she's holding the present, a transparent bag with a white stick in it). What is this?ScenesPhoebe: It's a cotton swab with a bit of my saliva on it, so that if they perfect the cloning process while you are over there, you can use the DNA to create your own Pheebs!ScenesRachel: I'm gonna throw this away, but thank you so much for the gesture!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. The living room.]
rows.Content: Monica: Chandler? I was just in our bedroom and I found these (she holds the furry handcuffs) on my pillow.ScenesChandler: Oh, yes. I decided to leave these out for you in case Richard stops by and you wanna engage on a little light bondage and moustache play!ScenesMonica: What are you talking about? These aren't mine.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, right! Good luck getting another scarf dance from me!ScenesMonica: That would be a terrible punishment. But, I'm serious, I've never seen these before.ScenesChandler: Really? Then what are they doing in our guestroom?ScenesMonica: Rachel used to live in that room.ScenesChandler: Rachel... with handcuffs! Interesting! (he looks excited)ScenesMonica: Joey's bare ass!ScenesChandler: (he doesn't look excited anymore). Well played.Scenes(Phoebe and Rachel enter the living room.)ScenesRachel: I love you Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: I love you too. (they hug) Please don't... Don't turn into... you know... French bitch! (they hug again)ScenesRachel: All right. Well, if I gonna do this, I'd better keep going.ScenesPhoebe: Ok.ScenesRachel: Ok. Monica?ScenesMonica: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Can you come here with me for a minute?ScenesMonica: Sure.ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Are you wearing waterproof mascara?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you're so screwed. (Monica goes into the guest room)ScenesRoss: (to Phoebe) Hey. What was that all about?ScenesPhoebe: She's gonna say goodbye to each of us individually.ScenesRoss: Are you kidding? Oh my God...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know, it's gonna be even worse for you... God... Ross, get ready to do some serious crying.ScenesRoss: Oh, man, I'm not going to be able to handle this. (pause) Now I know how my students feel at the end of each year. And why they act out by giving me such bad evaluations.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The guest bedroom. Rachel and Monica are talking to each other.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Mon... Okay... I've gotta... just say what it is I'm gonna say... None of the amazing things that have happened to me in the last ten years, would have happened if it wasn't for you. No-one has been more like a sister to me...ScenesMonica: I know what you mean. You're like a sister to me too.ScenesRachel: (starts crying and speaking at the same time, making it almost impossible to understand what she's saying) I wouldn't know what I'm gonna do without you...ScenesMonica: (having the same problem) You're the best friend I ever had.ScenesRachel: (says something that cannot be understood)ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: I... I... I... (again saying something that cannot be understood)ScenesMonica: That is so sweet. (they hug)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Back to the living room. Monica and Rachel enter and hug each other. The guys see this.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Joey) Oh no, she took down Monica... And I'm the crier in the family. Oh God! I could be next. Maybe she won't talk with me if it looks like we're deep in converstation. Oh, so that thing you said about the thing. It really made me think about that other thing.ScenesChandler: Uh, Rach?ScenesRoss: Well it's okay. Chandler is talking to her.ScenesJoey: I really made you think about that thing uh?ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) Uh, Rach... I think I have something that belongs to you. (shows her the cuffs)ScenesRachel: (laughs) Oh, I'm sure gonna miss pretending to laugh at your weird jokes that I don't get.ScenesChandler: No, no, no... They're really yours. We... found them in your old room.ScenesRachel: Well, these aren't mine. Maybe Monica used to use them with...ScenesChandler: Don't say Richard! Well, if they're not Monica's and they're not yours, then whose are they?ScenesRachel: Well, I think you're forgetting the kinkiest former resident of that room.ScenesChandler: Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: (from the other side of the room) Yeah!ScenesChandler: I think these are yours.ScenesPhoebe: These are not mine... Look how flimsy they are, come on! Good God! You try to hang a guy from a waterpipe with these, they'll snap like a piece of licorice.ScenesRachel: (to Chandler) Can I talk to you alone for a minute?ScenesChandler: Sure. (to Phoebe) You don't really handcuff guys to waterpipes do you?ScenesPhoebe: Where do you think Mike really is? (she giggles, Chandler looks aghast)Scenes

rows.Scenes: The guest bedroom. Chandler and Rachel.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh honey...ScenesChandler: Let me just say something... Because once we get into this, I'm gonna get all uncomfortable and probably make some stupid joke... I just want to say that I... I love you... And, I'm gonna miss you. And I'm so sad that you're leaving.ScenesRachel: (all mushy) Oh, you know what? Let's not say anything else. I love you. (they hug)ScenesChandler: Ooh, not so tight... (blows raspberry, and the hug ends) I'm sorry, just give me one more chance.ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh...Scenes(Chandler blows raspberry again)ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesChandler: I'm sor... Just go. Just go. I can't, I can't.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's living room. We look outside to the balcony where Rachel is saying goodbye to Joey.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Ross) So, I guess you're next. You're ready?ScenesRoss: I don't think so.ScenesChandler: Oh, you're definately not. I haven't cried like that in years.ScenesMonica: You cried yesterday at the six o'clock news.ScenesChandler: That old woman was being scammed by her mechanic.ScenesRoss: God! I can't believe she saved me for last. (looking out to the balcony) Why are they taking so long?ScenesPhoebe: I don't know. But, God, Joey seems to be handling it suprisingly well.Scenes(Rachel and Joey hug, and Rachel turns to enter the apartment through the side window again. At that moment Joey tries to climb over the edge of the balcony.)ScenesAll: No, no, no, no!Scenes(Rachel rushes back and pulls Joey back onto the balcony, and takes him inside.)ScenesRoss: Okay, here we go...ScenesRachel: Oh... (holding Ross's shoulder) Well...ScenesRoss: Yeah...ScenesRachel: I think I'm gonna take off. (pats Ross on his back, but he looks very surprised)ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesRachel: Oh, you guys. This was an amazing night. Thank you so much. I love you. Good night.Scenes(She leaves the apartment and they all stare at Ross)ScenesRoss: What? I don't get a goodbye?ScenesJoey: (still very emotional) Lucky bastard!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment continued... Phoebe, Chandler, Monica and Joey are sitting down and Ross is pacing up and down.]
rows.Content: Ross: Unbelievable. She says goodbye to everyone but me.ScenesMonica: Well, maybe she thought that with all of your history it could be, you know, implicit.ScenesRoss: Well, it needs to be plicit.ScenesJoey: All right, let's think about this. I mean, there's got to be an explanation. Uh... did you do anything to make her mad?ScenesRoss: No, I don't think so.ScenesPhoebe: You know, maybe she was just really spent from our talk. It was pretty intense.ScenesMonica: Yeah. Mine too.ScenesChandler: Mine was a humdingerScenesRoss: (annoyed) O-kay... I mean, don't I deserve anything? I mean, a few tears, a cursory hug? (Joey gives Ross a hug) NOT FROM YOU! (Joey lets go)ScenesPhoebe: Ross, if you're this upset, you should go and talk to her.ScenesMonica: And say what? "You owe me a goodbye", I mean, he's got more pride than that.ScenesRoss: THE HELL I DO!Scenes(Ross takes big steps leaving for Joey and Rachel's apartment, where Rachel is going through her papers.)ScenesRoss: I don't get a goodbye?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: (talking agitated and angry) Everyone gets a goodbye but me? What have I got to do to get a goodbye, huh? Be best friends with you? Uh, go out with you? Have a baby with you? Oh wait a minute, wait a minute, I did all those things.ScenesRachel: Ross...ScenesRoss: Oh no, maybe it's me, I'm just not giving you enough credit. Uh, I mean it is difficult to say goodbye to five people. Uh, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, good... (makes choking noises) IT'S PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE. You know what? After all we've been through, I can't believe this is how you want to leave things between us. Have a, have a good time in Paris. (He leaves the apartment. Rachel looks kind of desperate.)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. The others are still there.]
rows.Content: Monica: I hope Ross isn't too upset.ScenesJoey: I'm sure he's not more bummed out than I am.ScenesPhoebe: Tell me about it.ScenesChandler: Well, you can't say we don't know how to throw a party.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I think I'm gonna head out.ScenesMonica: Uh, where do you think you're going?ScenesPhoebe: I thought I was going home to go to bed, but I'm sensing there's something less fun for me to do here.ScenesMonica: We're moving in a couple of days and we've got a lot of packing to do. It would be great if you guys could pitch in.ScenesChandler: Joey and I can finish up in the guest room.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, yeah, good idea. (he mimes hitting his head with his fist)ScenesMonica: Oh no! You and Phoebe are gonna help me in here.ScenesChandler: (to Joey) You couldn't be cool. (he goes to the guest bedroom)ScenesMonica: Okay, we're gonna start in the kitchen. Plates get put into plate protectors and stacked ten to a box. The silverware gets bundled in rubber bands and then bubble wrapped. Got it?ScenesPhoebe and Joey: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Good! Now I need you to be careful and efficient. And remember, if I am harsh with you, it is only because you are doing it wrong.ScenesChandler: Hey Mon, I think I figured out whose handcuffs they are.ScenesMonica: You did? How?ScenesChandler: Well, I was cleaning out the closet and I found some pictures of them... being used.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Let me see. (they all look at the pictures)ScenesJoey: Who's that dirty old lady?ScenesChandler: Monica's grandmother.ScenesMonica: Nana liked it rough!Scenes(Erica, the pregnant girl, enters)ScenesErica: Hi!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: Come on here, have a seat.ScenesPhoebe: How was your night?ScenesErica: Oh, it was okay.
