Well played, Phoebe Buffay, well played.ScenesRachel: Alright, enough, enough, come on. Let's just all go in at the same time.ScenesAll: Alright, okay. (Phoebe reaches for the door, and tries to open it but it's locked)ScenesPhoebe: It's locked.ScenesRoss: Wha...? Oh sure, now they lock it, but when they're having sex on the couch, its like: "Come on in, my butt is surprisingly hairy".ScenesRachel: Alright, come on... (starts to knock on the door) Alright, you guys. We're so sorry we're late. Please let us in, so we can have dinner together.Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: No! Everything's cold. The turkey's dried out and the... the stuffing is all soggy.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and there's a bowl of cranberry sauce that... (speaking lower to Monica) what happens to cranberry sauce?ScenesMonica: (Rolling her eyes) Nothing. It's fine.ScenesChandler: (relieved) Oh thank God!Scenes[cut to the hall]ScenesRoss: Come on you guys, we're sorry, alri...? Our subway broke down.ScenesChandler: (looking through the peephole) That's a lie, you went to the game, I can see Joey's hand.ScenesRoss: (to Joey, who is wearing a blue, 3 foot hand) FOR THE LOVE OF GOD TAKE IT OFF!! (takes it off his hand and throws it on the floor)ScenesRachel: You guys, come on, it doesn't matter why we're late. We're all here now, please let us in so we can have some of your delicious turkey. (A slice of turkey on a piece of aluminum foil is slid under door)ScenesJoey: I had a dream once about a fax machine that did that. (Ross picks it up)Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: That's all the turkey you're gonna get.Scenes[cut to the hall]ScenesRoss: How are we gonna decide who gets this?ScenesJoey: (holds his fist up) WATER BALLOON! (he stuffs the slice in is mouth and gives the foil back to Ross)ScenesPhoebe: What are we gonna do? I'm starving.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh, I just remembered. We do have something to eat. Monica put something in our oven this morning.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah!Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]ScenesMonica: Hey, you touch that and you will be sorry.ScenesChandler: Guys, I'd listen to her. The vein is bigger than I've ever seen it. (Monica looks at Chandler)Scenes[cut to the hall]Scenes(Rachel comes out of the apartment holding a pot. Joey holds in anticipation and Rachel opens it)ScenesRachel: Huh... OH MY GOD IT'S BRUSSELS SPROUTS. (they all look appalled)ScenesRoss: That's worse than no food.Scenes[cut to Monica and Chandler]Scenes(Monica looks insulted)ScenesChandler: HA-HA! All you got was Monica's stinky Brussels sprouts!ScenesMonica: Stinky?!ScenesChandler: Please let me stay on this side of the door.Scenes[cut to hall]ScenesRachel: Oh, I know... I still have my old key! (She goes in to get it and comes back with her keys) We can just unlock the door.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I don't know if that's such a good idea. They clearly don't want to be with us.ScenesRachel: You know what? I don't want to be with them either, but it's Thanksgiving and we should not want to be together, together. (Goes to unlock the door)ScenesJoey: (to Ross) Just get in there and make a face to face apology, you know? Look them in the eye. I know I can get them to forgive us.ScenesRoss: I don't know...ScenesJoey: I'm telling ya... (his eyes open wide and he looks like his eyes are about to pop out. He stares at Ross like this without blinking) I can do it.ScenesRoss: (Staring back, and then breaks off) (To Phoebe and Rachel) Yeah, he can do it!Scenes(Rachel finally manages to open the door, but the door chain is on.)ScenesRachel: Oh!Scenes(Joey sticks his head through the gap. Monica and Chandler are now sitting at the dinner table. There is another smaller table full of food standing in front of the front door)Scenes(Monica and Chandler do not look amused by Joeys head in the door)ScenesJoey: Oh! It all looks so beautiful: the turkey, the stuffing...Scenes(Monica is now smiling)ScenesChandler: The cranberries...?ScenesMonica: Oh! Enough! A monkey could have made 'em!ScenesJoey: (still with his door wedged in the door gap, now opens his eyes wide and stares at Monica and Chandler as he did with Ross earlier in the hall) Hey listen guys, we feel really terrible.ScenesChandler: He's doing that weird eye contact thing. Don't look at him, don't look at him! (They both look away)ScenesJoey: Come on you guys, we want you to know we're (His eye widen even more) very very sorry. (Monica and Chandler are now covering their eyes with their hands) (then to the others in the hall) Right guys?Scenes(Ross head appears above Joey's, Rachel's below Joey's and Phoebe's at the bottom)ScenesRoss: I feel terrible.ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: So, so sorry.ScenesJoey: (smiling) Now let's not ruin this day. You worked so hard. Let's move past this and try to have a nice meal all together, huh?ScenesChandler: The floating heads do make a good point.ScenesMonica: Yeah, they do seem to feel pretty bad.ScenesRachel: So bad.ScenesRoss : So bad.ScenesPhoebe: So bad.ScenesMonica: (Gets up) Okay, okay. You two (to Phoebe and Rachel) go get the dessert. And I'll let you in.ScenesRachel: Dessert?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I asked you and Phoebe to pick up the pies. You did remember, right?ScenesPhoebe: Pies, oh, we thought you said priiiize (goes to the hall and comes back with Emma's trophy in her hand). Here! (gives it to Monica).Scenes(Monica takes it and reads the label)ScenesMonica: Grand Supreme Little Darling?ScenesRachel: Congratulatioooons!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! YOU FORGOT THE PIES? Well, I cannot believe this. You force me to make dinner, then you're an hour late and you forget the one little thing that I asked you to do.ScenesRoss: Really girls, not cool.ScenesChandler: Well, you manheads aren't any better. You lied about going to the game. You knew it would make you late, and you still went anyway.ScenesJoey: Hey! I'm getting a little tired of this okay? We said we're sorry. It's Thanksgiving for Pete's sakes! A day of forgiveness!ScenesRoss: It's a day to be thankful.ScenesJoey: (to Ross, mouthing) Don't make me come up there!ScenesMonica: It's too late for apologies.ScenesJoey: Fine! Let's just go. I don't need your stupid dinner.ScenesChandler: That would be a lot more convincing if you weren't drooling.ScenesRachel: Ewww, is that what that is?ScenesJoey: Sorry!ScenesPhoebe: Come on you guys, let's just do our own Thanksgiving.ScenesRachel: Yeah! I'll cook!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Let's go out.ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: Yeah! You three have a nice Thanksgiving.ScenesMonica: The three of us?ScenesJoey: Yeah! You, Chan, and the vein!Scenes(Monica gasps and holds her forehead. Phoebe, Rachel and Ross pull back their heads)ScenesJoey: Ha!Scenes(When Joey tries to pull back his head, he notices he is stuck)ScenesJoey: Oh-oh! I'm stuck!ScenesMonica: Joey, that is not gonna work.ScenesJoey: No seriously... I'm really wedged in here.ScenesPhoebe: I'll pull you through.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesJoey: (in agony) aaw-ahhh-aaahhh STOP! STOP! I'm worried about damaging my head.ScenesChandler: A little late for that.ScenesJoey: Alright, hurry up, you gotta do something.ScenesMonica: Alright, well, this does not change anything. (to Chandler) Okay, we need to get something to grease the sides of his face.ScenesChandler: Uhm, we've got turkey grease.ScenesMonica: Bring it.ScenesJoey: I just wanna say that I'm sorry I referred to the vein as a seperate person...Scenes(Chandler gives Monica a footlong "eye dropper" with the turkey grease in it)ScenesMonica: Here you go!Scenes(She squirts some of the grease along Joey's face.)ScenesJoey: Oh, that smells good!Scenes(And he starts licking the grease which trickles down his face. Monica also squirts some on the other side of his face, and his tongue follows her movements.)ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay, try it.Scenes(Joey tries to pull back at all his might.)ScenesJoey: It isn't working.ScenesMonica: Alright, we're gonna have to unscrew the chain.ScenesJoey: Well hurry, I can't feel my ears!ScenesChandler: Can you ever feel your ears?ScenesJoey: Interesting...ScenesMonica: Chandler, where are your tools?ScenesChandler: (sarcastically) Oh, I left them on my bulldozer... I don't have tools!ScenesMonica: I do, but Rachel borrowed them.ScenesRachel: I lent them to Ross.ScenesRoss: I gave them to Joey.ScenesJoey: I left them at the park.ScenesMonica: Oh!ScenesRoss: (looking at Joey's butt) I'm finding it really hard not to mess with him.ScenesPhoebe: I've already stuffed a bunch of Brussel sprouts down his pants.ScenesRoss: Nice!Scenes(The phone rings in Chandler and Monica's apartment)ScenesMonica: Okay, I have to get that. Now when I get back, I want you and your friends to be gone. Thanksgiving is over. The Vein has spoken.ScenesJoey: It's really starting to hurt.ScenesChandler: Okay, look, I'm gonna pull on the door and you guys push as hard as you can. Maybe we can get enough room to wiggle him out, okay? Okay, so PUSH!ScenesPhoebe: Just a sec., we're kind in the middle of something here.Scenes(Rachel, Ross and Phoebe have their hands full and are stuffing all kinds of things down Joeys pants.)ScenesJoey: Ooh! Stop putting things down my pants!ScenesChandler: Come on guys, PUSH!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Come on!ScenesJoey and Chandler: PUSH! PUSH! PUSH!Scenes(The chain breaks loose from the wall, and because Joey was pushing with all his might, he propells into the kitchen, towards the table with all the food. This table has wheels underneath it, and when Joey falls on this table, he rides into the living room, with all the food falling off, until finally Joey also falls off... Joey gets up quickly, a bit agitated, and acting as nothing happened. He is covered in food stains.)ScenesChandler: My cranberries!ScenesJoey: (looking at himself) Man, I've got food all over me.Scenes(He licks his fingers, liking it. He offers Chandler a taste.)ScenesChandler: Argh! I can't believe what you did. Monica's gonna kill you!Scenes(Monica enters from the spare bedroom.)ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Look! Look! Look what the... Look what... Look what the floating heads did!ScenesMonica: (very emotional) I don't care.Scenes(Chandler can't believe what he's hearing. He looks at Monica, then at the others, then back at Monica.)ScenesChandler: What's going on?ScenesMonica: That was the adoption agency...ScenesChandler: And?ScenesMonica: WE'RE GETTING A BABY!ScenesChandler: Are you serious? (they hug)ScenesMonica: There's a pregnant woman in Ohio, and she picked us!Scenes(They all cheer and Rachel, Ross and Phoebe join in for a group hug. Joey also joins, but he stands back a bit, because he is all sticky of the food on him)ScenesRachel: I'm so happy for you!ScenesMonica: This Thanksgiving kicks last Thanksgiving's ass!Scenes(They all cheer and hug again, but Joey's eating the food off his shirt)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. The table is set, and there's food on the tables again. They're all there, toasting.]
rows.Content: Rachel: To Monica and Chandler... and that knocked up girl in Ohio.ScenesRoss: I'm just so happy you guys are finally getting a kid.ScenesPhoebe: I know. Have you considered pageanting?ScenesMonica: I can't believe they called, and we're actually getting a baby. (she kisses Chandler)ScenesJoey: Oh, I know how you feel...Scenes(Monica and Chandler are looking curiously at Joey.)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Sure. I went through the exact same thing with Alicia Mae Emory... The waiting, the wandering... Then one day... I get that call from Toys "R" Us... She was in stock!ScenesChandler: That is the exact same thing.ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1009 - The One With The Birth MotherScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock and Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everyone's sitting on the couch.Monica and Chandler enter]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: We're just here to say goodbye, we're off to Ohio.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, right! Your adoption interview!ScenesMonica: Yep, we're gonna meet the lady who could be carrying our baby.ScenesJoey: I can't believe it. When you guys come back, you're gonna have a baby! That is so weird!ScenesChandler: And so incorrect!ScenesMonica: She's only a couple of months pregnant. She liked our application but who knows if she's gonna like us.ScenesRoss: Come on, she's gonna love you guys!ScenesChandler: Uhm, thank you, but we're really trying not to get our hopes up.ScenesMonica: And a lot could still get in our way.ScenesChandler: Yeah. I mean, this girl could decide against adoption or she could like another couple better..ScenesPhoebe: What are you gonna name the baby?ScenesChandler: I can develop a condition in which I talk and talk and no one hears a word.ScenesJoey: But just think, ok? What if everything goes right? What if this woman does pick you guys?ScenesMonica: Oh my God. She's gonna pick us!ScenesChandler: So we're standing firm on the 'not getting our hopes up'?ScenesMonica: You know, I know that things could still go wrong but if they don't? If this works out, we're gonna have a baby Chandler, a baby!ScenesChandler: Yes, but...ScenesMonica: Oh my God, it's gonna WORK! We're gonna make it work! I'm gonna be a mummy and (to Chandler) you're gonna be a daddy! All right, I'll see you suckers. I'm gonna get me... A BABY! {she leaves)ScenesChandler: Oh, screw it, I'm gonna be a daddy!!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe's speaking to a girl.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (to Joey) Hey, who's Phoebe with?ScenesJoey: I'm gonna say someone I'm gonna have sex with. (the girl leaves and Phoebe goes toward the couch) (to Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: So... who's your friend?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, that's Sarah. No, no. Don't you get any ideas, ok? No, I'm not setting you up with any more of my friends!ScenesJoey: OW, why, why, why?ScenesPhoebe: Because you'll date her once, sleep with her and then forget she exists!ScenesJoey: Oh, name one friend of yours that I did that with.ScenesPhoebe: Mandy.ScenesJoey: Mandy, uh? Uh... really hot blonde, big boobs?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesJoey: I know why I don't remember her, huh? (he winks at Rachel)ScenesRachel: Do you think I'm someone else?ScenesJoey: Ok, I may not have treated your friends well in the past, but I have grown up a lot, really. Honest, Rach?ScenesRachel: Well, believe it or not, it's true. When Joey and I were together, he was wonderful. He was thoughtful and mature. And for the one week that we went out, he didn't sleep with anybody else!ScenesJoey: (pointing at himself) Growth!ScenesPhoebe: Fine, I'll give you her number.ScenesJoey: Ok, thank you. And I promise you I will not forget this one. (he starts writing on his hand) Mandy.ScenesPhoebe: SARAH!ScenesJoey: Saraaah.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey you guys, I need some fashion advice.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesRoss: (he takes a baby blue beret out of a shopping box and puts it on) How does this look?ScenesRachel: Well, it's a little low... pick up a little... (Ross picks it up) a little bit more... (he picks it up again) a little bit more... (he takes it off) There you go! (pause) Now throw it away!ScenesRoss: C'mon! This looks good!ScenesRachel: Ross, please, trust me. I buy 30 fashion magazines a month. Now, I don't know who's running for president or who that... NATO guy is, but I do know that you have to get as far away as you can from that hat.ScenesRoss: Damnit! I have this date tomorrow night and I have to look cool!ScenesPhoebe: Well, you know, if you want fashion help, Rachel and I are going shopping tomorrow. You're more than welcome to come with us, right?ScenesRoss: Really? That would be great. I mean, I have to do something, she kinda teased me about how I dress.ScenesJoey: I can see why, nice shirt!ScenesRoss: You're wearing the same shirt.ScenesJoey: Stupid Gap on every corner!

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are entering with a man.]
rows.Content: Agency guy: Please, make yourself comfortable and I will back in a moment with Erica.ScenesMonica: Ok, thank you.(the man leaves) Uh, well this is it. Are you OK?ScenesChandler: Yeah. Just weird, you know. It's like: "Hi, I'm Chandler. May I have the human growing inside you?ScenesMonica: Uh, we're gonna be great.ScenesChandler: You're gonna be great.ScenesMonica: Well... obviously!ScenesAgency guy: (he enters with Erica) Monica, Chandler. I'd like you to meet Erica.ScenesMonica: Hi. It is so, so nice to meet you.ScenesErica: (whispering) Hi...ScenesChandler: Thank you so much for agreeing to see us.ScenesErica: Hi.ScenesAgency guy: I'll let you get acquainted.ScenesChandler: Ok.ScenesErica: So, it's Monica and Chandler. I only know you as file 0W33815-D.ScenesChandler: That's what our friends call us.ScenesErica: Gosh, you know, you're just such an amazing couple. It's... kind of intimidating.ScenesMonica: I don't know about that.ScenesErica: You're kidding me? I mean, it's enough that you are a doctor. But on top of it, you're married to a reverend?ScenesChandler: (astonished) I don't think that's exactly...ScenesMonica: (overlapping) Let her finish, doctor.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my friend Sarah had a great time last night.ScenesJoey: Well...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! So you're gonna call this one back?ScenesJoey: Nope.ScenesPhoebe: What are you talking about? Sarah's great!ScenesJoey: Oh, really? You know what your great friend did? We're out to dinner, ok? (he starts talking about the date and we can see what happened through a flashback video) We're getting along, having a really nice time. I was thinking she was really cool. And then, out of nowhere...Scenes(Sarah picks up some fries from Joey’s plate and Joey looks very angry. Then we’re back to Central Perk and Joey does a you-see-what-I-mean look to Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: That’s it? That’s why you won’t go out with her again? So, she took some fries, big deal!ScenesJoey: Hey, hey, look! It’s not about a few fries... it’s about what the fries represent.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: ALL FOOD!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I can’t believe I set you up with such a MONSTER!ScenesJoey: Hey, hey, hey, hey. Look. I take a girl out, she can order whatever she wants! The more, the better! All right? Just don’t order a Garden salad and then eat my food! That’s a good way to lose some fingers!Scenes(Rachel enters from the main door)ScenesPhoebe: (to Rachel) OhScenesRachel: HiScenesPhoebe: Thank God you’re here. Listen to this!ScenesRachel: what?ScenesPhoebe: Joey and my friend were out last night and having dinner and she reaches over and takes a few of his fries...ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, no!Scenes(Joey looks satisfied)ScenesPhoebe: What? You know about the plate thing?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah. Joey doesn’t share food. I mean, just last week we were having breakfast and he had a couple of grapes on his plate and ...ScenesPhoebe: (to Joey) You wouldn’t let her have a grape?ScenesRachel: Oh no! Not me! Emma!Scenes(Phoebe looks horrified and she turns to watch Joey)ScenesJoey: (mad and pointing a finger to himself) JOEY DOESN’T SHARE FOOD!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I still think that it’s a stupid reason not to call someone again. You are calling her! And if you need to, just get an extra plate of fries for the table!ScenesJoey: (he thinks a little, considering the option and seems to be quite satisfied) I like that! A sharing buffer! Yeah! I’ll order some extra fries! Maybe a plate of onion rings. Yeah. And a shrimp cocktail. And some buffalo wings. Maybe an individual pizza, uh? And some mozzarella sticks. (he looks absorbed in his food thoughts) What were we talking about?

rows.Scenes: A clothes store. Ross and Phoebe are shopping]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Ross) This place is awesome!ScenesRoss: You know, we should just go, I’m not gonna find anything here! This stuff is ridiculous!Scenes(Rachel arrives with a lot of clothes)ScenesRachel: Ah, this place is great!ScenesPhoebe: Wow!ScenesRoss: Rach, come on, I’m not gonna wear any of this! (he picks up a shirt) Nothing silver. (Rachel sighs). Ok? Nothing with hair! (Rachel sighs again) And nothing with padlocks on it! (Rachel heaves a long disappointing sigh).ScenesRachel: Ross, look, I know that some of this stuff is out there, but I mean, come on, look at this, look at this sweater! (she picks up a blue sweater). I mean, this is just beautiful!ScenesRoss: (feeling the fabric) Wow, this is really soft (he looks the price). Three hundred and fifty dollars?ScenesRachel: Yeah, down from seven hundred, you are saving like two hundred bucks!ScenesRoss: Both logic and math are taking a serious hit today.ScenesPhoebe (walking to Ross carrying a black leather jacket): Hey, check this out! It’s totally you!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!Scenes(Ross wears the jackets and look at himself in the mirror)ScenesRoss: Actually this looks like pretty good! Yeah!(he turns and watches his back and there’s a sign on the back of the jacket, “boys will be boys”) Boys will be boys?ScenesPhoebe: What? They will be!ScenesRoss: All right, that’s it, I’m getting out of here.ScenesRachel: No, no, no, no! Ross, wait! Come on! You know, there’s other stuff. Here’s a nice shirt, look at these nice pants...ScenesRoss: Uh, actually these might look pretty good on me.ScenesRachel: Yes, they will! You know what you should do? Just go take a walk, all right? I know your size and I’m... I’m gonna pick up some really good stuff for you.ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesRachel: Yes! And I know what looks sexy on guys. Please, just wear what I suggest, and she’s gonna go nuts for you.ScenesRoss: So, you’re saying, uh, if I wear these pants I might be getting into hers?ScenesRachel: (to Phoebe) Why do men keep talking to me like this?

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are still talking with Erica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So, the fact that I am a doctor, and my wife’s a reverend, that’s important to you?ScenesErica: Yeah, I read some great applications, but then I thought “who better then a minister to raise a child!”ScenesMonica: Amen.ScenesChandler: Plus I thought the baby would be in good hands with a doctor!ScenesMonica: Uh, good hands. (she holds Chandler hands) Healing hands.ScenesErica: Reverend, can I ask? Does the bible say anything about adoption?ScenesMonica: It says “Do it!”. And behold she did adopt onto them a baby. And it was good.ScenesErica: Wow.ScenesChandler: Yeah, wow.ScenesErica: I was wondering you both have such serious jobs. (to Monica) Would you have time to take care of a baby and your flock?ScenesMonica: Oh, you know, my flock is good, I mean, yeah, my flock pretty much takes care of themselves at this point. Good flock. Flock, flock, flock.ScenesErica: (to Chandler) Being a doctor must take up a lot of time.ScenesChandler: No-ot for me it doesn’t.Scenes(The agency guy enters the room)ScenesAgency guy: So, how’s everything going in here?ScenesErica: We’re great, I think I may have asked all my questions.ScenesAgency guy: Do you have any question for Erica?ScenesChandler: Yeah, actually. So, you read a file that you liked and you gave the agency the serial number and they contacted us?ScenesAgency guy: Yes, our system assures total anonimity. We’re very proud of it.ScenesChandler: You should be. You’re really on top of stuff..ScenesAgency guy: (to Erica) Well, then if there’s nothing else, then the two of us should talk.ScenesErica: Actually, I don’t think we have to.ScenesMonica: We don’t?ScenesErica: Yeah, when I read about you two, I was pretty sure I wanted you, but I just thought we should meet face to face. (to the agency guy). I've made my decision. I choose them.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, this is great! This is so great! (to Chandler, who looks bewildered). Did you hear that?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I did.ScenesMonica: (to Erica) Hey, thank you. Thank you so much. (they hugs). You are SO going to Heaven!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Rachel and Phoebe walk in, loaded with bags.]
rows.Content: Rachel: We got some really great stuff!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah but I am not sure about some of the bra's I got.ScenesRachel: Oh! Really? Do you wanna try some of them on for me?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! okay. Wait, are we in Joey's imagination?ScenesRachel: (looking into one of her shopping bags) Oh no! I took one of Ross' bags by Scenesmistake, and one of mine is missing.ScenesPhoebe: oh, well, Ross probably has it, you can get it from him later.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross walks into Central Perk, wearing a pink and white ladies shirt. Joey is on the couch]
rows.Content: ScenesRoss: (to Joey) So? What do you think? (Shows himself - Joey observes him with a strange look on his face.)ScenesJoey: I think were not wearing the same shirt anymore!!ScenesRoss: (not getting it) Yeah! Yeah! Rachel picked it out for me. She told me to trust her and you know what? I'm glad I did! I turned quite a few heads on my way over here.ScenesJoey: (now laughing a little) Dude, I really don't think you should be wearing that.ScenesRoss: Oh, I see, somebody is afraid of a little competition with the ladies?ScenesJoey: (looking a little agitated now) Looks like someone IS the ladies!!ScenesRoss: You're just jealous because you couldn't pull this off. Yeah, now if you'll excuse me (getting up and taking his coat) I have a date. (As he is walking out, everyone turns and stares at him) See? (To Joey) ALL eyes on ME!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's hotel room. They enter.]
rows.Content: Chandler: We are NOT signing those papers.ScenesMonica: Why not?ScenesChandler: It's wrong. They made a mistake. They think we're somebody else.ScenesMonica: God works in mysterious ways.ScenesChandler: You have gotta stop!ScenesMonica: But she liked us.ScenesChandler: She likes Doctor Chandler and Reverend Monica.ScenesMonica: Well, if you think about it, I am kind of like a Reverend. I mean, as a chef, I serve God, by feeing the hungry and poor. (looks very convinced about what she just said)ScenesChandler: Your Veal Chop is $34,95!ScenesMonica: C'mon Chandler, I think we have been given an opportunity. I mean, the mistake has already been made. They are writing up the paper right now.ScenesChandler: But we are not the one she chose! How can you feel okay about this?ScenesMonica: (very emotional) Because... We may not be who she thinks we are but no-one will ever love that baby more than us.ScenesChandler: I know..ScenesMonica: I mean, who knows how long it's gonna take for someone else to give us a baby? What if, what if no one ever picks us?ScenesChandler: oh, honey..ScenesMonica: (Almost crying) Please.. please, we are so close.ScenesChandler: Monica, I want a baby too, but this woman is giving away her child. She deserves to know who it's going to. ScenesMonica: (realizes Chandler is right. She's almost crying) okay, right. (They hug)ScenesChandler: So, we'll tell the truth and who knows, maybe she'll like us for us.ScenesMonica: (sniffing) Maybe she will. Uh! Why couldn't I have been a Reverend?ScenesChandler: You're Jewish.ScenesMonica: Technicality!Scenes

rows.Scenes: A restaurant. Joey is on his date with Phoebe’s friend, Sarah. They are sitting opposite each other on a table for two. Their waiter approaches with two plates.]
rows.Content: Waiter: A garden salad for the lady (sets the plate down)ScenesJoey: Oh, that looks great! Good ordering!ScenesWaiter: Seafood platter for the gentleman and extra fries. Enjoy!ScenesSarah: Mmmh, those fries look delicious.ScenesJoey: oh, I didn't know you liked French fries. Help yourself! What's mine is yours. (Sarah reaches over and takes a few fries)ScenesSarah: (looks over at Joey's platter) Oh wow, are those stuffed clams?ScenesJoey: Uuuh.. yes, they are my stuffed clams.Scenes(Sarah, is grinning and starts to reach over to Joey's plate to take a few clams)ScenesJoey: How about those fries though, huh? (Holds the plate between Sarah’s fingers and his plate, thus blocking her from reaching his)ScenesSarah: They are delicious (takes a few from the plate, puts one in her mouth and places the rest on her plate, then starts to reach over to Joey's platter again)ScenesJoey: (Spotting her movements takes her hand into his own) You are beautiful, you know that?ScenesSarah: Oh, that is so sweet..ScenesJoey: Oh (grinning, trying to hold in his impatience with her) okay.. (she takes her hand back)Scenes(Then she reaches over again and Joey moves his plate a little to the left, and she misses, then she reaches out again, and he moves his plate to the right , so she misses again. She tries a third time and this time, Joey pushes his plate so far to the left, it drops off the edge of the table)ScenesJoey: (Visibly annoyed) NOW look what you did!!ScenesSarah: What? what is the matter with you?ScenesJoey: I don't like it when people take food off of my plate, okay?ScenesSarah: But you just said "What's mine is yours"?ScenesJoey: WELL, I DIDN'T MEAN IT!ScenesSarah: Fine, I'm sorry, I didn't think it was that big a deal.ScenesJoey: I'm sorry, I'm overreacting. Okay, It's just when it comes to food, I have certain rules, okay, I mean (bends down and with his plate and his hands, scrapes the dropped dinner back onto the plate and puts it back on the table) There are things you do..and you now, things.. (takes something from the plate and blows it a little) that you don't do (He takes a bite from it).Scenes(Sarah looks a little disgusted)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Ross and his date walk into a lobby. They are both wearing their jackets]
rows.Content: ScenesGirl: Wow, this place looks great.ScenesRoss: Oh! You are gonna love it! (The girl is looking in the other direction as Ross is taking off his own coat, revealing the pink and white ladies shirt) and I'm so glad, we're finally doing this.ScenesGirl: Me too! (starts to take her coat off)ScenesRoss: Here (gets behind her to help. When the coat comes off we see she is wearing the exact same shirt Ross is wearing. They look at each other, shocked. They abruptly put their coat back on) So this was fun! (They leave the room and head into opposite directions)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Back at the restaurant with Joey and Sarah. Joey is holding Sarah's hands]
rows.Content: Joey: I really am sorry about, you know..before. I just want to make sure you know that I really do like you.ScenesSarah: Sure (smiling) Just not as much as clams.ScenesJoey: (Jokingly) Well, stuffed clams.Scenes(The waiter arrives with their deserts)ScenesWaiter: Chocolate Torte for the lady, cheesecake for the gentleman.ScenesJoey: Uh, excuse me sir, there seems to be some sort of red crap on my cheesecake.ScenesWaiter: Yes, that's Raspberry coule.ScenesJoey: (More to himself than anyone else) So stupid, ordering cheesecake, trying to Scenesbe healthy. (pushes it aside)ScenesSarah: (tasting hers) Oh my God! (Looks at the waiter and then to Joey)ScenesJoey: Oh, all right, I'll just have what she's having instead.ScenesWaiter: Oh, I'm sorry sir, that was our last piece.ScenesSarah: Mmmm! Mmm!Scenes(Sarah's beeper starts bleeping)ScenesSarah: Oh, no! This is work. I should call in. Can you excuse me?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure. No problem.Scenes(Joey's looking at Sarah's dessert, and takes her plate.)ScenesSarah: What are you doing? I thought you don't share food.ScenesJoey: Sure I do. (holding up his own dessert) Coule?ScenesSarah: (laughing) No. If I can't have your clams, you can't have my dessert. This is a two way street.ScenesJoey: (laughing) Really?ScenesSarah: Really! Now this all better be here when I come back. (puts her plate back at her side of the table)ScenesJoey: Yeah, of course. I can control myself. (laughs uneasily and Sarah leaves the room)Scenes(Joey sits sideways on his chair, looking at Sarah's chocolate torte, and then looking away from it, nervously playing with his fork, drumming with it on the table every now and then.)ScenesJoey: (to the torte) Stop staring at me!Scenes(He then straightens himself, and looks at the torte)ScenesJoey: Why, just a tiny little...Scenes(He takes a little piece of Sarah's dessert. At first he doesn't think it's that special, but then...)ScenesJoey: Oh-oh!ScenesTIME LAPSEScenes(Sarah enters the room again, and stops when she sees her dessert is missing. Joey has emptied her plate, and has a chocolate covered mouth, just like a kid.)ScenesJoey: I'm not even sorry.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The Adoption Agency in Ohio. Monica and Chandler are entering.]
rows.Content: Erica: Hi!ScenesAdoption Agency guy: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesAgency guy: So, these are the preliminary forms for an open adoption. There's a lot to go over, but I'll explain everything as we go through it.ScenesMonica: (pointing to a picture on the table) I-Is... Is that a picture?ScenesErica: Yeah. It's a sonogram they took of the baby last week. I thought you might want to see it. (gives it to Monica, who looks at it for a long time, and then shows it to Chandler)ScenesMonica: Look, doctor!Scenes(Chandler takes Monica's hand, and gets serious) Look, before we sign anything we really have to talk...(pause) We're not who you think we are.ScenesAgency guy: I don't understand.ScenesChandler: The agency must have made some mistake. My wife is not a reverend and I'm not a doctor.ScenesErica: What?ScenesAgency guy: That's impossible.ScenesChandler: I could perform an operation on you and prove it if you'd like.ScenesAgency guy: I'll go check your file. Excuse me.ScenesErica: So who are you?ScenesChandler: Well, our names really are Monica and Chandler. We're from New York.ScenesMonica: Yeah, but the important thing to know about us, is how much we would care for this little baby. (holds up the sonogram)ScenesErica: So you lied to me before?ScenesMonica: Well, we... (makes quotation signs in the air) "bore false witness"... See I could be a reverend.ScenesErica: I can't believe this.ScenesMonica: But we were hoping that since we told you the truth that you still might consider...ScenesErica: Giving you my baby? You think I'd give you my child after this?ScenesMonica: Well, you don't have to decide right now, but if you could just look at our file...ScenesErica: I don't want to look at your file! This is over.Scenes(She leaves the room, but Chandler runs after her. They meet in the hallway.)ScenesChandler: Erica wait!ScenesErica: I've nothing to say to you. (walks a few paces)ScenesChandler: You have every reason to be upset. We did lie. But only because we've been waiting and trying to have a baby for so long. Now we don't know how long it's gonna be before we can get another chance again.ScenesErica: Why don't you ask the reverend to pray on it?ScenesChandler: Erica, please. Just consider us. Ask them to see our file. Our last name's Bing. My wife's a chef and I'm in advertising.ScenesErica: Oh yeah. I actually liked you guys. But it doesn't matter, because what you did was wrong. (walks away again, but Chandler catches up with her again)ScenesChandler: But you did like us. And you should. My wife's an incredible woman. She's loving and devoted and caring. And don't tell her I said this but the woman's always right... I love my wife more than anything in this world. And I... It kills me that I can't give her a baby... I really want a kid. And when that day finally comes, I'll learn how to be a good dad. But my wife... she's already there. She's a mother... without a baby... Please?Scenes(They look at each other. We switch back to Monica. Chandler opens the door and she turns to look at him.)ScenesChandler: You still want that baby?Scenes(Monica plays those words back in her mind and then smiles and runs to Chandler, who is twisting with joy. They hug.)ScenesMonica: God bless you Chandler Bing!ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Joey's on the couch when Ross walks to him, with his jacket closed.]
rows.Content: Ross: Turns out this sweater is made for a woman.ScenesJoey: (nods) So, why are you still wearing it?ScenesRoss: Because it's soft... Hey, so how was your date?ScenesJoey: Ooh... Not so good.ScenesRoss: Well, looks like it's just the two of us tonight, huh old buddy?ScenesJoey: Yeah, and you know what? We could do a lot worse.Scenes(they shake hands the way friends would. There's a muffin on the table, and Ross breaks off a piece and wants to put it in his mouth.)ScenesJoey: (shouting to Ross) JOEY DOESN'T SHARE FOOD!Scenes(Ross puts the piece back on the plate)ScenesendScenesFriends Scenes1010 - The One Where Chandler Gets CaughtScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesProduced by: Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFlashback clips transcribed by: Guineapig, Dan Silverstein, Ruth Curran, Eric Aasen and Mindy Mattingly Phillips, and compiled by Eleonora.ScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everybody's sitting on the couch and Monica is eating a chunk of cake.]
rows.Content: Monica: (really excited) Mmh... this cake is amazing!ScenesRachel: My God, get a room!ScenesMonica: I would get a room with this cake. I think I could show this cake a good time!ScenesPhoebe: If you had to, what would you give up, food or sex?ScenesMonica: (with no hesitation) Sex!ScenesChandler: (looking at her) Seriously, answer faster!ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm sorry honey, you know, but when she said "sex" I wasn't thinking about "sex with you"!ScenesChandler: (to Phoebe) It's like a giant hug.ScenesPhoebe: Ross, how about you. What would you give up, sex or food?ScenesRoss: Food.ScenesPhoebe: Ok, how about... uhm... sex or dinosaurs?ScenesRoss: Oh my God. It's like Sophie's Choice.ScenesRachel: Oh God. What about you, Joe? What would you give up, sex or food?ScenesJoey: Uhm... oh... I don't know, it's too hard.ScenesRachel: No, you gotta pick one!ScenesJoey: Oh... food. No, sex. Food! Sex! Food! Se-I don't know! Good God, I don't know, I want girls on bread!ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel and Phoebe are looking at some photos and they're sitting next to the window.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You gotta see these latest pictures of Emma.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how cute!ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she looks just like a little doll!ScenesRachel: Oh, no, no. That is a doll.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank God, 'cause that thing's really creepy! (looking outside the window) Look, there's Chandler. (he's on the street, talking to a woman)ScenesRachel: Oh. Who is the blonde, she's pretty.ScenesPhoebe: OH! He's having an affair.ScenesRachel: He's not having an affair!ScenesPhoebe: You know, I'm always right about these things.ScenesRachel: No, you're not! Last week you thought Ross was trying to kill you!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm sorry but it's hard to believe that anyone would tell a story that dull just to tell it! (looking outside) See, there's something going on with them. Look, he's getting into the car with her!ScenesRachel: Oh, that doesn't mean anything.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah? Well, let's see. (she takes her mobile phone) Ok, duck down. (they both get down to hide themselves. Phoebe calls Chandler)ScenesChandler: (picking up the phone) Hello.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hi Chandler. It's Phoebe. Uhm... I know that Monica is working today so...(back to Central Perk) ...I was wondering if you want to come to the movies with me and Rachel.ScenesChandler: Oh, uhm... I have to work too. Yeah, I'm stuck at the office all day.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) Oh, well, it's a shame that you-that you miss the movie 'cause we were gonna see, you know, either "Liar, Liar" or "Betrayal", or... "An Affair To Remember".ScenesChandler: Those are all really old!ScenesPhoebe: Ok, then maybe it'll be, uhm...ScenesRachel: (whispering) "Dude, Where's My Car?ScenesPhoebe: (glancing at her) What?ScenesRachel: They're in a caaar...ScenesPhoebe: (to Chandler at the phone) Okay, we-we'll talk to you later. Okay, bye.ScenesRachel: Geez!ScenesPhoebe: Ok. Quick. We gotta find a cab and follow them.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, ok. Let me just grab my night vision goggles and my stun gun.ScenesPhoebe: (patting her bag) I got them!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Chandler enters the door.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey! You smell like perfume and cigarettes.ScenesChandler: I was in the car with Nancy all day.ScenesMonica: Nancy doesn’t smoke!ScenesChandler: Well, at least the perfume is not mine, be thankful for that!ScenesMonica: So? What do you think of the house?ScenesChandler: It’s perfect. It’s everything we’ve been looking for.ScenesMonica: Isn’t it? Then what about the amazing wainscotting and the crown molding and the dormer windows in the attic?ScenesChandler: And the wiggle wharms and the zip zorps? (pause) What were the things you said?ScenesMonica: Don’t you love the huge yard?ScenesChandler: And the fireplace in the bedroom.ScenesMonica: And Nancy said that it's really under price, because the guy lost his job and has to move in with his parents!ScenesChandler: This is bringing out a lovely color in you!ScenesMonica: So? Do you think we should get it?ScenesChandler: I don’t know. What do you think?ScenesMonica: I think we should.ScenesChandler: I do too.ScenesMonica: This is huge!ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesMonica: How bad you wanna smoke, right now.ScenesChandler: I don’t know what you mean, giant talking cigarette! Oh, by the way, Phoebe called just as I was getting into Nancy’s car, so if she asks you, I was at work all day.ScenesMonica: Gotcha. When do we tell them about this?ScenesChandler: We don’t. Not until it's a hundred percent. I mean, why upset everybody over nothing.ScenesMonica: Okay. Right. Oh my God that is gonna be so hard.ScenesChandler: I know. Gooooood luck with it.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment. Everybody except Monica and Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Ross: I just can’t see Chandler cheating!ScenesRachel: I’m telling you guys, we followed them out to a house in Westchester, the went in for like forty-five minutes and then they came out looking pretty happy!ScenesJoey: Chandler? Forty-five minutes? Well, something is not right. I just can’t believe he would do this to Monica!ScenesRoss: I know, and with the baby coming?ScenesPhoebe: So, should we tell her?ScenesRoss: I don’t know. Phoebe, if one of us saw Mike with another woman would you want us to tell you?ScenesPhoebe: Why? Who’d you seen him with?ScenesRoss: No one, I’m just saying if... (Phoebe starts pinching him in his neck)ScenesPhoebe: TELL ME WHAT YOU KNOW!ScenesRoss: (yelling in pain) I know nothing! Mike’s a great guy, it was hypothetical!ScenesPhoebe: All right. (she releases him). He is a good guy. You’re right, he wouldn’t cheat.ScenesRoss: Believe me, if I did see with someone, there’s no way I... (Phoebe starts pinching him again)ScenesPhoebe : WHO DID YOU SEE HIM WITH?Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica’s apartment. Monica is cleaning with a vacuum and then she cleans it with a dust buster. The guys enter the room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, look at her, so happy!ScenesMonica: If only there were a smaller one to clean this one!ScenesJoey: Hey, is uhm... is Chandler here?ScenesMonica: No, he’s picking up dinner, why, what’s up?ScenesPhoebe: Well, look, whatever happens, we’re here for you and we love you.ScenesMonica (puzzled): All right...ScenesRoss: We think Chandler might be having an affair.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: Phoebe and I saw Chandler with a blonde woman today outside on the street and then we followed them to a house in Westchester.ScenesPhoebe: They went in together. So sorry.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Oh my God that’s awful! What did you think of the house?Scenes(they all look confused and sorry for her)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: (walking towards her to hold her and support her) Monica, you understand what we are saying, right?ScenesMonica: Yeah, sure... uhm, I'm devastated, obviously... (to the rest) Did you think the neighborhood was homey? (Chandler enters)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) You son of a bitch!ScenesChandler: Is it me, or have the greetings gone downhill around here?ScenesMonica: (goes to Chandler) Phoebe and Rachel saw you with Nancy today and... em... they think you're having an affair.ScenesRachel: Who's Nancy?ScenesRoss: What's going on?ScenesMonica: (turns to them) Ok, alright, you guys, you'd better sit down, this is pretty big.ScenesChandler: Yeah (motions them to sit and they do) I'm not having an affair. Nancy is our realtor.ScenesJoey: I knew he couldn't be with a woman for 45 minutes!!ScenesPhoebe: Why do you have a realtor?ScenesMonica: Uhm, she has been showing us houses outside of the city.ScenesJoey: (clearly shocked) What?ScenesRachel: Are you serious?ScenesMonica: When we found out that we're gonna get this baby, Chandler and I started talking and we decided that we didn't want to raise a kid in the city.ScenesPhoebe: So you're gonna move?ScenesRoss: Oh my God.ScenesJoey: Shouldn't we all vote on stuff like this?!ScenesRachel: What is wrong with raising a kid in the city? I'm doing it, Ross is doing it, Sarah Jessica Parker is doing it!ScenesMonica: And that's great for you guys, but we want a lawn and a swingset...ScenesChandler: ...and a street where our kids can ride their bikes and maybe an ice-cream truck can go by.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) So you wanna buy a house in the 50's?ScenesPhoebe: Have you thought about what you would be giving up? You can't move out of the city, what if you want Chinese food at 5am? Or a fake Rolex that breaks as soon as it rains or an Asian hooker sent right to your door?ScenesRoss: You know what, if you wanna look for a house, that's okay.ScenesJoey: No, no, it's not, don't listen to him! (to Ross) I'm gonna thump you! (points his fist at him)ScenesRoss: (to Joey) It's ok, because they have to get it out of their system, okay (back to Mon and Chan), but you're going to realize, this is the only place, you wanna be.Scenes(pause before Monica and Chandler speak, they look like they are looking for the right words)ScenesChandler: Actually, we already found a house we love.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: And about an hour ago, we made an offer.Scenes(All the friends looked shocked and confused. There is a long silence.)ScenesChandler: Bet you wish I was having an affair now, huh?ScenesTIME LAPSEScenesRoss: You put an offer on a house?ScenesMonica: (smiling) It's so sweet. It really is. It has this big yard that leads down to this stream and then there's these old maple trees... (gets cut off)ScenesPhoebe: Wha..? Again with the nature, what are you? Beavers?ScenesChandler: I know this is really hard and we're really sorry.ScenesJoey: Is this because I come over here without knocking and eat your food? (Walks towards the fridge) Because I can stop doing that, (looks at the fridge) I really, really think I can!ScenesChandler: (goes towards Joey) You know that's not the reason Joe. (Joey hugs him and after, he takes something from the fridge and puts it in his mouth. He goes back to where he was standing before)ScenesMonica: We think if you saw it, you'd understand. I mean you guys were there. (Points to Rachel and Phoebe) It is beautiful, isn't it?ScenesRachel: Yeah it is.ScenesJoey: What the hell are you doin'?ScenesRachel: Well, it is, all right? When we were out there today, all I kept thinking was: I can't believe Chandler is screwing this woman, but MAN this would be a nice place to live!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but so is this.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I mean, if you moved there, you have to leave here. I mean, how can you leave this place?Scenes Scenes[We fade to some flashback scenes.]Scenes(from 1.01 - "The One Where Monica Gets a New Roommate - The Pilot")ScenesRachel: (talking on the phone) C'mon Daddy, listen to me! All of my life, everyone has always told me, 'You're a shoe! You're a shoe, you're a shoe, you're a shoe!'. And today I just stopped and I said, 'What if I don't wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a- a purse, y'know? Or a- or a hat! No, I don't want you to buy me a hat, I'm saying that I am a ha- It's a metaphor, Daddy!ScenesRoss: You can see where he'd have trouble.ScenesRachel: Well maybe I'll just stay here with Monica.ScenesMonica: Well, I guess we've established who's staying here with Monica...Scenes Scenes(from 1.18 - "The One With All the Poker")ScenesRoss: That money is mine, Green!ScenesRachel: You're fly is open, Geller!ScenesPhoebe: You guys, you know what I just realized? 'Joker' is 'poker' with a 'J.' Coincidence?ScenesChandler: Hey, that's...'joincidence' with a 'C'!Scenes Scenes(from 1.07 - "The One With The Blackout")ScenesPhoebe: [looking outside the window] Eww, look. Ugly Naked Guy lit a bunch of candles.Scenes[They all look at the window, grossed out, then flinch in pain.]ScenesRachel: Ow, that had to hurt!Scenes Scenes(from 3.09 - "The One With All the Football")ScenesPhoebe: Hey, it’s your Thanksgiving too, y'know, instead of watching football, you could help.ScenesThe Guys: We will. (they don’t move)ScenesMonica: Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmallows in concentric circles.ScenesRachel: No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.Scenes(Rachel sticks a marshmallow into Monica’s nose. Monica takes it out of her nose by closing one nostril, and blowing.)ScenesMonica: Every year.Scenes Scenes(from 5.08 - "The One With the Thanksgiving Flashbacks")ScenesJoey: (he has a turkey on his head) It's stuck!!!ScenesPhoebe: (walks him to the kitchen) Easy. Step. How did it get on?ScenesJoey: I put it on to scare Chandler!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Monica's gonna totally freak out!ScenesJoey: It smells really bad in here.ScenesPhoebe: Well, of course it smells really bad. You have your head inside a turkey's ass!Scenes(They hear Monica trying to unlock the door. So Phoebe quickly pushes his head down onto the table to make it look like the turkey is just sitting on a platter and not stuck on Joey's head.)ScenesMonica: Hey, did you get the turkey bast-Oh my God! Oh my God! (She sees someone is stuck in the turkey.) Who is that?ScenesJoey: It's Joey.Scenes Scenes(from 4.12 - "The one With the Embryos")ScenesMonica: I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?ScenesRachel: Oooohh that’s interesting.ScenesChandler: If you win, we give up the birds.ScenesJoey: (shocked) Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)ScenesChandler: But if we win, we get your apartment.ScenesJoey: Oooooh!ScenesMonica: Deal!ScenesTIME LAPSEScenesRoss: What was Monica’s nickname when she was a field hockey goalie?ScenesJoey: Big fat goalie.ScenesRoss: Correct. Rachel claims this is her favorite movie…ScenesChandler: Dangerous Liaisons.ScenesRoss: Correct. Her actual favorite movie is...ScenesJoey: Weekend at Bernie’s.ScenesRoss: Monica categorizes her towels. How many categories are there?Scenes(They both confer)ScenesJoey: Everyday use.ScenesChandler: Fancy.ScenesJoey: Guest.ScenesChandler: Fancy guest.ScenesRoss: Two seconds...ScenesJoey: Uhh, 11!ScenesRoss: 11, unbelievable, 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.)ScenesRoss: (to the girls) Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl’s breast?ScenesRachel: 14?ScenesRoss: No, 19.ScenesChandler: Thanks man.ScenesRoss: Joey had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?ScenesMonica: Maurice.ScenesRoss: Correct, his profession was?ScenesRachel: Space cowboy!ScenesRoss: Correct! What is Chandler Bing’s job?Scenes(The girls are stumped)ScenesRachel: Ow...Oh Gosh!ScenesRoss: 10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.ScenesMonica: It’s umm, it has something to do with transponding.ScenesRachel: Oh-oh-oh, he’s a transponce—transpondster!ScenesMonica: That’s not even a word!Scenes(Ross stops the clock, signifying the end of the lightning round.)ScenesMonica: NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!ScenesTIME LAPSEScenes(The door opens and Joey and Chandler ride in on the big, fake dog in triumph)ScenesRachel: Y’know what, you are mean boys, who are just being mean!ScenesJoey: Hey, don’t get mad at us! No one forced you to raise the stakes!ScenesRachel: That is not true. She did! She forced me!ScenesMonica: Hey, we would still be living here if hadn’t gotten the question wrong!ScenesRachel: Well it stupid, unfair question!ScenesRoss: Don’t blame the questions!ScenesChandler: Would you all stop yelling in our apartment! You are ruining moving day for us!Scenes Scenes(from 5.15 - "The One With The Girl Who Hits Joey")ScenesRoss: Chandler!!! Chandler!!! (He opens the door to the apartment but is stopped by the chain; Chandler and Monica quickly stop making out and try to get dressed.) Chandler, I saw what you were doing through the window! Chandler, I saw what you were doing to my sister! Now get out here!ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Wow! Listen, we had a good run. You know, what was it? Four? Five months? I mean, that's more than most people have in a lifetime! So, good-bye, take care, bye-bye then! (He kisses her and starts to climb out the balcony window)ScenesMonica: (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What's up bro?Scenes(Ross spots Chandler and starts chasing him around the kitchen table. Chandler runs and hides behind Monica.)ScenesRoss: What the hell are doing?!!ScenesRachel: (running from the guy's apartment with Joey in tow) Hey, what's-what's going on?!ScenesChandler: Well, I think, I think Ross knows about me and Monica.ScenesJoey: (panicking) Dude! He's right there!ScenesRoss: (To Chandler) I thought you were my best friend, this is my sister! My best friend and my sister! I-I cannot believe this!ScenesChandler: Look, we're not just messing around! I love her. Okay, I'm in love with her.ScenesMonica: I'm so sorry that you had to find out this way. I'm sorry, but iit-t's true, I love him too.Scenes(There's a brief pause.)ScenesRoss: (happily) My best friend and my sister! I cannot believe this. (He hugs them both.)Scenes Scenes(from 6.06 - "The One On The Last Night")ScenesMonica: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna label it, "What were you thinking?ScenesRachel: Funny, because I was just gonna go across the hall and write that on Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: Ok, you guys, I don’t mean to make things worse, but umm, I don’t want to live with Rachel anymore.ScenesMonica and Rachel: What?!ScenesPhoebe: You’re just so mean to each other! And I don’t want to end up like that with Rachel. I still like you!ScenesRachel: Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving.ScenesMonica: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know, I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate. She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the things she thinks that I’d like.ScenesPhoebe: What else?ScenesMonica: When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that.ScenesPhoebe: That’s nice. I like having things to read in the bathroom.ScenesMonica: When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with a blanket.ScenesRachel: Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold.ScenesMonica: And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive. (To Rachel) (Starts to cry) You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!! (They both break down in tears.)ScenesTIME LAPSEScenes(Monica closes the door and slowly walks into Rachel’s old and now empty room.)ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey.ScenesMonica: She really left.ScenesChandler: I know. (He kisses her.)ScenesMonica: Thank you.ScenesChandler: No problem roomie. (She turns around and hugs him.)ScenesMonica: Can I ask you a question?ScenesChandler: Sure!ScenesMonica: What the hell is that dog doing here?! (She notices the dog sitting in the living room.)Scenes Scenes(from 1.09 - "The One Where Underdog Gets Away")ScenesChandler: Little toast here. I know this isn't exactly the kind of Thanksgiving that all of you all planned, but for me, this has been really great, you know, I think because it didn't involve divorce or projectile vomiting. Anyway, I was just thinking, I mean, if you'd gone to Vail, and if you guys'd been with your family, if you didn't have syphilis and stuff, we wouldn't be all together, you know? So I guess what I'm trying to say is that I'm very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings sucked.ScenesAll: That's so sweet.ScenesRoss: And hey, here's to a lousy Christmas.ScenesRachel: And a crappy New Year.ScenesChandler: Here, here!Scenes

rows.Scenes: We're back to the present. Chandler and Monica's. They're all still at the kitchen table.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You can't move. You just... you just can't.ScenesJoey: Rachel's right. This is where you guys belong.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you don't wanna live in Westchester. That's like the worst of the Chesters.ScenesRoss: You know, sometimes when I'm alone in my apartment, I look over here and you guys... are just having dinner or... watching TV or something, but... it makes me feel better. And now when I look over, who am I gonna see? The Gottliebs, the Yangs? They don't make me feel so good. (Joey pats Ross on his back)ScenesRachel: Yeah. So don't move, okay? Just stay here and... (nods towards Ross) maybe close your blinds at night.Scenes(The phone rings and Chandler goes to get it)ScenesChandler: Hello? It's Nancy, they responded to our offer.ScenesMonica: And?Scenes(Chandler listens to what Nancy says)ScenesChandler: (to Nancy) Okay, thanks... (to Monica) They passed. They said they wouldn't go a penny under the asking price.ScenesMonica: We can't afford that.ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesMonica: Well, there you go.Scenes(Chandler and Monica hug)ScenesJoey: I'm really sorry you guys.ScenesRoss: Yeah. I'm sorry too. I'm even more sorry that that phone call didn't come before I told you about looking through the window.ScenesRachel: Yeah, we're gonna let you be alone.ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) You're gonna be okay?ScenesMonica: Yeah, we'll be okay.ScenesRoss: Love you guys. (he kisses Monica, he, Rachel and Phoebe leave.)ScenesJoey: You know, I'm really sorry I wasn't more supportive before.ScenesChandler: That's okay, we understand.ScenesJoey: And about this Nancy thing... If you're not sleeping with her, should I?Scenes(Chandler gives Joey her business card, which he eagerly grabs and he leaves.)ScenesMonica: I know there'll be other houses, but it's just so... I love that one so much.ScenesChandler: Yeah... Well, it's a good thing we got it then.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: We got the house.ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesChandler: I just didn't want to tell you in front of them.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! My God! We've got the house !?ScenesChandler: We're getting the house. (they hug) We're getting the house.ScenesMonica: And a baby...ScenesChandler: We're growing up.ScenesMonica: We sure are.ScenesChandler: So who's gonna tell them?ScenesMonica: (quickly) Not it!ScenesChandler: Not it! Damn it!ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAKScenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. The entire gang is there, and Chandler and Monica are handing out presents.]
rows.Content: Monica: Rachel, this is yours.ScenesRachel: Aah! Why? What are these for?ScenesChandler: You'll see.ScenesMonica: All right, everybody open them!Scenes(they all tear off the wrapping paper)ScenesRachel: Ooh! Oh wow this is so beautiful. (she got a scarf)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! These are the ones I was looking at in the store. (she got earrings)ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesRoss: I love this. (he got a sweater)ScenesJoey: A meatball Sub? Thanks! (he got a meatball sandwich)ScenesRoss: Seriously you guys, what's going on? What are these for?ScenesChandler: Well, I didn't know how to tell you before, but... We got the house.ScenesMonica: Enjoy!Scenes(they both run off, leaving Ross, Phoebe and Rachel stunned.)ScenesJoey: (speaking with his mouth full, enjoying his sandwich) What did they say?ScenesTHE ENDScenesFriends Scenes1011 - The One Where The Stripper CriesScenesWritten by: Marta Kauffman & David Crane ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy Knoller ScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by KimScenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everyone's sitting on the couch. Monica and Joey enter.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey guys!ScenesMonica: Hey, let me tell them!ScenesJoey: Sure.ScenesMonica: Joey is gonna be a celebrity guest on a game show!ScenesPhoebe: Great!ScenesRoss: Really? Which one?ScenesMonica: (stopping Joey from answering) Ohh! Fish, seaweed, a sunken ship.ScenesRoss: Things you find in the ocean, (to Joey) You're gonna be on "Pyramid"!!ScenesMonica: Oh, that was our favourite game show ever!ScenesRoss: Except for "Match game"...ScenesMonica: Or "Win, Lose or Draw".ScenesChandler: What did I marry into?ScenesJoey: Would you guys want to come down tomorrow and watch me tape the show?ScenesMonica: Oh, I can't. We're throwing Phoebe a bachelorette party.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, sorry boys, this ride's closing.ScenesRoss: Oh, and Chandler and I have this stupid college alumni thing. I can't believe you get to meet Donny Osmond.ScenesJoey: Seriously?ScenesRoss: (very excited) Yeah-uh!ScenesMonica: Ross and I always wanted to be Donny and Marie.ScenesChandler: You guys just keep getting cooler and cooler!ScenesMonica: Yeah, we used to perform for our family and friends.ScenesRachel: Oh God, that's right. I blocked that out.ScenesMonica: (singing) "I'm a little bit country"...ScenesRoss: (singing) "...and I'm a little bit rock 'n' roll"!ScenesChandler: (to Monica) I'm leaving you.ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Class of '91 reunion. Ross and Chandler enter.]
rows.Content: Ross: So weird to see all these people again... Oh my God, look, there's Geoffrey Cleric.ScenesChandler: Who?ScenesRoss: He was roommates with John Rosoff. He went out with Andrea Tamburino. She dumped him for Michael Skloff.ScenesChandler: (looking around) Did I go to this school?ScenesRoss: Hey, there's Missy Goldberg. You gotta remember her.ScenesChandler: (looks over at her) Sure, nice.ScenesRoss: Dude. You're married to my sister.ScenesChandler: You're right, by saying "nice" I'm virtually licking her.ScenesRoss: Hey, I hear she's single again, d'you think I should ask her out?ScenesChandler: Are you asking permission to break the pact?ScenesRoss: Yes please.Scenes Scenes[Flashback, year 1987. Chandler enters the school's corridor. Ross is hanging some flyers on the wall. Both have a funny 80s hair and clothes.]ScenesRoss: Hey. Hey, check out the flyers for the band. I made 'em on a Macintosh in the computer room!ScenesChandler: Awesome, the name really stands out.ScenesRoss: Thanks to a little something called "Helvetica Bold 24 point"!ScenesChandler: Man, we're gonna rock that Asian student union!ScenesMissy: Hey guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, Missy...ScenesChandler: You know, our band is playing on Friday.ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah. You should come check us out. We're called "Way! No Way!".ScenesMissy: No way!ScenesChandler and Ross: Way!ScenesMissy: Right. I'll be there. (she leaves)ScenesChandler: Fresh!ScenesRoss: Boss!ScenesChandler: Mint!ScenesRoss: She's gone.ScenesChandler: I know it. You know, I'm totally gonna ask her out.ScenesRoss: Dude, I was gonna ask her out.ScenesChandler: I said it first, bro.ScenesRoss: Well, I thought it first, Holmes.ScenesChandler: (angrily) Look, if you did...ScenesRoss: Woha! Wait... What are we doing? What we have is too important to mess it up over some girl. I mean, we can get laid anytime we want.ScenesChandler: Totally. I had sex in High school...ScenesRoss: Me too. I'm good at it.ScenesChandler: All right, I'd say we make a pact. Neither of us will go out with Missy Goldberg.ScenesRoss: You got it.ScenesChandler: All right, so that's Missy Goldberg, Phoebe Cates and Molly Ringwald, who neither of us can go out with.ScenesRoss: Those are the pacts!ScenesChandler: Oh, and Sheena Easton. But we probably couldn't get her anyway.ScenesRoss: Oh, oh... maybe not you!Scenes Scenes[We get back to the Class of '91 reunion, where Ross and Chandler are still looking at Missy.]ScenesChandler: Well, I officially give you permission to break the pact.ScenesRoss: Thank you. (they shake hands) All right, here I go. Hey, remember how scary it used to be going up to girls in college?ScenesChandler: Your hands are shaking.ScenesRoss: I know, and I can't stop sweating. (he walks towards Missy)Scenes

rows.Scenes: The "Pyramid" Studio.]
rows.Content: Voice: Five! Four! Three! Applause!ScenesDonny Osmond: Yeah! Welcome, it is Soap Opera week here on Pyramid, let's meet our contestants. First, Gene Lester is a database specialist, he's gonna be playing with "Days of Our Life's" star Joey Tribbiani! (Joey's amazed at the place and he keeps looking around till he realizes the audience is applauding him)ScenesJoey: (to Gene) I know it could be intimidating for regular people to be around celebrities but... relax, I'm just like you! (pause) Only better looking and richer.ScenesDonny: ...should be playing with the star of "General Hospital" Leslie Charleson. (applause) Welcome everybody. Good luck to all of you. Let's play Pyramid. All right? Now... we flipped a coin before the show, Gene, you won the toss, so you're gonna start. Which category would you like?ScenesGene: I'll take "You crossed the line".ScenesDonny: You crossed the line. Joey, describe for Gene these things that have lines. Give me 20 seconds on the clock, please. Ready, go!ScenesJoey: (on the screen there's the word "Supermarket") Uhm... ok. It's a store, like a supermarket. (there is a sound indicating he made a mistake as he shouldn't have said 'supermarket'. The next word appears, "notebook") Oh! I see-I see what I did. Yeah, ok, ok, uhm... I'm writing in my...ScenesGene: Diary.ScenesJoey: Noo, (whispering) more like a notebook... Damn it! (next word appears: "blueprint") Oh, if I'm building an house, the plan isn't called the 'shmoo-print'... Can't say that either? Woha... hey... (the last word is "Football field" and there are 5 seconds left) In high school, I once had sex with a girl right in the middle of the...ScenesGene: Cafeteria.ScenesJoey: Yeah! But that is not what they're looking for. (time's finished) OOOH!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment, where Phoebe's bachelorette party is taking place.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Rachel) Thank you so much for this.ScenesRachel: Oh, d'you like it?ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, it's all so elegant! When's the dirty stuff starting?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: You know, the strippers, and the guys dancing, and you know, pee-pee's flying about.ScenesRachel: Pheebs, I... there isn't gonna be any flying about! We actually thought we were a little too mature for stuff like that.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, ok. I see what you're doing, that's fine. This is all there is, just tea, uh, ok. (she drinks her tea) Hmmmm... raunchy!ScenesRachel: Seriously Pheebs, it's not gonna be that kind of a party.ScenesPhoebe: Really? So this is... this is my big send off in the married life? Rachel this is the only bachelorette party I'm ever gonna have! I've got a big wad of ones in my purse! Really? I mean, really? It's just tea?ScenesRachel: Nooo! Phoebe, of course there is more! I mean, I'll just go and talk to Monica and get an ETA on the pee-pee's!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's at the game show "Pyramid" with host Donny Osmond.]
rows.Content: Donny: Now Gene I must remind you, you need all six of these to stay in the game, all right? Describe for Joey things you find in your refrigerator.ScenesJoey: Ahaha, he might as well just give us the points.ScenesDonny: Give me twenty seconds on the clock. Ready? Go!Scenes(the first word is cream)ScenesGene: You put this in your coffee.ScenesJoey: A spoon. Your hands. Your face!ScenesGene: It's white!ScenesJoey: Paper, snow, a ghost!ScenesGene: It's heavier then milk!ScenesJoey: A rock, a dog, the earth.ScenesGene: Pass!Scenes(the second word is mayonnaise)ScenesGene: You put this on a sandwich.ScenesJoey: Salami, anchovies, jam!ScenesGene: It's white!ScenesJoey: Paper, snow, a ghost!ScenesGene: It's made from eggs!ScenesJoey: Chickens?ScenesGene: Pass!ScenesJoey: Oh!Scenes(The third word is ketchup)ScenesGene: You put this on a hamburger!ScenesJoey: Ketchup!ScenesGene: Yes!Scenes(The fourth word is soda)ScenesJoey: Relish!ScenesGene: Stop!ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesDonny: Oh, time's up! Joey! You were, uh, almost on a roll there...ScenesJoey: Yeah...ScenesDonny: Uh, Gene, you're gonna have a chance to go to the winner circle in the second half. But right now Henrietta you are going to the winner circle to try your luck for ten thousand dollars, right after this, don't go away.ScenesStage Manager : And we're out!ScenesJoey: Oh, so we didn't win, but it's fun to play the game, right?ScenesGene: Hey! I got a kid starting college. I've to get surgery on my knee, you just lost me ten grand!ScenesJoey: Oh, wow! I'm so sorry, ok? I promise, we'll do better next time!ScenesGene: Well, I will, because I won't be playing with you.ScenesJoey: Hey, you know, some of those are pretty hard! Like why would there be a ghost in my fridge? (pause). Yeah!Scenes

rows.Scenes: College reunion party. Ross is talking to Missy.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, Saturday night!ScenesMissy: I'd love to!ScenesRoss: Great!ScenesMissy: So how come it took you so long to ask me out?ScenesRoss: Oh, well, uh, this is gonna sound kinda silly, but, do you remember my roommate Chandler Bing?ScenesMissy: Sure, he was in your "band"? (she air quotes band)ScenesRoss: It's been sixteen years but the air quotes still hurt.ScenesMissy: Sorry.ScenesRoss: That's ok. Uh, anyway, well he and I both really liked you a lot, uhm, but we didn't want anything to jeopardize our friendship, so we kinda made a pact, that neither of us could ask you out!ScenesMissy: Really?ScenesRoss: Yeah, why?ScenesMissy: Well, Chandler and I used to make out! A lot!ScenesRoss: You did?ScenesMissy: Yeah. We'd go to the science lab after hours!ScenesRoss: (angrily) AND ON MY TURF?Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. The bachelorette party.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Rachel) Hey, where is this guy, it's been over an hour!ScenesRachel: Well, he's coming from Jersey, he said he would get here as fast as he could!Scenes(someone knocks at the door)ScenesMonica: Who is it?ScenesMan: It's the police!ScenesRachel: (pretends to be shocked) Uh! The police!ScenesPhoebe: (Excited, running back to her seat) Oh!ScenesMan: That's right, it's officer Goodbody.ScenesMonica: What's the matter, officer? Has someone been bad? (looks over to Phoebe and she opens the door, and to their dismay, the stripper is an old, short, fat guy who looks exhausted)ScenesRoy, the male stripper: (coughs) Whoo, that's a lot of stairs!ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAKScenesRoy: Ooh, boy. You should warn people there's no elevator! I should not have had that Mexican food for lunch.ScenesMonica: Are you gonna be ok, officer, uhm,...ScenesRoy: Goodbody!ScenesMonica: ...If-you-say-so.ScenesRoy: So where's the young lady who I'm supposed to take (he shakes his hips) downtown! (Monica points Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, God!ScenesRoy: All right, somebody show me where to plug in my box, and we'll get this party started! (he thrusts his pelvis towards Phoebe) Whaaaa... (walks back to plug in his cd player) Here? All right.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Are you kidding?ScenesRachel: All right, look, we did not know that you wanted a stripper so we went to the phonebook and we got the first name we could find!ScenesPhoebe: How old is your phonebook?ScenesMonica: Oh my God, this man is gonna get naked in my apartment!ScenesPhoebe: Oh God no, I don't wanna see him take his clothes off!ScenesRoy: Are you talking about me?ScenesMonica: Oh, no! I mean, obviously we want to see you take your clothes off! You big piece of eye candy!ScenesRoy: Ok, ok, ladies! Can I have your attention, please? (pause) Did someone call for the long arm of the law? (He extends his arm from around his crotch and then upward and outward, towards Phoebe) I should warn you, I have a concealed weapon! (Puts his hands over his crotch) I hope you're familiar with the States penal code, ok, ok, enough teasing. Now for some pleasing!Scenes(he uses his remote to turn on the music, "Tainted Love" by Soft Cell, and starts dancing for Phoebe. He shakes his butt, moves his shoulders back, grabs his crotch and hops towards Phoebe. Phoebe is half horrified and half scared. He takes his hat off and throws it away, does some "Can Can" high kicks and swings his butt in front of Phoebe who looks at it in disgust. Then he tears open his shirt and shows her his chest and she flinches.)ScenesRoy: Whoa, whoa, whoa (he turn off the music). She cringed!ScenesPhoebe: This is how I look when I'm turned on!ScenesRoy: You were talking about me before! Look, I don't need this! I'm outta here! Where's my hat? (goes to get it) Look, I've been in this business for a long time!ScenesPhoebe: Shocking!ScenesRoy: Now if you just pay me my three hundred dollars, I'll be on my way!ScenesPhoebe: Three hundred dollars, are you kidding?ScenesRachel: No, that's ok, let's me just get my check book!ScenesPhoebe: No, you're not gonna pay him, he didn't do anything!ScenesRoy: Didn't do anything? I took a bus all the way from Hoboken. I climbed ... I dunno... like a billion stairs... It's not like I can take them two at a time!ScenesPhoebe: I don't care. We're not paying you 300 dollars for this.ScenesRoy: Well, look - it's not my fault if you're too uptight to appreciate the male form in all it's glory.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, okay. I'm uptight. Yeah, that's why I don't want to watch a middle aged guy dance around in what I can only assume is a child halloween costume! (turns to look at Monica and Rachel who look like they feel very sorry for the stripper)ScenesRoy: I may have borrowed this from my nephew, but let me assure you, what's underneath (points at his groin)... is all man.ScenesPhoebe: I'm sorry, did you say all man or old man?ScenesRoy: (making a crying face) Oh, you're mean!ScenesMonica: (walks towards Phoebe and the stripper) Uh, look, officer... uhm Sir...ScenesRoy: Damnit. OH! (To Phoebe) Big surprise! The hunk of beef has feelings!Scenes

rows.Scenes: At Pyramid. Joey is with the woman now.]
rows.Content: Donny: Ok Henrietta, you've picked Jack and Jill went up the hill.ScenesJoey: (To Henrietta) My friend Rachel has a kid. I totally know nursery rhymes! (makes a thumbs up sign)ScenesDonny: Joey describe these things associated with the United States congress. (Joey goes form looking very confident to looking very shocked the instant the word congress is said) Give me 20 seconds on the clock please. Ready? Go!Scenes(Camera goes to Joey. The clock is at 20 sec. The word "Legislature" appears. He looks at it blank faced and his eyes shift between Henrietta and his screen)ScenesJoey: Oh, .. uh... uh... pass. (Next word: "Rotunda") Pass. (Next word: "Filibuster" stares at it a moment) Pass. (Henrietta is looking very confused) (Next word: "Addendum" 4 seconds remaining) Okay, the little thing that hangs down at the back of your throat.ScenesHenrietta: Uvula!ScenesJoey: Oh, then pass. (Next word: "Joint session", but time's up, Joey acts very disappointed)ScenesDonny: O-kay... Henrietta, you didn't get all the points you needed, so that means Gene, you are going to the winners circle to try for ten thousand dollars! (Gene is clapping his hands looking very happy and so is Joey) And you're gonna be going there with Joey Tribbiani (Both of their smiles fade away instantly)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Class of '91 reunion. Ross is walking angrily towards Chandler, who is talking to two other guys.]
rows.Content: Ross: (To Chandler) You made out with Missy Goldberg. How could you do that, after you promised me?Scenes(Chandler looks at the other two guys, embarrassed)ScenesChandler: (to the two guys) Excuse me. (Chandler and Ross move away from them). That didn't make us sound gay at all!ScenesRoss: You broke the pact!ScenesChandler: Ross, that was 16 years ago!ScenesRoss: That doesn't matter! We're talking about the foundation of our friendship.ScenesChandler: I believe the foundation of our friendship was unfortunate hair. (Ross just stares at him) All right, look, if we're really gonna do this... it's not like you never broke one of the pacts.ScenesRoss: I didn't.ScenesChandler: Oh really?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesChandler: Oh really!?ScenesRoss: NO!ScenesChandler: ADRIENNE TURNER!! (A girl behind them turns around)ScenesAdrienne: Yes?ScenesChandler and Ross: Hey! Hey Adrienne. (They move away from her)ScenesRoss: I never did anything with Adrienne Turner.ScenesChandler: Oh please, and you knew how much I liked her.ScenesRoss: I don't know what... you're talking about.ScenesChandler: Really?Scenes Scenes[Flashback scene: 80's College party.]ScenesPresent Chandler's voice: Remember that big party? Freshman year? A week before Christmas vacation? I do. You had some visitors.Scenes(An 80's Rachel and fat Monica walk into the party room. Both with funny hair-do's and clothes)ScenesMonica: I can't believe we are at a real college party! (Rachel laughs excitedly) I have to pee so bad!ScenesRachel: This is so awesome! College guys are so cute!ScenesMonica: Hey, you've got a boyfriend!ScenesRachel: I know. But if some guy who looks like Corey Haim wants to kiss me tonight, I'm sooo gonna let them! (They spot Chandler)ScenesMonica: Look, there's Chandler. You knew, that stupid friend of Ross'. Said I'm fat. You know I've already lost 4 pounds!ScenesRachel: It... You can so totally tell.ScenesMonica: I KNOW!ScenesRachel: Well lets see. Maybe he knows where Ross is. (They walk towards Chandler) Hey, how's it going (tries to look as un-interested in him as possible - checking out her nails).ScenesChandler: Aren't you...?ScenesRachel: Yeah, Rachel. And this (points to Monica) is Ross' sister, Monica. We met at Thanksgiving. (looks around the room as if searching for something more interesting to do).ScenesChandler: (smiling at Monica) Right. (to Rachel) So how're you doing?ScenesRachel: Bitchin'ScenesChandler: Hi Monica.ScenesMonica: Hi Chandler. It's really nice to see you (rolls her eyes) NOT. (she and Rachel giggle a little and Chandler looks unimpressed)ScenesChandler: O-kay. I'll see if I can find Ross. (Goes off to find Ross.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God Rach. Bean bag chairs.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesMonica: Do NOT let me sit in one of those. We'll be here for days.Scenes(Cut to Chandler. He's walking around looking for Ross. He sees him kissing a girl next to a vending machine)ScenesRoss: Listen Adrienne, you can't tell Chandler about this.ScenesAdrienne: Oh believe me, Ross, I won't be telling anybody about this.ScenesRoss: Cool! (They start kissing again and Chandler looks shocked)Scenes

rows.Scenes: We cut back to the present. The reunion where Chandler and Ross are talking.]
rows.Content: Ross: I didn't know you knew about that.ScenesChandler: Well, I did and it hurt. (they walk towards the bar) That's when I wrote the song: "Betrayal In The Common Room".ScenesRoss: (looks disappointed in himself) Man... I... I'm sorry.ScenesChandler: Look (hands him a drink) it was a lo-o-ong time ago.ScenesRoss: So, eh. I made out with Adrienne and you made out with Missy. Well I guess we're even.ScenesChandler: (smiling a little nervously) Hmm mmmhm..ScenesRoss: We are even, right?ScenesChandler: (sighs) Just one more thing. I was so pissed at you that night that I wanted to get back at you.
