So I thought, who does Ross like the more than anybody?ScenesRoss: (thinks about it for a few seconds) What did you do to my mom?ScenesChandler: Not her!Scenes Scenes[Flashback scene: We cut back to the 80's party. Rachel and Monica are "dancing".]ScenesRachel: I am sooo drunk.ScenesMonica: That's weird. I've had the same number of beers as you and I don't feel anything at all. (Chandler approaches)ScenesChandler: Soo... you girls having fun?ScenesMonica: For your information, ass munch, I've lost four pounds. Maybe even five with all the dancing. (A guy enters holding a pizza box)ScenesPizza guy: SOMEBODY ORDER A PIZZA?ScenesMonica: Oh THATS ME! (she runs to the pizza guy)ScenesRachel: (finishing the last of her drink) I am soo not going to do good on my SATs tomorrow.ScenesChandler: Well maybe if you go to school here next year we can totally hang out.ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Oh yeah. There is a plan! Why don't I just start taking my smart pills now?ScenesChandler: Well, maybe you can get in on a beauty scholarship.ScenesRachel: (blushing) Oh, what a line. (walks towards the drinks table with her back towards Chandler and whispers "Oh my God!")ScenesChandler: So where are you applying to?ScenesRachel: Oh well, You know, I think it's kinda really important that I go somewhere where there's sun, so I'm sort of... (Chandler leans in an kisses her) (She pulls away) Hey!ScenesChandler: I'm in college and I'm in a band.ScenesRachel: (She considers it for a second) Yeah okay. (She puts her hands around his neck and they start kissing again)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. The stripper is sitting at the kitchen table. Monica, Rachel and Phoebe are standing around him]
rows.Content: Roy: What's the matter? You never saw a 50 year old stripper cry before?ScenesPhoebe: You know, it's fine. We'll pay you.ScenesRoy: No, no, you're right. Who am I kidding? I should have hung up that breakaway jockstrap years ago. What am I gonna do? I mean, this has been my life for thirty two years. Taking my clothes off in front of people is all I know.ScenesRachel: No, wait. No there's gotta be something else that you can do. I mean, what skills do you have?ScenesRoy: I don't know... I can make my pecs dance... I can pick up a dollar bill with my butt cheeks... I can go to that special place inside me where I feel no shame.ScenesRachel: So maybe something in an office.ScenesPhoebe: Or you could teach stripping. You know, share your gift, pass the torch.ScenesRoy: You know, actually that's not a bad idea. I can do it out of my apartment. I don't think my mom would mind.ScenesPhoebe: There you go. Okay, do you think you're gonna be okay?ScenesRoy: Yeah, yeah, yeah... This is so weird. I mean, you never know when it's gonna be your last dance. And I didn't even get a chance to finish it.ScenesPhoebe: (after a pause) Finish it!ScenesRoy: What?ScenesPhoebe: Your last dance. Do it for us.ScenesRoy: Really?ScenesRachel: (to Phoebe) Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah. He deserves to do the thing he loves one last time.ScenesRoy: Okay, all right... Get ready ladies!Scenes(they sit down and Roy plays "You Make Me Feel" by Sylvester on his boom box, and starts... With his back towards the girls, he starts waving his hands, then backs towards the girls slapping his butt, then swings it around, and makes thrusting pelvic movements in front of Phoebe. He dances around the tables in between all the girls, and gets back into the kitchen part of the room. He then tears off one of his sleeves and throws it towards Monica and Rachel, who fight over who gets it. He then tears off his other sleeve and moves it back and forth between his legs, getting closer to Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh this is so ho-o-ot!Scenes(Roy then sits on Phoebe's lap, looking exhausted)ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, no, no, don't stop!ScenesRoy: (out of breath) Have to...Scenes

rows.Scenes: The game show studio. Joey and Gene are sitting in the winner circle.]
rows.Content: Donny: Well, welcome to the Winner Circle. Joey and Gene, you guys ready?ScenesJoey: (nervously) Yeah...ScenesGene: (irritable) Sure. (Joey gets even more nervous)ScenesDonny: Okay. Give me sixty seconds on the clock please... Ready, GO! (runs off)Scenes(the screen says "6 to win" and "types of trees")ScenesGene: Oak, maple, elm, birch...ScenesJoey: I-I-I don't know. Types of trees?Scenes(Joey hears the bell which means his answer is correct and is surprised. The screen now says "5 to win" and "Spanish words")ScenesGene: Uhm... Buenos días, enchilada, por favor...ScenesJoey: (sympathetic) Oh, I'm so sorry. I don't know any Spanish words.Scenes(There's the next bell, and the correct answer. The screen changes to "4 to win" and "things that burn". Gene now realizes that he got two correct answers and gets up in his seat.)ScenesGene: A match, a candle...ScenesJoey: Things that go "tssst" when you put them out.ScenesGene: A torch, a bonfire... (Joey seems lost) uhm, your pee...ScenesJoey: Things that burn.Scenes(and another bell for the correct answer. "3 to win" and "What a dog might say")ScenesGene: "I'd like to go for a walk", uhm "scratch my belly".ScenesJoey: Dude, dude! I think you're losing it.ScenesGene: Uhm, "I have fur", "I like to bark".ScenesJoey: Oh, oh, oh... What a dog says.Scenes(the bell sounds again, "2 to win" and "pizza toppings")ScenesGene: Pepperoni...ScenesJoey: (instantly) Pizza toppings, next!Scenes(there's 10 seconds left, "1 to win" and "Supermodels")ScenesGene: Cindy Crawford, Christie Brinkley, Heidi Klum, Claudia Schiffer...ScenesJoey: Oh, oh, oh... (5 seconds left)ScenesGene: Christie Turlington, Kate Moss...ScenesJoey: Girls Chandler could never get?ScenesGene: (irritated) Supermodels!ScenesJoey: Where? (looking around)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Monica's there and Ross and Chandler walk in.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, where's Rachel?ScenesMonica: She and Phoebe took the stripper to the hospital.ScenesRoss: Did you know Chandler kissed Rachel?ScenesMonica: What? When was this?ScenesRoss: Nineteen Eighty Seven. The weekend you guys visited me at school.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! That's wild!ScenesChandler: Yeah, but it was like a million years ago, so it doesn't matter.ScenesRoss: Well, it matters to me.ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesRoss: Because... the night you kissed Rachel was the night I kissed Rachel for the very first time.ScenesChandler: You kissed her that night too?ScenesMonica: Two guys in one night? Wow, I thought she became a slut after she got her nose fixed.ScenesChandler: Seriously, where did this happen?ScenesRoss: Okay, after you told me she was passed out in our room, I went in there to make sure she was all right. She was lying on my bed, all buried in peoples coats. Well, I went to kiss her on the forehead, you know. But it was so dark, I accidentally got her lips. I started to pull away, but then I felt her start to kiss me back. It was only for a second, but... it was amazing. And now, now I find out that you kissed her first.ScenesChandler: Oh wait... What bed did you say she was on?ScenesRoss: Mine.ScenesChandler: I'm pretty sure I put her on my bed.ScenesRoss: No, she was definitely on my bed.ScenesChandler: Why would I kiss a girl, and then put her on your bed?ScenesRoss: Well, then who was on my bed?ScenesMonica: (screeching) OH! Oh, oh! (holding her hand in front of her mouth)ScenesRoss: (realizing) NO! No, no!ScenesMonica: YES! (Chandler gets an "oh no!" look on his face)ScenesRoss: You were under the pile of coats?ScenesMonica: I was the pile of coats!ScenesRoss: OH MY GOD!ScenesMonica: You were my Midnight Mystery Kisser?ScenesRoss: You were my first kiss with Rachel?ScenesMonica: You were my first kiss ever?ScenesChandler: What did I marry into?ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAKScenes

rows.Scenes: Back at the party in 1987. People are dancing to "Disco Inferno" by The Trammps.]
rows.Content: (Monica is dancing. At first she seems insecure and moves slowly, but then gets into the groove and swings her hips from side to side while holding her hands up. She then eats the last piece of pizza she was holding and again moves her hips from side to side, pushing her hands in the air in beat with the music. Her moves get more wildly while she's snapping her fingers. She loses balance and falls back onto a pink bean bag.)ScenesMonica: Oh, crap!ScenesTHE ENDScenes ScenesFriends Scenes1012 - The One With Phoebe's WeddingScenesWritten by: Robert Carlock & Dana Klein ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy Knoller ScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Joey's sitting on the couch and Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, hey Joey.ScenesJoey: Uh, hey.ScenesPhoebe: Listen, I need to ask you something. Ok, you know how my step dad's in prison.ScenesJoey: (afraid) Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Well, uhm... listen he was supposed to get a weekend furlough, so he'd come to the wedding tomorrow, but he just called and... uhm... well, apparently stabbing Iceman in the exercise yard just couldn't wait till Monday.ScenesJoey: So he can't come?ScenesPhoebe: No, and so there's no one to walk me down the aisle and... well, I would just really love it if you would do it.ScenesJoey: Seriously?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you've... you know, sort of been like a dad to me. I mean, you've always, you know, looked out for me and shared your wisdom...ScenesJoey: I am pretty wisdomous.ScenesPhoebe: So... what do you say?ScenesJoey: Are you kidding? Phoebe, I would be honored. (they hug)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank you. I hope... I hope you know how much you mean to me.ScenesJoey: (takes her hand) Listen, I hope... that you know... (has difficulty saying it) I don't want you to see your father cry, GO TO YOUR ROOM!Scenes ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe and Joey are sitting on the couch. A waitress brings a coffee and Phoebe wants to pay.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh.ScenesJoey: Oh no, no, no, let your dad get this.ScenesPhoebe: (her mobile phone rings) Oh, it's my wedding planner. She's driving me crazy! (she answers) Hello... Hey, ok, stop screaming! Ok? So, halibut. All right, so salmon, either way. I don't-I don't... it doesn't matter to me!ScenesMonica: (she enters with a headset on and she's speaking into the microphone) Well, it matters to me!ScenesPhoebe: Well, I don't care, so you pick!ScenesMonica: Did you just hung up on me? (she hangs up too) All right, look, I need you at the rehearsal dinner tonight at 1800 hours.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-uh. Ok. What time is that.ScenesMonica: You don't know military time?ScenesPhoebe: Why, I must have been in missile training the day they taught that.ScenesMonica: Just subtract twelve.ScenesPhoebe: Ok, so... 1800 minus twelve is... one thousand, seven hundred and...ScenesMonica: (screaming) Six o'clock!ScenesPhoebe: Ok.ScenesMonica: Ok. Hold on. (her mobile phone rings) Geller here! No! I said it has to be there by 4 o'clock. Goodbye. (she hangs up) Oh, how hard it is to make an ice sculpture?ScenesPhoebe: Ice sculpture? That sounds really fancy! I told you I just want a simple wedding.ScenesMonica: Please... honey, leave the details to me. Now I wanna make this day as special for you as I can. Now, ok, I was thinking that the harpist should wear white.ScenesPhoebe: What harpist? My friend Marjorie is playing the steel drums.ScenesMonica: Ooh... she backed out.ScenesPhoebe: She did? Why?ScenesMonica: I made her. (Phoebe looks shocked) Steel drums don't really say "elegant wedding". Nor does Marjorie's overwhelming scent.ScenesPhoebe: (looking angry) Hey! She will shower when Tibet is free.Scenes

rows.Scenes: The wedding rehearsal dinner.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesChandler: You look great. I'm so glad we're having this rehearsal dinner, you know, I so rarely get to practice my meals before I eat them.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, what did we say was your one gift to us?ScenesChandler: No stupid jokes. I thought that was for the actual wedding.ScenesPhoebe: Rehearse it!ScenesRoss: Hi! (he kisses Phoebe)ScenesMike: Thanks for coming you guys.ScenesRoss: Oh, (he goes towards Mike in order to shake hands but Mike hugs him) hey, oh... I... I was-I was going for a hand shake.ScenesMike: Is that why your hand is pressed against my crotch?ScenesRoss: That is why!ScenesMike: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: So Rach.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Where is Emma?ScenesRachel: Oh, Monica made me send her to my mother's. Apparently babies and weddings don't mix.ScenesMonica: (coming) Are you still crying about your damn baby? Pheebs, you gotta keep the line moving, remember, 20 seconds per person. Your see these clowns all the time! (she takes off)ScenesJoey: Hey, you're Mike's parents, right?ScenesMike's mother: Yes, we are.ScenesJoey: Ah, our little ones are growing up fast, uh?ScenesMike's father: How's that?ScenesJoey: You know, on the one hand you're happy for them, but on the other hand it's hard to let go.ScenesMike's father: Who in God's name are you?ScenesJoey: Hey, I'm not that fond of you either, ok buddy? But I'm just trying to be nice for the kids!Scenes(cut to Ross, Chandler and Rachel)ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) You know what I just realized? We have no idea what we're doing in the wedding tomorrow.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I thought we'd be groomsmen, but wouldn't they have asked us by now? When did they ask you to be their bridesmaid?ScenesRachel: Uh... November?ScenesRoss: I wanna say it's not looking good.ScenesRachel: Hey Pheebs...ScenesPhoebe: What's up?ScenesRachel: Uhm... you haven't told these guys what they're doing in the wedding yet.ScenesChandler: Heh.ScenesPhoebe: Uhm... well, they're not in the wedding.ScenesRoss: What? (Ross and Chandler don't know what to say, so there's an embarrassing long pause)ScenesRachel: Well, this is really awkward (staring at the floor) Oh, and I can leave!ScenesPhoebe: I'm sorry you guys but, you know, Mike's got his brother and his friends from school so... you know, you were-you were... if it helps you, you were next in line, you just-you just missed the cut.ScenesRoss: Oh, man!ScenesChandler: This is like figure skating team all over again. (Phoebe and Ross glare at him astonished) I mean synchronized swimming. (they continue to glare) I mean- I mean the balance beam. (to Ross) Help me!ScenesRoss: FOOTBALL!ScenesChandler: Thank you.ScenesMonica: (looking at Phoebe eating something) Pheebs, spit that out, that has pork in it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I though the pot stickers were supposed to be vegetarian!ScenesMonica: Yeah, I changed them. I-I sent you a fax about it!ScenesPhoebe: I don't have a fax machine.ScenesMonica: Ah, well then there are gonna be a few surprises!ScenesRoss: I can't believe we're gonna be the only people that aren't in this wedding.ScenesChandler: I know, I hate being left out of things.ScenesRoss: And it's a wedding! It'd be weird if I'm not in it...ScenesMike: Hey guys, how is it going?ScenesChandler: Fine. We're just sitting here. Alone. Doing nothing. It's our rehearsal for tomorrow.ScenesMike: Yeah look, about tomorrow, I... I've got a question for ya. I just found out that one of my groomsmen had had an emergency and can't make it.ScenesChandler: What happened?ScenesRoss: Who cares, AND?ScenesMike: ...and I was wondering if... you know, maybe one of you guys... (Ross stands up)ScenesRoss: I'll do it!ScenesChandler: (standing up too) M-Me-me-me!ScenesMike: You both wanna do it? Uhm... there's only room for one.ScenesChandler: Pick me, I look great in a tux and I will not steal focus.ScenesRoss: No, Mike, no, no. You wanna pick me, I mean... watch! (he mimics the groommens way of walking down the aisle with a bridesmaid) Huh?ScenesMike: You know, I really don't feel very comfortable making this decision. You know, Phoebe knows you better, I'm gonna let her choose. (he leaves)ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) Well, if Phoebe's choosing, then say hello to Mike's next groomsman.ScenesChandler: Oh, I will. But I will need a mirror... as he is me!ScenesRoss: Please, you're going down!ScenesChandler: You are going downer!ScenesRoss: Is that what they say on the Figure Skating Team?ScenesChandler: (almost crying) I wouldn't know, I didn't make it! (they hug)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Wedding rehearsal dinner. Joey and Mike are talking.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, you know I'm filling in for Phoebe's step dad, tomorrow, right?ScenesMike: Yeah, yeah. Hey, thanks for doing that.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, my pleasure. (he suddenly becomes very serious) So what are your intentions with my Phoebe?ScenesMike: I intend to marry her.ScenesJoey: Oh, a wiseacre. (Mike looks bewildered). No, no, no, I understand you plan to support your wife by playing the piano? Isn't that kind of unstable?ScenesMike: No more so than acting.ScenesJoey: Strike two!ScenesMike: You're right. She probably will support me. Hey, unless we move in with you, dad?ScenesJoey: Strike three! You only get one more, Mike!Scenes(Cut to Chandler and Ross. Phoebe comes out of the ladies room and they run toward her.)ScenesRoss: So, what did you decide?ScenesPhoebe: I decided to pee.ScenesChandler: Mike didn't tell you? You have to chose one of us to be in your wedding. One of his groomsmen fell out.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, no. I can't choose between you two! I love you both so much!ScenesChandler: Just not enough to put us in the original wedding party.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I don't wanna choose! It's (Rachel is walking by). Oh okay, wait. Rach! Listen I have a very special bridesmaid task for you today.ScenesRachel: (excited and clapping her hands in front of her face) Goody, what is it!ScenesPhoebe: Well, there's a spot open for only one groomsman and you have to choose between Ross and Chandler. So good luck with that.ScenesRachel: What, what, what, no, I don't wanna do that.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I guess I'll have to find a new bridesmaid.ScenesRoss: I'll do it! (Monica approaches)ScenesMonica: Ok, it's 2100 hours. (to Phoebe) Time for your toast. (Mike appears)ScenesMike: Do I have a minute to go to the bathroom?ScenesMonica: You had a bathroom break at 2030. Pee on your own time, Mike! (to Phoebe and Mike). Now, in regard to the toast, okay, you wanna keep them short, nothing kills a rehearsal dinner like long speeches. Okay. You just get in, do your thing and get out!ScenesMike: Is that what you say to Chandler?ScenesMonica: (very serious) It's 2101 and I am not amused. (pause). Ok, the bride and groom have a few words they'd like to say. (Everyone sits and Phoebe gets up)ScenesPhoebe: Ok. Hello everyone and thank you all for being here tonight. So tomorrow's the big event and some of you might not know, but Mike and I didn't get off to the best start. (she reads a note). My friend Joey and I decided to fix each other up with friends so I, I... (Monica is twirling her hands in order to make Phoebe speed up her speech) oh I... hum... I gave it a lot of thought and I fixed him up with my friend Mary Ellen who couldn't be here tonight because... (Monica is tapping her watch with her finger) it's not important... she is in rehab. Anyway, so, ok, Joey said that he was fixing me up with his friend Mike, only he didn't have a friend Mike so he just brought, uhm, my Mike and, and (Monica clears her throat) but despite, you know... it got... it got good. Ok, I wanna take a moment to mention my mother, who couldn't be here...ScenesMonica (rolling her eyes): oh God.ScenesPhoebe: And... moment's over! (Rachel, Joey and Chandler all turn and look disapprovingly towards Monica but she just shrugs it off) So, ok, uh, I can forget that. I can forget that and uhm... (she's flipping cards skipping half of them) Oh this is funny! Oh, but you need to know that to... that, to... Oh, ok, well, uhm, I (Monica is miming CUT). Ok, ok, I, ok, I.... MONICA I CAN'T DO IT LIKE THIS! THIS IS MY WEDDING! OKAY, I DON'T WANT THIS (she mimes Monica's when she was twirling her hands) OR THIS (she taps her watch) OR THIS (she mimes CUT) OK? I JUST WANTED A SIMPLE WEDDING! WHERE MY FIANCEE CAN GO TO THE BATHROOM ANYTIME HE WANTS! (pause) You know what? You're done.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: YOU'RE FIRED! (mimes the CUT again) (pause and she raises her glass) Cheers! (Chandler raises his, smiling and Monica stares at him and he puts down his glass.)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. Joey's having breakfast; Phoebe enters the room carrying her wedding dress.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Happy wedding day!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, happy my wedding day to you!ScenesRachel: Ok-dokey, Joey, listen. This is gonna be bridesmaid central, all right? We're gonna have hair and make-up going on in the bathroom and oh, I had to move a couple of things in the fridge to make room for the corsages.ScenesJoey: Oh, man! I wouldn't have had breakfast if I knew there was going to be corsages!Scenes(Monica enters the room)ScenesMonica: Hi. About last night... I know you are under a lot of stress and even though the things you said hurt me a little bit... My point is, uh, well, I'm willing to take my job back.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well that's ok. I think you and I will do much better if you're just... here as a bridesmaid.ScenesMonica: Oh, is that so? Ok. If that's really what you want, then here... I give you the headset. Well, I don't really want to give you the headset. Well I guess if you're taking over, you should probably return these messages. (hands her a stack of papers with messages and calls to return)ScenesPhoebe: Wow, this is a lot!ScenesMonica: Uh-huh, but I'm sure you can handle this. I mean, I have won awards for my organizational skills, but, uh, I'm sure you'll do fine.ScenesPhoebe: You won awards?ScenesMonica: Mm-mh. I printed them out on my computer.Scenes(Ross enters the room)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRoss: Where's Rach?ScenesMonica: She's in her room, why?ScenesRoss: I have to talk to her about this groomsman situation, ok? I'm not gonna watch Chandler up there while I'm sitting in the seats like some chump! (he goes to Rachel's room, knocks the door and enters the room). (very fake gasp) Oh! My God! You're breathtaking!ScenesRachel: What d'you want?ScenesRoss: You haven't by any chance chosen a groomsman yet, have you?ScenesRachel: Oh, Ross, c'mon, please! Don't make this harder than it already is!ScenesRoss: I'm not! I'm making it easier! Pick me!ScenesRachel: Well, Chandler said that it's really important to him too!ScenesRoss: Listen, listen. Whoever you pick is gonna walk down the aisle with you! Now, I promise I won't say a word, but if you pick Chandler he's gonna be whispering stupid jokes in your ear the whole time!ScenesRachel: Oh, you are the lesser of two evils!ScenesRoss: (waving his fist in the air in triumph) YES, YES!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. Phoebe is talking at the phone, Monica is listening amused.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Sven I don't understand what you're saying! What is wrong with the flowers? Lorkins? What the hell are lorkins?ScenesMonica: I know.Scenes(Mike enters the room).ScenesMike: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Listen, Mike, if you were Swedish and you were saying the word "lorkins" what flowers would that be?ScenesMike: (thinks a moment) Orchids?ScenesPhoebe: Right there! That's why I'm marrying you!Scenes(Joey comes out from his room)ScenesJoey: (to Mike) Hello Michael.ScenesMike: Joseph.ScenesJoey: May I have a word with you, please?ScenesMike: (looking around the room) This is... great...ScenesJoey: Have a seat. (Mike sits on his bed, and Joey towers over him. He starts talking in an Italian godfather-type voice) Last night, I tried to welcome you into my family... and instead, you disrespect me... (shakes his head) I cannot allow this.ScenesMike: (not amused) Are you rehearsing for some really bad mafia movie?ScenesJoey: More back talk. And yes, I may be borrowing a few lines from my recent unsuccessful audition for "Family Honor 2: Thissa Time Itsa Personal.ScenesMike: Joey, I kinda have a lot to do today, what do you want?ScenesJoey: I want you to take this seriously! Phoebe is very very important to me, ok? And I wanna make sure that you are gonna take care of her.ScenesMike: (gets up) Joe, I love Phoebe. She's the single most important thing in my life. I'd die before I let anything happen to her.ScenesJoey: (very satisfied and smiling) That's what I wanted to hear! Because she's family, ok, and now you're gonna be family, and there is nothing more important in the whole world, than family.ScenesMike: That must have been one lousy movie.ScenesJoey: (almost crying) That was ME!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Chandler is pacing and Rachel walks in.]
rows.Content: Rachel: HiScenesChandler: Hey, can I talk to you about this groomsman thing? If you pick Ross, he'll walk you down the isle just fine. But if you choose me, you'll be getting some comedy!ScenesRachel: Even so, I think I'm gonna pick Ross.ScenesChandler: Let me tell you why you need to pick me. (Goes to sit on the couch facing backwards to the kitchen. Rachel gets a chair and sits opposite him) See, when I was a kid, I was always left out of everything, you know, and it really made me feel... insecure. You know, I was always picked last in gym. Even behind that big fat exchange student who didn't even know the rules to baseball. I mean, this guy would strike out and then run to third. Anyway, If I'm the only one left out of this wedding, I just know that all those feelings are gonna come rushing back.ScenesRachel: All right fine, I pick you.ScenesChandler: (Getting up and raising his fist in victory) Y-Y-YEEESSS! Make "groom" for Chandler.ScenesRachel: (not amused by his pun but forcing a smile anyway) Oh my...Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe is on the phone and Monica is nonchalantly "minding her own business".]
rows.Content: Phoebe: No! We're gonna do it my way. (listens) Because your way is stupid! Alright I gotta go, I have another call, Reverend. (switches calls) Hello?Scenes(Mike and Joey come out of Joey's room)ScenesJoey: I'm glad we had this little talk.ScenesMike: Yes. Yeah and thanks for all the wedding night advice. (walks away) That didn't make me uncomfortable at all! Alright, so I'll see everybody tonight?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesMonica: Bye.Scenes(Mike opens the door and there is a gigantic ice sculpture standing in the doorway)ScenesMike: Uhm, did you guys know that there is a giant ice sculpture in the hall?ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, what's it doing here?ScenesMonica: (Obviously enjoying this setback) Ugh, I guess it got sent to the billing address as opposed to the shipping address. (by now she can barely keep herself from smiling) Uh! What a pickle.ScenesPhoebe: (starting to panic) Oh my God, everything is such a mess. Why is this happening to me?ScenesJoey: (staring at the ice sculpture) How bad do you want to stick your tongue on that? (They all glare at him)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Ross is getting coffee at the counter. Chandler walks in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: How's it going?ScenesRoss: (smiling to himself) Good. I'm just getting some coffee. So I'm alert for the wedding.ScenesChandler: (smiling to himself too) That's what I was doing too.ScenesRoss: (barely containing himself at this point) Well, you have fun tonight.ScenesChandler: You too.ScenesRoss: Oh, I will.ScenesChandler: Me too.Scenes(They walk passed each other, Ross towards the door, Chandler towards the counter, suddenly they turn around to face each other)ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, I know why I'm being such an ass, why are you?ScenesChandler: I'm not supposed to tell you.ScenesRoss: I'm not supposed to tell you!Scenes(Cut to Joey and Rachel's apartment. Chandler and Ross storm in looking very unhappy)ScenesChandler: You told us both we could be in the wedding? (they both stare at Rachel)ScenesRachel: Well, in my defense, you were not supposed to tell each other.ScenesRoss: Rachel, only one of us can do it, you have to choose. You and me together again. (he winks at her and Rachel looks disgusted)ScenesChandler: Rach, Rach, knock knock.ScenesRachel: Who's there?ScenesChandler: I'll tell you at the wedding.ScenesRachel: Uh.Scenes(Mike walks in.)ScenesMike: Hey, I forgot my scarf.ScenesRachel: You know what, I can't do this. I don't know which one of you guys to pick.ScenesMike: Oh, you haven't picked yet. Oh good, 'cause I had an idea. I thought it would be fun if the third groomsman was my family dog. Chappy.ScenesRoss: What? A dog? No! Rachel gets to choose.Scenes(all eyes turn to Rachel)ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Wow, this is a tough one. I think I'm gonna have to go with the dog.Scenes(Ross and Chandler look shocked)Scenes(Cut to Phoebe who is in the living room, still on the phone.)ScenesPhoebe: Alright, wait, so what you're saying is that the chef is at the Hamilton Club, but the food is not and the drinks are there, but the bartender is not? Are you, are you FREAKING KIDDING ME!?ScenesMonica: (enjoying what she's seeing) How's it going?ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Help me.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: I want you to be Crazy Bitch again.ScenesMonica: (Sounds moved) Really?ScenesPhoebe: (Nearly in tears) Please?ScenesMonica: You really want me to come back?ScenesPhoebe: More than I wanna get married.ScenesMonica: Ok people, we are back in business! (Gets her headset out of her purse) Oh God, we've missed you soo much! (takes all the notes from Phoebe) Ok, go and get your hair and make-up done, and I'll take care of everything.Scenes(Joey walks in)ScenesJoey: Hey, what are you guys gonna do?ScenesPhoebe: (sounds scared already) About what?ScenesJoey: The blizzard. I just saw on the news, it's like the worst snow storm in 20 years! They already closed all the bridges and tunnels. (Opens the curtains to reveal a snow storm outside)ScenesMonica: Ooh! But the band and the photographer are coming all the way in from New Jersey!ScenesJoey: I don't think they are.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Haha! Looks like you're not going to be in the wedding either. (Looks at Phoebe) So sorry Pheebs.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. They are all sitting around.]
rows.Content: Monica: (Putting down her phone) Well, the club lost it's power.ScenesJoey: Yeah according to the news, most of the city did.ScenesRachel: Since when do you watch the news?ScenesJoey: Uh, for your information, since they hired a very hot weather girl.ScenesRoss: (To Phoebe and Mike) I can't believe you guys aren't going to be able to get married today.ScenesPhoebe: I know.ScenesRachel: Wow, you know, it's so beautiful out there. You always wanted to get married outside. Why don't you guys just do it on the street?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: Well, look, it's hardly snowing anymore. I mean you couldn't ask for a more romantic setting. This could be the simple wedding you've always wanted!ScenesPhoebe: (Turning to Mike) What do you think?ScenesMike: I think I wanna get married to you today.ScenesPhoebe: Me too! (turning to Monica) Monica, do you think we could do it?ScenesMonica: (thinking) AFFIRMATIVE!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Outside. They are a bunch of people arranging chairs, shoveling snow and making other preparations.]
rows.Content: Monica: (walking around with her headset still on) OK LET'S GET THESE CHAIRS OUT HERE! Gunther, hit the Christmas lights. (He does so and the lights above the chairs light up. Monica looks satisfied) Okay, who left the ice sculpture (picks up a piece of ice from the ground) ON THE STEAM GRATE? (nobody answers)ScenesMike's mom: Michael!ScenesMike: Hey! You made it. Great! Chappy! Hi! (kisses his dad) Hi! (kisses his mom) Mom, I know getting married in the street isn't something you approve of...ScenesMike's mom: No... It's lovely. The lights and the snow. I could look at them forever.ScenesMike's dad: (leans in towards Mike) I crushed a pill and put it in her drink... (to his wife) Come on, sweetheart.ScenesMike: (to Chandler and Ross) You know, Chappy's too small to handle all this snow. Someone's gonna have to walk him down the aisle.ScenesChandler: So technically, would this person be in the wedding?ScenesMike: I guess.ScenesChandler and Ross: I'll do it!ScenesRoss: No, but Chandler, hello... Aren't you scared of dogs?ScenesChandler: I'm not scared. (moves towards Mike and Chappy) I'll just take little Chappy and... (he backs out) HE CAN SENSE MY FEAR. MY THROAT IS EXPOSED.ScenesRoss: (takes Chappy from Mike) Well, I guess I'm in the wedding then. Ha haaa... (smells Chappy) He stinks!ScenesMonica: Level 1 alert. I repeat, level 1. This is not a drill. Okay we've got a situation. The minister just called. He's snowed in. He can't make it.ScenesMike: Oh, no!ScenesJoey: Oh hey, don't worry. I'm still ordained from your wedding.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah, you'd think I'd give up being a minister and start paying to ride the subway? Huhuh...ScenesRoss: Uhm, ministers don't ride the subway for free.ScenesJoey: I had to read the Bible pretty carefully, but... yeah we do.ScenesMonica: Okay, if Joey does the ceremony, then we have to find someone else to walk Phoebe down the isle.ScenesChandler: (quickly) I'll do it.ScenesRoss: I'll...ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Na ha ha... (to Chappy) Ne he he... (Ross moves Chappy to Chandler, who quickly backs away) Ah ah...ScenesMonica: Okay, Mike and Joey, get in position. Chandler, come with me. (they walk off, Ross looks down to Chappy, who he's holding and he gets a whiff of the dog's smell. He is clearly disgusted by it.)Scenes(Cut to inside Central Perk where Rachel is helping Phoebe. Chandler and Monica enter.)ScenesMonica: Okay, Joey's doing the ceremony and Chandler's giving you away.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay. Hi new dad. (Chandler waves)ScenesMonica: So, you're ready to do this?ScenesPhoebe: Uhuh, uhuh... Oh my God! This is really happening.ScenesRachel: Oh Phoebe, I'm so happy for you honey. (she gives her a kiss)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, thank you.ScenesMonica: I love you. (Phoebe leans in to kiss her.) Oh, wait, wait, wait! No hugs. The dresses... Oh what the hell. (the girls hug)ScenesPhoebe: I love you guys.ScenesRachel and Monica: I love you.ScenesMonica: Okay. (in her microphone) It's zero hour. All teams execute on my count. (to all) Let's get this bad boy on the road.ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Is it okay that I want you to wear that head set in bed tonight?ScenesMonica: (checking her clipboard) I have you scheduled for nudity at 2300 hours.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! (Monica walks outside)ScenesMonica: Okay Marjorie, hit it.Scenes(A woman with a steel drum and a guy with a xylophone start playing an instrumental version of "Can't Help Falling In Love" by Elvis Presley. A bridesmaid and a groomsman walk down the isle. Next are Rachel and Ross, who carries Chappy in his arms.)ScenesRachel: Geez Ross, you could have showered.ScenesRoss: It's the dog.Scenes(we cut to Monica)ScenesMonica: Groomsman, groomsman, why are you just standing there, where is your bridesmaid? (into microphone) We've got a broken arrow. Bridesmaid down! (realizes) Oh, that's me.Scenes(She walks down the aisle with the groomsman. We cut to inside Central Perk, where Phoebe and Chandler are waiting.)ScenesChandler: Ready?ScenesPhoebe: (nervously) Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait, oh no. Wait.Scenes(She takes off the coat she was wearing over her wedding dress, which is violet and has a darker shade petticoat underneath which shows at one side where the dress is lifted up to about the height of her hip and connected to the petticoat. She's wearing a veil over her curly hair and a low cut top with straps only just hanging over her shoulders.)ScenesChandler: Wow! Aren't you gonna be cold?ScenesPhoebe: I don't care... I'll be my something blue.ScenesChandler: You look beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you.Scenes(They start to leave Central Perk. The band starts to play "Here, There and Everywhere" by the Beatles. The crowd rises from their seats. Phoebe and Chandler walk down the aisle. Phoebe really glows with happiness. So does Mike who watches her walk down the isle. When Phoebe and Chandler arrive, they kiss and Phoebe walks to her bridesmaids.)ScenesMike: My God! Aren't you freezing?ScenesPhoebe: Na-ah.Scenes(the music ends)ScenesJoey: Friends, family, dog... Thank you all for being here to witness this blessed event. The cold has now spread to my special place... so I'm gonna do the short version of this. Phoebe and Mike are perfect for each other. And I know I speak for every one here... when I wish them a lifetime of happiness. Who has the rings?Scenes(one of the groomsmen gives the rings to Joey)ScenesJoey: (whispering to Phoebe) Okay...ScenesPhoebe: When I was growing up, I didn't have a normal mom and dad, or a regular family like everybody else, and I always knew that something was missing. But now I'm standing here today, knowing that I have everything I'm ever gonna need... You are my family. (She puts the ring on Mikes finger)ScenesMike: Phoebe you're so beautiful. You're so kind, you're so generous. You're so wonderfully weird. Every day with you is an adventure, and I can't believe how lucky I am, and I can't wait to share my life with you forever. (He puts the ring on Phoebe's finger.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh wait, oh I forgot... and uhm... I love you... and you have nice eyes.ScenesMike: I love you too.ScenesRoss: Uh Joey...ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Chappy's heart rate has slowed way down.ScenesJoey: Oh, okay. Phoebe, do you take this man to be your husband?ScenesPhoebe: I do.Scenes(Joey has a "Yeah you do" smile on his face)ScenesJoey: Mike, do you take this woman to be your wife?ScenesMike: I do.ScenesJoey: I now pronounce you... husband and wife.Scenes(Phoebe and Mike kiss)ScenesPhoebe: I got married! (everyone applauds) Could someone get me a coat, I'm freaking freezing.Scenes(Mike takes off his coat to give to Phoebe and the steel band plays "The Wedding Song")Scenes ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the two apartments. Chandler and Joey are walking up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: That really was an incredible wedding.ScenesJoey: It was, yeah. I kind of don't want it to end. Hey, you wanna come in for a drink and a bite of corsage?ScenesChandler: I'd love to, but it's 2300 hours and I'm about to have the most organized sex anyone's ever had.ScenesJoey: Nice. Oh hey, what about Ross?ScenesChandler: I don't know. Maybe he hooked up with that hot girl he was talking to.Scenes(cut to the street in front of Central Perk where Ross is walking Chappy. He has a plastic bag in his hand.)ScenesRoss: Come on Chappy, do your business. MAKE! MA-AKE! I did not sign on for this.Scenes ScenesTHE ENDScenes ScenesFriends Scenes1013 - The One Where Joey Speaks FrenchScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilding-Graham & Ellen Plummer ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Everyone's sitting on the couch and Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: HiScenesAll: Hey! Hi!ScenesRachel: How was the honeymoon?ScenesPhoebe; Oh, incredible! Oh! Champagne, candle-lit dinners, moonlight walks on the beach, it was sooo ro-man-tic!ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesChandler: So, where's Mike?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, he's at the doctor, he didn't poop the whole time we were there!ScenesJoey: Well anyway, I'm glad you're back, I really need your help.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, why? What's up?ScenesJoey: I have an audition for this play and for some of it I have to speak French. Which, according to my résumé, I'm fluent in.ScenesRoss: Joey, you shouldn't lie on your résumé.ScenesMonica: Yeah, you really shouldn't. (to Ross, sarcastically) By the way, how was that year-long dig in Cairo?ScenesRoss: (whispering) It was ok...ScenesRachel: I did not know you spoke French.ScenesPhoebe: Oui, bien sur je parle Français! Qu'est-ce que tu penses alors?ScenesRachel: Oh... you're so sexy!ScenesJoey: Well, so, will you help me? I really wanna be in this play.ScenesPhoebe: Sure! Tout le plaisir est pour moi, mon ami.ScenesRachel: Seriously stop it, or I'm gonna jump on ya.Scenes ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Why are you wearing my apron?ScenesMonica: I'm making cookies for Erica. And oh, by the way, we have to leave for the airport soon, her plane comes in about an hour.ScenesChandler: Oh, hey, when she gets here, is it ok if I introduce you two as "my wife" and "the woman who's carrying my child"? (she's not amused) No? Divorce?ScenesRoss: (he enters) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesRoss: You guys know where Rachel is?ScenesMonica: No, we haven't seen her since this morning.ScenesRoss: So unbelievable. She was supposed to meet me half an hour ago with Emma. (he tries to take a cookie but Monica slaps his hand)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: These are for Erica!ScenesRoss: What? She's gonna eat all those cookies?ScenesMonica: Well, I want he baby to come out all cute and fat!ScenesRoss: So, why is Erica coming to visit?ScenesMonica: Well, because we want to get to know her better and she's never been to New York so she wants to see all the tourists' spots... you know, Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building...ScenesChandler: Oh, those places! There's always so many people, their being corralled like cattle, and... you know, there's always some idiot who goes "Mooooo"!ScenesMonica: Well, if it annoys you so much, then why do you do it?ScenesRoss: (looking at Rachel entering with Emma) Oh, hi! Hi! Thanks for showing you up thirty minutes late!ScenesRachel: Ross...ScenesRoss: No, no, no, I'm sure you have a great excuse, wh-was it a hair appointment, a mani-pedi or was there a sale at Barney's?ScenesRachel: My father had an heart attack... (crying) ...while I was at Barney’s.ScenesRoss: Oh my God.ScenesMonica: Honey.ScenesChandler: I'm so sorry...ScenesRoss: Is-is he ok?ScenesRachel: Yeah, they said he's gonna be fine, but he's still heavily sedated.ScenesRoss: Ok, ok. I'm gonna come out to Long Island with you, I mean, you can't be alone right now.ScenesRachel: No, come on, I'm totally ok. (hugging him) I don't need you to come! I can totally handle this on my own.ScenesRoss: Still-still, let me come... for me.ScenesRachel: Ok. If you really need to.ScenesRoss: I bet someone could use one of Monica's freshly baked cookies.ScenesRachel: Oh, I really could.ScenesRoss: Oh!ScenesRachel: Ohh... (Ross mouths HA-HA at Monica and takes two cookies and she looks at him angrily)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe's trying to teach Joey French, so she's sitting in front of him with the script in her hands.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: All right, it seems pretty simple. Your first line is "My name is Claude", so, just repeat after me. "Je m'appelle Claude".ScenesJoey: Je de coup Clow.ScenesPhoebe: Well, just... let's try it again.ScenesJoey: Ok.ScenesPhoebe: Je m'appelle Claude.ScenesJoey: Je depli mblue.ScenesPhoebe: Uh. It's not... quite what I'm saying.ScenesJoey: Really? It sounds exactly the same to me.ScenesPhoebe: It does, really?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: All right, let just try it again. Really listen.ScenesJoey: Got it.ScenesPhoebe: (slowly) Je m'appelle Claude.ScenesJoey: Je te flouppe Fli.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, mon Dieu!ScenesJoey: Oh, de fuff!ScenesMonica: (entering with Erica and Chandler) Hey you guys.ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesMonica: I want you to meet someone really special. Phoebe, this is Erica. And this is the baby!ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesMonica: Joey. Erica, baby!ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesMonica: Everyone. Erica, baby!ScenesChandler: Monica. Calm, self.ScenesErica: Thank you. It's really nice to meet you guys, I can't believe I'm here!ScenesJoey: Welcome to New York City! Or should I say "ghe deu flooff New York City"?ScenesChandler: Why would you say that?ScenesPhoebe: Ok. What are you gonna be doing today?ScenesErica: I wanna see everything! Times Square, Coney Island, Rockefeller Center...ScenesJoey: Oh, you know what you should do? You should walk all the way at the top of Statue of Liberty.ScenesErica: Oh yeah, let's do that!ScenesChandler: Great! (to Monica) This baby'd better to be really good.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Hospital.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (stopping a nurse who's coming out of a room) Oh, uhm, excuse me, I'm here to see my father. My name is Rachel Green.ScenesRoss: And I'm Doctor Ross Geller.ScenesRachel: Ross, please, this is a hospital, ok? That actually means something here.ScenesRachel: Can somebody please go in?ScenesNurse: Absolutely.ScenesRoss: Rach, I think I'm gonna wait out here, because my throat is feeling a little scratchy, I don't want to infect him.ScenesRachel: Ross, please, don't be so scared of him!ScenesRoss: I'm not scared of him, I'm really sick!ScenesNurse: He's under sedation, so he's pretty much out.ScenesRoss: I'm feeling better.ScenesRachel: Oh! (They enter. Rachel sees his father, lying on a bed, with tubes, drip and everything) Oh! Oh my God! Ohhh, ohhh, wow, that ear and nose hair trimmer I got him was just money down the drain, huh?ScenesNurse: Miss Green, your father's doctor is on the phone if you'd like to speak to him.ScenesRachel: Oh, great, Are you gonna be ok?ScenesRoss: He's unconscious, I think we'll be just fine!ScenesRachel (leaving): Ok.Scenes(Ross goes into the room where Dr. Green is laying unconscious. He turns on the TV, puts his feet on the bed and starts watching a dinosaur movie where the dinosaur is caught by two cowboys. Dr. Geller awakes.)ScenesRoss: Did the TV wake you?ScenesDr. Green: No, when you put your feet up in my bed, you tugged on my catheter.ScenesRoss: Ouchy.ScenesDr. Green: What are you doing here, Geller?ScenesRoss: Well, I came with Rachel, who should be back any second! (pause) So what's new?ScenesDr. Green: Ooh, I have a little heart attack.ScenesRoss: Right, is it painful?ScenesDr. Green: What, the heart attack or sitting here talking to you?ScenesRoss (he buzzes for the nurse) Let's see if we can get that Rachel back here.ScenesDr. Green: So what's new with you, uh, knocked up any more of my daughters lately?ScenesRoss: Nope, just the one. RACH!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. Phoebe is trying to teach Joey French.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Je m'appelle Claude.ScenesJoey: Je do call blue!ScenesPhoebe: Noooo! Ok, maybe if we just break it down. Ok, let's try at one syllable at a time. Ok? So repeat after me. "je".ScenesJoey: je.ScenesPhoebe: m'apScenesJoey: mahScenesPhoebe: pelleScenesJoey: pel.ScenesPhoebe: Great, ok faster! "jeScenesJoey: je.ScenesPhoebe: m'apScenesJoey: mahScenesPhoebe: pelleScenesJoey: pel.ScenesPhoebe: Je m'appelle!ScenesJoey: Me pooh pooh!ScenesPhoebe: Ok, it's too hard, I can't teach you!ScenesJoey: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: I, I have to go before I put your head through a wall. (she leaves)ScenesJoey: (he goes out calling her) Don't move! Don't go! I need you! My audition is tomorrow! Shah blue blah! Me lah peeh! Ombrah! (he gives up). Pooh.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Green's mansion. Rachel's Room. Rachel's is combing her hair; Ross's coming into the room]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: I was gonna make us some dinner but all I found in your dad's fridge was bacon and heavy cream. (pause) I think we solved the mystery of the heart attack.ScenesRachel: Uh. (pause) Did you call your parents?ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah. Emma's doing great.ScenesRachel: Oh good.ScenesRoss: Wow.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: Just can't believe I'm in Rachel Green's room.ScenesRachel: What do you mean? You've been in my room before!ScenesRoss: Yeah, sure, right! Like I've ever been in Rachel Green's room.ScenesRachel: Ok I gotta tell ya, it's really weird when you use my whole name.ScenesRoss: Sorry. (Rachel sits on her bed). You ok?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: You had a rough day, uh?ScenesRachel: Yeah, just so weird seeing him like that, you know? I mean he is a doctor, you don't expect doctors to get sick!ScenesRoss: But we do! (pause) It's gonna be ok, Rach!ScenesRachel: (she's sad) Ow. I don't want him to wake up alone! I should go to the hospital!ScenesRoss: What? No, no! Hey, hey, hey look...ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: They gave him a lot of medication, ok? He wouldn't even know if you were there. Look, we'll go see him first thing in the morning, ok?ScenesRachel: Really, I shouldn't feel guilty?ScenesRoss: No, God! Hey, Rach, you've been an amazing daughter, ok? Right now you just need to get some rest.ScenesRachel: Ok, maybe you're right.ScenesRoss: (he kisses her on her forehead) Good night.ScenesRachel: Wait, wait, wait, wait. Would you stay here with me for a little while?ScenesRoss: Sure!ScenesRachel: Ok. (She sits on the bed and Ross sits near her) Thank you for coming with me today.ScenesRoss: Oh, of course...ScenesRachel: Rachel Green is very happy you're in her room!ScenesRoss: Me too. Come here. (They hug)ScenesRachel: I just don't want to be alone tonight.ScenesRoss: Ok, well, uh, I can maybe grab a sleeping bag, or...(There's one of those moments. They're staring at each other, no word uttered, and then she leans toward him in order to kiss him, but he ducks and avoids her more than once.) Oh, oh. (he then hugs her and when she tries to kiss him again, he stands up and she falls down on the bed). No, Rach! I'm sorry, I just don't think this, this, this is a good idea.ScenesRachel: Wait, we won't know that until we do it, will we?ScenesRoss: No, look, uh. You are upset about your father and you're feeling vulnerable and I just don't feel it would be right, I'd feel like I'd be, you know, taking advantage of you.ScenesRachel: Taking advantage? I'm giving you the advantage, enjoy!ScenesRoss: Look, I'm sure it would be great, but I-I think one of us has to be thinking clearly, so, I'm gonna go!ScenesRachel: Wow. Ok.ScenesRoss: I'll see you in the morning (he leaves).ScenesRachel: Mhm-mh!ScenesRoss: (outside her room, talking by himself) Haven't had sex in four months, I should get a medal for that!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica's apartment. Monica and Erica have just arrived.]
rows.Content: Erica: Thanks so much for taking me to all those places. I had a great time.ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm glad. Listen, I want to apologize about Chandler, though. I just did not see this coming.ScenesChandler: (enters the room wearing an "I love New York" t-shirt, a "Statue of Liberty" hat and carrying bags) New York is awesome!ScenesMonica: What is with you?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I've been to these places before, but I've never really seen them, you know.ScenesMonica: Yeah, you miss alot, when you're moo-ing.ScenesErica: Thanks so much for showing me around.ScenesMonica: Oh! It was our pleasure. We are so much enjoying getting to know you.ScenesErica: Well, if there is anything else you wanna know... (Monica and Chandler look at each other)ScenesChandler: Oh, uhm, okay, uhm, do you mind if we ask you some questions about the father?ScenesErica: Oh, sure. Yeah, well, he was my high school boyfriend. Captain of the football team, really cute and he got a scholarship and went off to college. (Monica and Chandler are smiling from ear to ear)ScenesChandler: That's great.ScenesErica: Yeah... it's almost definitely him. (Monica and Chandler look confused now)ScenesMonica: How's that now?ScenesErica: Well, there is a chance it's another guy. I mean, I have only ever been with two guys, but they sorta overlapped.ScenesChandler: So, what does the other guy do? Does he go to college too?ScenesErica: No, he's in prison. (More shocked looks from Monica and Chandler)ScenesMonica: Was he falsely accused of something? (They look hopeful)ScenesErica: No... he killed his father with a shovel. (Monica and Chandler's jaws drop) But other than that, he's a great guy.ScenesChandler: I'll bet his dad doesn't think so.Scenes(Time lapse. Chandler and Monica are in bed now)ScenesMonica: Are you awake?ScenesChandler: Of course I'm awake. Assume from now on that I'm always awake! (He turns the light on)ScenesMonica: Alright, we don't know that it's him. I mean, it could be the football guy.ScenesChandler: Honey, it's us. Of course it's the shovel-killer.ScenesMonica: Alright, lets say that it is him, would we not want the baby? No! Would we treat him any differently?ScenesChandler: I'd keep an eye on him! We have to find out which one the father is.ScenesMonica: How?ScenesChandler: I dunno, aren't there tests for these things, right?ScenesMonica: Yeah, but maybe we're just over-reacting.ScenesChandler: Pff, easy for you to say, he's a father killer. He probably loves him mommy. He's probably got a tattoo that says "mom" on his shovel-wielding arm!Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment. He is sitting on the barcalounger holding a French study book and listening to a French learning tape.]
rows.Content: Tape: We will now count from one to five. Un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq.ScenesJoey: Huh, un, blu, bla, flu, flenk!ScenesTape: Good job.ScenesJoey: Thank you.Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesPhoebe: Hey Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Listen, I feel really badly about yesterday and I thought about it a lot and, and I know, I was too impatient. SO lets try it again.ScenesJoey: Oh, no, that's okay, I don't need your help. I worked on it myself and I gotta say, I am pretty good!ScenesPhoebe: Really, can I hear some of it.ScenesJoey: Sure, sure. Ok, (clears his throat and starts to read from his script. He starts talking in a fake French accent, making gestures with his hands) "Bleu de la bleu, de la blu bla bleu" (Phoebe looks astonished, annoyed and disgusted, Joey seems very proud though) See?ScenesPhoebe: Well, you're not, (she tries to smile and contain her anger, but loses it) You're not... you're not... again, you're not SPEAKING FRENCH!ScenesJoey: (offended) Oh well I think I am, yeah and I think I'm definitely gonna get the part.ScenesPhoebe: How could you possibly think that?ScenesJoey: For one thing, the guy on the tape said I was doing a good job!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The hospital. Rachel is pouring her self a cup of coffee. Ross approaches from behind.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Rach, can you grab me a cup of coffee?ScenesRachel: (She turns around very slowly, looks at him for a second and then turns back to her coffee) Sure. (She gives him the cup she was pouring for herself without looking at him)ScenesRoss: You've been quiet all morning. Is everything okay?ScenesRachel: Hmm-hmm. (starts to pour herself a cup of coffee, never looking at Ross)ScenesRoss: You sure you're alright?ScenesRachel: (coldly) Yep.ScenesRoss: (knowing she's not alright) O-kay. Well, I'm gonna go grab us some breakfast. (He starts to leave)ScenesRachel: FYI..ScenesRoss: (knew this was coming) There it is... (he comes back)ScenesRachel: In the future, when a girl asks for some ill-advised sympathy sex... just do it. (she smiles fakely at him)ScenesRoss: (half amused) Wait, wait, (looks around a little) You're mad at me about last night? I was just trying to do the right thing.ScenesRachel: (sarcastically) Really? Well, it seems to me if you'd done the right thing, I would not have woken up today feeling stupid and embarrassed, I would have woken up feeling comforted and satisfied!ScenesRoss: (acknowledging the last part of her sentence) Well...ScenesRachel: Oh stop that!ScenesRoss: I can't believe this. I was just being a good guy. I treated you with respect and understanding.ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Oh, that is so hot. She walks around him to the other side)ScenesRoss: Hey, I was looking out for you.ScenesRachel: Oh, really, well Ross, you know what? I am a big girl. I don't need someone telling me what is best for me.ScenesRoss: I gotta say, I have not had sex a lot of times before, this is the worst ever.ScenesRachel: Oh, really, really? Well, it wasn't very good for me either. (She turns to leave and Ross over takes her and stands infront on her, his back to the row of doors leading to the hospital rooms)ScenesRoss: Hey you know what? You know what? To avoid this little thing in the future, let's just say, you and me, never having sex again.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: That's right, sex is off the table. (The door starts to open behind him and Dr. Green emerges) I am never having sex with you again. (Rachel stays quiet and after a few moments Ross realizes what has happened. He turns abruptly) Dr. Green, are you feeling better? (Rachel's dad glares at him with a deadly look)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Monica and Erica enter, Chandler is in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! How was lunch?ScenesErica: (To Chandler) We had a good time. By the way, I wanted to ask you something. It would really mean a lot to me, if the baby was a boy, that you name him after my father, Jiminy Billy Bob (Monica smiles at Chandler and his he looks shocked and scared, getting no support from his wife)ScenesChandler: (struggling) Oh, really?ScenesErica: No! (To Monica) You we're right, that was fun! I'm gonna go finish packing.ScenesChandler: O-okay. (steps closer to Monica and speaks softly) So, is she gonna take the test?ScenesMonica: Nope, she doesn't have to, I found out who the father is.ScenesChandler: Oh God. It's shovely-Joe, isn't it?ScenesMonica: (smiling) No it's not.ScenesChandler: How do you know?ScenesErica: Well, it turns out that Erica didn't pay much attention in Sex Ed class, because the thing she did with that prison guy... it'd be pretty hard to make a baby that way.ScenesChandler: Oh God! What was it? The thing that we hardly ever do or the thing we never do?ScenesMonica: The thing we never do.ScenesChandler: (nods in appreciation) Shovely Joe!Scenes

rows.Scenes: The theatre where Joey is auditioning. Phoebe enters when Joey's on stage and she sits down. He hasn't seen her.]
rows.Content: Director: Whenever you're ready Joey.ScenesJoey: Right. (clears his throat) Dja bu bu Claude. Uh, c'est la pu les la lu blah bloo.ScenesCasting assistant: I'm sorry, what's going on?ScenesJoey: Dude, come on! French it u-up!ScenesDirector: Joey, do you speak French?ScenesJoey: Toutes la smore! Bu blu-ay bloo blah ooh! Pfoof!ScenesDirector: You know what. I think this audition is over. (Joey looks disappointed, but understands.)ScenesPhoebe: (in a French accent) Uh, excuse me. Uh, I am Reginé Philange. I was passing by when I heard this man speaking the regional dialect of my French town of Estée Lauder.ScenesDirector: You really think this man is speaking French?ScenesJoey: Sa-sa-saw!ScenesPhoebe: Écoutez, je vais vous dire la vérité. C'est mon petit frère. Il est un peu retardé. (Translation: Listen, I will tell you the truth. He's my little bother. He's a bit retarded.)Scenes(The director looks at Joey and he nods.)ScenesPhoebe: Alors, si vous pouviez jouer le jeu avec lui... (Translation: So, would you please just humor him?)ScenesDirector: (to Joey) Good job, little buddy. That was some really good French. But I think we're gonna go with someone else for the part.ScenesJoey: Ah. All right. But my French was good?ScenesDirector: It was great.ScenesJoey: (to Phoebe) Oh-hoh! Ha-hah! See!ScenesPhoebe: (to the director) Merci. Au revoir. (Translation: Thanks, goodbye.)ScenesJoey: Yeah-hah. Toute-de-le-fruit.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting at the kitchen counter and Ross enters from Rachel and Emma's room.]
rows.Content: Ross: Emma's down for the night.ScenesRachel: Oh, good.ScenesRoss: So uh... I guess I wanna take off.ScenesRachel: Okay... Hey listen, just before you go I-I again, I just wanna say "thank you" for coming with me.ScenesRoss: Oh, no problem.ScenesRachel: And also, you know I uh, I was thinking about what you said, you know, about the whole sex thing and... it's probably not a great idea to go down that road again.ScenesRoss: Thank you. I'm glad you agree.ScenesRachel: It's a shame though, I mean, when we did it, it was pretty good.ScenesRoss: Yeah... Yeah, that's true.ScenesRachel: Hey uhm, do you remember that one really great time...?ScenesRoss: Oh, ye-ah!ScenesRachel: You know it was you're uhm... birthday...ScenesRoss: ...Valentine's day...ScenesBoth: (long pause, they realize) Oh yeah!ScenesRachel: Well, I guess that's all in the past, now.ScenesRoss: Hmmm-mmmm.ScenesRachel: (after a pause) Not even one more time?ScenesRoss: Not even once.ScenesRachel: No matter how much we want it.ScenesRoss: Even if we want it really bad.ScenesRachel: That's what we decided.ScenesRoss: Uhm, right!ScenesRachel: ...It's kinda hard though!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: You know, when two people have a connection, you know, that's... just seems like such a... waste.ScenesRoss: ...I hate waste.ScenesRachel: ...Ross?ScenesRoss: Yes?ScenesRachel: Just so you know... With us... it's never off the table. (she enters her room and closes the door.)ScenesRoss: Damn it. It's never off the table. (he leaves the apartment)ScenesCOMMERCIAL BREAK

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe and Joey are "updating" Joey's resumé.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, can you really tapdance?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: It's off the resumé. (she strikes it through with a pencil)ScenesPhoebe: Archery?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Horseback riding?ScenesJoey: Would fall off a lot.ScenesPhoebe: You can drink a gallon of milk in 10 seconds?ScenesJoey: That I can do.ScenesPhoebe: Come on! You can drink a gallon of milk in 10 seconds?ScenesJoey: All right, watch me! (he takes a full container of milk from the fridge) Okay, you time me. Ready?ScenesPhoebe: Ready... GO!Scenes(Joey takes the plastic container to his mouth and starts to drink. Most of the milk gushes from the bottle down his chin and over his clothes to the floor. He keeps "drinking" and all of a sudden he lifts it up and half the bottle of milk pours out in an instant. He then continues to drink the rest. He then puts the empty container down on the counter.)ScenesPhoebe: (checking her watch) You did it!ScenesTHE ENDScenes ScenesFriends Scenes1014 - The One With Princess ConsuelaScenesTeleplay by: Tracy Reilly ScenesStory by: Robert Carlock ScenesProduced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy KnollerScenesTranscribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & VanessaScenesFinal check by Kim

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's apartment. They are having a diner party with Phoebe and Mike.]
rows.Content: Mike: (raising his glass) Thank you guys for having us over.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Yeah, this is fun, couples night.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I don't know why we hang out with married couples more often.ScenesMonica: Well, because every time we do, you make jokes about swinging and scare them away.ScenesChandler: You mean that Portuguese couple? Yeah, like you wouldn't have done it. (she shrugs)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey, you guys... I have great news.ScenesMonica: Ross, we're kind of in the middle of diner here.ScenesRoss: Oh, well, er, I already ate, but sure...! (they all look at each other when Ross grabs a plate) Guess what happened at work today...ScenesChandler: A dinosaur died a million years ago?ScenesRoss: Try sixty-five million years ago, and then try sssshhhhhh.... My tenure review board met today and I hear it's looking really good.ScenesPhoebe: Wow!ScenesRoss: Yeah. Do you have any idea what this means in academic circles, uh? I am gonna get laid.ScenesRachel: (while entering) Hi you guys.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesRachel: Ooh, Italian! (she also grabs a plate)ScenesMonica: No one wanted seconds, right?ScenesRoss: No, no. I-I'm good.ScenesRachel: Hey you guys... You're never gonna believe it. This headhunter called me. I have a meeting tomorrow with Gucci. Gucci wants me.ScenesRoss: I'm up for tenure.ScenesRachel: Congratulations!ScenesRoss: You too! What are the odds?ScenesRachel: Ooh! (they hug)ScenesJoey: (enters) Guess what? (they all look expectantly at him) I finally got that seed out of my teeth.ScenesMonica: I don't know who I'm happiest for...ScenesPhoebe: I do, he's been working on that all day! (looking at Joey)Scenes ScenesOPENING CREDITS

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler on their couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey Mon? Was it weird changing your name to Geller-Bing?ScenesMonica: No, no. It felt nice to acknowledge this. (pats Chandler on his leg)ScenesPhoebe: Where did you go to do it?ScenesMonica: Uhm the... the ministry... of names... bureau...ScenesChandler: YOU NEVER DID IT!ScenesMonica: I'm sorry. It's just the idea of being an official Bing.ScenesChandler: Hey! I will have you know that... aah, who am I kidding. Let's call the kid Geller and let Bing die with me.ScenesMike: (walks to the couch with coffee for Phoebe) Here you go.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks! Honey, would you want me to take your name?ScenesMike: Oh, it's just... It's up to you. It's your name. You've got to live with it.ScenesPhoebe: All right, let's see, call me mrs Hannigan.ScenesChandler: Mrs Hannigan?ScenesPhoebe: What? Can't you see I'm in the middle of something? Ooh, I like it.ScenesJoey: (enters) Hey guys.ScenesChandler: Hey Joe! We've got a couple of things we've got to check out at the new house. You want to come with us?ScenesJoey: No, thank you.ScenesMonica: All right. I know you're not happy about us moving, but you're the only one who hasn't seen the house.ScenesChandler: Yeah, come with us. You'll see how close it is to the city.ScenesJoey: But no, it's not close. You said it was in escrow? I couldn't even find it on the map.ScenesMonica: Joey, please come. It would mean so much to us.ScenesJoey: You know what? You are my friends, I wanna be supportive, I will come with you. SHOTGUN!ScenesChandler: Damn it.ScenesMonica: See you guys later.ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesMonica: (to Joey) I'll pick you up at eleven. So glad you're coming.ScenesPhoebe: Good for you. That was really mature.ScenesJoey: What? No, the only reason I'm going to their stupid new house, is so I can point out everything that's wrong with it, so they don't move. I'm gonna make them stay here.ScenesMike: You're a strange kind of grown-up.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, you can't make someone do something they don't want to do. Believe me, there's something I've been trying to get Mike to do in bed and there's... he's just...ScenesMike: Woo-wo-hey-hey-hey... Can we not talk about that right now?ScenesPhoebe: All right, prude... Look, Monica and Chandler really love this house. You are not gonna talk them into staying here.ScenesJoey: Hey, hey... I can convince people to do anything, you know. I bet I can even get Mike to do that "thing". What is it?Scenes(Phoebe whispers something in Joey's ear, but after hearing it he jumps up, shocked)ScenesJoey: I AM NOT GONNA HELP YOU DO THAT! Goodbye! (he leaves)Scenes

rows.Scenes: A restaurant. Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (to maitre d') Hi, I'm here to see mr Campbell... with Gucci. The reservation is probably under Gucci. It's spelled like Gukki, which could be confusing.ScenesMaitre d': Mr Campbell's not here yet. Let me show you to his table.Scenes(They walk to the table, but Rachel suddenly gasps. Sitting there is mr Zellner, her boss from her current job at Ralph Lauren.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! That's my boss. You have to seat us somewhere else.ScenesMaitre d': I'm sorry. That's always mr Campbell's table.ScenesRachel: But my... but my boss cannot see me. I'm interviewing for another job.ScenesMaitre d': I know. With GukkiScenesRachel: Sssshhhh!ScenesMr Zellner: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Hi... I'm on a date...ScenesMr Zellner: (confused) That's great!ScenesRachel: Yeah, it is. Yeah, you know, it's tough. Single mom, career... You gotta get out there.ScenesMr Zellner: Well, you got uhm... good energy.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesMr Campbell: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yes, hi!ScenesMr Campbell: James Campbell...ScenesRachel: Hi! (to mr Zellner) Excuse us.ScenesMr Campbell: Please... (shows her to sit)ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh, yeah... (whispering to mr Zellner) Oh he's cute!ScenesMr Campbell: So... your resumé is quite impressive. (Mr Zellner who sits behind Rachel shrugs)ScenesRachel: Wha... My resumé? I wouldn't... I wouldn't call my online dating profile a resumé.ScenesMr Campbell: Dating profile? I-I-I'm talking about the work resumé.ScenesRachel: (starts singing la la la la) Whatever happened to just singing for no reason? Huh?ScenesMr Campbell: Maybe people... found it weird.... So, why do you want to leave Ralph Lauren?ScenesRachel: What? I-I don't.ScenesMr Campbell: You don't?ScenesRachel: No, I-I-I love it there.ScenesMr Campbell: Well, if you don't want to leave, why are we having this lunch?Scenes(Rachel mimes and mouths to mr Campbell "That is my boss", pointing to mr Zellner)ScenesMr Campbell: What?Scenes(Rachel now silently whispers "That's my boss".)ScenesMr Campbell: That's Hugo Boss?Scenes(Rachel holds her hand in order to support her head. Mr Zellner obviously overheard the conversation.)Scenes

rows.Scenes: A counter at a government building. Phoebe's waiting in line.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the woman behind her) This place is so depressing. If I had to work here I'd kill myself. (she turns around and the clerk behind the counter heard her.) But you obviously haven't.ScenesClerk: How can I help you?ScenesPhoebe: I need to change my name, please. See, I need to change it because I'm-I'm hiding from the law. (the clerk shows no change in expression whatsoever) You're fun.ScenesClerk: You need to fill out this form. (motions for the next person in line)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well, I just don't, I don't know how it works exactly. See, my name is Buffay and my husband's name is Hannigan, so is it supposed to be Buffay-Hannigan or Hannigan-Buffay?ScenesClerk: It can be anything you want.ScenesPhoebe: Well, not anything, I mean...ScenesClerk: Yeah... anything.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this could take a while.ScenesClerk: Get out of my line.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Chandler and Monica are there when Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, not anymore. I changed it today.ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm sorry, mrs Hannigan.ScenesPhoebe: Wrong again! Apparently you can change it to anything you want. So I thought, all right, here's an opportunity to be creative. So meet Princess Consuela Banana Hammock.ScenesChandler: That's what we were gonna name the baby.ScenesMonica: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Uh! Princess Consuela.ScenesMonica: You seriously changed your name to that?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh!ScenesMonica: Okay, so from now on we have to call you Princess Consuela?ScenesPhoebe: Uhm, no. I'm gonna have my friends call me Valerie.Scenes(Rachel enters, looking depressed)ScenesChandler: Hey, how'd the interview go?ScenesRachel: Oh! It's not good.ScenesChandler: You know, I always feel that way after an interview. I'll bet it went better than you think.ScenesRachel: Well, I didn't get the job at Gucci and I got fired from Ralph Lauren.ScenesChandler: That is a bad interview.ScenesPhoebe: What are you, what are you talking about? How did this happen?ScenesRachel: Well, my boss was at the same restaurant where I was having my interview and he heard everything. So later he calls me to his office and he tells me that he's gonna have to let me go, because I'm not a team player. And I said "Wait a minute! Yes I am." and I had to sit there for 45 minutes while he proved that that in fact... was true.ScenesMonica: Oh God. I'm so sorry.Scenes(Ross enters with a bottle in his hand)ScenesRoss: Hey! Wha-hoo! What's this? (showing the bottle) Well it's a, it's a bottle of champagne. Why is this here?ScenesPhoebe: Ross...ScenesRoss: I guess it's here because I GOT TENURE!ScenesAll (except Rachel): Congratulations! (Rachel looks devastated)ScenesRoss: This is the single greatest day of my professional career. Gunther, six glasses!ScenesGunther: Six? You want me to join you?ScenesRoss: Oh, I thought Joey was here. Five is good. (Gunther leaves, hurt) Well, I'm gonna have a loogie in my coffee tomorrow.ScenesChandler: Ooh! Israeli champagne. And it's vanilla!ScenesRoss: I got tenure. I didn't win the lottery... Hey Rach, so uh... how did your thing go?ScenesRachel: Oh it... good! Yeah, but I'm not gonna hear from that for a couple of days.ScenesRoss: Oh, you know what? You're gonna get it. I-I-I-I can feel it.ScenesPhoebe: Can you?ScenesRachel: Ah, all right. Here's to Ross!ScenesRoss: And-and to years of hard work finally paying off.ScenesPhoebe: And to knowing that your career doesn't mean everything. (Rachel mouths "aah")ScenesRoss: But also knowing it means a lot.ScenesMonica: But more importantly to full well-rounded lives.ScenesRoss: ...that center around work.ScenesChandler: To Ross!ScenesAll (except Rachel): Ross!Scenes(they all drink from the champagne, but clearly dislike the taste of it)ScenesRoss: You know what the best part about this is? I can never be fired.ScenesPhoebe: Oh God!ScenesRoss: No seriously. I have job security for life. You know, I never have to worry. (Rachel starts crying) Oh, look at you. Look how happy you are for me.ScenesRachel: (crying) No, it's not that. I got fired today. And I didn't get the other job.ScenesRoss: Rach, I'm so sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesRoss: Great. I feel like an idiot.ScenesRachel: No, it's okay, you didn't know.ScenesRoss: Oh... (to the others) Little heads-up would have been nice.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Monica's future house. They enter the living room with the realtor and Joey.]
rows.Content: Monica: Thank you for letting us see the house again.ScenesChandler: And thank you for explaining to us what escrow means... I've already forgotten what you said, but thank you.ScenesRealtor: Take as long as you want. Just let me know when you're through. (she leaves the room)ScenesMonica: Ah, so glad you decided to come.ScenesJoey: Me too. Yeah, this place is great. I'm so happy for you guys. Although, you know, I hope you like fungus.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Fungus! Yeah. Place is full of it.ScenesMonica: No it's not. We had an inspection and they didn't find anything.ScenesJoey: Okay. Then I guess I have dry eyes and a scratchy throat for no reason.ScenesMonica: Maybe because it's you hung your head out of the window like a dog the whole ride here.ScenesJoey: Maybe. So this is the living room huh? Ooh, it's pretty dark. (starts feeling around him like he's in a completely dark room, touching Chandler, who backs out and hits him)ScenesMonica: No it's not!ScenesJoey: (squinting his eyes) Are you kiddin'? I think I just saw a bat in the corner!ScenesChandler: When your head was hanging out the window, it didn't hit a mailbox, did it?ScenesJoey: (glares at him for a moment, then admits grudgingly) Maybe. Well, I just think you guys can do better than this house, you know? Or any other house for that matter.ScenesMonica: Oh Joey, look, we know you're having a hard time with this, but we really, we love it here.ScenesJoey: FINE, ok, if you love this house so much, then you should just live here, okay? I just hope you get used to that weird humming sound. (He turns his back to them and starts humming) Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...ScenesMonica: Joey, we know that's you.ScenesJoey: no... hmmmmm... it's not... hmmmmmmmmmmScenes

rows.Scenes: Phoebe is at Central Perk. Mike enters.]
rows.Content: Mike: Hey (He kisses Phoebe)ScenesPhoebe: Welcome back!ScenesMike: Ah! I missed youScenesPhoebe: Oh, me too!ScenesMike: So, what's new?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I'm no longer Phoebe Buffay.ScenesMike: That's great! You changed you name?ScenesPhoebe: Yes I did! Meet: Princess Consuela Banana Hammock! (She smiles from ear to ear)ScenesMike: (afraid) You're kidding right?ScenesPhoebe: Nope.ScenesMike: You really did that?ScenesPhoebe: Yep.ScenesMike: Yeah, but you can't do that.ScenesPhoebe: Why? It's fun, it's different, no-one else has a name like it.ScenesMike: (looks at her astonished) Alright, then I'm gonna change my name.ScenesPhoebe: Great, okay, what are you gonna change it to?ScenesMike: Crap Bag.ScenesPhoebe:(not amused) Mike Crap Bag?ScenesMike: No, no Mike, just Crap Bag. First name Crap, last name Bag.ScenesPhoebe: You're not serious, right?ScenesMike: Yeah, I'm serious. (sarcastic) It's fun, it's different and no-one else has a name like that!ScenesPhoebe: Uhu, uhu, well, then, great. If you love it, I love it.ScenesMike: I do love it, and I love your name. I love Princess Consuela.ScenesPhoebe: And I love Crap.Scenes

rows.Scenes: Joey is in Monica and Chandler's future house, sitting in a child's bedroom, looking at a quiz card which has "5+10=" printed on one side.]
rows.Content: Joey: (turns the card around, obviously had the wrong answer) Ow!Scenes(A young girl enters)ScenesGirl: Who are you?ScenesJoey: Oh, hi, I'm Joey. My stupid friends are buying this house. Who are you?ScenesGirl: I'm Mackenzie. My stupid parents are selling this house.ScenesJoey: (understanding) Oh.ScenesMackenzie: (sighs) I hate my parents.ScenesJoey: I hate my friends. (They shake on it as if they just made a pact) Alright, look. There's gotta be a way that we can stop this from happening.ScenesMackenzie: Like what?ScenesJoey: (thinking) Uhm... oh! Okay. You come with me, and you tell them that the house is haunted!ScenesMackenzie: What are you? Eight?ScenesJoey: Woah, uh! Okay, let's hear your great idea.ScenesMackenzie: I don't have any great ideas. I am eight.ScenesJoey: (frustrated) Ahh! There's gotta be a way. I mean, you know, if Monica and Chandler move out here and now Phoebe is married to Mike. That just leaves me and Ross and Rach, you know what I mean?ScenesMackenzie: I really don't.ScenesJoey: What am I gonna do, I feel like I'm losing my friends.ScenesMackenzie: My parents say I'm gonna make new friends.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, sure, easy for you, you're young. Me, I'm set in my ways.ScenesMackenzie: This is what my mom was talking about. Whiners are wieners. (Joey glares at her angrily) Look, you want your friends to be happy, right?ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, I guess.ScenesMackenzie: Well, if moving here is gonna make them happy, don't you want them to do it?ScenesJoey: (having difficulty admitting it) Yeah, maybe.ScenesMackenzie: Then you gotta let them go.ScenesJoey: (In near tears, realizes she is right) I hate to admit it, but you're probably right. How did you get to be so smart?ScenesMackenzie: I read a lot.ScenesJoey: (his mood changes instantly) Just when I thought we could be friends. (he leaves the room)Scenes

rows.Scenes: Outside Ralph Lauren building. Rachel just walked out carrying a box of her stuff, and a strange man approaches her.]
rows.Content: Man: Hey Rach, I just heard. I'm so sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh, thank you... (looks at his face trying to remember his name)ScenesMan: You still don't know my name, do you?ScenesRachel: (Is embarrassed for a moment, but it quickly passes) Well, now I don't have to. (The man leaves instantly)Scenes(In the meantime, Ross is trying to squeeze and push a rather large chair through the revolving doors of the Ralph Lauren building.)ScenesRachel: (annoyed) Ross, what is taking you so long?ScenesRoss: (stares at her through the door and starts pushing the chair harder, looking very annoyed. He finally manages) (sarcastic) I'm sorry, it's almost as if this wasn't built for a quick getaway!Scenes(Mark, approaches from behind and recognizes her)ScenesMark: Rachel?ScenesRachel: (turns around) Mark? Oh my God! (puts the box on the chair and they hug each other)ScenesMark: How've you been?ScenesRachel: I'm fantastic. You remember Ross?ScenesMark: Sure, sure. (To Ross) What's with the chair. (Rachel signals him not to mention she's been fired)ScenesRoss: Uh, you know, you can't always get a seat on the subway, so... (laughs stupidly)ScenesMark: Clever.
